hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֵּיצַד הָעֵדִים נַעֲשִׂים זוֹמְמִין? ״מְעִידִין אָנוּ בְּאִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי שֶׁהוּא בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה אוֹ בֶּן חֲלוּצָה״, אֵין אוֹמְרִים: יֵעָשֶׂה זֶה בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה אוֹ בֶּן חֲלוּצָה תַּחְתָּיו, אֶלָּא לוֹקֶה אַרְבָּעִים.
human_translation: How are witnesses rendered conspiring We testify with regard to so-and-so, that he is the son of a divorced woman or the son of a ḥalutza , one does not say This shall be rendered the son of a divorced woman or the son of a ḥalutza in his stead. Rather, he receives forty lashes
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: How are conspiring witnesses made? "We testify regarding a certain individual that he is the son of a divorced woman or the son of a halutzah." One does not say, "Let this one be the son of a divorced woman or the son of a halutzah in his place," rather, he receives forty lashes.

hebrew_text: ״מְעִידִין אָנוּ בְּאִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב לִגְלוֹת״, אֵין אוֹמְרִים: יִגְלֶה זֶה תַּחְתָּיו, אֶלָּא לוֹקֶה אַרְבָּעִים.
human_translation: We testify with regard to so-and-so that he is liable to be exiled one does not say This shall be exiled in his stead. Rather, he receives forty lashes.
llm_translation: "We testify regarding a certain individual that he is obligated to reveal," we do not say: "Let this one reveal in his place," rather, he receives forty lashes.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָא ״כֵּיצַד אֵין הָעֵדִים נַעֲשִׂים זוֹמְמִין״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! וְעוֹד, מִדְּקָתָנֵי לְקַמַּן: אֲבָל אָמְרוּ לָהֶם: ״הֵיאַךְ אַתֶּם מְעִידִין, הֲרֵי בְּאוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם אַתֶּם הֱיִיתֶם עִמָּנוּ בְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ זוֹמְמִין, מִכְּלָל דְּאֵלּוּ אֵין זוֹמְמִין!
human_translation: But should have How are witnesses not rendered conspiring And furthermore, from that teaches later But said to them: How you testify on that day you were with us in such and such place, these are conspiring by inference those are not conspiring
llm_translation: The text: "Gemara: 'How are the witnesses not made into conspirators?' - What does he ask? Furthermore, from what is taught later: 'But if they said to them: "How can you testify, for on that day you were with us in such and such a place" - these are conspirators, which implies that these are not conspirators!"

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא הָתָם קָאֵי: כׇּל הַזּוֹמְמִין מַקְדִּימִין לְאוֹתָהּ מִיתָה, חוּץ מִזּוֹמְמֵי בַּת כֹּהֵן וּבוֹעֲלָהּ, שֶׁאֵין מַקְדִּימִין לְאוֹתָהּ מִיתָה אֶלָּא לְמִיתָה אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: The tanna is standing there All who are conspiring witnesses are led to the same execution except for conspiring the daughter of a priest and her paramour that not taken directly to the same execution rather, a different execution,
llm_translation: The Mishnah there teaches: All conspirators precede her death, except for conspirators of a Kohen's daughter and her seducer, as they do not precede her death except for another death.

hebrew_text: וְיֵשׁ עֵדִים זוֹמְמִין אֲחֵרִים, שֶׁאֵין עוֹשִׂין בָּהֶן דִּין הֲזָמָה כׇּל עִיקָּר, אֶלָּא מַלְקוֹת אַרְבָּעִים, כֵּיצַד? ״מְעִידִין אָנוּ בְּאִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי שֶׁהוּא בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה אוֹ בֶּן חֲלוּצָה״, אֵין אוֹמְרִים: יֵעָשֶׂה זֶה בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה אוֹ בֶּן חֲלוּצָה תַּחְתָּיו, אֶלָּא לוֹקֶה אֶת הָאַרְבָּעִים.
human_translation: And there are other conspiring witnesses with regard to whom does not apply the halakhot conspiring at all, Rather, forty lashes. How, We testify with regard to so-and-so that he is the son of a divorced woman or the son of a ḥalutza , one does not say This shall be rendered the son of a divorced woman or the son of a ḥalutza in his stead. Rather, he receives forty lashes.
llm_translation: And there are conspiring witnesses, who do not incur the full penalty of conspiring, but rather receive forty lashes. How so? "We testify concerning a certain individual that he is the son of a divorcee or the son of a halutzah," one does not say: "Let this one be considered the son of a divorcee or the son of a halutzah in his place," but he receives the forty lashes.

hebrew_text: מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וַעֲשִׂיתֶם לוֹ כַּאֲשֶׁר זָמַם״, ״לוֹ״ – וְלֹא לְזַרְעוֹ. וְלִיפְסְלוּהוּ לְדִידֵיהּ וְלָא לִיפְסְלוּ לְזַרְעֵיהּ! בָּעִינַן ״כַּאֲשֶׁר זָמַם לַעֲשׂוֹת״, וְלֵיכָּא.
human_translation: From where is this matter Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: as the verse states: “And you shall do to him as he conspired” “to him,” but not to his offspring. Let invalidate and not invalidate his offspring. we require “as he conspired to do” and not
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What are the consequences of these matters? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish: As the verse states, "And you shall do to him as he plotted," "to him" – and not to his descendants. They should disqualify it for themselves, and not disqualify it for their descendants! We require "to do as he plotted," and it is not so.

hebrew_text: בַּר פְּדָא אוֹמֵר: קַל וָחוֹמֶר, וּמָה הַמְחַלֵּל אֵינוֹ מִתְחַלֵּל, הַבָּא לְחַלֵּל וְלֹא חִילֵּל – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא יִתְחַלֵּל? מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבִינָא: אִם כֵּן בִּטַּלְתָּ תּוֹרַת עֵדִים זוֹמְמִין!
human_translation: Bar Padda says an a fortiori If one who disqualifies is not disqualified who came to disqualify and did not disqualify isn’t it logical that he should not be disqualified? Ravina objects to this If so, you have rendered the halakha of conspiring witnesses obsolete,
llm_translation: Bar Pedah says: "Kal vachomer, and what about one who desecrates and is not desecrated, if one comes to desecrate and does not desecrate - is it not fitting that he should not be desecrated?" Ravina objects: "If so, you have nullified the Torah of false witnesses!"

hebrew_text: וּמָה הַסּוֹקֵל אֵינוֹ נִסְקָל, הַבָּא לִסְקוֹל וְלֹא סָקַל – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא יִסָּקֵל? אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא כִּדְשַׁנִּינַן מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: If one who stones is not stoned, who came to stone and and did not stone isn’t it logical that he should not be stoned? Rather, it is clear as we answered initially:
llm_translation: And what is the case of one who is to be stoned but is not stoned, one who comes to be stoned but does not stone - is it not a judgment that he should not be stoned? Rather, it is a matter of "mechavvarta" as we learn from the outset.

hebrew_text: מְעִידִין אָנוּ בְּאִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב גָּלוּת כּוּ׳. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״הוּא יָנוּס אֶל אַחַת הֶעָרִים״ – הוּא, וְלָא זוֹמְמִין.
human_translation: We testify with regard to so-and-so that he is liable to exile, From where is this matter Reish Lakish says: as the verse states “And he shall flee to one of the cities” He but conspiring not.
llm_translation: We testify regarding a certain individual that he is liable for exile. How do we know these matters? Reish Lakish said: As the verse states, "He shall flee to one of the cities" - he, and not the witnesses.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹמֵר: קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה הוּא, שֶׁעָשָׂה מַעֲשֶׂה – בְּמֵזִיד אֵינוֹ גּוֹלֶה, הֵן, שֶׁלֹּא עָשׂוּ מַעֲשֶׂה – בְּמֵזִיד אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא יִגְלוּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: an a fortiori If who performed an action intentionally, he would not be exiled who did not perform an action, intentionally, isn’t it logical that they should not be exiled?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan says: Kal vachomer: And what is it? That if one performed an action intentionally, he is not exiled; so, if they did not perform an action intentionally, is it not logical that they should not be liable to exile?

hebrew_text: וְהִיא נוֹתֶנֶת, (וַהֲלֹא דִין הוּא): הוּא, שֶׁעָשָׂה מַעֲשֶׂה – בְּמֵזִיד לָא לִיגְלֵי, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא תֶּיהְוֵי לֵיהּ כַּפָּרָה. הֵן, שֶׁלֹּא עָשׂוּ מַעֲשֶׂה – בְּמֵזִיד נָמֵי לִיגְלוֹ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלֶיהְוֵי לְהוּ כַּפָּרָה! אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא כִּדְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ.
human_translation: But that provides Could this not logical inference? one who performed an action, intentionally, let not be exiled so that he will not have atonement who did not perform an action, intentionally, let them also be exiled so that they will have atonement Rather, it is clear in accordance with of Reish Lakish:
llm_translation: And she gives, (isn't it the same): he, who did an act - intentionally, it should not be revealed, so that it will not become like atonement. Yes, if they did not do an act - intentionally, it should also be revealed, so that it will not become like atonement! Rather, as Mechavvarta as Reish Lakish.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: רֶמֶז לְעֵדִים זוֹמְמִין מִן הַתּוֹרָה מִנַּיִן? רֶמֶז לְעֵדִים זוֹמְמִין?! וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״וַעֲשִׂיתֶם לוֹ כַּאֲשֶׁר זָמַם״! אֶלָּא: רֶמֶז לְעֵדִים זוֹמְמִין שֶׁלּוֹקִין מִן הַתּוֹרָה, מִנַּיִן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִצְדִּיקוּ אֶת הַצַּדִּיק וְהִרְשִׁיעוּ אֶת הָרָשָׁע. וְהָיָה אִם בִּן הַכּוֹת הָרָשָׁע״. מִשּׁוּם וְהִצְדִּיקוּ אֶת הַצַּדִּיק – וְהִרְשִׁיעוּ אֶת הָרָשָׁע, וְהָיָה אִם בִּן הַכּוֹת הָרָשָׁע?
human_translation: Ulla says: From where an allusion in the Torah to conspiring witnesses an allusion to conspiring witnesses But isn’t it written “And you shall do to him as he conspired” Rather, From where an allusion in the Torah to that conspiring witnesses are flogged which is written: and they vindicated the righteous and condemned the wicked, and it shall be if the wicked is deserving of lashes” due to “they vindicated the righteous” “condemned the wicked, and it shall be if the wicked is deserving of lashes”?
llm_translation: Ula said: A hint for conspiring witnesses from the Torah, where is it derived? A hint for conspiring witnesses?! But isn't it written: "And you shall do to him as he conspired"! Rather, a hint for conspiring witnesses who are acquitted from the Torah, where is it derived? As it is written: "And they shall justify the righteous and condemn the wicked. And it shall be if the wicked deserves to be beaten." Because "And they shall justify the righteous – and condemn the wicked, and it shall be if the wicked deserves to be beaten?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: עֵדִים שֶׁהִרְשִׁיעוּ אֶת הַצַּדִּיק, וַאֲתוֹ עֵדִים אַחֲרִינֵי וְהִצְדִּיקוּ אֶת הַצַּדִּיק דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא, וְשַׁוִּינְהוּ לְהָנֵי רְשָׁעִים, ״וְהָיָה אִם בִּן הַכּוֹת הָרָשָׁע״.
human_translation: Rather, witnesses who, condemned the righteous, and other witnesses came and vindicated the original righteous and rendered these wicked “And it shall be if the wicked is deserving of lashes,”
llm_translation: Rather: Witnesses who incriminated the righteous, and other witnesses came and exonerated the righteous from the outset, and they compared them to those wicked ones, "and it shall be if the guilty one deserves to be beaten."

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מִ״לֹּא תַעֲנֶה״! מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵי לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה, וְכׇל לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה אֵין לוֹקִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: And derive from “You shall not bear due to that it is a prohibition that does not involve an action, and every prohibition that does not involve an action, one is not flogged for its
llm_translation: And it should emerge for him "from 'you shall not answer'!" because it is a negative commandment that does not involve action, and any negative commandment that does not involve action, one is not liable for it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַרְבָּעָה דְּבָרִים נֶאֶמְרוּ בְּעֵדִים זוֹמְמִין: אֵין נַעֲשִׂין בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה וּבֶן חֲלוּצָה, וְאֵין גּוֹלִין לְעָרֵי מִקְלָט, וְאֵין מְשַׁלְּמִין אֶת הַכּוֹפֶר, וְאֵין נִמְכָּרִין בְּעֶבֶד עִבְרִי. מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אָמְרוּ: אַף אֵין מְשַׁלְּמִין עַל פִּי עַצְמָן.
human_translation: The Sages taught Four matters were stated with regard to conspiring witnesses, They are not rendered the son of a divorced woman or the son of a ḥalutza ; they are not exiled to a city of refuge; they do not pay the ransom and they are not sold as a Hebrew slave said in the name of Rabbi Akiva: They also do not pay based on their own
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Four matters were stated regarding conspiring witnesses: One does not make a son of a divorced woman or a son of a halutzah, and one does not redeem cities of refuge, and one does not pay the atonement money, and one does not sell with an Ivri slave. Because of Rabbi Akiva they said: Also, one does not pay based on their own admission.

hebrew_text: אֵין נַעֲשִׂין בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה וּבֶן חֲלוּצָה – כְּדַאֲמַרַן. וְאֵין גּוֹלִין לְעָרֵי מִקְלָט – כְּדַאֲמַרַן. וְאֵין מְשַׁלְּמִין אֶת הַכּוֹפֶר – קָסָבְרִי: כּוּפְרָא – כַּפָּרָה, וְהָנֵי לָאו בְּנֵי כַּפָּרָה נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: They are not rendered the son of a divorced woman or the son of a ḥalutza , as we stated And they are not exiled to a city of refuge, as we stated And they do not pay the ransom, hold the ransom atonement And these are not subject to atonement,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "We do not make a son of a divorced woman and a son of a halutzah - as we said. And we do not exile to cities of refuge - as we said. And we do not complete the atonement money - for he holds: 'Kufra' is like 'kaparah,' and these are not sons of kaparah."

hebrew_text: מַאן תָּנָא כּוּפְרָא כַּפָּרָה? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְנָתַן פִּדְיֹן נַפְשׁוֹ״ – דְּמֵי נִיזָּק. רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אוֹמֵר: דְּמֵי מַזִּיק. מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? דְּמָר סָבַר: כּוּפְרָא מָמוֹנָא, וּמָר סָבַר: כּוּפְרָא כַּפָּרָה?
human_translation: Who taught the ransom atonement? Rav Ḥisda says: It is Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, as it is taught and he shall give the redemption of his soul” the value of the victim, Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, says: the value of the one liable for the damage. What, is it not they disagree with regard to this That Sage, holds the ransom monetary restitution and Sage, holds the ransom atonement,
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna who holds that Kofer is like Kaparah? Rav Ḥisda said: It is Rabbi Yishmael, the son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, as it was taught: "And he shall give the ransom of his soul" - referring to damages. Rabbi Yishmael, the son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, says: referring to damages caused by a harmful object. What is the reason they do not disagree in this matter? One Sage holds: Kofer is monetary, and the other Sage holds: Kofer is like Kaparah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא כּוּפְרָא כַּפָּרָה, וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, מָר סָבַר: בִּדְנִיזָּק שָׁיְימִינַן, וּמָר סָבַר: בִּדְמַזִּיק שָׁיְימִינַן.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: No, everyone agrees the ransom atonement, and here, with regard to this they disagree: Sage, holds we assess in of victim; and Sage, holds we assess in of one liable for the damage.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: No, the entire world is like atonement, and here in this case it is different, Master holds: we establish according to the one who causes damage, and Master holds: we establish according to the one who pays compensation.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּרַבָּנַן? נֶאֱמַר הֲשָׁתָה לְמַטָּה, וְנֶאֱמַר הֲשָׁתָה לְמַעְלָה. מָה לְהַלָּן – בִּדְנִיזָּק, אַף כָּאן – בִּדְנִיזָּק.
human_translation: What is the reason of the Rabbis, Imposition is stated below and imposition is stated above, Just as there, in of victim, here too, in of victim
llm_translation: What is the reason of the Rabbis? It is stated "drink below" and it is stated "drink above." Just as there - with a vessel, so too here - with a vessel.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״וְנָתַן פִּדְיֹן נַפְשׁוֹ״ כְּתִיב. וְרַבָּנַן? אֵין, ״פִּדְיוֹן נַפְשׁוֹ״ כְּתִיב, מִיהוּ כִּי שָׁיְימִינַן, בִּדְנִיזָּק שָׁיְימִינַן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael, “And he shall give the redemption of his soul” is written, And the Rabbis Yes, “redemption of his soul” is written, Nevertheless, when we assess in of victim we assess
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael: "And he shall give redemption for his soul" is written. And the Rabbis? No, "his redemption for his soul" is written, however, when we establish it, we establish it in a case where we establish it.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין נִמְכָּרִין בְּעֶבֶד עִבְרִי. סָבַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא לְמֵימַר: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּאִית לֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ, דְּמִיגּוֹ דְּאִיהוּ לָא נִזְדַּבַּן – אִינְהוּ נָמֵי לָא מִיזְדַּבְּנוּ. אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִית לְהוּ לְדִידְהוּ – מִיזְדַּבְּנוּ.
human_translation: are not sold as a Hebrew slave Rav Hamnuna thought to say: This statement has of his own as since, he would not have been sold not sold But where does not have of his own, even if have of their own, they are sold,
llm_translation: They are not sold as a Hebrew slave. Rav Hamnuna thought to say: These matters, where he has them for himself, since they are not acquired by him - they are not acquired. But where he does not have them for himself, even though they are for his benefit - they are acquired.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: וְלֵימְרוּ לֵיהּ: אִי אַנְתְּ הֲוָה לָךְ מִי הֲוָה מִיזְדַּבְּנַתְּ? אֲנַן נָמֵי לָא מִיזְדַּבְּנִינַן. אֶלָּא סָבַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא לְמֵימַר: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּאִית לֵיהּ אוֹ לְדִידֵיהּ אוֹ לְדִידְהוּ, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ לָא לְדִידֵיהּ וְלָא לְדִידְהוּ – מִזְדַּבְּנִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: ״וְנִמְכַּר בִּגְנֵבָתוֹ״, אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא – בִּגְנֵבָתוֹ, וְלֹא בִּזְמָמוֹ.
human_translation: Rava said to him: And let say to If you had would you have been sold? We too will not be sold. Rather, Rav Hamnuna thought to say: This statement where either he, or they, have but where neither he nor they have are sold. Rava said to him: the Merciful One states: “And he shall be sold for his theft” For his theft, but not for his conspiring
llm_translation: Rava said to him: And let them say to him: If you were the one who was involved, were we not also involved? Rather, Rav Hamnuna thought to say: Those words apply where it is relevant to him or to his counterpart, but where it is not relevant to him or to his counterpart - we are involved. Rava said to him: "And he shall be sold with his theft," the Merciful One said - with his theft, and not with his scheming.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אָמְרוּ וְכוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? קָסָבַר קְנָסָא הוּא, וּקְנָס אֵין מְשַׁלֵּם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ. אָמַר רַבָּה: תֵּדַע, שֶׁהֲרֵי לֹא עָשׂוּ מַעֲשֶׂה, [וְנֶהֱרָגִים] וּמְשַׁלְּמִין. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: תֵּדַע, שֶׁהֲרֵי מָמוֹן בְּיַד בְּעָלִים, וּמְשַׁלְּמִים.
human_translation: said in the name of Rabbi Akiva: What is the reason of Rabbi Akiva? holds is a fine [ kenasa ], and One does not pay a fine based on his own Rabba says: Know as did not perform an action and they are executed or pay Rav Naḥman says: Know as the money in the possession of the owner and they pay
llm_translation: From the statement of Rabbi Akiva they said, etc. What is the reason for Rabbi Akiva's opinion? He holds that it is a penalty, and a penalty is not paid willingly. Rabbah said: Know that since they did not commit the act, and they are killed and they pay. Rav Nachman said: Know that the money is in the possession of the owners, and they pay.

hebrew_text: מַאי נִיהוּ, דְּלֹא עָשׂוּ מַעֲשֶׂה? הַיְינוּ דְּרַבָּה! אֵימָא: ״וְכֵן אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן״.
human_translation: What is that they did not perform an action. That is of Rabba, Say: And likewise Rav Naḥman says:
llm_translation: What is it that they did not do the deed? That is Rabah! Say: "And so said Rav Nachman."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: עֵד זוֹמֵם מְשַׁלֵּם לְפִי חֶלְקוֹ. מַאי ״מְשַׁלֵּם לְפִי חֶלְקוֹ״? אִילֵּימָא דְּהַאי מְשַׁלֵּם פַּלְגָא וְהַאי מְשַׁלֵּם פַּלְגָא, תְּנֵינָא: מְשַׁלְּשִׁין בְּמָמוֹן, וְאֵין מְשַׁלְּשִׁין בְּמַלְקוֹת!
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: A conspiring witness pays according to his share. What Pays according to his share? If we say that this pays half and that pays half, we learned one divides money but one does not divide lashes
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: A conspiring witness pays according to his share. What is meant by "pays according to his share"? If you say that this one pays half and that one pays half, we learned: They divide in monetary matters, but they do not divide in lashes!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: כְּגוֹן דְּאִיתַּזּוּם חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ, דִּמְשַׁלֵּם פַּלְגָא דִידֵיהּ, וּמִי מְשַׁלֵּם? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: אֵין עֵד זוֹמֵם מְשַׁלֵּם מָמוֹן עַד שֶׁיִּזּוֹמּוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם!
human_translation: Rather, where one of was rendered a conspiring that he pays his half And does pay But isn’t it taught A conspiring witness pays money only when both were rendered conspiring
llm_translation: Rather: for example, if one of them agreed, he pays half of his own, and who pays? And it was taught: A conspiring witness does not pay money until both of them conspire!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: בְּאוֹמֵר ״עֵדוּת שֶׁקֶר הֵעַדְתִּי״. כֹּל כְּמִינֵּיהּ? כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיד שׁוּב אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר וּמַגִּיד!
human_translation: Rava says: to says: false testimony I testified. Is it in his Once stated he may not then state
llm_translation: Rava said: When one says, "I have testified falsely," is it all like its kind? Once he has confessed, he does not retract and confess again!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּאוֹמֵר: ״הֵעַדְנוּ וְהוּזַמְנוּ בְּבֵית דִּין פְּלוֹנִי״. כְּמַאן – דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאִי כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, הָא אָמַר: אַף אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ!
human_translation: Rather, to says: We testified and were rendered conspiring in such and such a court. In accordance with whose not in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, since if in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, doesn’t he say: also does not pay based on his own
llm_translation: Rather, in saying: "We testified and were summoned in the court of so-and-so." Like whom? Like one who is not like Rabbi Akiva, for if he were like Rabbi Akiva, he would also say: He does not even pay according to his own admission!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּאוֹמֵר ״הֵעַדְנוּ וְהוּזַמְנוּ בְּבֵית דִּין פְּלוֹנִי וְחוּיַּיבְנוּ מָמוֹן״.
human_translation: Rather, to says: We testified and were rendered conspiring in such and such a court and we were rendered liable money.
llm_translation: Instead, in saying, "We have testified and been summoned in the court of so-and-so, and we are obligated to pay money."

hebrew_text: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: כֵּיוָן דִּלְחַבְרֵיהּ לָא מָצֵי מְחַיֵּיב לֵיהּ, אִיהוּ נָמֵי לָא מִיחַיַּיב, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: enter your mind to say since he is unable to render his fellow liable he too is not liable teaches us
llm_translation: I will ascend to your understanding: since he cannot join with his fellow, he is not obligated, he himself also is not obligated, he is teaching us.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״מְעִידִין אָנוּ אֶת אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי שֶׁגֵּירַשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וְלֹא נָתַן לָהּ כְּתוּבָתָהּ״, וַהֲלֹא בֵּין הַיּוֹם וּבֵין לְמָחָר, סוֹפוֹ לִיתֵּן לָהּ כְּתוּבָתָהּ.
human_translation: We testify a man so-and-so that he divorced his wife and did not give her her marriage contract, But isn’t either today or tomorrow, ultimately he to give her her marriage contract?
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "We testify regarding a certain man who divorced his wife and did not give her the marriage contract." But isn't it the case that between today and tomorrow, ultimately he must give her the marriage contract.

hebrew_text: אוֹמְדִין כַּמָּה אָדָם רוֹצֶה לִיתֵּן בִּכְתוּבָּתָהּ שֶׁל זוֹ, שֶׁאִם נִתְאַלְמְנָה אוֹ נִתְגָּרְשָׁה, וְאִם מֵתָה, יִירָשֶׁנָּה בַּעֲלָהּ.
human_translation: assesses how much person willing to give in this marriage contract, that if she was widowed or divorced but if she dies, her husband will inherit her,
llm_translation: We establish how much a man wants to give in her marriage contract, that if she becomes widowed or divorced, and if she dies, her husband will inherit her.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ כֵּיצַד שָׁמִין? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: בַּבַּעַל.
human_translation: How does assess Rav Ḥisda says: in the husband:
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, how do we hear?" Rav Ḥisda said: "With the owner."

hebrew_text: רַב נָתָן בַּר אוֹשַׁעְיָא אוֹמֵר: בָּאִשָּׁה.
human_translation: Rav Natan bar Oshaya says: in the wife:
llm_translation: Rav Natan bar Oshaya says: "In a woman."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בָּאִשָּׁה וּבִכְתוּבָּתָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: in the wife, and in her marriage contract.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: "With the woman and with her document."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״מְעִידִין אָנוּ בְּאִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב לַחֲבֵירוֹ אֶלֶף זוּז, עַל מְנָת לִיתְּנָן לוֹ מִכָּאן וְעַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר, ״מִכָּאן וְעַד עֶשֶׂר שָׁנִים״.
human_translation: We testify with regard to a man so-and-so that he owes another one thousand dinars on the condition to give to him from now until thirty days and says from now until ten years
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "We testify against a certain man that he owes his fellow one thousand zuz, on the condition to give it to him from now until thirty days," and he says, "from now until ten years."

hebrew_text: אוֹמְדִים כַּמָּה אָדָם רוֹצֶה לִיתֵּן וְיִהְיוּ בְּיָדוֹ אֶלֶף זוּז, בֵּין נוֹתְנָן מִכָּאן וְעַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, בֵּין נוֹתְנָן מִכָּאן וְעַד עֶשֶׂר שָׁנִים.
human_translation: estimates how much a person willing to give would one thousand dinars in his possession, between give from now until thirty days and give from now until ten years
llm_translation: One establishes how much a person wants to give, and they are in his possession a thousand zuz, whether he gives them from here until thirty days, or he gives them from here until ten years.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ לְעֶשֶׂר שָׁנִים – שְׁבִיעִית מְשַׁמַּטְתּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: one who lends another for ten years, the Sabbatical abrogates
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: One who lends to his fellow for ten years - the seventh year releases it.

hebrew_text: וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּהַשְׁתָּא לָא קָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״לֹא יִגֹּשׂ״, סוֹף אָתֵי לִידֵי ״לֹא יִגֹּשׂ״.
human_translation: And even though now, we do not read concerning his “He shall not exact it ultimately, come to “He shall not exact it”
llm_translation: And even though currently we do not read in it "he shall not approach," ultimately it will lead to "he shall not approach."

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב כָּהֲנָא: אוֹמְדִים כַּמָּה אָדָם רוֹצֶה לִיתֵּן וְיִהְיוּ אֶלֶף זוּז בְּיָדוֹ בֵּין לִיתֵּן מִכָּאן וְעַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, וּבֵין לִיתֵּן מִכָּאן וְעַד עֶשֶׂר שָׁנִים. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ שְׁבִיעִית מְשַׁמַּטְתּוֹ – כּוּלְּהוּ נָמֵי בָּעֵי שַׁלּוֹמֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rav Kahana raises an objection estimates how much a person willing to give would one thousand dinars in his possession, between to give from now until thirty days and give from now until ten years And if you say the Sabbatical abrogates need pay the entire as well,
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Kahana said: One may assess how much a person wishes to give, and he may have a thousand zuz in his possession between the time he wishes to give from here until thirty days, and between the time he wishes to give from here until ten years. And if you say that the seventh year cancels his debt – all of them, indeed, require peace with him!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בְּמַלְוֶה עַל הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן, וּבְמוֹסֵר שְׁטָרוֹתָיו לְבֵית דִּין. דִּתְנַן: הַמַּלְוֶה עַל הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן, וְהַמּוֹסֵר שְׁטָרוֹתָיו לְבֵית דִין – אֵין מַשְׁמִיטִין.
human_translation: Rava said: What are we dealing with here in lends on collateral, or in transfers his notes to the court As we learned one who lends on collateral and one who transfers his notes to the court does not abrogate
llm_translation: Rava said: Here, with what are we dealing? - With one who lends on a mortgage, and one who delivers his bonds to the court. For it was taught: One who lends on a mortgage, and one who delivers his bonds to the court - we do not release them.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ לְעֶשֶׂר שָׁנִים – אֵין שְׁבִיעִית מְשַׁמַּטְתּוֹ. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּאָתֵי לִידֵי ״לָא יִגֹּשׂ״, הַשְׁתָּא מִיהָא לָא קָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״לָא יִגֹּשׂ״.
human_translation: There are who state Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: one who lends another for ten years, the Sabbatical does not abrogate And even though come to “He shall not exact it” now, in any event, we do not read “He shall not exact it” concerning his
llm_translation: There is one who says, Rav Yehudah says Shmuel: One who lends to his fellow for ten years - the seventh year does not release him. And even though it is subject to "he shall not exact," now we do not read in it "he shall not exact."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: אוֹמְדִין כַּמָּה אָדָם רוֹצֶה לִיתֵּן וְיִהְיוּ אֶלֶף זוּז בְּיָדוֹ, בֵּין לִיתֵּן מִכָּאן וְעַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, וּבֵין לִיתֵּן מִכָּאן וְעַד עֶשֶׂר שָׁנִים. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ שְׁבִיעִית מְשַׁמַּטְתּוֹ – כּוּלְּהוּ נָמֵי בָּעוּ שַׁלּוֹמֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Kahana says: We learn as well: estimates how much a person willing to give one thousand dinars will be in his possession, between to give from now until thirty days and to give from now until ten years And if you say the Sabbatical abrogates should pay the entire as well,
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: We also learned in a Mishnah: One may set aside however much money a person wishes to give, even a thousand zuz in his hand, whether to give it from here until thirty days, or to give it from here until ten years. And if you say the seventh year releases it - all of them came to make peace with him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בְּמַלְוֶה עַל הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן, וּבְמוֹסֵר שְׁטָרוֹתָיו לְבֵית דִּין, דִּתְנַן: הַמַּלְוֶה עַל הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן, וְהַמּוֹסֵר שְׁטָרוֹתָיו לְבֵית דִין – אֵין מַשְׁמִיטִין.
human_translation: Rava said: what are we dealing with here in lends on collateral, or in transfers his notes to the court As we learned one who lends on collateral and one who transfers his notes to the court does not abrogate
llm_translation: Rava said: Here, with what are we dealing? - With one who lends on a mortgage, and who delivers his documents to the court, as we learned: One who lends on a mortgage, and who delivers his documents to the court - we do not release the debt.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁלֹּא תְּשַׁמְּטֵנִי שְׁבִיעִית״ – שְׁבִיעִית מְשַׁמֶּטֶת. לֵימָא קָסָבַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מַתְנֶה עַל מָה שֶׁכָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה הוּא, וְכׇל הַמַּתְנֶה עַל מָה שֶׁכָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה – תְּנָאוֹ בָּטֵל?
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says one who says to another on the condition that the Sabbatical will not abrogate my the Sabbatical abrogates Let us say Shmuel holds is stipulates counter to that which is written in the Torah, and anyone who stipulates counter to that which is written in the Torah, his stipulation is voided.
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: One who says to his fellow, "On the condition that you do not release me during the seventh year," the seventh year releases him. Let us say that Shmuel holds: One can stipulate based on what is written in the Torah, and anyone who stipulates based on what is written in the Torah – his stipulation is nullified?

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִיתְּמַר, הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֵין לְךָ עָלַי אוֹנָאָה״, רַב אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ לוֹ עָלָיו אוֹנָאָה, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֵין לוֹ עָלָיו אוֹנָאָה.
human_translation: But wasn’t it stated one who says to another on the condition that you have no exploitation against me Rav says: has exploitation against him, And Shmuel says: He has no exploitation against him.
llm_translation: And it was stated: One who says to his fellow, "On condition that you have no claim against me for ona'ah (overcharging)," Rav says: He has a claim of ona'ah against him, and Shmuel says: He has no claim of ona'ah against him.

hebrew_text: הָא אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַב עָנָן: לְדִידִי מִפָּרְשָׁא לֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֵין לְךָ עָלַי אוֹנָאָה״ – אֵין לוֹ עָלָיו אוֹנָאָה. ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ אוֹנָאָה״ – הֲרֵי יֵשׁ בּוֹ אוֹנָאָה.
human_translation: Wasn’t it stated with regard to that Rav Anan said: It was explained to me by Shmuel On the condition that you have no exploitation against me, has no exploitation against him, On the condition that there is no exploitation in there is exploitation in
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: It was stated regarding this matter, Rav Anan said: According to my understanding, from the explanation of Shmuel, "On the condition that you have no oppression upon me" - he does not have oppression upon him. "On the condition that he has no oppression" - behold, there is oppression in it.

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי, ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁלֹּא תְּשַׁמְּטֵנִי בַּשְּׁבִיעִית״ – אֵין שְׁבִיעִית מְשַׁמַּטְתּוֹ. ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁלֹּא תְּשַׁמְּטֵנִי שְׁבִיעִית״ – שְׁבִיעִית מְשַׁמַּטְתּוֹ.
human_translation: Here too, on the condition that you will not abrogate during the Sabbatical the Sabbatical does not abrogate On the condition that the Sabbatical will not abrogate my the Sabbatical abrogates
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text into English: Here it is taught: "On the condition that you do not release me in the seventh year" - the seventh year does not release it. "On the condition that you do not release me in the seventh year" - the seventh year releases it.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ סְתָם – אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לְתוֹבְעוֹ פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. סְבַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חַנָּה קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב לְמֵימַר: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּמִלְוֶה בִּשְׁטָר, דְּלָא עֲבִד אִינִישׁ דְּטָרַח דְּכָתֵב שְׁטָר בְּצִיר מִתְּלָתִין יוֹמִין, אֲבָל מִלְוֶה עַל פֶּה – לָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב: הָכִי אָמַר חֲבִיבִי: אֶחָד הַמַּלְוֶה בִּשְׁטָר וְאֶחָד הַמַּלְוֶה עַל פֶּה.
human_translation: taught: One who lends another an unspecified is not permitted to demand from him less than thirty days Rabba bar bar Ḥana, before Rav, thought to say: This statement with regard to a loan with note, as a person does not typically exert to write note less than thirty days. But a loan by oral no, Rav said to him: This my uncle, said: both one who lends with note and one who lends by oral
llm_translation: Mishna: One who lends to his fellow without specifying - he is not permitted to demand repayment for less than thirty days. Rabba bar bar Ḥana thought before Rav to say: These matters apply to lending with a document, for a person does not exert himself to write a document until thirty days have passed, but lending orally - no. Rav said to him: So said my beloved one: One who lends with a document and one who lends orally.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ סְתָם – אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לְתוֹבְעוֹ פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, אֶחָד הַמַּלְוֶה בִּשְׁטָר וְאֶחָד הַמַּלְוֶה עַל פֶּה.
human_translation: That is also taught One who lends another an unspecified is not permitted to demand from him less than thirty days both one who lends with note and one who lends by oral
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If one lends money to his fellow without specifying a time limit, he is not permitted to demand repayment until thirty days have passed, whether one lent with a contract or one lent verbally.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב מַתְנָה: לָא תִּיתֵּיב אַכַּרְעָיךָ עַד דִּמְפָרְשַׁתְּ לָהּ לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא: מְנַָא הָא מִילְּתָא דַאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן: הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ סְתָם אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לְתוֹבְעוֹ פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, אֶחָד הַמַּלְוֶה בִּשְׁטָר וְאֶחָד הַמַּלְוֶה עַל פֶּה?
human_translation: Shmuel said to Rav Mattana: You shall not sit on your feet until you have explained this halakha ; From where is this matter that the Sages stated One who lends another an unspecified is not permitted to demand from him less than thirty days both one who lends with note and one who lends by oral
llm_translation: Shmuel said to Rav Matna: Do not sit down until you clarify this matter for her: From where is this matter that the Rabbis say: One who lends to his fellow without specifying a time is not permitted to demand repayment until after thirty days, whether one lent with a contract or one lent verbally?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּכְתִיב ״קָרְבָה שְׁנַת הַשֶּׁבַע שְׁנַת הַשְּׁמִטָּה״, מִמַּשְׁמַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״קָרְבָה שְׁנַת הַשֶּׁבַע״, אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁהִיא שְׁנַת שְׁמִטָּה? אֶלָּא מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״שְׁנַת הַשְּׁמִטָּה״? לוֹמַר לָךְ: [יֵשׁ] שְׁמִטָּה אַחֶרֶת שֶׁהִיא כָּזוֹ, וְאֵיזוֹ – זוֹ הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ סְתָם, שֶׁאֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לְתוֹבְעוֹ בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. דְּאָמַר מָר: שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם בַּשָּׁנָה חָשׁוּב שָׁנָה.
human_translation: said to him as it is written: “The seventh year, the Sabbatical Year, approaches” From that it is stated: “The seventh year…approaches,” don’t I know that it is the Sabbatical Year? Rather, why the verse state: “The Sabbatical Year”? to tell you there is another that is like the Sabbatical and which is it? It is one who lends another an unspecified who is not permitted to demand from him less than thirty days as the Master said: Thirty days in a year are considered a year.
llm_translation: He said to him: As it is written, "The seventh year, the year of release," from the implication that it says, "The seventh year," I do not know that it is the year of release? Rather, what is the teaching to say "the year of release"? To tell you: there is another release that is like this, and what is it? This is one who lends money to his fellow without specifying, that he is not allowed to demand repayment from him for less than thirty days. As Mar said: Thirty days in the year are considered a year.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הַפּוֹתֵחַ בֵּית הַצַּוָּאר בְּשַׁבָּת – חַיָּיב חַטָּאת. מַתְקֵיף לָהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא: וְכִי מָה בֵּין זֶה לִמְגוּפַת חָבִית? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זֶה חִבּוּר, וְזֶה אֵינוֹ חִבּוּר.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says Rav says: One who opens neck opening on Shabbat liable a sin-offering. Rav Kahana objects to this: And what between this and the stopper of barrel, said to him: this a connecting and that not a connecting
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: One who opens the door of a storehouse on Shabbat - is liable for a sin offering. Rav Kahana objected to him: What is the difference between this and breaking the neck of a barrel? He said to him: This is a connection, and that is not a connection.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: שְׁלֹשֶׁת לוּגִּין מַיִם שֶׁנָּפַל לְתוֹכָן קוּרְטוֹב שֶׁל יַיִן, וּמַרְאֵיהֶן כְּמַרְאֵה יַיִן, וְנָפְלוּ לְמִקְוֶה – לֹא פְּסָלוּהוּ. מַתְקֵיף לָהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא: וְכִי מָה בֵּין זֶה לְמֵי צֶבַע? דִּתְנַן: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מֵי צֶבַע פּוֹסְלִין אֶת הַמִּקְוֶה בִּשְׁלֹשֶׁת לוּגִּין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: הָתָם ״מַיָּא דְצִבְעָא״ מִקְּרֵי, הָכָא ״חַמְרָא מְזִיגָא״ מִקְּרֵי.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says Rav says: three log water into which one sixty-fourth of a log [ kortov ] wine fell, and the color of is like the color of wine, and fell into a ritual bath does not invalidate it, Rav Kahana objects to this: And what between this and dye water, as we learned Rabbi Yosei says: Dye water in three log invalidates a ritual bath? Rava said to him: there is called dye water, here it is called diluted wine.
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Three log of water into which a quarter-log of wine fell, and their appearance is like the appearance of wine, and they fell into a mikveh - they do not disqualify it. Rav Kahana objected to him: What is the difference between this and colored water? As we learned: Rabbi Yosei says: Colored water disqualifies the mikveh with three log. Rava said to him: There, it is called "water of dye," here it is called "wine that is poured."

hebrew_text: וְהָתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: הוֹרִידוּ אֶת הַמִּקְוֶה! אָמַר רָבָא: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי, הָא רַבָּנַן, דִּתְנַן: שְׁלֹשֶׁת לוּגִּין מַיִם
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya teach reduce the ritual bath Rava said not difficult, this Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri, that the Rabbis, As we learned three log water
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "And it was taught by Rabbi Chiya: 'Lower the mikveh!' Rava said: 'It is not difficult, for Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri, the Sages, as we learned: 'Three lug of water.'"

hebrew_text: חָסֵר קוּרְטוֹב, שֶׁנָּפַל לְתוֹכָן קוּרְטוֹב יַיִן, וּמַרְאֵיהֶן כְּמַרְאֵה יַיִן, וְנָפְלוּ לַמִּקְוֶה – לֹא פְּסָלוּהוּ. וְכֵן שְׁלֹשָׁה לוּגִּין מַיִם חָסֵר קוּרְטוֹב, שֶׁנָּפַל לְתוֹכָן קוּרְטוֹב חָלָב, וּמַרְאֵיהֶן כְּמַרְאֵה מַיִם, וְנָפְלוּ לַמִּקְוֶה – לֹא פְּסָלוּהוּ.
human_translation: less one kortov into which a kortov of wine fell, and appearance like the appearance of wine; and fell into a ritual bath, it did not invalidate And likewise, three log water less one kortov into which a kortov of milk fell and appearance like the appearance of water, and fell into a ritual bath, it did not invalidate
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If a kurtove is missing, which a kurtove of wine fell into them, and their appearance is like the appearance of wine, and they fell into the mikveh - they do not disqualify it. And similarly, if three lug of water are missing, which a kurtove of milk fell into them, and their appearance is like the appearance of water, and they fell into the mikveh - they do not disqualify it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי אוֹמֵר: הַכֹּל הוֹלֵךְ אַחַר הַמַּרְאֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri says: Everything follows the appearance
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri says: Everything goes after the appearance.

hebrew_text: הָא מִיבַּעְיָא בָּעֵי לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא. דְּבָעֵי רַב פָּפָּא: רַב תָּנֵי: ״חָסֵר קוּרְטוֹב״ בְּרֵישָׁא, אֲבָל שְׁלֹשָׁה לוּגִּין, לְתַנָּא קַמָּא פָּסְלִי, וַאֲתָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְמֵימַר: הַכֹּל הוֹלֵךְ אַחַר הַמַּרְאֶה, וְרַב אוֹמֵר כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי.
human_translation: Wasn’t raised as a dilemma by Rav Pappa? As Rav Pappa raised a dilemma: Rav teaches: less one kortov , in the first clause. But three log according to the first tanna , it invalidates And Rabbi Yoḥanan comes to say: Everything follows the appearance, And Rav states in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri.
llm_translation: The matter that Rav Pappa inquired about. For Rav Pappa inquired: Rav taught: "Lacking a kav" at the beginning, but three lugim, according to the first Tanna, disqualify. And Rabbi Yochanan came to say: Everything follows the appearance, and Rav says like Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִּלְמָא רַב לָא תָּנֵי: ״חָסֵר קוּרְטוֹב״ בְּרֵישָׁא, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי – כִּי פְּלִיג, אַסֵּיפָא הוּא דִּפְלִיג,
human_translation: Or perhaps Rav did not teach: less one kortov , in the first clause And when Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri disagrees, it is with regard to the latter clause that he disagrees,
llm_translation: Or perhaps Rav did not teach: "Lacking a quarter-kor" at the beginning, and Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri - for he disputes, it is the latter part that he disputes.

hebrew_text: וְרַב דְּאָמַר – כְּדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל?
human_translation: And Rav states in accordance with everyone.
llm_translation: And Rav said - like the words of everyone?

hebrew_text: לְרַב פָּפָּא מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ, לְרָבָא פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: for Rav Pappa is a dilemma for Rava obvious.
llm_translation: To Rav Papa, Mivaya Leih, to Rava, Peshita Leih.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לָא שְׁמִיעָא לִי הָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אַתְּ אֲמַרְתְּ לַהּ נִיהֲלַן, וְהָכִי אֲמַרְתְּ נִיהֲלַן, דְּרַב לָא תָּנֵי ״חָסֵר קוּרְטוֹב״ בְּרֵישָׁא, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אַסֵּיפָא פְּלִיג, וְרַב דְּאָמַר כְּדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: I did not hear this halakha Abaye said to him: You said it to us, And this is you said to us: Rav did not teach: Less one kortov , in the first and Rabbi Yoḥanan disagrees with regard to the latter clause, Rav who states in accordance with everyone.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "I did not hear this statement." Abaye said to him: "You said to her 'we will manage,' and thus you said 'we will manage,' for Rav does not teach 'lacking a kurtov' at the beginning, and Rabbi Yochanan disagrees at the end, and Rav said as the words of everyone."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: חָבִית מְלֵיאָה מַיִם שֶׁנָּפְלָה לַיָּם הַגָּדוֹל, הַטּוֹבֵל שָׁם – לֹא עָלְתָה לוֹ טְבִילָה. חָיְישִׁינַן לִשְׁלֹשָׁה לוּגִּין שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ בְּמָקוֹם אֶחָד. וְדַוְקָא לַיָּם הַגָּדוֹל, דְּקָאֵי וְקָיְימָא, אֲבָל נַהֲרָא בְּעָלְמָא – לָא.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says Rav says: a barrel full of water that fell into the Mediterranean Sea, one who immerses there immersion did not effect his we are concerned that three log should not be in one place, And specifically to the Mediterranean Sea, whose are stagnant. But a standard river, no,
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: A barrel full of water that fell into the great sea, if one immerses there - the immersion is not valid. We are concerned for three log that may not be in one place. And specifically in the great sea, where it is stationary and established, but in a regular river - no.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: חָבִית מְלֵיאָה יַיִן שֶׁנָּפְלָה לַיָּם הַגָּדוֹל, הַטּוֹבֵל שָׁם – לֹא עָלְתָה לוֹ טְבִילָה. חָיְישִׁינַן לִשְׁלֹשָׁה לוּגִּין שְׁאוּבִין שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ בְּמָקוֹם אֶחָד. וְכֵן כִּכָּר שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה שֶׁנָּפַל שָׁם – טָמֵא.
human_translation: This is also taught a barrel full of wine that fell into the Mediterranean Sea, one who immerses there, immersion did not effect his we are concerned that three log of drawn should not be in one place. And likewise, a loaf of teruma that fell there, is impure
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: If a barrel full of wine fell into the great sea, and one immersed it there - immersion is not effective for it. We are concerned for three log cisterns that are not in one place. Similarly, a loaf of terumah that fell there - it is impure.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְכֵן״? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא, הָתָם אוֹקֵי גַּבְרָא אַחֶזְקֵיהּ, הָכָא אוֹקֵי תְּרוּמָה אַחֶזְקַהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: What And likewise? Lest you say there, Establish the person on his presumptive status here, Establish the teruma on its presumptive status teaches us
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "and so"? What might you say, there he established the man's ownership, here he established the status of the offering, it teaches us.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״מְעִידִין אָנוּ בְּאִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי שֶׁחַיָּיב לַחֲבֵירוֹ מָאתַיִם זוּז״, וְנִמְצְאוּ זוֹמְמִין – לוֹקִין וּמְשַׁלְּמִין, שֶׁלֹּא הַשֵּׁם הַמְּבִיאָן לִידֵי מַכּוֹת מְבִיאָן לִידֵי תַּשְׁלוּמִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל הַמְשַׁלֵּם – אֵינוֹ לוֹקָה.
human_translation: We testify with regard to a man so-and-so that he is liable to another two hundred dinars, and they were found conspiring they are flogged, and they pay that the source that brings them to lashes not brings them to payment; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: Anyone who pays is not flogged
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "We testify against a certain individual that he is obligated to pay his fellow two hundred zuz, and if the witnesses are found to be conspiring witnesses – they receive lashes and make restitution. For just as the Name that brings about liability to receive lashes also brings about liability to make restitution, these are the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: Anyone who makes restitution is not subject to lashes."

hebrew_text: ״מְעִידִין אָנוּ בְּאִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב מַלְקוֹת אַרְבָּעִים״, וְנִמְצְאוּ זוֹמְמִין – לוֹקִין שְׁמוֹנִים, מִשּׁוּם: ״לֹא תַעֲנֶה בְרֵעֲךָ עֵד שָׁקֶר״, וּמִשּׁוּם: ״וַעֲשִׂיתֶם לוֹ כַּאֲשֶׁר זָמַם״, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין לוֹקִין אֶלָּא אַרְבָּעִים.
human_translation: We testify with regard to a man so-and-so that he is liable forty lashes, and they were discovered conspiring they are flogged eighty due to “You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor” and due to “And you shall do to him as he conspired” the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: They are flogged only forty
llm_translation: "We testify regarding a certain individual that he is liable for forty lashes," and if they are found to be conspiring witnesses - he receives eighty lashes, due to: "You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor," and due to: "And you shall do to him as he conspired," the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: One only receives forty lashes.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבָּנַן. ״כְּדֵי רִשְׁעָתוֹ״ כְּתִיב, מִשּׁוּם רִשְׁעָה אַחַת אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ וְאִי אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁתֵּי רִשְׁעָיוֹת. אֶלָּא רַבִּי מֵאִיר מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: Granted, to the Rabbis, according to the measure of his wickedness” is written For one evildoing you can render him liable, but you cannot render him liable for two evildoings, But Rabbi Meir, what is the reason
llm_translation: Gemara: "Regarding the sages' opinion. 'For his wickedness' is written, due to one wickedness you obligate him, and if you do not obligate him, it is due to his two wickednesses. Rather, what is Rabbi Meir's reasoning?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: גָּמַר מִמּוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע. מָה מוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע – לוֹקֶה וּמְשַׁלֵּם, אַף כֹּל – לוֹקֶה וּמְשַׁלֵּם. מָה לְמוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע, שֶׁכֵּן קְנָס! סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאָמַר: עֵדִים זוֹמְמִין – קְנָסָא הוּא.
human_translation: Ulla said: derived from one who defames Just as the defamer is flogged and pays, so too, anyone is flogged and pays. What about a defamer? in that a fine, holds in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who says: conspiring witnesses is a fine.
llm_translation: Ula said: One who utters a derogatory name is liable. Just as one who utters a derogatory name is liable to receive lashes and pay compensation, so too in every case one is liable to receive lashes and pay compensation. Why is one who utters a derogatory name liable? Because it is a penalty. He holds like Rabbi Akiva who said: Conspiring witnesses incur a penalty.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לְהָא דְּעוּלָּא אַהָא דְּתַנְיָא: ״לֹא תוֹתִירוּ מִמֶּנּוּ עַד בֹּקֶר וְהַנֹּתָר מִמֶּנּוּ עַד בֹּקֶר, וְגוֹ׳״ – בָּא הַכָּתוּב לִיתֵּן עֲשֵׂה אַחַר לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, לוֹמַר שֶׁאֵין לוֹקִין עָלָיו, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: There are those who teach this of Ulla with regard to that which is taught “And you shall let nothing of it remain until morning, but that which remains of it until morning The verse comes to provide a positive mitzva after a prohibition, to say that one is not flogged for its the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: There is one who teaches in accordance with that which was taught: "Do not leave any of it until morning, and what remains of it until morning, etc." - the verse comes to give a positive command after a negative command, to say that one is not liable for it, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: לֹא מִן הַשֵּׁם הוּא זֶה, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה, וְכׇל לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה אֵין לוֹקִין עָלָיו. מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה לוֹקִין עָלָיו, מְנָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: is not for reason; rather, due to that is a prohibition that does not involve an action, and any prohibition that does not involve an action, one is not flogged for its by inference that Rabbi Yehuda holds a prohibition that does not involve an action, one is flogged for its From where does
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Not from the name is this, rather because it is not that there is no action, and any negative commandment that does not have an action, one does not receive lashes for it. From the principle that Rabbi Yehuda holds that a negative commandment that does not have an action, one receives lashes for it, how does he derive this?

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: גָּמַר מִמּוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע. מָה מוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה – לוֹקִין עָלָיו, אַף כׇּל לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה – לוֹקִין עָלָיו. מָה לְמוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע, שֶׁכֵּן לוֹקֶה וּמְשַׁלֵּם!
human_translation: Ulla said: derived from the defamer; just as the defamer a prohibition that does not involve an action, one is flogged for its so too, any prohibition that does not involve an action, one is flogged for its What about defamer? in that he is flogged and pays
llm_translation: Ula said: One is liable for defamation. Just as one is liable for defamation that lacks an action, so too, one is liable for any defamation that lacks an action. Just as one is liable for defamation, so too, one is liable and must pay!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: גָּמַר מֵעֵדִים זוֹמְמִין. מָה עֵדִים זוֹמְמִין לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה – לוֹקִין עָלָיו, אַף כׇּל לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה – לוֹקִין עָלָיו. מָה לְעֵדִים זוֹמְמִין, שֶׁכֵּן אֵין צְרִיכִין הַתְרָאָה!
human_translation: Rather, Reish Lakish says: derives from conspiring witnesses. Just as the conspiring witnesses a prohibition that does not involve an action is flogged for its so too, any prohibition that does not involve an action, one is flogged for its What about conspiring witnesses? in that do not require forewarning
llm_translation: Rather, Reish Lakish said: "We learn from conspiring witnesses. Just as conspiring witnesses who testify about something that did not involve an action are subject to lashes, so too, any prohibition that does not involve an action is subject to lashes. Just as conspiring witnesses, who are not in need of a warning, are subject to lashes!"

hebrew_text: מוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע יוֹכִיחַ. וְחָזַר הַדִּין: לֹא רְאִי זֶה כִּרְאִי זֶה, וְלֹא רְאִי זֶה כִּרְאִי זֶה. הַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן – לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה וְלוֹקִין עָלָיו, אַף כׇּל לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה לוֹקִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: The defamer will prove And the inference has reverted characteristic of this is not like characteristic of that characteristic of that characteristic of this Their common denominator a prohibition that does not involve an action and one is flogged for its So too, any prohibition that does not involve an action, one is flogged for its
llm_translation: One who brings out a bad name shall be rebuked. And the judgment returned: Not this sight like that sight, and not that sight like this sight. The equal side in them - it is not one that has a deed and they flog him, even every one that does not have a deed they flog him.

hebrew_text: מָה לְהַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן, שֶׁכֵּן קְנָס! הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: What about their common denominator? in that a fine, This not difficult; Rabbi Yehuda does not hold in accordance with Rabbi Akiva
llm_translation: What is the case of the equal side in them, that it is a penalty! This is not difficult: Rabbi Yehuda does not hold like Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מָה לְהַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן, שֶׁכֵּן יֵשׁ בָּהֶן צַד חָמוּר! וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? צַד חָמוּר לָא פָּרֵיךְ.
human_translation: Rather, What about their common denominator? in that both contain a stringent aspect; And Rabbi Yehuda does not refute stringent aspect.
llm_translation: Rather: What is the side that is equal in both, that there is a severe side in them! And Rabbi Yehuda? He did not explain the severe side.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, הַאי ״לֹא תַעֲנֶה בְרֵעֲךָ עֵד שָׁקֶר״ מַאי דָּרְשִׁי בֵּיהּ?
human_translation: And the Rabbis, this “You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor,” what do they derive from it,
llm_translation: And the Rabbis, this "You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor," what do they expound in it?

hebrew_text: הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְאַזְהָרָה לְעֵדִים זוֹמְמִין. וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, אַזְהָרָה לְעֵדִים זוֹמְמִין מְנָא לֵיהּ? אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״וְּהַנִּשְׁאָרִים יִשְׁמְעוּ וְיִרָאוּ וְלֹא יֹסִיפוּ עוֹד״.
human_translation: They require that as a prohibition against conspiring witnesses. And Rabbi Meir, from where does he a prohibition for conspiring witnesses? Rabbi Yirmeya said: He derives it from “And those who remain shall hear and fear, and shall not continue any more
llm_translation: That one asks for a warning for conspiring witnesses. And Rabbi Meir, how does he derive a warning for conspiring witnesses? Rabbi Yirmiyah said: It is derived from "the rest shall hear and fear, and shall henceforth commit no more evil."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן? הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ
human_translation: And the Rabbis, That is necessary
llm_translation: And the sages? That one asks him.

hebrew_text: לְהַכְרָזָה. וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר? הַכְרָזָה מִ״יִּשְׁמְעוּ וְיִרָאוּ״ נָפְקָא.
human_translation: for proclamation. And Rabbi Meir derives proclamation from “Shall hear and fear.”
llm_translation: Announcement. And Rabbi Meir? Announcement from "Who will listen and fear" is derived.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מְשַׁלְּשִׁין בַּמָּמוֹן וְאֵין מְשַׁלְּשִׁין בַּמַּכּוֹת. כֵּיצַד? הֶעִידוּהוּ שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב לַחֲבֵירוֹ מָאתַיִם זוּז וְנִמְצְאוּ זוֹמְמִין – מְשַׁלְּשִׁין בֵּינֵיהֶם. אֲבָל אִם הֶעִידוּהוּ שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב מַלְקוֹת אַרְבָּעִים וְנִמְצְאוּ זוֹמְמִין – כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד לוֹקֶה אַרְבָּעִים.
human_translation: one divides of money but one does not divide of lashes How so? testified about that he owes another two hundred dinars and they were found conspiring divide among themselves But if they testified about that he was liable forty lashes and they were found conspiring each and every one receives forty lashes.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may divide the payment for damages when it comes to monetary matters, but one may not divide the payment when it comes to corporal punishments. How so? If they testified that he owes his fellow two hundred zuz, and then witnesses were found to be conspiring witnesses – they divide the payment between them. But if they testified that he is liable for forty lashes, and then witnesses were found to be conspiring witnesses – each and every one of them receives forty lashes.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: נֶאֱמַר ״רָשָׁע״ בְּחַיָּיבֵי מַלְקִיּוֹת, וְנֶאֱמַר ״רָשָׁע״ בְּחַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין. מָה לְהַלָּן – אֵין מִיתָה לְמֶחֱצָה, אַף כָּאן – אֵין מַלְקוֹת לְמֶחֱצָה.
human_translation: From where are these matters, Abaye said: “Wicked” is stated with regard to those liable lashes, and: “Wicked” is stated with regard to those liable a court death Just as there, there is no partial death so too here, there is no partial lashes.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemar mena hanei milei? Amar Abbaye: Ne'emar "rasha" bechayavei malkiyot, vene'emar "rasha" bechayavei mitot beit din. Mah lehalan - ein mitah lemechatzah, af kan - ein malkot lemechatzah. English translation: How do we know these matters? Abbaye said: It is stated "wicked" regarding those liable for lashes, and it is stated "wicked" regarding those liable for death by the court. Just as there - there is no partial death penalty, so too here - there are no partial lashes.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: בָּעִינַן ״כַּאֲשֶׁר זָמַם לַעֲשׂוֹת לְאָחִיו״, וְלֵיכָּא. אִי הָכִי, מָמוֹן נָמֵי! מָמוֹן מִצְטָרֵף, מַלְקוֹת לָא מִצְטָרֵף.
human_translation: Rava said: we require “As he conspired to do to his brother” and not If so, money too, money combine, lashes cannot combine.
llm_translation: Rava said: We require "as he devised to do to his brother," and it is not so. If so, monetary payment! Monetary payment combines, but lashes do not combine.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין הָעֵדִים נַעֲשִׂים זוֹמְמִין עַד שֶׁיָּזֵימּוּ אֶת עַצְמָן.
human_translation: Witnesses are not rendered conspiring until impeach themselves
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The witnesses are not considered conspiring witnesses until they incriminate themselves.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? אָמְרוּ ״מְעִידִין אֲנִי בְּאִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי שֶׁהָרַג אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ״. אָמְרוּ לָהֶם: ״הֵיאַךְ אַתֶּם מְעִידִין? שֶׁהֲרֵי נֶהֱרָג זֶה אוֹ הַהוֹרֵג זֶה הָיָה עִמָּנוּ אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם בְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי!״ – אֵין אֵלּוּ זוֹמְמִין. אֲבָל אָמְרוּ לָהֶם: ״הֵיאַךְ אַתֶּם מְעִידִין? שֶׁהֲרֵי אַתֶּם הֱיִיתֶם עִמָּנוּ אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם בְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי!״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ זוֹמְמִין, וְנֶהֱרָגִין עַל פִּיהֶם.
human_translation: How so? said: We testify with regard to a man so-and-so that he killed a person, said to them: How can you testify This was killed, or this who killed, was with us, that day in such and such place, these not conspiring But said to them: How can you testify You were with us that day in such and such place. these conspiring and are executed on the basis of their,
llm_translation: How so? They said, "I testify concerning a certain man who killed the soul." They said to them, "How do you testify? For either this one was killed or the one killing was with us today in such and such a place!" - These are not considered conspiring witnesses. But if they said to them, "How do you testify? For you were with us today in such and such a place!" - These are considered conspiring witnesses, and they are executed based on their own words.

hebrew_text: בָּאוּ אֲחֵרִים וֶהֱזִימּוּם, בָּאוּ אֲחֵרִים וֶהֱזִימּוּם, אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה – כּוּלָּם יֵהָרְגוּ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִיסְטָטִית הִיא זוֹ, וְאֵינוֹ נֶהֱרָג אֶלָּא כַּת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: other came and rendered them conspiring other came and rendered them conspiring even one hundred all of them are executed Rabbi Yehuda says: This is a conspiracy [ istatit ], and only the first set alone executed.
llm_translation: Others came and instigated them, others came and instigated them, even a hundred - all of them shall be killed. Rabbi Yehuda says: This is a precautionary measure, and only the first group is killed.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב אַדָּא: דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהִנֵּה עֵד שֶׁקֶר הָעֵד שֶׁקֶר עָנָה״ – עַד שֶׁתִּשָּׁקֵר גּוּפָהּ שֶׁל עֵדוּת.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rav Adda said: as the verse states “And the witness is a false witness; he testified falsely until the body of the testimony is rendered false,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemar mena hanei milei? Amar Rav Adda: De'amar kra: "Ve'hineh ed sheker ha'ed sheker anah" - ad shetishaker gufah shel edut. English translation: What is the meaning of these words? Rav Adda said: As the verse states, "And behold, a false witness who testifies falsely" - until her testimony is proven false.

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל תָּנָא: ״לַעֲנוֹת בּוֹ סָרָה״ – עַד שֶׁתִּסְרֶה גּוּפָהּ שֶׁל עֵדוּת.
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught to bear perverted witness against him” until the body of the testimony is rendered perverted,
llm_translation: Houses of Rabbi Yishmael taught: "To afflict it with leprosy" - until her body of testimony is afflicted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: בָּאוּ שְׁנַיִם וְאָמְרוּ: ״בְּמִזְרַח בִּירָה הָרַג פְּלוֹנִי אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ״, וּבָאוּ שְׁנַיִם וְאָמְרוּ: ״וַהֲלֹא בְּמַעֲרַב בִּירָה עִמָּנוּ הֱיִיתֶם!״, חָזֵינַן, אִי כִּדְקָיְימִי בְּמַעֲרַב בִּירָה מִיחְזֵא חָזוּ לְמִזְרַח בִּירָה – אֵין אֵלּוּ זוֹמְמִין, וְאִם לָאו – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ זוֹמְמִין.
human_translation: Rava says: Two came and said: So-and-so killed a person to the east of a building [ bira ], and two came and said But were you not with us to the west of the building We see: If, when are standing to the west of the building they see to the east of the building, these are not conspiring But if not these are conspiring
llm_translation: Rava said: Two witnesses came and said, "In the east of the city, Ploni killed the person," and two witnesses came and said, "But weren't you with us in the west of the city!" We saw, if they are established in the west of the city, they can see into the east of the city - these are not conspiring witnesses. But if not, behold, these are conspiring witnesses.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לֵיחוּשׁ לִנְהוֹרָא בָּרְיָא, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious? Lest you say: Let us be concerned about good eyesight teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious! What might you say: to be concerned about the light of the Creator, it is heard for us.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: בָּאוּ שְׁנַיִם וְאָמְרוּ ״בְּסוּרָא בְּצַפְרָא בְּחַד בְּשַׁבְּתָא הָרַג פְּלוֹנִי אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ״, וּבָאוּ שְׁנַיִם וְאָמְרוּ: ״בְּפַנְיָא בְּחַד בְּשַׁבְּתָא עִמָּנוּ הֱיִיתֶם בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא!״, חָזֵינַן, אִי מִצַּפְרָא לְפַנְיָא מָצֵי אָזֵיל מִסּוּרָא לִנְהַרְדְּעָא – לָא הָווּ זוֹמְמִין, וְאִי לָאו – הָווּ זוֹמְמִין.
human_translation: And Rava says: two came and said: So-and-so killed a person in Sura in the morning on Sunday, and two came and said In the evening on Sunday you were with us in Neharde’a, we see: If is able to travel from Sura to Neharde’a from morning until evening they are not conspiring And if not they are conspiring
llm_translation: And Rava said: Two witnesses came and said, "In Sura, in Tzafra, on one Shabbat, Ploni killed a person," and two other witnesses came and said, "In Panya, on one Shabbat, you were with us in Nehardea!" We saw, if from Tzafra to Panya it is possible to go from Sura to Nehardea - they are not conspiring, but if not - they are conspiring.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא לֵיחוּשׁ לְגַמְלָא פָּרָחָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious? Lest you say: Let us be concerned about a flying camel, teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious! What might you say, to suspect the camel of theft, it is evident to us.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: בָּאוּ שְׁנַיִם וְאָמְרוּ ״בְּחַד בְּשַׁבְּתָא הָרַג פְּלוֹנִי אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ״, וּבָאוּ שְׁנַיִם וְאָמְרוּ ״עִמָּנוּ הֱיִיתֶם בְּחַד בְּשַׁבְּתָא, אֶלָּא בִּתְרֵי בְּשַׁבְּתָא הָרַג פְּלוֹנִי אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ״. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ אָמְרוּ ״עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת הָרַג פְּלוֹנִי אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ״ – נֶהֱרָגִין, דִּבְעִידָּנָא דְּקָא מַסְהֲדִי, גַּבְרָא לָאו בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא.
human_translation: And Rava says: two came and said: On Sunday so-and-so killed a person, and two came and said: You were with us on Sunday, but on Monday so-and-so killed person. Moreover, even said: Shabbat eve so-and-so killed person, is executed, that at the time that they testified, the man not liable execution
llm_translation: And Rava said: Two witnesses came and said, "On one occasion on Shabbat, Ploni killed a person," and two witnesses came and said, "You were with us on one occasion on Shabbat, rather on two occasions on Shabbat, Ploni killed a person." And not only that, but even if they said, "On Erev Shabbat, Ploni killed a person" - they are put to death, because in the time that they are testifying, a person is not a son of death.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא: לְפִיכָךְ, נִמְצֵאת אַחַת מֵהֶן זוֹמֶמֶת – הוּא וָהֵן נֶהֱרָגִין, וְהַשְּׁנִיָּה פְּטוּרָה.
human_translation: What is teaching us? We learn Therefore, one of was found conspiring he, and they, are executed and the second is exempt.
llm_translation: What is it teaching us? We learned: Therefore, if one of them is found to be a conspirator - he and they are put to death, and the other one is exempt.

hebrew_text: סֵיפָא, ״מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בִּגְמַר דִּין״, אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ: בָּאוּ שְׁנַיִם וְאָמְרוּ ״בְּחַד בְּשַׁבְּתָא נִגְמַר דִּינוֹ שֶׁל פְּלוֹנִי״, וּבָאוּ שְׁנַיִם וְאָמְרוּ ״בְּחַד בְּשַׁבְּתָא עִמָּנוּ הֱיִיתֶם, אֶלָּא בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת נִגְמַר דִּינוֹ שֶׁל פְּלוֹנִי״. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ אָמְרוּ ״בִּתְרֵי בְּשַׁבְּתָא נִגְמַר דִּינוֹ שֶׁל פְּלוֹנִי״ – אֵין אֵלּוּ נֶהֱרָגִין. דִּבְעִידָּנָא דְּקָא מַסְהֲדִי, גַּבְרָא בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא.
human_translation: the latter clause that it is not so with regard to verdict, was necessary for two came and said: On Sunday so-and-so was sentenced and two came and said: On Sunday you were with us but on Shabbat eve so-and-so was sentenced Moreover, even said: On Monday so-and-so was sentenced are not executed, as at the time that they testified the man was liable to be executed,
llm_translation: The latter part: "That which is not so in the final judgment," it requires for itself: Two came and said, "On one Sabbath his judgment was completed," and two came and said, "On one Sabbath you were with us, rather on Friday evening his judgment was completed." And not only that, but even if they said, "On two Sabbaths his judgment was completed" - these are not put to death. For in the case where they contradict each other, it is a false witness.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן לְעִנְיַן תַּשְׁלוּמֵי קְנָס:
human_translation: And likewise, to the matter of payments of a fine.
llm_translation: And so too regarding the matter of payments for penalties.

hebrew_text: בָּאוּ שְׁנַיִם וְאָמְרוּ ״בְּחַד בְּשַׁבְּתָא גָּנַב וְטָבַח וּמָכַר״, וּבָאוּ שְׁנַיִם וְאָמְרוּ ״בְּחַד בְּשַׁבְּתָא עִמָּנוּ הֱיִיתֶם, אֶלָּא בִּתְרֵי בְּשַׁבְּתָא גָּנַב וְטָבַח וּמָכַר״ – מְשַׁלְּמִין. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ אָמְרוּ ״בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת גָּנַב וְטָבַח וּמָכַר״ – מְשַׁלְּמִין, דִּבְעִידָּנָא דְּקָא מַסְהֲדִי גַּבְרָא לָאו בַּר תַּשְׁלוּמִין הוּא.
human_translation: two came and said: On Sunday stole and slaughtered or sold and two came and said On Sunday you were with us but on Monday stole and slaughtered or sold pay Moreover, even said: on Shabbat eve, stole and slaughtered or sold pay as at the time that they testified the man not liable for payment
llm_translation: Two came and said, "On one Sabbath he stole, slaughtered, and sold." And two others came and said, "On one Sabbath you were with us, rather on two Sabbaths he stole, slaughtered, and sold" - they pay. And not only that, but even if they said, "On Friday evening he stole, slaughtered, and sold" - they pay, because at the time when a man is being testified against, it is not a matter of payment.

hebrew_text: בָּאוּ שְׁנַיִם וְאָמְרוּ ״בְּחַד בְּשַׁבְּתָא גָּנַב וְטָבַח וּמָכַר וְנִגְמַר דִּינוֹ״, וּבָאוּ שְׁנַיִם וְאָמְרוּ ״בְּחַד בְּשַׁבְּתָא עִמָּנוּ הֱיִיתֶם, אֶלָּא עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת גָּנַב וְטָבַח וּמָכַר וְנִגְמַר דִּינוֹ״, וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ אָמְרוּ ״בְּחַד בְּשַׁבְּתָא גָּנַב וְטָבַח וּמָכַר, וּבִתְרֵי בְּשַׁבְּתָא נִגְמַר דִּינוֹ״ – אֵין מְשַׁלְּמִין, דִּבְעִידָּנָא דְּקָא מַסְהֲדִי גַּבְרָא בַּר תַּשְׁלוּמִין הוּא.
human_translation: two came and said: On Sunday stole and slaughtered or sold and was sentenced and two came and said: On Sunday you were with us, but stole and slaughtered or sold and was sentenced on Shabbat eve, Moreover, even said: On Sunday he stole and slaughtered or sold and on Monday he was sentenced do not pay because at the time that they testified the man liable for payment
llm_translation: Two came and said, "On one Sabbath he stole, slaughtered, sold, and his judgment was completed." And two came and said, "On one Sabbath you were with us, but on Friday evening he stole, slaughtered, sold, and his judgment was completed." And not only that, but even if they said, "On one Sabbath he stole, slaughtered, and sold, and on two Sabbaths his judgment was completed" - they are not liable, for at the time when payment is being demanded, it is a matter of payment.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִיסְטָטִית הִיא זוֹ כּוּ׳.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says this is a conspiracy,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: "Ishtatit is this, as it is written."

hebrew_text: אִי אִיסְטָטִית הִיא זוֹ, אֲפִילּוּ כַּת רִאשׁוֹנָה נָמֵי לָא! אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: שֶׁקָדְמוּ וְהָרְגוּ.
human_translation: If this is a conspiracy, even first set also not Rabbi Abbahu said: where already executed
llm_translation: If she is a virgin, even if she is a firstborn, no! Rabbi Abbahu said: They came first and killed.

hebrew_text: מַאי דַהֲוָה הֲוָה! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִם אֵינָהּ אֶלָּא כַּת אַחַת – נֶהֱרֶגֶת, אִי אִיכָּא טְפֵי – אֵין נֶהֱרָגִין. הָא ״בִּלְבַד״ קָאָמַר! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: what was, was; Rather, Rava said this is saying: If it is only one set are executed; if there is more they are not executed But doesn’t say: alone difficult.
llm_translation: "What is, is!" Rather, Rava said, thus he said: If there is only one liver - she is killed, if there are more - they are not killed. He said "only"! It is difficult.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא דַּאֲתַאי סָהֲדִי וְאִישְׁתַּקּוּר, אַיְיתִי סָהֲדִי וְאִישְׁתַּקּוּר. אֲזַלָה אַיְיתִי סָהֲדִי אַחֲרִינֵי דְּלָא אִישְׁתַּקּוּר. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הוּחְזְקָה זוֹ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אִם הִיא הוּחְזְקָה, כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל מִי הוּחְזְקוּ?
human_translation: a certain woman who brought witnesses and they were liars. She brought witnesses, and they were liars. She went brought other witnesses, who were not liars. Reish Lakish said: This has assumed the presumptive status Rabbi Elazar said to him: If she has assumed the presumptive status has the entire Jewish people assumed presumptive status?
llm_translation: The woman who came was a witness and a relative, she brought witnesses and relatives. She went and brought other witnesses who were not relatives. Reish Lakish said: This is a presumption. Rabbi Elazar said to him: If she is presumed, then who is presumed in all of Israel?

hebrew_text: זִימְנִין הָווּ יָתְבִי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אֲתָא כִּי הַאי מַעֲשֶׂה לְקַמַּיְיהוּ. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הוּחְזְקָה זוֹ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אִם הוּחְזְקָה זוֹ – כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל מִי הוּחְזְקוּ? הֲדַר חַזְיֵהּ לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בִּישׁוּת, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שָׁמְעַתְּ מִילֵּי מִבַּר נַפָּחָא וְלָא אֲמַרְתְּ לִי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ?
human_translation: occasion, were sitting before Rabbi Yoḥanan an incident similar to this came before them Reish Lakish said: This has assumed the presumptive status Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: If she has assumed the presumptive status has the entire Jewish people assumed presumptive status? he turned glared angrily at Rabbi Elazar, he said to him: You heard matter from bar Nappaḥa, and you did not say to me in his name?
llm_translation: Times were sitting in front of Rabbi Yohanan, came this incident before them. Reish Lakish said: This is a presumption. Rabbi Yohanan said to him: If this is a presumption, then who is presumed in all of Israel? He then went and saw Rabbi Elazar the son of Shammua, and said to him: Have you heard any words from the son of Nappaha and not told me his name?

hebrew_text: לֵימָא רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמַר כְּרַבָּנַן?
human_translation: Let us say Reish Lakish stated in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, And Rabbi Yoḥanan stated in accordance with the Rabbis,
llm_translation: Let us say, Reish Lakish said like Rabbi Yehuda, and Rabbi Yochanan said like Rabanan?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי לָךְ אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבָּנַן – עַד כָּאן לָא קָא אָמְרִי רַבָּנַן הָתָם, דְּלֵיכָּא דְּקָא מְהַדַּר. אֲבָל הָכָא, אִיכָּא הָא דְּקָא מְהַדְּרָא.
human_translation: Reish Lakish say to you: I state even in accordance with the Rabbis, the Rabbis say only there, where there is no one who is seeking But here, there is this who is seeking
llm_translation: He said to you, Reish Lakish: I, who say to you, even to the Rabbis - until here, the Rabbis did not say there, where there is no one who opposes. But here, there is one who opposes.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר לָךְ: אֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה – עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הָתָם, דְּאָמְרִינַן: ״אַטּוּ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא גַּבֵּי הָנֵי הָווּ קָיְימִי?״, אֲבָל הָכָא, הָנֵי יָדְעִי בְּסָהֲדוּתָא, וְהָנֵי לָא יָדְעִי בְּסָהֲדוּתָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan say to you: I state even in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yehuda says only there, as we say: Is that to say everyone, was standing near these But here, these know of the testimony, and these do not know of the testimony.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said to you: I, who say even according to Rabbi Yehuda - until here Rabbi Yehuda did not say there, as we say: "Are all the people of the world standing here?" But here, these know through testimony, and those do not know through testimony.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין הָעֵדִים זוֹמְמִין נֶהֱרָגִין עַד שֶׁיִּגָּמֵר הַדִּין. שֶׁהֲרֵי הַצַּדּוּקִין אוֹמְרִים: עַד שֶׁיֵּהָרֵג, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״נֶפֶשׁ תַּחַת נָפֶשׁ״.
human_translation: The conspiring witnesses are executed only the verdict is concluded. as the Sadducees say: only is killed as it is stated: “A life for a life”
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The witnesses are not considered conspirators until the judgment is completed. For the Sadducees say: Until he is killed, as it is stated, "A life for a life."

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶם חֲכָמִים: וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״וַעֲשִׂיתֶם לוֹ כַּאֲשֶׁר זָמַם לַעֲשׂוֹת לְאָחִיו״, וַהֲרֵי אָחִיו קַיָּים! וְאִם כֵּן לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר ״נֶפֶשׁ תַּחַת נָפֶשׁ״? יָכוֹל מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁקִּבְּלוּ עֵדוּתָן יֵהָרְגוּ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״נֶפֶשׁ תַּחַת נָפֶשׁ״, הָא אֵינָם נֶהֱרָגִין עַד שֶׁיִּגָּמֵר הַדִּין.
human_translation: The Rabbis said to But wasn’t it already stated: “And you shall do to him as he conspired to do to his brother” and his brother is alive? And if so, why is it stated: “A life for a life”? might from the moment accepted their testimony they will be executed, the verse states: “A life for a life,” they are executed only the verdict will be concluded,
llm_translation: They said to them, the sages: But hasn't it already been said, "And you shall do to him as he plotted to do to his brother," and behold, his brother is still alive! And if so, why is it said, "A life for a life"? Could it be that from the moment they accept their testimony they should be killed? The Talmud teaches: "A life for a life," meaning they are not killed until the judgment is completed.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא, בְּרִיבִּי אוֹמֵר: לֹא הָרְגוּ – נֶהֱרָגִין, הָרְגוּ – אֵין נֶהֱרָגִין. אָמַר אָבִיו: בְּנִי, לָאו קַל וָחוֹמֶר הוּא?
human_translation: taught the Distinguished Beribbi says: not killed they are executed, they killed they are not executed. The father of said My son, is not an a fortiori
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Tana, beribbi omer: lo hargu - neheragin, hargu - ein neheragin. Amar aviv: bni, lav kal va'chomer hu?" English translation: "Gemara: A Tanna taught in the name of Rabbi: If they did not kill, they are killed; if they killed, they are not killed. His father said to him: My son, is it not a fortiori reasoning?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: לִימַּדְתָּנוּ רַבֵּינוּ שֶׁאֵין עוֹנְשִׁין מִן הַדִּין. דְּתַנְיָא: ״אִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יִקַּח [אֶת] אֲחֹתוֹ בַּת אָבִיו אוֹ בַת אִמּוֹ״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בַּת אָבִיו שֶׁלֹּא בַּת אִמּוֹ וּבַת אִמּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בַּת אָבִיו. בַּת אִמּוֹ וּבַת אָבִיו מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עֶרְוַת אֲחֹתוֹ גִּלָּה״.
human_translation: He said to You have taught us, our teacher, that one does not administer punishment on inference. As it is taught “A man who takes his sister, the daughter of his father or the daughter of his mother” I have only the daughter of his father who is not the daughter of his mother, or the daughter of his mother who is not the daughter of his father. From where the daughter of his mother and the daughter of his father? the verse states: “He has uncovered the nakedness of his sister”
llm_translation: He said to him: You have taught us, our teacher, that they do not receive punishment from the court.
