As it was taught: "A man who takes his sister, the daughter of his father or the daughter of his mother," I have learned only about the daughter of his father that he is forbidden to marry, not the daughter of his mother, and the daughter of his mother that he is forbidden to marry, not the daughter of his father. How do we know about the prohibition of marrying the daughter of his mother and the daughter of his father? The Torah teaches us to say: "He has uncovered his sister's nakedness."

hebrew_text: עַד שֶׁלֹּא יֵאָמֵר יֵשׁ לִי בַּדִּין: אִם עָנַשׁ עַל בַּת אָבִיו שֶׁלֹּא בַּת אִמּוֹ, וּבַת אִמּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בַּת אָבִיו – בַּת אָבִיו וּבַת אִמּוֹ לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן? הָא לָמַדְתָּ שֶׁאֵין עוֹנְשִׁין מִן הַדִּין.
human_translation: if had not stated I have from inference: If punished with the daughter of his father who is not the daughter of his mother, or the daughter of his mother who is not the daughter of his father, not all the more so the daughter of his father and the daughter of his mother? you learn that one does not administer punishment on inference.
llm_translation: Until it is not said, "There is a judgment": If one punished for the daughter of his father who is not the daughter of his mother, and the daughter of his mother who is not the daughter of his father - the daughter of his father and the daughter of his mother, all the more so? This teaches that they are not punished by the law.

hebrew_text: עוֹנֶשׁ שָׁמַעְנוּ, אַזְהָרָה מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״עֶרְוַת אֲחוֹתְךָ בַת אָבִיךָ אוֹ בַת אִמֶּךָ״. אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בַּת אָבִיו שֶׁלֹּא בַּת אִמּוֹ, וּבַת אִמּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בַּת אָבִיו. בַּת אָבִיו וּבַת אִמּוֹ מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עֶרְוַת בַּת אֵשֶׁת אָבִיךָ מוֹלֶדֶת אָבִיךָ אֲחוֹתְךָ הִוא״.
human_translation: We heard punishment From where prohibition the verse states: “The nakedness of your sister, the daughter of your father or the daughter of your mother… I have only the daughter of his father who is not the daughter of his mother, or the daughter of his mother who is not the daughter of his father. From where the daughter of his father and the daughter of his mother? the verse states: “The nakedness of the daughter of your father’s wife, born of your father; she is your sister”
llm_translation: Punishment we heard, warning from where? Scripture says "the nakedness of your sister, the daughter of your father or the daughter of your mother." I only know daughter of his father but not daughter of his mother, and daughter of his mother but not daughter of his father. Daughter of his father and daughter of his mother, from where? Scripture says: "the nakedness of the daughter of your father's wife, begotten by your father, she is your sister."

hebrew_text: עַד שֶׁלֹּא יֵאָמֵר יֵשׁ לִי מִן הַדִּין: מָה אִם הוּזְהַר עַל בַּת אִמּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בַּת אָבִיו, וּבַת אָבִיו שֶׁלֹּא בַּת אִמּוֹ, בַּת אָבִיו וּבַת אִמּוֹ לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן? הָא לָמַדְתָּ שֶׁאֵין מַזְהִירִין מִן הַדִּין.
human_translation: if had not stated I have from inference: If one was prohibited with the daughter of his mother who is not the daughter of his father, and the daughter of his father who is not the daughter of his mother, not all the more so the daughter of his father and the daughter of his mother? You learn that one does not a prohibition on inference.
llm_translation: Until it is not said, there is from the law: What if one was warned about his mother's daughter who is not his father's daughter, and his father's daughter who is not his mother's daughter, his father's daughter and his mother's daughter all the more so? You have learned that we do not warn from the law.

hebrew_text: חַיָּיבֵי מַלְקִיּוֹת מִנַּיִן – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״רָשָׁע״ ״רָשָׁע״.
human_translation: From where those liable lashes The verse states wicked wicked
llm_translation: Those liable for lashes, from where? - The Talmud teaches "wicked" "wicked."

hebrew_text: חַיָּיבֵי גָּלִיּוֹת מִנַּיִן – אָתְיָא ״רָצַח״ ״רֶצַח״.
human_translation: From where those liable to be exiled derived “murderer” “murderer”
llm_translation: Those liable for exile, from where do we derive it? It is stated: "murder" "murder."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן טָבַאי: אֶרְאֶה בְּנֶחָמָה אִם לֹא הָרַגְתִּי עֵד זוֹמֵם לְהוֹצִיא מִלִּבָּן שֶׁל צַדּוּקִים. שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: אֵין הָעֵדִים זוֹמְמִין נֶהֱרָגִין עַד שֶׁיֵּהָרֵג הַנִּדּוֹן.
human_translation: it is taught Rabbi Yehuda ben Tabbai says I will see the consolation if I did not kill conspiring witness, to eradicate from the hearts of the Sadducees, who would say: The conspiring witnesses are executed only will be killed.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda ben Tabai said: I will see with consolation if I did not kill a conspiring witness to remove from the heart of the Sadducees. For they used to say: Conspiring witnesses are not executed until the defendant is executed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח: אֶרְאֶה בְּנֶחָמָה אִם לֹא שָׁפַכְתָּ דָּם נָקִי, שֶׁהֲרֵי אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אֵין הָעֵדִים זוֹמְמִין נֶהֱרָגִין עַד שֶׁיִּזּוֹמּוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם, וְאֵין לוֹקִין עַד שֶׁיִּזּוֹמּוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם.
human_translation: Shimon ben Shataḥ said to him: I will see the consolation if you did not shed innocent blood, as the Sages said: Conspiring witnesses are not executed unless both of them are rendered conspiring and they are not flogged unless both of them are rendered conspiring
llm_translation: Shimon ben Shatach said to him: I will see with consolation if you did not spill innocent blood, for the sages have said: Witnesses who conspire are not executed until both of them are made to conspire, and they are not flogged until both of them are made to conspire.

hebrew_text: מִיָּד קִבֵּל עָלָיו רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן טָבַאי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מוֹרֶה הוֹרָאָה אֶלָּא לִפְנֵי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח. וְכׇל יָמָיו שֶׁל רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן טָבַאי הָיָה מִשְׁתַּטֵּחַ עַל קִבְרוֹ שֶׁל אוֹתוֹ הָעֵד, וְהָיָה קוֹלוֹ נִשְׁמָע, וְכִסְבוּרִין הָעָם לוֹמַר: קוֹלוֹ שֶׁל הָרוּג. אָמַר: קוֹלִי שֶׁלִּי הוּא, תֵּדְעוּ – לְמָחָר הוּא מֵת, אֵין קוֹלוֹ נִשְׁמָע.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Tabbai immediately accepted upon himself that he would issue a halakhic ruling only before Shimon ben Shataḥ, And all of Rabbi Yehuda ben Tabbai’s days he would prostrate himself on the grave of that witness and his voice was heard And the people thought to say the voice of executed said It is my voice. Know tomorrow, he, will die, his voice will no be heard.
llm_translation: Immediately accepted upon him Rabbi Yehudah ben Tabai that he does not teach instruction except before Shimon ben Shatach. And all his days of Rabbi Yehudah ben Tabai he would spread out upon the grave of that witness, and his voice would be heard, and the people thought to say: "It is the voice of the murdered." He said: "It is my voice, you shall know - tomorrow he will die, his voice will not be heard."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: דִּלְמָא בְּדִינָא קָם בַּהֲדֵיהּ, אִי נָמֵי פַּיּוֹסֵי פַּיְּיסֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: Perhaps he confronted in trial Alternatively, appeased
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: Perhaps he arose in judgment against him, if not, appease him.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם עֵדִים אוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה עֵדִים יוּמַת הַמֵּת״ – אִם מִתְקַיֶּימֶת הָעֵדוּת בִּשְׁנַיִם לָמָּה פָּרַט הַכָּתוּב בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה? אֶלָּא לְהַקִּישׁ שְׁלֹשָׁה לִשְׁנַיִם: מָה שְׁלֹשָׁה מְזִימִּין אֶת הַשְּׁנַיִם, אַף הַשְּׁנַיִם יָזוֹמּוּ אֶת הַשְּׁלֹשָׁה. וּמִנַּיִן אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״עֵדִים״.
human_translation: “At the mouth of two witnesses or three witnesses shall he who is to die be executed” If the testimony is valid with two why did the verse specify with three? Rather, to juxtapose three to two: Just as three can render the two conspiring so too, the two can render the three conspiring And from where even one hundred the verse states: witnesses.”
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "By the mouth of two witnesses or three witnesses shall the one deserving of death be put to death" - If the testimony is established by two, why does the verse specify three? Rather, to compare three to two: Just as three incriminate two, so too, two will incriminate three. And from where do we learn this even if there are a hundred? The Torah teaches to say "witnesses."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מָה שְׁנַיִם אֵינָן נֶהֱרָגִין עַד שֶׁיִּהְיוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם זוֹמְמִין – אַף שְׁלֹשָׁה אֵינָן נֶהֱרָגִין עַד שֶׁיִּהְיוּ שְׁלׇשְׁתָּם זוֹמְמִין. וּמִנַּיִן אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״עֵדִים״.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says Just as two are not killed unless both of them are conspiring so too, three are not killed unless three of them are conspiring And from where even one hundred the verse states: witnesses.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Just as two are not executed until they both conspire, so too three are not executed until all three conspire. And from where do we know that even a hundred - the Torah says "witnesses."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: לֹא בָּא הַשְּׁלִישִׁי לְהָקֵל, אֶלָּא לְהַחֲמִיר עָלָיו וְלַעֲשׂוֹת דִּינוֹ כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּאֵלּוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: The third does not come to be lenient rather, to be stringent concerning him and to render his halakhic status like these
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: The third one did not come to be lenient, but to be stringent upon it and to do its judgment like the equivalent of these.

hebrew_text: וְאִם כֵּן עָנַשׁ הַכָּתוּב לַנִּטְפָּל לְעוֹבְרֵי עֲבֵירָה כְּעוֹבְרֵי עֲבֵירָה – עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה יְשַׁלֵּם שָׂכָר לַנִּטְפָּל לְעוֹשֵׂי מִצְוָה כְּעוֹשֵׂי מִצְוָה.
human_translation: And if the verse punished one who associates with transgressors like transgressors, all the more so will pay a reward to one who associates with those who perform a mitzva like who perform mitzva
llm_translation: And if so, the Scripture punished the negligent for transgressing a sin like transgressors of a sin - how much more so will He reward the diligent for performing a commandment like performers of a commandment.

hebrew_text: וּמָה שְׁנַיִם נִמְצָא אֶחָד מֵהֶן קָרוֹב אוֹ פָּסוּל – עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵלָה, אַף שְׁלֹשָׁה נִמְצָא אֶחָד מֵהֶן קָרוֹב אוֹ פָּסוּל – עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵלָה. מִנַּיִן אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״עֵדִים״.
human_translation: And just as two one of them is found a relative or disqualified, their testimony is voided, so too, three one of them is found a relative or disqualified, their testimony is voided, From where even one hundred the verse states: “Witnesses.”
llm_translation: And what if two, one of them is close or disqualified - their testimony is nullified, even if three, one of them is close or disqualified - their testimony is nullified. From where do we derive this even if a hundred? The Talmud teaches to say "witnesses."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – בְּדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת, אֲבָל בְּדִינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת – תִּתְקַיֵּים הָעֵדוּת בַּשְּׁאָר. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת וְאֶחָד דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: In what is this statement, said? with regard to capital law, But with regard to monetary law, the testimony will be validated with the rest Rabbi says: both monetary law and capital law.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: In what are these matters said? - In cases of capital law, but in cases of monetary law - the testimony is upheld in other cases. Rabbi says: There is one law for monetary cases and one law for capital cases.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָתַי – בִּזְמַן שֶׁהִתְרוּ בָּהֶן. אֲבָל בִּזְמַן שֶׁלֹּא הִתְרוּ בָּהֶן, מַה יַּעֲשׂוּ שְׁנֵי אַחִין שֶׁרָאוּ בְּאֶחָד שֶׁהָרַג אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ?!
human_translation: And when when forewarned them But when they did not forewarn them, what shall two brothers do where saw someone who killed a person?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And when - at a time when they permitted them. But at a time when they did not permit them, what should two brothers who saw one person kill a soul do?!"

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רָבָא: וְהוּא שֶׁהֵעִידוּ כּוּלָּם בְּתוֹךְ כְּדֵי דִיבּוּר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: מִכְּדִי תּוֹךְ כְּדֵי דִיבּוּר הֵיכִי דָּמֵי – כְּדֵי שְׁאֵילַת תַּלְמִיד לְרַב. מֵאָה טוּבָא הֲווֹ!
human_translation: Rava says: And that where all testified within for speaking Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: Now, what are the circumstances Within for speaking equivalent the greeting of a student to a rabbi: one hundred is greater
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rava: And he that they testified all of them within the time of speech. Said to him Rav Acha from Difti to Ravina: From within the time of speech, how is it similar - the time of a student's question to the teacher. They were a hundred tovah!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כׇּל חַד וְחַד בְּתוֹךְ כְּדֵי דִיבּוּר שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: said to him: each and every within for speaking after the other
llm_translation: He said to him: every one and one within the time of speech of his fellow.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר לֹא בָּא שְׁלִישִׁי כּוּ׳. וּמָה שְׁנַיִם כּוּ׳. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, הָרוּג יַצִּיל! כְּשֶׁהֲרָגוֹ מֵאֲחוֹרָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: The third does not come And just as two Rav Pappa said to Abaye: But if that is so, murdered should spare when he killed from behind him
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says, "The third did not come." And what about two? Rav Papa said to Abaye: Rather, from now on, "The one who kills will be saved!" When he killed him from behind.

hebrew_text: נִרְבָּע יַצִּיל! כְּשֶׁרְבָעוֹ מֵאֲחוֹרָיו.
human_translation: The one who was sodomized should spare when he sodomized from behind him,
llm_translation: Nirba will save! When he turns from behind him.

hebrew_text: הוֹרֵג וְרוֹבֵעַ יַצִּילוּ! אִישְׁתִּיק. כִּי אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״יָקוּם דָּבָר״ – בִּמְקַיְּמֵי דָּבָר הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: murderer and the one who sodomizes should spare was silent When came before Rava said to him: shall a matter be established” with regard to establish a matter the verse is speaking.
llm_translation: He who kills and dismembers will save! He remained silent. When he came before Rava, he said to him: "Let a matter arise" - in the context of fulfilling what is written, the Scripture speaks.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים. כּוּ׳ מַה יַּעֲשׂוּ שְׁנֵי אַחִים וְכוּ׳. הֵיכִי אָמְרִינַן לְהוּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: In what is this statement said…what shall two brothers do How do we, say to
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: In what case are these matters said? "What shall two brothers do," etc. How do we say to them?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הָכִי אָמְרִינַן לְהוּ: לְמִיחְזֵי אֲתִיתוּ אוֹ לְאַסְהוֹדֵי אֲתִיתוּ? אִי אָמְרִי לְאַסְהוֹדֵי אֲתוֹ, נִמְצָא אֶחָד מֵהֶן קָרוֹב אוֹ פָּסוּל – עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵלָה, אִי אָמְרִי לְמִיחְזֵי אֲתוֹ, מַה יַּעֲשׂוּ שְׁנֵי אַחִין שֶׁרָאוּ בְּאֶחָד שֶׁהָרַג אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ?
human_translation: Rava says: This we say to Did you come to observe or did you come to testify? If say they came to testify, one of them is found a relative or disqualified, their testimony is voided. If say they came to observe, what shall two brothers do where they saw someone who killed a person?
llm_translation: Rava said: Thus do we say to them: Should they come to see or should they come to testify? If they say they come to testify, and one of them is found to be close or disqualified - their testimony is nullified. But if they say they come to see, what should two brothers do who saw one person kill another?

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. וְרַב נַחְמָן אוֹמֵר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי.
human_translation: it was stated Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, and Rav Naḥman says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha follows Rabbi Yosei. And Rav Nachman says: The halakha follows Rabbi.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָיוּ שְׁנַיִם רוֹאִין אוֹתוֹ, מֵחַלּוֹן זֶה, וּשְׁנַיִם רוֹאִין אוֹתוֹ מֵחַלּוֹן זֶה, וְאֶחָד מַתְרֶה בּוֹ בָּאֶמְצַע, בִּזְמַן שֶׁמִּקְצָתָן רוֹאִין אֵלּוּ אֶת אֵלּוּ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ עֵדוּת אַחַת, וְאִם לָאו – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שְׁתֵּי עֵדֻיוֹת. לְפִיכָךְ, אִם נִמְצֵאת אַחַת מֵהֶן זוֹמֶמֶת – הוּא וָהֵן נֶהֱרָגִין, וְהַשְּׁנִיָּה פְּטוּרָה.
human_translation: were two observing from this window and two observing him from that window and one forewarning in the middle where some of see each other, these one testimony, but if not these two testimonies. Therefore, if one of was found conspiring he, and they, are executed, and the second is exempt.
llm_translation: It was taught: Two people see him, from this window, and two see him from that window, and one sees him in the middle. When some of them see these and these - these are considered one testimony, and if not - these are considered two testimonies. Therefore, if one of them is found to be a conspirator - he and they are put to death, and the other is exempt.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם אֵין נֶהֱרָגִין עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ שְׁנֵי עֵדָיו מַתְרִין בּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם עֵדִים״. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם עֵדִים״ – שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא סַנְהֶדְרִין שׁוֹמַעַת מִפִּי הַתּוּרְגְּמָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: are never executed unless his two witnesses are forewarning him, as it is stated: “At the mouth of two witnesses… Alternatively, “at the mouth of two witnesses” that Sanhedrin will not hear from the mouth of an interpreter.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Always we do not kill until two witnesses testify against him, as it is said, "By the mouth of two witnesses." Another explanation: "By the mouth of two witnesses" - that the Sanhedrin should not hear from the interpreter's mouth.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּא אָמַר רַב: מִנַּיִן לְעֵדוּת מְיוּחֶדֶת שֶׁהִיא פְּסוּלָה? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא יוּמַת עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד״. מַאי אֶחָד? אִילֵּימָא עֵד אֶחָד מַמָּשׁ – מֵרֵישָׁא שָׁמְעִינַן לָהּ, ״עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם עֵדִים״! אֶלָּא מַאי ״אֶחָד״? אֶחָד אֶחָד.
human_translation: Rav Zutra bar Tuvya says Rav says: From where to disjointed testimony, that it is not valid? as it is stated: “He shall not die at the mouth of one witness” What “one If we say one witness literally, we learn it from the first “At the mouth of two witnesses,” Rather, what “one one one
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said, Rav Zutra bar Tobia said, Rav: From where do we derive that testimony that is singular is invalid? As it is stated: "One shall not be put to death on the testimony of one witness." What is meant by "one witness"? If you wish, say it means an actual single witness - we already heard it from the beginning, "on the testimony of two witnesses"! Rather, what is "one"? One is one.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: ״לֹא יוּמַת עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד״, לְהָבִיא שְׁנַיִם שֶׁרוֹאִים אוֹתוֹ אֶחָד מֵחַלּוֹן זֶה וְאֶחָד מֵחַלּוֹן זֶה, וְאֵין רוֹאִין זֶה אֶת זֶה, שֶׁאֵין מִצְטָרְפִין. וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה בְּחַלּוֹן אֶחָד – אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין.
human_translation: This is also taught “He shall not die at the mouth of one witness,” to include two who observe one from this window and one from that window, and they do not see each other, that they do not join Moreover, even one after the other in one window, they do not join
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: "He shall not be put to death on the evidence of one witness," to bring two witnesses who see him, one from this window and one from that window, and they do not see each other, so that they do not combine. And not only that, but even if one after the other in the same window - they do not combine.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: הַשְׁתָּא, וּמָה אֶחָד מֵחַלּוֹן זֶה וְאֶחָד מֵחַלּוֹן זֶה, דְּהַאי קָא חָזֵי כּוּלּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה, וְהַאי קָא חָזֵי כּוּלּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה – אָמְרַתְּ לָא מִצְטָרְפִי, בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה, דְּהַאי חָזֵי פַּלְגָא דְמַעֲשֶׂה וְהַאי חָזֵי פַּלְגָא דְמַעֲשֶׂה, מִיבַּעְיָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לֹא נִצְרְכָא אֶלָּא לְבוֹעֵל אֶת הָעֶרְוָה.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: Now if one from this window and one from that window, where this sees the entire incident and that sees the entire incident, you say they do not join one after the other, where this sees half incident and that sees half incident, necessary said to him: is necessary only to engages in intercourse with a forbidden relative,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: Now, what if one beam is from this window and one beam is from that window, for this one sees the entire beam as a single entity, and that one sees the entire beam as a single entity - you say they do not combine, one after the other, for this one sees half of the beam and that one sees half of the beam, is it necessary? He said to him: It is only necessary for one who wishes to engage in forbidden sexual relations.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אִם הָיוּ רוֹאִין אֶת הַמַּתְרֶה, אוֹ הַמַּתְרֶה רוֹאֶה אוֹתָן – מִצְטָרְפִין. אָמַר רָבָא: מַתְרֶה שֶׁאָמְרוּ, אֲפִילּוּ מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ, וַאֲפִילּוּ מִפִּי הַשֵּׁד.
human_translation: Rava says: if sees the one who is forewarning or the one who is forewarning could see they join Rava says: forewarning whom spoke even from his own mouth, and even from the mouth of a demon,
llm_translation: Rava said: If they were seeing the Matreh, or the Matreh is seeing them - they combine. Rava said: The Matreh that they said, even from his own mouth, and even from the mouth of the demon.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: עֵדוּת מְיוּחֶדֶת כְּשֵׁירָה בְּדִינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת, דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא יוּמַת עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד״ – בְּדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת הוּא דְּאֵין כְּשֵׁירָה, אֲבָל בְּדִינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת – כְּשֵׁירָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: Disjointed testimony is valid in monetary law, as it is written: “He shall not die at the mouth of one witness” it is with regard to capital law that is not valid, but with regard to monetary law is valid.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Testimony that is specific is valid in cases of monetary matters, as it is written: "One witness shall not rise up against a man for any iniquity or for any sin" (Deuteronomy 19:15) - this is in matters of life, where it is not valid, but in matters of money - it is valid.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב זוּטְרָא: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה בְּדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת תַּצִּיל! אַלְּמָה תְּנַן ״הוּא וָהֵן נֶהֱרָגִין״? קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Rav Zutra objects to this: But if that is so, in capital law should spare Why, did we learn he, and they, are executed? difficult
llm_translation: Challenges her Rav Zutra: Rather from now on in cases of capital punishment you will save! Why do we learn "he and they shall be put to death"? It is difficult.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר וְכוּ׳. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: וּמִי אִית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַאי סְבָרָא? וְהָתְנַן רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: הַשּׂוֹנֵא – נֶהֱרָג, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כְּמוּעָד וּמוּתְרֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: And is Rabbi Yosei of this reasoning But didn’t we learn Rabbi Yosei says: An enemy he is executed due to that his like cautioned and forewarned.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says, etc. Rav Papa said to Abbaye: Does Rabbi Yosei hold this opinion? But didn't we learn: Rabbi Yosei says, "One who hates - is liable to be killed, because he is considered as a murderer and is permitted to be killed."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָהוּא – רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: חָבֵר אֵין צָרִיךְ הַתְרָאָה, לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא נִיתְּנָה הַתְרָאָה אֶלָּא לְהַבְחִין בֵּין שׁוֹגֵג לְמֵזִיד.
human_translation: said to him: That is Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda, as it is taught Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: A ḥaver does not require forewarning, as forewarning was instituted only to distinguish between unwittingly and intentionally.
llm_translation: He said to him: That one - Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda it is. As it was taught: Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: A colleague does not need warning, because warning was only given to distinguish between unintentional and intentional.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם עֵדִים״ – שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא סַנְהֶדְרִין שׁוֹמַעַת מִפִּי הַתּוּרְגְּמָן. הָנְהוּ לָעוֹזֵי דַּאֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אוֹקִי רָבָא תּוּרְגְּמָן בֵּינַיְיהוּ. וְהֵיכִי עֲבִיד הָכִי? וְהָתְנַן: שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא סַנְהֶדְרִין שׁוֹמַעַת מִפִּי הַתּוּרְגְּמָן! רָבָא מִידָּע הֲוָה יָדַע מָה דַּהֲווֹ אָמְרִי, וְאַהְדּוֹרֵי הוּא דְּלָא הֲוָה יָדַע.
human_translation: Alternatively, “at the mouth of two witnesses” that Sanhedrin will not hear from the mouth of an interpreter. certain a foreign who came before Rava Rava installed an interpreter between them And how did he do so? But didn’t we learn that Sanhedrin will not hear from the mouth of an interpreter? Rava knew what they were saying, but he did not know respond
llm_translation: Another explanation: "By the mouth of two witnesses" - that the Sanhedrin should not accept from the mouth of the translator. These are the strong ones who came before Rava, Rava would examine the translator between them. And how did he do so? And we learned in a Mishnah: "The Sanhedrin should not accept from the mouth of the translator!" Rava immediately knew what they had said, and it was the generations that did not know.

hebrew_text: אִילְעָא וְטוֹבִיָּה, קָרִיבֵיהּ דְּעָרְבָא הֲוֹה. סְבַר רַב פָּפָּא לְמֵימַר: גַּבֵּי לֹוֶה וּמַלְוֶה רַחִיקִי נִינְהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרַב פָּפָּא: אִי לֵית לֵיהּ לְלֹוֶה, לָאו בָּתַר עָרְבָא אָזֵיל מַלְוֶה?
human_translation: Ile’a and Tuviyya, were relatives of the guarantor Rav Pappa thought to say vis-à-vis the borrower and lender are distant Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rav Pappa: If the borrower does not have doesn’t lender pursue the guarantor
llm_translation: El'aa and Toviya, his close friends, were residents of Arva. Rav Papa thought to say: Regarding lenders and borrowers, they are considered distant. Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rav Papa: If one does not have someone to lend to, does he not then go to borrow?

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁנִּגְמַר דִּינוֹ, וּבָרַח, וּבָא לִפְנֵי אוֹתוֹ בֵּית דִּין – אֵין סוֹתְרִין אֶת דִּינוֹ. כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיַּעַמְדוּ שְׁנַיִם וְיֹאמְרוּ: ״מְעִידִים אָנוּ בְּאִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי שֶׁנִּגְמַר דִּינוֹ בְּבֵית דִּין שֶׁל פְּלוֹנִי, וּפְלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי עֵדָיו״ – הֲרֵי זֶה יֵהָרֵג.
human_translation: one whose verdict was delivered and he fled, and he came before the same court they do not overturn his verdict any place where two will stand and say: We testify with regard to a man so-and-so that his verdict was delivered in the court of so-and-so, and so-and-so and so-and-so his witnesses, that shall be executed
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One whose judgment has been completed, and he fled, and he comes before that same court – they do not annul his judgment. In any place where two stand and say, "We testify concerning so-and-so that his judgment has been completed in the court of so-and-so, and so-and-so and so-and-so are his witnesses" – this one shall be put to death.

hebrew_text: סַנְהֶדְרִין נוֹהֶגֶת בָּאָרֶץ וּבְחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ. סַנְהֶדְרִין הַהוֹרֶגֶת אֶחָד בְּשָׁבוּעַ נִקְרֵאת חוֹבְלָנִית. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד לְשִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה. רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמְרִים: אִילּוּ הָיִינוּ בְּסַנְהֶדְרִין לֹא נֶהֱרַג אָדָם מֵעוֹלָם. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף הֵן מַרְבִּין שׁוֹפְכֵי דָּמִים בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: a Sanhedrin is in effect in Eretz and outside Eretz A Sanhedrin that executes once in seven years is characterized a destructive Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya says: once in seventy years. Rabbi Tarfon and Rabbi Akiva say: If we had been of the Sanhedrin, no person would have ever been executed. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: they too increase murderers among the Jewish people.
llm_translation: The Sanhedrin operates in the Land and outside the Land. A Sanhedrin that executes one person in seven days is called a destructive Sanhedrin. Rabbi Eliezer ben Azariah says: one in seventy years. Rabbi Tarfon and Rabbi Akiva say: if we were in the Sanhedrin, no one would ever be executed. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: they would also increase the shedding of blood in Israel.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לִפְנֵי אוֹתוֹ בֵּית דִּין הוּא דְּאֵין סוֹתְרִין, הָא לִפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין אַחֵר – סוֹתְרִין. הָא תָּנֵי סֵיפָא: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיַּעַמְדוּ שְׁנַיִם וְיֹאמְרוּ: ״מְעִידִין אָנוּ אֶת אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי שֶׁנִּגְמַר דִּינוֹ בְּבֵית דִּין פְּלוֹנִי, וּפְלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי עֵדָיו״ – הֲרֵי זֶה נֶהֱרָג!
human_translation: It is before the same court that they do not overturn but before a different court they overturn Isn’t it taught in the latter clause Any place where two will stand and say: We testify with regard to a man so-and-so that his verdict was delivered in the court of so-and-so, and so-and-so and so-and-so his witnesses, that shall be executed
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemar l'fnei oto beit din hu d'ein sotrin, ha l'fnei beit din acher – sotrin. Ha tanei seifa: Kol makom sheyamdu shnayim v'yomru: 'Me'idin anu et ish ploni she'nigmar dino b'veit din ploni, u'ploni u'ploni edav' – harei zeh neherag!" English translation: "Once a case is concluded before a particular court, they cannot overturn it; but if it is brought before a different court, they can overturn it. The latter clause teaches: In any place where two stand and say, 'We testify that so-and-so's case was concluded in the court of such-and-such, and so-and-so and so-and-so are his witnesses' – this person is executed!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָא קַשְׁיָא, כָּאן בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, כָּאן בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: Abaye said: not difficult, here, in Eretz Yisrael. There, outside Eretz
llm_translation: Abaye said: Not difficult, here in the Land of Israel, here outside the Land.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן דּוֹסְתַּאי אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח: בָּרַח מֵאָרֶץ לְחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ – אֵין סוֹתְרִין אֶת דִּינוֹ. מֵחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ לָאָרֶץ – סוֹתְרִין אֶת דִּינוֹ, מִפְּנֵי זְכוּתָהּ שֶׁל אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda ben Dostai says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Shataḥ: fled from Eretz to outside Eretz one does not overturn his verdict. from outside Eretz to Eretz one overturns his verdict due to the merit of Eretz Yisrael,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yehuda ben Dosatai says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Shatach: If one fled from the land to outside the land - his judgment is not contradicted. If one fled from outside the land to the land - his judgment is contradicted, due to the merit of the land of Israel.

hebrew_text: סַנְהֶדְרִין נוֹהֶגֶת כּוּ׳. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְהָיוּ אֵלֶּה לָכֶם לְחֻקַּת מִשְׁפָּט לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶם״, לָמַדְנוּ לְסַנְהֶדְרִין שֶׁנּוֹהֶגֶת בָּאָרֶץ וּבְחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: a Sanhedrin is in effect From where are these matters as the Sages taught: “And these shall be for you as a statute of justice for your generations we learn that a Sanhedrin is in effect in Eretz and outside Eretz
llm_translation: Tractate Sanhedrin is conducted as follows. From where do we derive these matters? For the Rabbis taught: "And these shall be for you a statute of judgment for your generations," we learn that the Sanhedrin functions both within the land and outside the land.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ״? בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ אַתָּה מוֹשִׁיב בָּתֵּי דִינִים בְּכׇל פֶּלֶךְ וָפֶלֶךְ וּבְכׇל עִיר וָעִיר, וּבְחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ אַתָּה מוֹשִׁיב בְּכׇל פֶּלֶךְ וָפֶלֶךְ, וְאִי אַתָּה מוֹשִׁיב בְּכׇל עִיר וָעִיר.
human_translation: If so, what the verse states: in all your gates” In your gates, you establish courts in each and every district and in each and every city, and outside Eretz you establish in each and every district, but you do not establish in each and every city.
llm_translation: If so, what does the Talmud mean by "in your gates"? In your gates, you establish courts in every district and every city, and outside the land you establish in every district and every city, but you do not establish in every city and every city.

hebrew_text: סַנְהֶדְרִין הַהוֹרֶגֶת וְכוּ׳. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: אַחַת לְשִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה נִקְרֵאת חַבְּלָנִית, אוֹ דִלְמָא אוֹרַח אַרְעָא הִיא? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: A Sanhedrin that executes A dilemma was raised before once in seventy, years is characterized as a destructive Or perhaps standard conduct is shall stand
llm_translation: Tractate Sanhedrin, the one who kills, etc. It was asked: One who is called a midwife after seventy years, is she considered a murderer, or perhaps she is a helper of the land? The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמְרִים: אִילּוּ הָיִינוּ וְכוּ׳. הֵיכִי הֲווֹ עָבְדִי? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר דְאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: רְאִיתֶם טְרֵיפָה הָרַג, שָׁלֵם הָרַג?
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon and Rabbi Akiva say: If we had been How would they have acted Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Elazar both say Did you see killed a tereifa , he killed intact?
llm_translation: Rabbi Tarfon and Rabbi Akiva say: "If we were etc." How did they serve? Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Elazar both say: "Did you see a treifah killed, was it killed whole?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר שָׁלֵם הֲוָה, דִּלְמָא בִּמְקוֹם סַיִיף נֶקֶב הֲוָה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: if you say he was intact perhaps in the place sword there was a perforation
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: If you find to say "he was whole," perhaps it was in a place of a pierced sword.

hebrew_text: בְּבוֹעֵל אֶת הָעֶרְוָה הֵיכִי הֲווֹ עָבְדִי? אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: רְאִיתֶם כְּמִכְחוֹל בִּשְׁפוֹפֶרֶת? וְרַבָּנַן, הֵיכִי דָּיְינוּ? כִּשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בִּמְנָאֲפִים – מִשֶּׁיִּרְאוּ כִּמְנָאֲפִים.
human_translation: With regard to one who engages in intercourse with a forbidden relative, how would they have acted Abaye and Rava both say Did you see like a brush into a tube? And the Rabbis, how would they adjudicated in accordance with Shmuel, as Shmuel says: In adulterers from when they will appear as adulterers,
llm_translation: In one who engages in forbidden relations, how are they considered servants? Abaye and Rava both said: Have you seen like a speck of dust in a sieve? And the Rabbis, how do they evaluate? Like Shmuel, for Shmuel said: With adulterers - as soon as they are seen like adulterers.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ כֵּיצַד הָעֵדִים
llm_translation: We will return to you, how the witnesses.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵלּוּ הֵן הַגּוֹלִין: הַהוֹרֵג נֶפֶשׁ בִּשְׁגָגָה, הָיָה מְעַגֵּל בַּמַּעְגֵּילָה וְנָפְלָה עָלָיו וַהֲרָגַתּוּ, הָיָה מְשַׁלְשֵׁל בֶּחָבִית וְנָפְלָה עָלָיו וַהֲרָגַתּוּ, הָיָה יוֹרֵד בַּסּוּלָּם וְנָפַל עָלָיו (וַהֲרָגַתּוּ) [וַהֲרָגוֹ] – הֲרֵי זֶה גּוֹלֶה. אֲבָל אִם הָיָה מוֹשֵׁךְ בַּמַּעְגֵּילָה וְנָפְלָה עָלָיו וַהֲרָגַתּוּ, הָיָה דּוֹלֶה בֶּחָבִית וְנִפְסַק הַחֶבֶל וְנָפְלָה עָלָיו וַהֲרָגַתּוּ
human_translation: These are who are exiled: who kills a person unintentionally. one was rolling a roller and fell upon and killed him, one was lowering a barrel and it fell on and killed him, was descending a ladder and he fell on and killed him, he is exiled. But if one was pulling a roller and it fell upon and killed him, one was lifting a barrel and the rope was severed and it fell upon and killed him,
llm_translation: Mishnah: These are the rollers: one who unintentionally kills a person. If he was rolling a barrel on a slope and it fell on him and killed him, if he was dragging a chest and it fell on him and killed him, if he was descending a ladder and it fell on him (and killed him) – this is exile. But if he was pulling a barrel and it fell on him and killed him, if he was pushing a chest and the rope snapped and it fell on him and killed him.

hebrew_text: הָיָה עוֹלֶה בַּסּוּלָּם וְנָפַל עָלָיו וַהֲרָגוֹ – הֲרֵי זֶה אֵינוֹ גּוֹלֶה. זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל שֶׁבְּדֶרֶךְ יְרִידָתוֹ – גּוֹלֶה, וְשֶׁלֹּא בְּדֶרֶךְ יְרִידָתוֹ – אֵינוֹ גּוֹלֶה.
human_translation: one was climbing a ladder and he fell upon and killed him, that is not exiled. This is the principle: Any who through his downward is exiled, and who not through his downward is not exiled.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If one was ascending a ladder and it fell on him and killed him - he is not exiled. This is the principle: anyone whose descent is in the manner of his ascent - is exiled, and one whose descent is not in the manner of his ascent - is not exiled.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וַיַּפֵּל עָלָיו וַיָּמֹת״ – עַד שֶׁיִּפּוֹל דֶּרֶךְ נְפִילָה.
human_translation: From where are these matters as Shmuel says that the verse states “And he cast it down upon him and dies” unless falls in a downward
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of these words? For Shmuel said in the name of a verse: "And he fell upon him and died" - until he falls in a way of falling.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״בִּשְׁגָגָה״ – פְּרָט לְמֵזִיד. ״בִּבְלִי דַּעַת״ – פְּרָט לְמִתְכַּוֵּין.
human_translation: The Sages taught “Unintentionally” exclude the intentionally. “Unawares” exclude the with intent.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "By mistake" - excludes intentional. "Without knowledge" - excludes deliberate.

hebrew_text: מֵזִיד? פְּשִׁיטָא, בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: אֵימָא פְּרָט לְאוֹמֵר מוּתָּר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אִי אוֹמֵר מוּתָּר, אָנוּס הוּא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר, הָאוֹמֵר מוּתָּר – קָרוֹב לְמֵזִיד הוּא.
human_translation: intentionally? obvious he is subject to death Rather, Rava said: Say exclude the says it is permitted Abaye said to If says it is permitted, he a victim of circumstances beyond his control, said to him: as I say one who says it is permitted, borders on the intentional.
llm_translation: Deliberate? Obviously, it is intentional, he is a son of a murderer! Rather, Rava said: Say it is an exception to the rule. Abaye said to him: If you say it is an exception, is he coerced? He said to him: When I say, one who says it is permitted is close to being deliberate.

hebrew_text: ״בִּבְלִי דַעַת״ – פְּרָט לְמִתְכַּוֵּין. מִתְכַּוֵּין? פְּשִׁיטָא, בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא! אָמַר רַבָּה: פְּרָט לְמִתְכַּוֵּין לַהֲרוֹג אֶת הַבְּהֵמָה וְהָרַג אֶת הָאָדָם, לַגּוֹי וְהָרַג אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל, לַנֵּפֶל וְהָרַג בֶּן קַיָּימָא.
human_translation: “Unawares”; exclude the with intent. With intent? obvious he is subject to death Rabba said: exclude the with intent to kill an animal and he killed a person to a gentile and he killed a Jew, to a non-viable newborn and he killed a viable
llm_translation: "Without knowledge" - excluding those who intend. Intend? Obviously, it is a case of accidental killing! Rabbah said: Excluding those who intend to kill an animal and end up killing a person, to a gentile and end up killing a Jew, to a stillborn and end up killing a viable child.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אִם בְּפֶתַע״ – פְּרָט לְקֶרֶן זָוִית. ״בְּלֹא אֵיבָה״ – פְּרָט לְשׂוֹנֵא. ״הֲדָפוֹ״ – שֶׁדְּחָפוֹ בְּגוּפוֹ. ״אוֹ הִשְׁלִיךְ עָלָיו״ – לְהָבִיא יְרִידָה שֶׁהִיא צוֹרֶךְ עֲלִיָּה. ״בְּלֹא צְדִיָּה״ – פְּרָט לְמִתְכַּוֵּין לְצַד זֶה וְהָלְכָה לָהּ לְצַד אַחֵר.
human_translation: The Sages taught “If suddenly”; exclude a corner. “Without enmity”; exclude enemy, “He thrust him”; that shoved him with his body “Or cast upon him”; include a downward that is for the purpose of an upward “Without lying in wait”; exclude had intent to this side and it went to a different side
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "If suddenly" - excluding a corner horn. "Without enmity" - excluding a hater. "He pushed" - that he pushed with his body. "Or threw upon him" - to bring about a descent that is necessary for ascent. "Without intent" - excluding one who intends for this side and the halacha goes to the other side.

hebrew_text: ״וַאֲשֶׁר לֹא צָדָה״ – פְּרָט לְמִתְכַּוֵּין לִזְרוֹק שְׁתַּיִם, וְזָרַק אַרְבַּע. ״וַאֲשֶׁר יָבֹא אֶת רֵעֵהוּ בַיַּעַר״ – מָה יַעַר רְשׁוּת לַנִּיזָּק וְלַמַּזִּיק לִיכָּנֵס לְשָׁם, אַף כֹּל רְשׁוּת לַנִּיזָּק וְלַמַּזִּיק לִיכָּנֵס לְשָׁם.
human_translation: “And who did not lie in wait” exclude had intent to throw two and he threw four “And as one who goes with his neighbor into the forest” Just as a forest permission for the victim and for the assailant to enter there, so too, any permission for the victim and for the assailant to enter there,
llm_translation: "And she was not betrothed" - excluding one who intended to throw two items and threw four. "And if a man meets his neighbor in the forest" - just as the forest is a place of danger and harm, where one should not enter, so too, any place of danger and harm, one should not enter there.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ מֵרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָיָה עוֹלֶה בַּסּוּלָּם וְנִשְׁמְטָה שְׁלִיבָה מִתַּחְתָּיו, וְנָפְלָה וְהָרְגָה, מַהוּ? כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא עֲלִיָּה הִיא, אוֹ יְרִידָה הִיא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּבָר נָגַעְתָּ בִּירִידָה שֶׁהִיא צוֹרֶךְ עֲלִיָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu raised a dilemma before Rabbi Yoḥanan: one was ascending a ladder and the rung was displaced from beneath him, and fell and killed what is In a case like this, is an upward or is a downward said to him: you already touched upon a downward that is for the purpose of an upward
llm_translation: Requested of him Rabbi Abbahu from Rabbi Yochanan: If one was ascending in a ladder and its rung slipped from beneath him, and he fell and died, what is the ruling? Is it considered ascent or descent? He said to him: You have already engaged in descent, which requires ascent.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ, זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל שֶׁבְּדֶרֶךְ יְרִידָתוֹ – גּוֹלֶה, שֶׁלֹּא בְּדֶרֶךְ יְרִידָתוֹ – אֵינוֹ גּוֹלֶה. שֶׁלֹּא בְּדֶרֶךְ יְרִידָתוֹ לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מַאי? לָאו לְאֵיתוֹיֵי כְּהַאי גַוְונָא? וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, כָּל שֶׁבְּדֶרֶךְ יְרִידָתוֹ, לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מַאי?
human_translation: raised an objection to This is the principle: Any who through his downward is exiled, and who not through his downward is not exiled. who not through his downward what to add? Is it not to add a case like this, And according to your reasoning Any who through his downward to add?
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: this is the principle: anyone whose descent is in the way of his going down - he rolls, if not in the way of his going down - he does not roll. If not in the way of his going down for what purpose? Is it not for the purpose of this quality? And to taste, anyone whose descent is in the way of his going down, for what purpose?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְאֵיתוֹיֵי קַצָּב, הָכָא נָמֵי לְאֵיתוֹיֵי קַצָּב. דְּתַנְיָא: קַצָּב שֶׁהָיָה מְקַצֵּב, תָּנָא חֲדָא: לְפָנָיו – חַיָּיב, לְאַחֲרָיו – פָּטוּר. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: לְאַחֲרָיו – חַיָּיב, לְפָנָיו – פָּטוּר. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: בֵּין לְפָנָיו בֵּין לְאַחֲרָיו – חַיָּיב, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: בֵּין לְפָנָיו בֵּין לְאַחֲרָיו – פָּטוּר. וְלָא קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Rather, to add a butcher. Here too, to add a butcher, as it is taught a butcher who was chopping one taught in front of him, liable behind him, exempt. And it is taught another behind him, liable; in front of him, exempt. And it is taught another Both in front of him and behind him, liable. And it is taught another Both in front of him and behind him, exempt. And not difficult.
llm_translation: Rather, for the purpose of cutting, here it is stated for the purpose of cutting. As it was taught: A cutter who was cutting, one teaching: if before him - liable, if after him - exempt. And it was taught the other way: if after him - liable, if before him - exempt. And it was taught the other way: whether before him or after him - liable, and it was taught the other way: whether before him or after him - exempt. And there is no difficulty.

hebrew_text: כָּאן – בִּירִידָה שֶׁלְּפָנָיו, וַעֲלִיָּה שֶׁלְּאַחֲרָיו. כָּאן – בַּעֲלִיָּה שֶׁלְּפָנָיו, וִירִידָה שֶׁלְּאַחֲרָיו.
human_translation: Here, with a downward in front of him and an upward behind him. There, with an upward in front of him and a downward behind him.
llm_translation: Here is the English word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text: "Here - in descent of his face, and ascent of his back. Here - in ascent of his face, and descent of his back."

hebrew_text: כָּאן – בִּירִידָה שֶׁלְּפָנָיו וְשֶׁל אַחֲרָיו, כָּאן – בַּעֲלִיָּה שֶׁלְּפָנָיו וְשֶׁל אַחֲרָיו.
human_translation: here, with a downward in front of him and behind him. There, with an upward in front of him and behind him.
llm_translation: Here is the English word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text: "Here - in descent of his face and of his back, here - in ascent of his face and of his back."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: הָיָה עוֹלֶה בַּסּוּלָּם וְנִשְׁמְטָה שְׁלִיבָה מִתַּחְתָּיו, תָּנֵי חֲדָא חַיָּיב, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ פָּטוּר. מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר יְרִידָה הִיא, וּמָר סָבַר עֲלִיָּה הִיא?
human_translation: Let us say the subject of tanna’im : one was ascending a ladder and its rung was displaced from beneath him, it is taught one liable, and it is taught another exempt. What, is it not disagree with regard to this, as Sage holds: It is a downward and Sage holds: It is an upward
llm_translation: Let us say like the Tannaim: If one was ascending on a ladder and a shard fell from beneath him, one Tanna teaches: he is liable, and another Tanna teaches: he is exempt. What is the reason they do not disagree in this case? For one Sage holds it is a descent, and the other Sage holds it is an ascent?

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא עֲלִיָּה הִיא. וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן לִנְיזָקִין, כָּאן לְגָלוּת.
human_translation: No, as everyone agrees it is an upward and not difficult, here, to damages, there, to exile,
llm_translation: Not, all of the world, going up it is. And not difficult: here for damages, here for exile.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא הָא וְהָא לְגָלוּת, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא דְּאַתְלַיע, הָא דְּלָא אַתְלַע.
human_translation: If you wish, say this and that to exile, and not difficult, this where was worm infested that where was not worm infested,
llm_translation: If you will say, "Here and here for exile," and it is not difficult, this one that is hidden, this one that is not hidden.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא וְהָא דְּלָא אַתְלַע, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא דְּמִיהַדַּק, וְהָא דְּלָא מִיהַדַּק.
human_translation: And if you wish, say this and that was not worm infested, and not difficult, this where was tightly and that where was not tightly
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: This and this, that do not mix, and are not difficult, this that is similar, and this that is not similar.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נִשְׁמַט הַבַּרְזֶל מִקַּתּוֹ וְהָרַג, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ גּוֹלֶה, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: גּוֹלֶה. מִן הָעֵץ הַמִּתְבַּקֵּעַ, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: גּוֹלֶה, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ גּוֹלֶה.
human_translation: the blade was displaced from its handle, and killed Rabbi says: He is not exiled, and the Rabbis say: exiled. of a tree that is being split Rabbi says: exiled, and the Rabbis say: He is not exiled.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If the iron detached from its handle and killed someone, Rabbi says: it does not roll to be considered a dangerous object, and the Sages say: it does roll. If the iron is from a tree that was split, Rabbi says: it rolls, and the Sages say: it does not roll.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא, אָמַר לָהֶם רַבִּי לַחֲכָמִים: וְכִי נֶאֱמַר ״וְנָשַׁל הַבַּרְזֶל מֵעֵצוֹ״? וַהֲלֹא לֹא נֶאֱמַר אֶלָּא ״מִן הָעֵץ״! וְעוֹד, נֶאֱמַר ״עֵץ״ לְמַטָּה וְנֶאֱמַר ״עֵץ״ לְמַעְלָה, מָה ״עֵץ״ הָאָמוּר לְמַעְלָה מִן הָעֵץ הַמִּתְבַּקֵּעַ, אַף ״עֵץ״ הָאָמוּר לְמַטָּה מִן הָעֵץ הַמִּתְבַּקֵּעַ.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi said to the Rabbis: Is it stated And the blade displaces from its wood But isn’t it stated: from the wood” And furthermore: Etz is stated below: and etz is stated above, Just as etz stated above from the tree that is being split, so too, etz stated below from the tree that is being split,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: It was taught: Rabbi said to the sages, 'Is it stated, "And the iron shall be removed from its wood"?' But was it not stated only, "from the wood"? Furthermore, it is stated "wood" below and it is stated "wood" above. Just as the "wood" mentioned above is from the tree that is being split, so too the "wood" mentioned below is from the tree that is being split."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: וּשְׁנֵיהֶם מִקְרָא אֶחָד דָּרְשׁוּ: ״וְנָשַׁל הַבַּרְזֶל מִן הָעֵץ״, רַבִּי סָבַר: יֵשׁ אֵם לַמָּסוֹרֶת, ״וְנִישֵּׁל״ כְּתִיב, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: יֵשׁ אֵם לַמִּקְרָא, ״וְנָשַׁל״ קָרֵינַן.
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi says Rav says: And both of them, interpreted one verse “And the blade displaces [ venashal ] from the wood.” Rabbi holds: tradition is authoritative, And it is written venishel , And the Rabbis maintain: vocalization is authoritative, and we read venashal ,
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Ashe said in the name of Rav: And both of them expounded one verse: "And the iron axe head flew off from the wood." Rabbi Sabar holds: There is a mother for the tradition, as it is written "venishel" (and it was loosened). And the Rabbis hold: There is a mother for the scripture, as we read "venashal" (and it was loosened).

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי, יֵשׁ אֵם לַמָּסוֹרֶת סְבִירָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: And Rabbi hold tradition is authoritative?
llm_translation: And Rabbi, is there a mother for the tradition that he agrees with?

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רַבִּי, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן רוֹעֵץ, וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, כּוּלְּהוּ סְבִירִי לְהוּ יֵשׁ אֵם לַמִּקְרָא! הַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר לְהוּ ״וְעוֹד״.
human_translation: But doesn’t Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rabbi Yosef, say Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi and Rabbi Yehuda ben Roetz, and Beit Shammai, and Rabbi Shimon, and Rabbi Akiva all hold vocalization is authoritative, That is that said to And furthermore.
llm_translation: And he said, Rav Yitzchak son of Rabbi Yosef said, Rabbi Yochanan said: Rabbi, and Rabbi Yehuda ben Roetz, and Beit Shammai, and Rabbi Shimon, and Rabbi Akiva, all of them hold that there is a mother to the Scripture! That is what he said to them, "And furthermore."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מַאן דִּשְׁדָא פִּיסָּא לְדִיקְלָא וְאַתַּר תַּמְרֵי, וַאֲזוּל תַּמְרֵי וּקְטוּל, בָּאנוּ לְמַחְלוֹקֶת דְּרַבִּי וְרַבָּנַן. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא, כְּכֹחַ כֹּחוֹ דָּמֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: one who cast a clod onto a palm tree, and he severed dates and the dates went and killed him, we have arrived at the dispute Rabbi and the Rabbis obvious? Lest you say are like a force force of his teaches us
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Whoever throws a stone at a palm tree and hits two dates, and the dates fall and are cut, we come to the dispute of Rabbi and the Rabbis. It is obvious! Lest you say, "Like his strength, so is his worth," it is teaching us.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כֹּחַ כֹּחוֹ לְרַבִּי הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? כְּגוֹן דִּשְׁדָא פִּיסָּא וּמַחֲיֵהּ לְגִרְמָא, וַאֲזַל גִּרְמָא וּמַחֲיֵהּ לִכְבָאסָא וְאַתַּר תַּמְרֵי, וַאֲזוּל תַּמְרֵי וּקְטוּל.
human_translation: But according to Rabbi how can you find a force force of his where one cast a clod and it struck a branch and the branch, proceeded to strike a cluster of dates [ likhevasa ] and severed dates and dates proceeded to kill
llm_translation: Rather, how does Rabbi find strength? For example, he takes a piece of bread and gives it to a fig, then the fig goes and gives it to a flask of oil, and the flask of oil to a cake, and the cake to dates, and the dates are consumed.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַזּוֹרֵק אֶבֶן לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וְהָרַג – הֲרֵי זֶה גּוֹלֶה. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: אִם מִכְּשֶׁיָּצָאתָה הָאֶבֶן מִיָּדוֹ הוֹצִיא הַלָּה אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ וְקִבְּלָהּ – הֲרֵי זֶה פָּטוּר.
human_translation: One who threw a stone into the public domain and killed is exiled. Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: If after the stone left his hand the other placed his head out and received he is exempt,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who throws a stone into a public domain and kills someone - he is exiled. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: If the stone was removed from his hand, and he bent his head and received it - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: זָרַק אֶת הָאֶבֶן לַחֲצֵרוֹ וְהָרַג, אִם יֵשׁ רְשׁוּת לַנִּיזָּק לִיכָּנֵס לְשָׁם – גּוֹלֶה, וְאִם לָאו – אֵינוֹ גּוֹלֶה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַאֲשֶׁר יָבֹא אֶת רֵעֵהוּ בַיַּעַר״ – מָה הַיַּעַר רְשׁוּת לַנִּיזָּק וְלַמַּזִּיק לִיכָּנֵס לְשָׁם, אַף כֹּל רְשׁוּת לַנִּיזָּק וְלַמַּזִּיק לְהִכָּנֵס לְשָׁם. יָצָא חֲצַר בַּעַל הַבַּיִת, שֶׁאֵין רְשׁוּת לַנִּיזָּק וְלַמַּזִּיק לִיכָּנֵס לְשָׁם.
human_translation: threw the stone into his courtyard and killed if the victim had permission to enter into there, exiled, but if not, he is not exiled, as it is stated “And as one who goes with his neighbor into the forest” Just as a forest, the victim and the assailant have permission to enter there, so too, all the victim and the assailant have permission to enter there, to exclude courtyard of the homeowner, where the victim and the assailant do not have permission to enter there.
llm_translation: He threw the stone into his courtyard and killed someone. If there is permission for the injured party to enter there - he is exiled, and if not - he is not exiled, as it is stated: "And if a man shall come with his neighbor into the forest" - just as the forest is a place where the injured and the injurer have permission to enter, so too, any place where the injured and the injurer have permission to enter. The owner of the house's courtyard is exempt, as there is no permission for the injured and the injurer to enter there.

hebrew_text: אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: מָה חֲטָבַת עֵצִים רְשׁוּת, אַף כֹּל רְשׁוּת, יָצָא הָאָב הַמַּכֶּה אֶת בְּנוֹ, וְהָרַב הָרוֹדֶה אֶת תַּלְמִידוֹ, וּשְׁלִיחַ בֵּית דִּין.
human_translation: Abba Shaul says: Just as the cutting of wood optional, so too, all optional. to exclude a father who strikes his son, and a teacher who oppresses his student, and an agent of the court
llm_translation: Abba Shaul says: Just as chopping wood is a permitted activity, so too all permitted activities. The father who strikes his son, the teacher who disciplines his student, and the agent of the court have fulfilled their obligation.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, מֵזִיד הוּא! אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יִצְחָק: בְּסוֹתֵר אֶת כּוֹתְלוֹ. אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְעַיּוֹנֵי! בְּסוֹתֵר אֶת כּוֹתְלוֹ בַּלַּיְלָה. בַּלַּיְלָה נָמֵי אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְעַיּוֹנֵי!
human_translation: into the public domain, He is an intentional Rav Shmuel bar Yitzḥak says: where one is demolishing his wall, he should have examined where one is demolishing his wall at night, At night too he is required to examine
llm_translation: Gemar to the public domain, it is intentional! Rav Shmuel bar Yitzchak said: by demolishing his wall. The scholars asked him: by demolishing his wall at night. At night also they asked him: by demolishing his wall at night!

hebrew_text: בְּסוֹתֵר אֶת כּוֹתְלוֹ לְאַשְׁפָּה. הַאי אַשְׁפָּה הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי שְׁכִיחִי בַּהּ רַבִּים – פּוֹשֵׁעַ הוּא, אִי לָא שְׁכִיחִי בַּהּ רַבִּים – אָנוּס הוּא!
human_translation: where one demolishes his wall into a scrap heap, What are the circumstances of this scrap heap? If it is frequented by the multitudes he is negligent; if it is not frequented by the multitudes, he is a victim of circumstances beyond his control,
llm_translation: In one who demolishes his wall to a refuse heap. This refuse heap, how is it comparable? If it is common among many - he is a transgressor, if it is not common among many - he is compelled!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא צְרִיכָא אֶלָּא לְאַשְׁפָּה הָעֲשׂוּיָה לִיפָּנוֹת בָּהּ בַּלַּיְלָה, וְאֵין עֲשׂוּיָה לִיפָּנוֹת בָּהּ בַּיּוֹם, וְאִיכָּא דְּמִקְּרֵי וְיָתֵיב. פּוֹשֵׁעַ לָא הָוֵי – דְּהָא אֵינָהּ עֲשׂוּיָה לִיפָּנוֹת בָּהּ בַּיּוֹם, אוֹנֶס נָמֵי לָא הָוֵי, דְּהָא אִיכָּא דְּמִקְּרֵי וְיָתֵיב.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: necessary only in a scrap heap that is utilized to defecate there at night but is not utilized to defecate there during the day, but it happens will sit is neither negligent, as is not utilized to defecate there during the day, nor is he a victim of circumstances beyond his control, as it happens will sit
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: It is necessary only for the ash heap made for turning in it at night, and not made for turning in it during the day, and there are those who call it a seat. It is not considered a transgression - for it is not made for turning in it during the day, and it is not considered coercion, for there are those who call it a seat.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וּמָצָא״ – פְּרָט לְמַמְצִיא אֶת עַצְמוֹ. מִכָּאן אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב: אִם מִשֶּׁיָּצָתָה הָאֶבֶן מִיָּדוֹ הוֹצִיא הַלָּה אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ וְקִבְּלָהּ, פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: The Sages taught “And finds”; to exclude presents himself From here Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: If after the stone left his hand the other placed his head out and received exempt.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says, etc. The Rabbis taught: "And he shall find" - this is a detail to include finding oneself. From here Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov said: If the stone was removed from his hand, and the halachah accepted it, he is exempt.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּ״מָצָא״ מֵעִיקָּרָא מַשְׁמַע? וּרְמִינְהִי: ״וּמָצָא״ – פְּרָט לְמָצוּי, שֶׁלֹּא יִמְכּוֹר בְּרָחוֹק וְיִגְאוֹל בְּקָרוֹב, בְּרָעָה וְיִגְאוֹל בְּיָפָה!
human_translation: to say that “and finds” indicates initially, And raises a contradiction “and finds” to exclude found that he may not sell in a distant and redeem in a proximate a low-quality and redeem with high-quality
llm_translation: In the matter of "matsa" - does it imply from the outset? And raise a contradiction: "and he finds" - this is specific to a found object, that he should not sell it from afar and redeem it nearby, in its ugliness and redeem it in its beauty!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הָכָא מֵעִנְיָינֵיהּ דִּקְרָא וְהָתָם מֵעִנְיָינֵיהּ דִּקְרָא. הָתָם מֵעִנְיָינֵיהּ דִּקְרָא, ״וּמָצָא״ דּוּמְיָא דִּ״וְהִשִּׂיגָה יָדוֹ״, מָה ״הִשִּׂיגָה יָדוֹ״ מֵהַשְׁתָּא, אַף ״מָצָא״ נָמֵי מֵהַשְׁתָּא. הָכָא מֵעִנְיָינֵיהּ דִּקְרָא, ״וּמָצָא״ דּוּמְיָא דְּיַעַר, מָה יַעַר מִידֵּי דְּאִיתֵיהּ מֵעִיקָּרָא, אַף ״וּמָצָא״ נָמֵי מִידֵּי דְּאִיתֵיהּ מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: Rava said: here, with the context of the verse, and there, with the context of the verse. There, with the context of the verse. “and finds” similar to “And he acquires the means.” Just as “he acquires the means” from now, so too, “and finds” also from now Here, with the context of the verse, “and finds” similar a forest: Just as a forest an entity that is there initially, so too, “and finds” also an entity that is there initially.
llm_translation: Rava said: Here, the concern is with the matter of the verse, and there, the concern is with the matter of the verse. There, the concern is with the matter of the verse, "and he found" is similar to "and his hand reached," just as "his hand reached" is from the present time, so too "he found" is also from the present time. Here, the concern is with the matter of the verse, "and he found" is similar to a forest, just as a forest is from the beginning, so too "and he found" is also from the beginning.

hebrew_text: הַזּוֹרֵק אֶת הָאֶבֶן וְכוּ׳. אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן לְרָבָא: מִמַּאי דְּמַחֲטָבַת עֵצִים דִּרְשׁוּת? דִּלְמָא מֵחֲטָבַת עֵצִים דְּסוּכָּה, וּמֵחֲטָבַת עֵצִים דְּמַעֲרָכָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא לִיגְלֵי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ כֵּיוָן דְּאִם מָצָא חָטוּב אֵינוֹ חוֹטֵב, לָאו מִצְוָה, הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי – לָאו מִצְוָה.
human_translation: One who throws a stone, etc. One of the Sages said to Rava: From where that from the cutting of wood that optional? Perhaps from the cutting of wood for a sukka or from cutting wood for the arrangement and even so the Merciful One states: Let him be exiled. said to him: Since if one found cut he does not cut not a mitzva now, as well, not a mitzva.
llm_translation: The one who throws the stone, etc. He said to him, that certain Sage to Rava: From what source do you derive the chopping of wood for the Sukkah as a permitted activity on Shabbat? Perhaps it is derived from the chopping of wood for the Sukkah, and from the chopping of wood for the altar, and even so, did the Merciful One say to reveal this? He said to him, since if one found the wood already chopped, he should not chop more, it is not a mitzvah, so too now - it is not a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרָבָא: יָצָא הָאָב הַמַּכֶּה אֶת בְּנוֹ, וְהָרַב הָרוֹדֶה אֶת תַּלְמִידוֹ, וּשְׁלִיחַ בֵּית דִּין. לֵימָא: כֵּיוָן דְּאִילּוּ גְּמִיר לָאו מִצְוָה, הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי, לָאו מִצְוָה! הָתָם אַף עַל גַּב דִּגְמִיר מִצְוָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״יַסֵּר בִּנְךָ וִינִיחֶךָ וְיִתֵּן מַעֲדַנִּים לְנַפְשֶׁךָ״.
human_translation: Ravina raised an objection to Rava to exclude a father who strikes his son, and a teacher who oppresses his student, and an agent of the court. Let us say Since if learned, not a mitzva now, too, not a mitzva, There, even though is learned, a mitzva as it is written: “Chastise your son, and he will give you rest; and he will give delight to your soul”
llm_translation: Ravina raised an objection to Rava: If the father who strikes his son, and the teacher who disciplines his student, and the agent of the court are all exempt, let us say: Since if he were not fulfilling a commandment, now too, he is not fulfilling a commandment! There, even though he is fulfilling a commandment, as it is written: "He who spares his rod hates his son, but he who loves him disciplines him promptly."

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר רָבָא: לָאו מִילְּתָא הִיא דַּאֲמַרִי. ״וַאֲשֶׁר יָבֹא אֶת רֵעֵהוּ בַיַּעַר״, מָה יַעַר דְּאִי בָּעֵי עָיֵיל וְאִי בָּעֵי לָא עָיֵיל, וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ מִצְוָה, מִי סַגִּיא דְּלָא עָיֵיל?
human_translation: Rava then said: That which I said is nothing, “And as when one [ ve’asher ] goes with his neighbor into the forest.” what forest where if one wants he enters and if one wants he does not enter. And if it enters your mind a mitzva, would it suffice if he did not enter
llm_translation: Rava said: It is not a matter that they said. "And when one goes with his neighbor into the forest," whether the forest requires vigilance or does not require vigilance, and if it enters your mind that it is a commandment, is it not significant that it does not require vigilance?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה לְרָבָא: כֹּל הֵיכָא דִּכְתִיב ״אֲשֶׁר״, דְּאִי בָּעֵי הוּא? אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה ״וְאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יִטְמָא וְלֹא יִתְחַטָּא״ – אִי בָּעֵי מִיטַּמֵּא אִי בָּעֵי לָא מִיטַּמֵּא. מֵת מִצְוָה, דְּלָא סַגִּי דְּלָא מִיטַּמֵּא, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּפָטוּר?
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said to Rava: wherever asher is written where if he wants If that is so, “And a man who [ asher ] becomes impure and does not purify himself, if he wants he becomes impure, if he wants he does not become impure. a corpse with no one to bury it [ met mitzva ], where it would not suffice for him not to become impure So too, he is exempt
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Adda bar Ahava to Rava: Wherever it is written "asher," does it mean he must? Rather, from now on, "and a man who becomes impure and does not purify himself" - if he wants to become impure, he can; if he does not want to become impure, he does not have to. Regarding a dead body, where there is no obligation to become impure, is it also exempt?

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא:
human_translation: There it is different, as the verse states
llm_translation: The difference there is, as the verse states:

hebrew_text: ״טָמֵא יִהְיֶה״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: “He shall be impure” in any case,
llm_translation: "Tamay Yihyeh" - mi'kol makom.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״טָמֵא יִהְיֶה״ – לְרַבּוֹת טְבוּל יוֹם, ״טוּמְאָתוֹ בוֹ״ – לְרַבּוֹת מְחוּסַּר כִּיפּוּרִים! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא מֵ״עוֹד טוּמְאָתוֹ״ קָא אָמֵינָא.
human_translation: He requires that as that which is taught “He shall be impure” to include one who immersed that day “His impurity is upon him,” to include one who has not yet an atonement said to I said from “His impurity is yet
llm_translation: That one asked him according to the teaching: "He shall be impure" - to include a Tevul Yom, "His impurity is upon him" - to include one lacking atonement! He said to him: I am saying "His impurity is upon him" from the additional wording.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַהָא: ״בֶּחָרִישׁ וּבַקָּצִיר תִּשְׁבֹּת״, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר חָרִישׁ שֶׁל שְׁבִיעִית וְקָצִיר שֶׁל שְׁבִיעִית, שֶׁהֲרֵי כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״שָׂדְךָ לֹא תִזְרָע וְכַרְמְךָ לֹא תִזְמֹר״, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ חָרִישׁ שֶׁל עֶרֶב שְׁבִיעִית שֶׁנִּכְנַס לִשְׁבִיעִית, וְקָצִיר שֶׁל שְׁבִיעִית שֶׁיָּצָא לְמוֹצָאֵי שְׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: Some teach with regard to this “In plowing and in harvest you shall rest” Rabbi Akiva says: does not need to state plowing Sabbatical or harvesting Sabbatical as it is already stated: “You shall neither sow your field, nor prune your vineyard” Rather, even plowing eve of Sabbatical which Sabbatical enters, and harvest of Sabbatical which emerged conclusion of the Sabbatical
llm_translation: There is one who teaches it to him: "In plowing and in harvesting you shall rest." Rabbi Akiva says: It is not necessary to say plowing of the seventh year and harvesting of the seventh year, for it has already been stated, "You shall not sow your field or prune your vineyard." Rather, even the plowing of the eve of the seventh year that enters into the seventh year, and the harvesting of the seventh year that goes out after the conclusion of the seventh year.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: מָה חָרִישׁ רְשׁוּת – אַף קָצִיר רְשׁוּת. יָצָא קְצִיר הָעוֹמֶר שֶׁהוּא מִצְוָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says: Just as plowing optional, so too, harvesting optional. the harvesting of the omer which is a mitzva,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says: Just as the permission is silent, so too the harvesting is permitted. The harvesting of the Omer offering, which is a commandment, has been fulfilled.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן לְרָבָא: מִמַּאי דַּחֲרִישָׁה דִּרְשׁוּת? דִּלְמָא חֲרִישַׁת עוֹמֶר דְּמִצְוָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא ״תִּשְׁבֹּת״! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כֵּיוָן דְּאִם מָצָא חָרוּשׁ אֵינוֹ חוֹרֵשׁ, לָאו מִצְוָה.
human_translation: One of the Sages said to Rava: From where that plowing that optional? Perhaps plowing omer which a mitzva, and even so the Merciful One states: “You shall rest.” said to him: Since if found plowed, not plow not a mitzva
llm_translation: He said to him, that one from the sages to Rava: From what is the silence of the Reshut? Perhaps the silence of the Omer offering is a commandment, yet even so, the Merciful One said "to rest"! He said to him: Since if one found a plower, he does not plow, it is not a commandment.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרָבָא: יָצָא הָאָב הַמַּכֶּה אֶת בְּנוֹ, וְהָרַב הָרוֹדֶה אֶת תַּלְמִידוֹ, וּשְׁלִיחַ בֵּית דִּין. וְאַמַּאי? לֵימָא כֵּיוָן דְּאִילּוּ גְּמִיר לָאו מִצְוָה, הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי – לָאו מִצְוָה! הָתָם אַף עַל גַּב דִּגְמִיר נָמֵי מִצְוָה קָא עָבֵיד, דִּכְתִיב: ״יַסֵּר בִּנְךָ וִינִיחֶךָ״.
human_translation: Ravina raised an objection to Rava to exclude a father who strikes his son, and a teacher who oppresses his student, and an agent of the court. And why Let us say Since if learned, not a mitzva now, too, not a mitzva, There, even if is learned, is performing a mitzva as it is written: “Chastise your son, and he will give you rest; and he will give delight to your soul”
llm_translation: Ravina raised an objection to Rava: If the father who strikes his son, and the teacher who disciplines his student, and the agent of the court do so, why is it permitted? Let us say, since if he learns, it is not a commandment, now too - it is not a commandment! There, even though he learns, he is doing a commandment, as it is written: "He who spares his rod hates his son."

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר רָבָא: לָאו מִילְּתָא הִיא דַּאֲמַרִי. קְצִירָה דּוּמְיָא דַּחֲרִישָׁה, מָה חֲרִישָׁה, מָצָא חָרוּשׁ – אֵינוֹ חוֹרֵשׁ, אַף קְצִירָה נָמֵי, מָצָא קָצוּר אֵינוֹ קוֹצֵר, וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ מִצְוָה, מָצָא קָצוּר אֵינוֹ קוֹצֵר?! מִצְוָה לִקְצוֹר וּלְהָבִיא!
human_translation: Rava then said: That which I said is nothing, harvesting similar plowing: Just as plowing, one found plowed, he not plow, so too harvesting as well, one found harvested, he not harvest. And if it enters your mind a mitzva, one found harvested, he not harvest? a mitzva to harvest and bring
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Rava further said: It is not a matter that they said. Harvesting is similar to plowing. Just as plowing, if one found a plowshare - he does not plow, so too harvesting, if one found a cut stalk - he does not harvest. And if it enters your mind to say, is it possible that if it is a commandment, if one found a cut stalk he does not harvest?! It is a commandment to harvest and bring in!

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאָב גּוֹלֶה עַל יְדֵי הַבֵּן, וְהַבֵּן גּוֹלֶה עַל יְדֵי הָאָב. הַכֹּל גּוֹלִין עַל יְדֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְיִשְׂרָאֵל גּוֹלִין עַל יְדֵיהֶן, חוּץ מִגֵּר תּוֹשָׁב. וְגֵר תּוֹשָׁב אֵינוֹ גּוֹלֶה אֶלָּא עַל יְדֵי גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב.
human_translation: The father is exiled due to son. And the son is exiled due to father. Everyone is exiled due to a Jew, and a Jew is exiled due to them, except for a gentile who resides in Eretz Yisrael and observes the seven Noahide mitzvot [ ger toshav ]. And a ger toshav is exiled only due to a ger toshav .
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The father may perform Ḳiddushin on behalf of his son, and the son may perform Ḳiddushin on behalf of his father. All perform Ḳiddushin through the agency of Israelites, and Israelites perform Ḳiddushin through their own agency, except for a resident alien. And a resident alien may only perform Ḳiddushin through the agency of a resident alien.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָאָב גּוֹלֶה עַל יְדֵי הַבֵּן. וְהָאָמְרַתְּ: יָצָא הָאָב הַמַּכֶּה אֶת בְּנוֹ! דִּגְמִיר. הָאָמְרַתְּ אַף עַל גַּב דִּגְמִיר מִצְוָה קָעָבֵיד! בִּשְׁוַלְיָא דְּנַגָּרֵי.
human_translation: The father is exiled due to son. But didn’t you say To exclude a father who strikes his son, who is learned, But didn’t you say: Even if is learned, performs a mitzva with regard to a carpenter’s apprentice [ bishevaleya ].
llm_translation: The father's anger is upon the son. And you say: "The father who strikes his son has gone out!" It is learned. You say, even though it is learned, the commandment is honored! In the marketplace of Naggarei.

hebrew_text: שְׁוַלְיָא דְּנַגָּרֵי – חַיּוּתֵאּ הִיא דְּלַמְּדֵיהּ! דִּגְמִיר אוּמָּנוּתָא אַחֲרִיתִי.
human_translation: a carpenter’s apprentice, is teaching him a livelihood, who has learned another craft,
llm_translation: Shvulya d'naggarei - chayuta hi d'lamdei! Digmir umanuta achriti.

hebrew_text: וְהַבֵּן גּוֹלֶה עַל יְדֵי הָאָב כּוּ׳. וּרְמִינְהִי, ״מַכֵּה נֶפֶשׁ״ – פְּרָט לַמַּכָּה אָבִיו. אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְהָא רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And the son is exiled due to father. And raises a contradiction one who strikes a person to exclude one who strikes his father, Rav Kahana said: not difficult; this Rabbi Shimon, and that the Rabbis.
llm_translation: The son is exiled by the father. And raise a dilemma: "One who strikes a person" - excluding striking his father. Rav Kahana said: It is not difficult, this is the opinion of Rabbi Shimon and this is the opinion of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּאָמַר חֶנֶק חָמוּר מִסַּיִיף, שִׁגְגַת סַיִיף נִיתְּנָה לְכַפָּרָה, שִׁגְגַת חֶנֶק לֹא נִיתְּנָה לְכַפָּרָה.
human_translation: According to Rabbi Shimon, who says: Strangulation severe than sword, unwitting sword, is eligible for atonement unwitting strangulation, is not eligible for atonement
llm_translation: To Rabbi Shimon, who said: Strangulation is more severe than the sword, for the unintentional killing by the sword is subject to atonement, but the unintentional killing by strangulation is not subject to atonement.

hebrew_text: לְרַבָּנַן, דְּאָמְרִי סַיִיף חָמוּר מֵחֶנֶק, הוֹרֵג אָבִיו [בְּשׁוֹגֵג] שִׁגְגַת סַיִיף הוּא, וְשִׁגְגַת סַיִיף נִיתְּנָה לְכַפָּרָה.
human_translation: according to the Rabbis, who say: sword severe than strangulation, unintentionally kills his father an unwitting sword. And an unwitting sword, is eligible for atonement
llm_translation: To the sages, who say: A sword is more severe than strangulation, one who unintentionally kills his father, it is a mistake of the sword, and the mistake of the sword was given for atonement.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: פְּרָט לְעוֹשֶׂה חַבּוּרָה בְּאָבִיו בְּשׁוֹגֵג. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: כֵּיוָן דִּבְמֵזִיד בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא, בְּשׁוֹגֵג נָמֵי לִיגְלֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rava says: to exclude one inflicts a wound on his father unwittingly. it enters your mind to say: Since where intentionally, he is liable to be executed unwittingly, let him also be exiled teaches us
llm_translation: Rava said: Specifically regarding one who performs a forbidden labor on Shabbat unintentionally in his father's domain. The reason for your opinion I say: Since intentionally he is liable to be executed, even unintentionally it is also revealed, it is evident to us.

hebrew_text: הַכֹּל גּוֹלִין עַל יְדֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְכוּ׳. ״הַכֹּל גּוֹלִין עַל יְדֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״ לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מַאי? לְאֵיתוֹיֵי עֶבֶד וְכוּתִי. תְּנֵינָא לְהָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: עֶבֶד וְכוּתִי גּוֹלֶה וְלוֹקֶה עַל יְדֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְיִשְׂרָאֵל גּוֹלֶה וְלוֹקֶה עַל יְדֵי כּוּתִי וְעֶבֶד.
human_translation: Everyone is exiled due to a Jew, Everyone is exiled due to a Jew: What to add? to add slave and a Samaritan. We learn that which the Sages taught slave and a Samaritan are exiled and flogged due to a Jew, and a Jew is exiled and flogged due to a Samaritan and slave.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "All roll on the hands of Israel, etc." "All roll on the hands of Israel" - to include what? To include a slave and a Samaritan. We learned in the Mishnah that the Rabbis taught: A slave and a Samaritan are rolled and flogged by the hands of Israel, and Israel is rolled and flogged by the hands of a Samaritan and a slave.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא עֶבֶד וְכוּתִי גּוֹלֶה עַל יְדֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְלוֹקֶה, גּוֹלֶה – דְּקַטְלֵיהּ, וְלוֹקֶה – דְּלַטְיֵיהּ. אֶלָּא יִשְׂרָאֵל גּוֹלֶה וְלוֹקֶה עַל יְדֵי כּוּתִי? בִּשְׁלָמָא גּוֹלֶה – דְּקַטְלֵיהּ, אֶלָּא לוֹקֶה, אַמַּאי? דְּלַטְיֵיהּ? ״וְנָשִׂיא בְעַמְּךָ לֹא תָאֹר״ – בְּעוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֵׂה עַמְּךָ!
human_translation: Granted, a slave and a Samaritan are exiled and flogged due to a Jew; exiled where he killed and flogged where he cursed But a Jew is exiled and flogged due to a Samaritan, granted, exiled where killed but is flogged for what For cursing “And a leader in your people you may not curse” with regard to performs an action of your people,
llm_translation: In peace, a Jewish slave and a Cuthean who are taken captive by Israelites and are punished, if taken captive - because he killed, and if punished - because he wounded. But can a Cuthean be taken captive and punished by the hands of a Jew? In peace, if taken captive - because he killed, but if punished, why? Because he wounded? "And a prince among your people you shall not curse" - concerning one who acts like a member of your people!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהֵעִיד בּוֹ וְהוּזַם. דִּכְווֹתֵיהּ גַּבֵּי עֶבֶד, שֶׁהֵעִיד בּוֹ וְהוּזַם, עֶבֶד בַּר עֵדוּת הוּא? אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּגוֹן שֶׁהִכָּהוּ הַכָּאָה
human_translation: Rather, Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: where testified against and he was rendered a conspiring witness. in the corresponding with regard to slave, where testified against and was rendered a conspiring witness? Is a slave eligible to testimony? Rather, Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, said: What are we dealing with here? where one struck a blow
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ahah bar Yaakov said: For example, if he testified against him and was hazam. His punishment is lashes, for he testified against him and was hazam. Is he not a slave who is a valid witness? Rather, Rav Ahah, son of Rav Ika, said: What are we dealing with here? For example, if he struck him a blow.

hebrew_text: שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הִכָּהוּ הַכָּאָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – לוֹקֶה. וְלָא מַקְּשִׁינַן הַכָּאָה לִקְלָלָה.
human_translation: that does not have worth one peruta , as Rabbi Ami says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: he struck him a blow that does not have worth one peruta , he is flogged And we do not liken striking to cursing.
llm_translation: The text: "That it does not have a similar detail. As Rabbi Ammi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: If one strikes a blow here that does not have a similar detail - he is liable. And we do not equate a blow here to a curse."

hebrew_text: חוּץ מֵעַל יְדֵי גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב וְכוּ׳. אַלְמָא גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב גּוֹי הוּא. אֵימָא סֵיפָא: גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב גּוֹלֶה עַל יְדֵי גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב! אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: לָא קַשְׁיָא, כָּאן בְּגֵר תּוֹשָׁב שֶׁהָרַג גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב, כָּאן בְּגֵר תּוֹשָׁב שֶׁהָרַג יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: except for due to a ger toshav . Apparently, a ger toshav is a gentile, Say the latter clause A ger toshav is exiled due to a ger toshav , Rav Kahana said: not difficult. Here, in a ger toshav who killed a ger toshav there, in a ger toshav who killed a Jew.
llm_translation: Outside the hands of a resident alien, etc. This implies that a resident alien is a gentile. Let us say the latter clause: A resident alien is exiled by the hands of a resident alien! Rav Kahana said: It is not difficult - here it refers to a resident alien who killed a resident alien, and here it refers to a resident alien who killed an Israelite.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּרָמֵי קְרָאֵי אַהֲדָדֵי, כְּתִיב: ״לִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְלַגֵּר וְלַתּוֹשָׁב בְּתוֹכָם תִּהְיֶינָה שֵׁשׁ הֶעָרִים״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיוּ לָכֶם הֶעָרִים לְמִקְלָט״, ״לָכֶם״ – וְלֹא לְגֵרִים! אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: לָא קַשְׁיָא, כָּאן – בְּגֵר תּוֹשָׁב שֶׁהָרַג יִשְׂרָאֵל, כָּאן – בְּגֵר תּוֹשָׁב שֶׁהָרַג גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב.
human_translation: There are who raised a contradiction between verses. It is written: “For the children of Israel and for the stranger and for the resident [ velatoshav ] among them, shall six cities be And it is written “And the cities shall be for you for refuge” for you but not for a ger Rav Kahana said: not difficult. Here, concerning a ger toshav who killed a Jew; there, concerning a ger toshav who killed a ger toshav .
llm_translation: There is one who raises a contradiction between verses, as it is written: "For the children of Israel and for the stranger and for the resident among them shall these six cities be," and it is written: "And they shall be for you cities of refuge," "for you" – and not for strangers!
