Rav Kahana said: It is not difficult, here – regarding a resident stranger who killed an Israelite, and here – regarding a resident stranger who killed a resident stranger.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהִי: לְפִיכָךְ גֵּר וְגוֹי שֶׁהָרְגוּ – נֶהֱרָגִין. קָתָנֵי גֵּר דּוּמְיָא דְּגוֹי: מָה גּוֹי לָא שְׁנָא דִּקְטַל בַּר מִינֵּיהּ, וְלָא שְׁנָא דִּקְטַל דְּלָאו בַּר מִינֵיהּ – נֶהֱרָג, אַף גֵּר, לָא שְׁנָא דִּקְטַל בַּר מִינֵּיהּ וְלָא שְׁנָא קְטַל דְּלָאו בַּר מִינֵיהּ – נֶהֱרָג!
human_translation: And raises a contradiction Therefore, a ger and a gentile who killed are killed, teaches a ger similar a gentile: Just as a gentile no different where he killed one of his kind, and no different where he killed one not of his kind, he is executed so too, a ger no different where he killed one of his kind, and no different where he killed one not of his kind, he is executed
llm_translation: And they asked: Therefore, a convert and a gentile who killed – are killed. It was taught: A convert is similar to a gentile: Just as a gentile, it makes no difference whether he killed his own kind or someone else's kind, he is killed; so too, a convert, it makes no difference whether he killed his own kind or someone else's kind, he is killed!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לָא קַשְׁיָא, כָּאן שֶׁהֲרָגוֹ דֶּרֶךְ יְרִידָה, כָּאן שֶׁהֲרָגוֹ דֶּרֶךְ עֲלִיָּיה. דֶּרֶךְ יְרִידָה, דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל גָּלֵי – אִיהוּ נָמֵי סַגִּי לֵיהּ בְּגָלוּת. דֶּרֶךְ עֲלִיָּיה, דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל פָּטוּר – הוּא נֶהֱרָג.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: not difficult. Here, where he killed him in a downward there, where he killed him in an upward in a downward where a Jew, be exiled, also suffices with exile. in an upward where a Jew, be exempt is executed.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: It is not difficult, here where he killed him by way of descent, here where he killed him by way of ascent. By way of descent, when Israel is revealed - he is also exiled with him. By way of ascent, when Israel is exempt - he is killed.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: וְלָאו קַל וָחוֹמֶר הוּא? וּמָה דֶּרֶךְ יְרִידָה דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל גָּלֵי, אִיהוּ נָמֵי סַגִּי לֵיהּ בְּגָלוּת, דֶּרֶךְ עֲלִיָּיה, דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל פָּטוּר, אִיהוּ נֶהֱרָג?!
human_translation: Rava said to him: And is it not an a fortiori If a downward where a Jew, be exiled, also suffices with exile an upward where a Jew, be exempt he killed?
llm_translation: He said to him Rava: And is it not a fortiori reasoning? Just as when the descent of Israel is revealed, he too is deemed fit for exile, the ascent, when Israel is exempt, he is to be killed?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: בְּאוֹמֵר מוּתָּר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אוֹמֵר מוּתָּר אָנוּס הוּא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר, אוֹמֵר מוּתָּר – קָרוֹב לְמֵזִיד הוּא.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: where says it is permitted Abaye said to him: says it is permitted is a victim of circumstances beyond his control, said to him: as I say one who says it is permitted, borders on the intentional.
llm_translation: Rava said: By saying "permitted." Abaye said to him: Saying "permitted" is coercion! He said to him: When I say, saying "permitted" - it is close to intentional.

hebrew_text: וְאָזְדוּ לְטַעְמַיְיהוּ, דְּאִיתְּמַר: כְּסָבוּר בְּהֵמָה וְנִמְצָא אָדָם, גּוֹי וְנִמְצָא גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב. רָבָא אוֹמֵר: חַיָּיב, אוֹמֵר מוּתָּר קָרוֹב לְמֵזִיד הוּא. רַב חִסְדָּא אוֹמֵר: פָּטוּר, אוֹמֵר מוּתָּר אָנוּס הוּא.
human_translation: And follow their reasoning, as it was stated he thought an animal and it was discovered a person, a gentile and it was discovered a ger toshav , Rava says liable one who says it is permitted, borders on the intentional. Rav Ḥisda says exempt, as says it is permitted is a victim of circumstances beyond his control.
llm_translation: And they went according to their reasons, for it was said: If one intended for an animal and found a human, or intended for a gentile and found a convert resident alien. Rava says: He is liable, saying it is permitted is closer to intentional. Rav Ḥisdah says: He is exempt, saying it is permitted is closer to unintentional.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב חִסְדָּא: ״הִנְּךָ מֵת עַל הָאִשָּׁה אֲשֶׁר לָקַחְתָּ״. מַאי לָאו בִּידֵי אָדָם?
human_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Ḥisda You shall die for the woman you took, What, is it not at the hand of people,
llm_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Ḥisda: "If you die on the woman whom you have taken." What, is it not in the hands of man?

hebrew_text: לָא, בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״מֵחֲטוֹא לִי״.
human_translation: No, at the hand of Heaven, is also precise as it is written: from sinning against Me”
llm_translation: Not by the hands of heaven. It is precisely stated, as it is written: "From Me is your sin."

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, ״וְחָטָאתִי לֵאלֹהִים״ – לֵאלֹהִים וְלֹא לְאָדָם? אֶלָּא, דִּינוֹ מָסוּר לְאָדָם, הָכָא נָמֵי דִּינוֹ מָסוּר לָאָדָם.
human_translation: And according to your reasoning and sin to God” vis-à-vis God and not vis-à-vis man? Rather, his judgment is given over to man; here too, his judgment is given over to man.
llm_translation: "And according to your reasoning, 'and my sin is before God' - before God and not before man? Rather, his judgment is entrusted to man, here it is also stated that his judgment is entrusted to man."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרָבָא: ״הֲגוֹי גַּם צַדִּיק תַּהֲרֹג״! הָתָם כִּדְקָא מְהַדְּרִי עִלָּוֵיהּ: ״וְעַתָּה הָשֵׁב אֵשֶׁת הָאִישׁ כִּי נָבִיא הוּא״ –
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to Rava “Will You even slay a righteous nation?” There, is as they responded to him “And now, restore the man’s wife, as he is a prophet”
llm_translation: Abaye raised an objection to Rava: "A gentile, even a righteous one, you shall kill!" There, as they were honoring him, as it is written: "Now return the man's wife, for he is a prophet."

hebrew_text: אֵשֶׁת נָבִיא הוּא דְּתֶיהְדַּר, דְּלָאו נָבִיא לָא תֶּיהְדַּר?!
human_translation: Is it the wife of a prophet that is returned, who is not a prophet is not returned?
llm_translation: A prophet's wife, she should adorn herself, for if not a prophet, should she not adorn herself?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּדְאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: ״וְעַתָּה הָשֵׁב אֵשֶׁת הָאִישׁ״, מִכׇּל מָקוֹם. וּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ: ״הֲגוֹי גַּם צַדִּיק תַּהֲרֹג, הֲלֹא הוּא אָמַר לִי אֲחוֹתִי הִיא וְגוֹ׳״ – נָבִיא הוּא וּמִמְּךָ לָמַד. אַכְסְנַאי (הוּא) שֶׁבָּא לָעִיר, עַל עִסְקֵי אֲכִילָה וּשְׁתִיָּיה שׁוֹאֲלִין אוֹתוֹ, כְּלוּם שׁוֹאֲלִין אוֹתוֹ ״אִשְׁתְּךָ זוֹ״ ״אֲחוֹתְךָ זוֹ״?
human_translation: Rather, as Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says, as Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: This is saying to “And now, restore the man’s wife” in any case, And that which you said: “Will You even slay a righteous nation? Didn’t he say to me: She is my sister” He is a prophet and from you he learned a stranger [ akhsenai ] who comes to the city, one asks him about matters of eating and drinking, Does one ask him: that your wife? that your sister?
llm_translation: Rather, as Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said, as Rabbi Yonatan said: This is what he said to him: "And now return the man's wife," from any place. And you are saying: "Even a righteous gentile you shall kill, did not my sister say to me, 'He is my brother,' etc." - he is a prophet and learned from you. Aksnai came to the city, regarding matters of eating and drinking they asked him, they did not ask him, "Is this your wife?" "Is this your sister?"

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן שֶׁבֶּן נֹחַ נֶהֱרָג, שֶׁהָיָה לוֹ לִלְמוֹד וְלֹא לָמַד.
human_translation: From here that a descendant of Noah, is executed as he should have learned and he did not learn.
llm_translation: From here it is derived that a son of Noah is to be killed, for he had the opportunity to learn but did not learn.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַסּוֹמֵא אֵינוֹ גּוֹלֶה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: גּוֹלֶה. הַשּׂוֹנֵא אֵינוֹ גּוֹלֶה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: הַשּׂוֹנֵא נֶהֱרָג, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כְּמוּעָד. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ שׂוֹנֵא גּוֹלֶה וְיֵשׁ שׂוֹנֵא שֶׁאֵינוֹ גּוֹלֶה. זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁהוּא יָכוֹל לוֹמַר לְדַעַת הָרַג – אֵינוֹ גּוֹלֶה, וְשֶׁלֹּא לְדַעַת הָרַג – הֲרֵי זֶה גּוֹלֶה.
human_translation: A blind person is not exiled; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Meir says: exiled. The enemy is not exiled, Rabbi Yosei says: an enemy is executed because like forewarned Rabbi Shimon says: There is an enemy who is exiled and there is an enemy who is not exiled. This is the principle: any where could say he killed knowingly, is not exiled, And he killed unknowingly, he is exiled,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The blind person does not roll the dice, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Meir says: He rolls. The hater does not roll. Rabbi Yosei says: The hater is killed, because he is like a murderer. Rabbi Shimon says: There is a hater who rolls and there is a hater who does not roll. This is the principle: anyone who is able to say with certainty "kill" – does not roll, and if he cannot say with certainty "kill" – then he rolls.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״בְּלֹא רְאוֹת״ – פְּרָט לְסוֹמֵא, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: ״בְּלֹא רְאוֹת״ – לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַסּוֹמֵא.
human_translation: the Sages taught: “without seeing” to exclude a blind person; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Meir says: “without seeing” to include a blind person.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Without seeing" - excluding a blind person, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Meir says: "Without seeing" - to include a blind person.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה – דִּכְתִיב: ״וַאֲשֶׁר יָבֹא אֶת רֵעֵהוּ בַיַּעַר״ – אֲפִילּוּ סוֹמֵא. אֲתָא ״בְּלֹא רְאוֹת״, מַעֲטֵיהּ.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Yehuda? as it is written “And as one who goes with his neighbor into the forest” even a blind person. “without seeing” comes excludes
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda? - As it is written: "And when a man shall come upon his neighbor in the forest" - even if blind. He came "without seeing," diminishes it.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר: ״בְּלֹא רְאוֹת״ – לְמַעֵט, ״בִּבְלִי דַּעַת״ – לְמַעֵט, הָוֵי מִיעוּט אַחַר מִיעוּט, וְאֵין מִיעוּט אַחַר מִיעוּט אֶלָּא לְרַבּוֹת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir “Without seeing” to exclude “without knowledge” to exclude This is a restrictive expression following a restrictive expression, and a restrictive expression following a restrictive expression only to amplify
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir: "Without seeing" - to exclude, "without knowledge" - to exclude, there should be exclusion after exclusion, and exclusion after exclusion is only to include.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? ״בִּבְלִי דַּעַת״ – פְּרָט לְמִתְכַּוֵּין הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda “without knowledge” comes to exclude one with intent,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda? "Bibli da'at" - detail to those who intend he came.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר הַשּׂוֹנֵא נֶהֱרָג כּוּ׳. וְהָא לָא אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ! מַתְנִיתִין רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: חָבֵר אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ הַתְרָאָה, לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא נִיתְּנָה הַתְרָאָה אֶלָּא לְהַבְחִין בֵּין שׁוֹגֵג לְמֵזִיד.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: An enemy is executed But did not forewarn him, The mishna is Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: One devoted to the meticulous observance of mitzvot [ ḥaver ] does not require forewarning because forewarning was established only to distinguish between unwitting and intentional
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: "The one who hates will be killed." But is this not found in it? The Mishnah is Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda's, as it was taught: Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: A friend does not need warning, because warning is only given to distinguish between accidental and intentional actions.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ שׂוֹנֵא גּוֹלֶה וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא: כֵּיצַד אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן יֵשׁ שׂוֹנֵא גּוֹלֶה וְיֵשׁ שׂוֹנֵא שֶׁאֵינוֹ גּוֹלֶה? נִפְסַק – גּוֹלֶה, נִשְׁמַט – אֵינוֹ גּוֹלֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: There is an enemy who is exiled It is taught what did Rabbi Shimon say there is an enemy who is exiled and there is an enemy who is not exiled? snapped exiled, was displaced he is not exiled,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: There is one who hates exile, etc. It was taught: How did Rabbi Shimon say there is one who hates exile and there is one who hates not being in exile? If it is decreed - in exile, if it is removed - not in exile.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם אֵינוֹ גּוֹלֶה עַד שֶׁיִּשָּׁמֵט מַחְצָלוֹ מִיָּדוֹ. קַשְׁיָא נִפְסַק אַנִּפְסַק, קַשְׁיָא נִשְׁמַט אַנִּשְׁמַט!
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Rabbi Shimon says: One is never exiled unless his trowel was displaced from his hand? snapped, and snapped, difficult. was displaced, and was displaced, difficult.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "And it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says: One should never roll a loaf of bread until he removes the knife from his hand. If the dough is tough, let it be cut; if the dough is soft, let it be rolled!"

hebrew_text: נִפְסַק אַנִּפְסַק לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּאוֹהֵב, וְהָא בְּשׂוֹנֵא.
human_translation: snapped and snapped not difficult. This to a friend and that to an enemy
llm_translation: It is interrupted, it is not interrupted, there is no difficulty: this one in loving, and this one in hating.

hebrew_text: נִשְׁמַט אַנִּשְׁמַט לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא רַבִּי, וְהָא רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: was displaced and was displaced not difficult, this Rabbi and that the Rabbis,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Nishmat anishmat la kashya: ha Rabbi, ve'ha Rabbanan." Translation: "A soul, a soul, not difficult: this is Rabbi, and this is the Rabbis."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ לְהֵיכָן גּוֹלִין? לְעָרֵי מִקְלָט, לְשָׁלֹשׁ שֶׁבְּעֵבֶר הַיַּרְדֵּן וּלְשָׁלֹשׁ שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ כְּנַעַן. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֵת שְׁלֹשׁ הֶעָרִים תִּתְּנוּ מֵעֵבֶר לַיַּרְדֵּן וְאֵת שְׁלֹשׁ הֶעָרִים תִּתְּנוּ בְּאֶרֶץ כְּנָעַן וְגוֹ׳״. עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִבְחֲרוּ שָׁלֹשׁ שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא הָיוּ שָׁלֹשׁ שֶׁבְּעֵבֶר הַיַּרְדֵּן קוֹלְטוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שֵׁשׁ עָרֵי מִקְלָט תִּהְיֶינָה״ – עַד שֶׁיִּהְיוּ שֶׁשְׁתָּן קוֹלְטוֹת כְּאַחַת.
human_translation: To where are exiled? to cities of refuge, to three that in bank of the Jordan and to three cities that in the land of Canaan, as it is stated: “Three cities shall you give beyond the Jordan and three cities shall you give in the land of Canaan; Until three that in Eretz Yisrael were selected, would not be admitted three that in bank of the Jordan, as it is stated: “Six cities of refuge shall they be” until six of them admit as one.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Where are the cities of refuge established? For the three on the other side of the Jordan River, and for the three in the land of Canaan, as it is stated: "You shall give three cities beyond the Jordan, and you shall give three cities in the land of Canaan, etc." Until the three in the land of Israel were not chosen, the three on the other side of the Jordan did not receive refugees, as it is stated: "There shall be six cities of refuge" - until all six are established at once.

hebrew_text: וּמְכֻוּוֹנוֹת לָהֶן דְּרָכִים מִזּוֹ לָזוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תָּכִין לְךָ הַדֶּרֶךְ וְשִׁלַּשְׁתָּ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And roads were aligned for them from this to that as it is stated: “Prepare for you the road, and divide
llm_translation: And their directions are like this to that, as it is said: "Prepare for yourself the way, divide it..."

hebrew_text: וּמוֹסְרִין לָהֶן שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, שֶׁמָּא יַהַרְגֶנּוּ בַּדֶּרֶךְ, וִידַבְּרוּ אֵלָיו. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אַף הוּא מְדַבֵּר עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְזֶה דְּבַר הָרֹצֵחַ״.
human_translation: And would provide two Torah scholars, perhaps will kill him in transit, and they, will talk to Rabbi Meir says: also speaks [ medabber ] on his own behalf as it is stated: “And this is the matter [ devar ] of the murderer,
llm_translation: And they would appoint for them two Torah scholars, lest he be killed on the way, and they would speak to him. Rabbi Meir says: He himself also speaks on his own behalf, as it is said: "And this is the word of the slayer."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בַּתְּחִלָּה, אֶחָד שׁוֹגֵג וְאֶחָד מֵזִיד מַקְדִּימִין לְעָרֵי מִקְלָט וּבֵית דִּין שׁוֹלְחִין וּמְבִיאִין אוֹתוֹ מִשָּׁם. מִי שֶׁנִּתְחַיֵּיב מִיתָה בְּבֵית דִּין – הֲרָגוּהוּ, וְשֶׁלֹּא נִתְחַיֵּיב מִיתָה – פְּטָרוּהוּ. מִי שֶׁנִּתְחַיֵּיב גָּלוּת – מַחְזִירִין אוֹתוֹ לִמְקוֹמוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהֵשִׁיבוּ אֹתוֹ הָעֵדָה אֶל עִיר מִקְלָטוֹ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: Initially, either unintentionally or intentionally hurry to the cities of refuge, and the court send and bring him from there one who was liable death in court execute him, and one who was not liable death they free him. one who was liable to be exiled, restore him to his place as it is stated: and the congregation shall restore him to his city of refuge,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: Initially, whether unintentional or intentional, they bring one who killed to the cities of refuge, and the court sends and brings him from there. If one is liable to death by the court, they execute him, and if he is not liable to death, they release him. If one is liable to exile, they return him to his place, as it is stated: "And the congregation shall restore him to the city of his refuge, etc."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שָׁלֹשׁ עָרִים הִבְדִּיל מֹשֶׁה בְּעֵבֶר הַיַּרְדֵּן וּכְנֶגְדָּן הִבְדִּיל יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בְּאֶרֶץ כְּנַעַן, וּמְכֻוּוֹנוֹת הָיוּ כְּמִין שְׁתֵּי שׁוּרוֹת שֶׁבַּכֶּרֶם: חֶבְרוֹן בְּהַר יְהוּדָה כְּנֶגֶד בֶּצֶר בַּמִּדְבָּר, שְׁכֶם בְּהַר אֶפְרַיִם כְּנֶגֶד רָמוֹת בַּגִּלְעָד, קֶדֶשׁ בְּהַר נַפְתָּלִי כְּנֶגֶד גּוֹלָן בַּבָּשָׁן. ״וְשִׁלַּשְׁתָּ״ – שֶׁיְּהוּ מְשׁוּלָּשִׁין, שֶׁיְּהֵא מִדָּרוֹם לְחֶבְרוֹן כְּמֵחֶבְרוֹן לִשְׁכֶם, וּמֵחֶבְרוֹן לִשְׁכֶם כְּמִשְּׁכֶם לְקֶדֶשׁ, וּמִשְּׁכֶם לְקֶדֶשׁ כְּמִקֶּדֶשׁ לַצָּפוֹן.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Moses designated three cities in the bank of the Jordan, and corresponding to them, Joshua designated in the land of Canaan. And the cities were aligned like two rows in a vineyard: Hebron in Mount Judea, corresponding to Bezer in the wilderness; Shechem in Mount Ephraim, corresponding to Ramoth in the Gilead; Kadesh in Mount Naphtali, corresponding to Golan in the Bashan. “And you shall divide [ veshilashta ]” that three [ meshulashin ] that from the southern to Hebron, will be like from Hebron to Shechem, and from Hebron to Shechem like from Shechem to Kadesh, and from Shechem to Kadesh like from Kadesh to the northern
llm_translation: The sages taught: Moses designated three cities on the eastern side of the Jordan, and corresponding to them Joshua designated in the land of Canaan, and they were arranged like two rows in a vineyard: Hebron in the hill country of Judah opposite Bezer in the wilderness, Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim opposite Ramoth in Gilead, Kedesh in the hill country of Naphtali opposite Golan in Bashan. "And you shall measure" - that they should be measured in threefold, that the distance from the south to Hebron should be like from Hebron to Shechem, and from Hebron to Shechem like from Shechem to Kedesh, and from Shechem to Kedesh like from Kedesh to the north.

hebrew_text: בְּעֵבֶר הַיַּרְדֵּן תְּלָת, בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל תְּלָת?! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בְּגִלְעָד שְׁכִיחִי רוֹצְחִים,
human_translation: three on bank of the Jordan, three in Eretz Yisrael, Abaye said: In Gilead, murderers are common.
llm_translation: On the other side of the Jordan, three; in the land of Israel, three?! Abaye said: In Gilead, murderers are common.

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״גִּלְעָד קִרְיַת פֹּעֲלֵי אָוֶן עֲקֻבָּה מִדָּם״, מַאי ״עֲקוּבָּה מִדָּם״? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שֶׁהָיוּ עוֹקְבִין לַהֲרוֹג נְפָשׁוֹת.
human_translation: as it is written: “Gilead is a city of those who work iniquity; it is covered [ akuba ] with blood” What Covered [ akuba ] with blood? Rabbi Elazar says: that they would set an ambush [ okevin ] to kill people.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It is written: "Gilead, a city of workers of iniquity, tracked with blood." What is "tracked with blood"? Rabbi Elazar said: They were tracking to kill souls.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא מֵהַאי גִּיסָא וּמֵהַאי גִּיסָא דִּמְרַחֲקִי, וּמַאי שְׁנָא מְצִיעָאֵי דִּמְקָרְבִי?
human_translation: And what is different this side and from that side that are distanced and what is different middle which is close
llm_translation: And what is the difference between this case of a beam and that case of a beam that are far apart, and what is the difference between the supports that are close?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בִּשְׁכֶם נָמֵי שְׁכִיחִי רוֹצְחִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּכְחַכֵּי אִישׁ גְּדוּדִים חֶבֶר כֹּהֲנִים, דֶּרֶךְ יְרַצְּחוּ שֶׁכְמָה וְגוֹ׳״, מַאי ״חֶבֶר כֹּהֲנִים״? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שֶׁהָיוּ מִתְחַבְּרִין לַהֲרוֹג נְפָשׁוֹת, כְּכֹהֲנִים הַלָּלוּ שֶׁמִּתְחַבְּרִין לַחְלוֹק תְּרוּמוֹת בְּבֵית הַגֳּרָנוֹת.
human_translation: Abaye said: Murderers are also common in Shechem, as it is written: “And as troops of robbers wait for a man, so does the band of priests; they murder in the way toward Shechem, What “the band of priests”? Rabbi Elazar says: that would band together to kill people, like those priests who band together to distribute teruma in the granaries.
llm_translation: Abaye said: In Shechem, murderers are common, as it is written: "And like gangs of robbers they consort together, the company of priests murder on the road" (Hosea 6:9). What is meant by "the company of priests"? Rabbi Elazar said: They were united to shed blood, like these priests who were united to distribute the offerings in the Temple granaries.

hebrew_text: וְתוּ לֵיכָּא? וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״וַעֲלֵיהֶם תִּתְּנוּ אַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁתַּיִם עִיר״! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַלָּלוּ, קוֹלְטוֹת בֵּין לְדַעַת בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא לְדַעַת. הַלָּלוּ – לְדַעַת קוֹלְטוֹת, שֶׁלֹּא לְדַעַת אֵינָן קוֹלְטוֹת.
human_translation: And are there no more But isn’t it written: and beyond them you shall give forty-two cities” Abaye said: these admitted whether deliberately, whether inadvertently. those admitted deliberately, inadvertently, not admitted
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And is there a need for this? But it is written: "And upon them you shall levy forty-two cities"! Abaye said: These, whether with intent or without intent. These - with intent they are collected, without intent they are not collected.

hebrew_text: וְחֶבְרוֹן עִיר מִקְלָט הֲוַא[י]? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיִּתְּנוּ לְכָלֵב אֶת חֶבְרוֹן כַּאֲשֶׁר דִּבֶּר מֹשֶׁה״! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: פַּרְווֹדֶהָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֶת שְׂדֵה הָעִיר וְאֶת חֲצֵרֶיהָ נָתְנוּ לְכָלֵב בֶּן יְפֻנֶּה״.
human_translation: And is Hebron a city of refuge? But isn’t it written: “And they gave Hebron to Caleb, as Moses had spoken” Abaye said: Its suburbs [ parvadaha ] as it is written and the field of the city and its courtyards they gave to Caleb, son of Jephunneh”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Is Hebron a city of refuge? And it is written: "And they gave Hebron to Caleb as Moses had spoken"! Abaye said: It is a pastureland, as it is written: "And they gave the field of the city and its villages to Caleb the son of Jephunneh."

hebrew_text: וְקֶדֶשׁ עִיר מִקְלָט הֲוַאי? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְעָרֵי מִבְצָר הַצִּדִּים צֵר וְחַמַּת רַקַּת וְכִנָּרֶת וְגוֹ׳ וְקֶדֶשׁ וְאֶדְרֶעִי וְעֵין חָצוֹר״, וְתַנְיָא: עָרִים הַלָּלוּ אֵין עוֹשִׂין אוֹתָן לֹא טִירִין קְטַנִּים וְלֹא כְּרַכִּים גְּדוֹלִים אֶלָּא עֲיָירוֹת בֵּינוֹנִיּוֹת! אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: תַּרְתֵּי קֶדֶשׁ הֲוַאי. (אָמַר) רַב אָשֵׁי [אָמַר]: כְּגוֹן סְלֵיקוּם וְאַקְרָא דִּסְלֵיקוּם.
human_translation: And is Kadesh a city of refuge? But isn’t it written: “And the fortified cities were Ziddim Zer, and Hammath, Rakkath, and Chinnereth…and Kedesh and Edrei and En Hazor” and it is taught these cities one does not establish them small settlements [ tirin ] or large cities; rather, intermediate towns? Rav Yosef said: There were two Kedesh, Rav Ashi said: similar to Selikum and the fortification [ ve’akra ] of Selikum.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Is Kedesh a city of refuge? And it is written: "And the fortified cities are Ziddim Zer, Hammath Rakath, Chinnereth, etc., and Kedesh and Edrei and En-hazor," and it was taught: These cities are not made neither small fortresses nor large enclosures, but rather intermediate towns! Rav Yosef said: There are two Kedesh. Rav Ashei said: Such as Selikum and Akra of Selikum.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: עָרִים הַלָּלוּ, אֵין עוֹשִׂין אוֹתָן לֹא טִירִין קְטַנִּים וְלֹא כְּרַכִּין גְּדוֹלִים, אֶלָּא עֲיָירוֹת בֵּינוֹנִיּוֹת. וְאֵין מוֹשִׁיבִין אוֹתָן אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם מַיִם, וְאִם אֵין שָׁם מַיִם – מְבִיאִין לָהֶם מַיִם. וְאֵין מוֹשִׁיבִין אוֹתָן אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם שְׁווֹקִים, וְאֵין מוֹשִׁיבִין אוֹתָן אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם אוּכְלוּסִין. נִתְמַעֲטוּ אוּכְלוּסֵיהֶן – מוֹסִיפִין עֲלֵיהֶן. נִתְמַעֲטוּ דִּיּוּרֵיהֶן – מְבִיאִין לָהֶם כֹּהֲנִים לְוִיִּם וְיִשְׂרְאֵלִים.
human_translation: the itself, these cities one does not establish them small settlements or large cities; rather, intermediate- towns. And one establishes them only in a place water and if there is no water there, one brings them water And one establishes them only in a place markets, and one establishes them only in a populated place, population diminishes, one adds to it. residents diminishes, one brings priests, Levites, and Israelites.
llm_translation: Body: These cities, they do not make them neither small fortresses nor large villages, but intermediate towns. And they do not settle them except in a place of water, and if there is no water there - they bring water to them. And they do not settle them except in a place of markets, and they do not settle them except in a place of gatherings. If their gatherings decrease - they add to them. If their dwellings decrease - they bring to them Kohanim, Leviim, and Yisraelim.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין מוֹכְרִין בָּהֶן לֹא כְּלֵי זַיִין, וְלֹא כְּלֵי מְצוּדָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה. וַחֲכָמִים מַתִּירִין. וְשָׁוִין שֶׁאֵין פּוֹרְסִין בְּתוֹכָן מְצוּדוֹת, וְאֵין מַפְשִׁילִין לְתוֹכָן חֲבָלִים, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא רֶגֶל גּוֹאֵל הַדָּם מְצוּיָה שָׁם.
human_translation: And one may not sell weapons or hunting tools the statement of Rabbi Neḥemya. And the Rabbis permit And agree that one may not spread nets in nor may they braid [ mafshilin ] ropes in so that the foot of the blood redeemer will not be found there.
llm_translation: And one does not sell in them neither vessels of olive-press, nor vessels of a fortress, the words of Rabbi Nechemiah. And the sages permit. And they agree that one does not spread out traps within them, and one does not hang ropes within them, so that the foot of the redeemer of blood should not be found there.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מַאי קְרָא? ״וְנָס אֶל אַחַת מִן הֶעָרִים הָאֵל וָחָי״ – עֲבֵיד לֵיהּ מִידֵּי דְּתֶהְוֵי לֵיהּ חִיּוּתָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says: What is the verse “And he shall flee to one of these cities and live” Perform some for that will be living for him.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: What is the verse? "And flee to one of these cities and live." - He should do it immediately, so that he will have life.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: תַּלְמִיד שֶׁגָּלָה – מַגְּלִין רַבּוֹ עִמּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וָחַי״ – עֲבֵיד לֵיהּ מִידֵּי דְּתֶהְוֵי לֵיהּ חִיּוּתָא. אָמַר רַבִּי זְעֵירָא: מִכָּאן שֶׁלֹּא יִשְׁנֶה אָדָם לְתַלְמִיד שֶׁאֵינוֹ הָגוּן.
human_translation: taught: a student who was exiled, his teacher is exiled with him, as it is stated: and live,” Perform some for that will be living for him. Rabbi Zeira says: From here that a person should not teach a student who is not fit,
llm_translation: It was taught: A student who was exiled - they exile his teacher with him, as it is stated: "And he shall live" - do for him immediately so that he may have life. Rabbi Zeira said: From here it is derived that one should not sleep for a student who is not fitting.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָרַב שֶׁגָּלָה – מַגְּלִין יְשִׁיבָתוֹ עִמּוֹ. אִינִי? וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִנַּיִן לְדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה שֶׁהֵן קוֹלְטִין? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶת בֶּצֶר בַּמִּדְבָּר וְגוֹ׳״, [וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ:] ״וְזֹאת הַתּוֹרָה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: a teacher who was exiled, his school is exiled with him. Is that so But doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: From where that matters of Torah provide refuge, as it is stated: “Bezer in the wilderness, and it is written thereafter: “And this is the Torah”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "A Rabbi who is exiled - his yeshiva is exiled with him." Is it not so? But didn't Rabbi Yochanan say: "From where do we derive that the words of Torah are absorbed? As it is stated: 'At the command of the Lord they encamped, and at the command of the Lord they journeyed,' and it is written afterwards: 'And this is the Torah.'"

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא – בְּעִידָּנָא דְּעָסֵיק בַּהּ, הָא – בְּעִידָּנָא דְּלָא עָסֵיק בַּהּ.
human_translation: not difficult, this at the time that one is engaged in its that at the time that he is not engaged in its
llm_translation: Not difficult, this - in the time of engaging in it, this - in the time of not engaging in it.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא, מַאי קוֹלְטִין – מִמַּלְאַךְ הַמָּוֶת. כִּי הָא דְּרַב חִסְדָּא הֲוָה יָתֵיב וְגָרֵיס בְּבֵי רַב, וְלָא הֲוָה קָא יָכֵיל שְׁלִיחָא [דְּמַלְאֲכָא דְּמוֹתָא] לְמִיקְרַב לְגַבֵּיהּ, דְּלָא הֲוָה שָׁתֵיק פּוּמֵּיהּ מִגִּירְסָא, סְלֵיק וִיתֵיב אַאַרְזָא דְּבֵי רַב, פְּקַע אַרְזָא וּשְׁתֵיק, וִיכֵיל לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say: What provide refuge? from the Angel of Death. as this where Rav Ḥisda was sitting and studying in the study hall of Rav and the agent of the Angel of Death was unable to approach him because his mouth was not silent from his study ascended and sat on the cedar of the study hall of Rav. The cedar broke and Rav Ḥisda was silent, and overcame him.
llm_translation: If you wish, I will say: What is the sound of footsteps? - It is the sound of the Angel of Death. For this is like the case of Rav Ḥisda who was sitting and learning in the study hall of Rav, and the Angel of Death could not approach him, as he did not interrupt his learning. He got up and sat in the cedar tree of the study hall, the cedar tree cracked and was silent, and the Angel of Death was able to take him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם בַּר חֲנִילַאי: מִפְּנֵי מָה זָכָה רְאוּבֵן לִימָּנוֹת בְּהַצָּלָה תְּחִלָּה? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא פָּתַח בְּהַצָּלָה תְּחִלָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּשְׁמַע רְאוּבֵן וַיַּצִּלֵהוּ מִיָּדָם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Tanḥum bar Ḥanilai says: For what was Reuben privileged to be enumerated first in the rescue, due to that he began the rescue first, as it is stated: “And Reuben heard and delivered him from their hands”
llm_translation: Rabbi Tanhum bar Hanilai said: For what reason did Reuben merit to count first in the rescue? Because he initiated the rescue first, as it is stated: "And Reuben heard and he saved him from their hands."

hebrew_text: דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי שִׂמְלַאי: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אָז יַבְדִּיל מֹשֶׁה שָׁלֹשׁ עָרִים בְּעֵבֶר הַיַּרְדֵּן מִזְרְחָה [שָׁמֶשׁ]״? אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה: הַזְרַח שֶׁמֶשׁ לָרוֹצְחִים. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי אָמַר לוֹ: הִזְרַחְתָּ שֶׁמֶשׁ לָרוֹצְחִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Simlai taught: What which is written: “Then Moses separated three cities beyond the Jordan, to the east of the sun [ mizreḥa shamesh ]” The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Moses: Shine the sun [ hazraḥ shemesh ] for murderers, Some say said to you have shined the sun for murderers.
llm_translation: The Rabbi Shmueli expounded: What is the meaning of what is written: "Then Moses set apart three cities on the east side of the Jordan, where the sun rises"? The Holy One, blessed be He, said to Moses: The rising of the sun is for the murderers. Some say He said to him: You have caused the sun to rise for the murderers.

hebrew_text: דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי סִימַאי: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אֹהֵב כֶּסֶף לֹא יִשְׂבַּע כֶּסֶף וּמִי אֹהֵב בֶּהָמוֹן לֹא תְבוּאָה״? ״אֹהֵב כֶּסֶף לֹא יִשְׂבַּע כֶּסֶף״ – זֶה מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, שֶׁהָיָה יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין שָׁלֹשׁ עָרִים שֶׁבְּעֵבֶר הַיַּרְדֵּן קוֹלְטוֹת עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִבְחֲרוּ שָׁלֹשׁ בְּאֶרֶץ כְּנַעַן, וְאָמַר: מִצְוָה שֶׁבָּאָה לְיָדִי אֲקַיְּימֶנָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Simai taught: What which is written: “He who loves silver shall not be satisfied with silver; nor he who loves abundance with increase” “He who loves silver shall not be satisfied with silver”; this Moses our teacher, that he knew that would not be admitted to the three cities that were in bank of the Jordan until three that in the land of Canaan were selected, and he said: a mitzva that has come my way, I will fulfill it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Simlai expounded: What is the meaning of what is written: "He who loves silver will not be satisfied with silver, nor he who loves abundance with increase"? "He who loves silver will not be satisfied with silver" – this is our teacher Moses, who knew that there are not three cities on the other side of the Jordan that receive him until three are chosen in the land of Canaan, and he said: If a commandment comes into my hand, I will fulfill it.

hebrew_text: ״וּמִי אֹהֵב בֶּהָמוֹן לֹא תְבוּאָה״ – לְמִי נָאֶה לְלַמֵּד בְּהָמוֹן? מִי שֶׁכׇּל תְּבוּאָה שֶׁלּוֹ. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: ״מַאי דִּכְתִיב מִי יְמַלֵּל גְּבוּרוֹת ה׳ יַשְׁמִיעַ כׇּל תְּהִלָּתוֹ״? לְמִי נָאֶה (לְלַמֵּד) [לְמַלֵּל] גְּבוּרוֹת ה׳ – מִי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְהַשְׁמִיעַ כׇּל תְּהִלָּתוֹ.
human_translation: “Nor he who loves abundance with increase,” For whom is it fitting to teach an abundance One whom all increase belongs to him, And that is which Rabbi Elazar says: What which is written: “Who can express the mighty acts of God, or make all His praise heard” For whom is it fitting to express the mighty acts of God? one who can make all His praise heard.
llm_translation: "And who loves a multitude shall not come to wealth" - To whom is it fitting to teach with a multitude? One whose wealth is all his. And this is what Rabbi Elazar said: "What is meant by 'Who can utter the mighty acts of the Lord, make all His praise heard'?" To whom is it fitting (to teach) to utter the mighty acts of the Lord - one who is able to make all His praise heard.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבָּה בַּר מָרִי, אָמַר: ״מִי אֹהֵב בֶּהָמוֹן לוֹ תְּבוּאָה״ – כׇּל הָאוֹהֵב (לִמְלַמֵּד) בֶּהָמוֹן – לוֹ תְבוּאָה. יְהַבוּ בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן עֵינַיְיהוּ, בְּרָבָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis and some say Rabba bar Mari says, “nor he who loves abundance with increase” whoever loves who teaches in an abundance to him shall be increase, the Sages cast their eyes upon Rava, son of Rabba,
llm_translation: The sages, and it was stated: Rabba bar Mari said: "Whoever loves the multitude, for him there is produce." Anyone who loves (to learn) in a multitude, for him there is produce. The sages gave their eyes to it, in the house of Rabba, the son of Rabba.

hebrew_text: (סִימָן: אָשֵׁי לִלְמוֹד, רָבִינָא לְלַמֵּד).
human_translation: a mnemonic Ashi to study, Ravina to teach.
llm_translation: Section: The Fires of Learning, Ravina to Teach.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: כׇּל הָאוֹהֵב לִלְמוֹד בֶּהָמוֹן – לוֹ תְּבוּאָה. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״חֶרֶב אֶל הַבַּדִּים וְנֹאָלוּ״? חֶרֶב עַל צַוְּארֵי שׂוֹנְאֵיהֶם שֶׁל תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, שֶׁיּוֹשְׁבִין וְעוֹסְקִין בַּתּוֹרָה בַּד בְּבַד, וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁמִּטַּפְּשִׁין – כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְנֹאָלוּ״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״אֲשֶׁר נוֹאַלְנוּ״. וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁחוֹטְאִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַאֲשֶׁר חָטָאנוּ״. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא מֵהָכָא: ״נוֹאֲלוּ שָׂרֵי צֹעַן״.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: Anyone who loves to study in abundance, to him shall be increase, And that is which Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: What which is written: “A sword is upon the baddim , veno’alu ” a sword on the necks of the enemies of Torah scholars, who sit and engage in the Torah individually [ bad bevad ]. Moreover, they grow foolish it is written here: Veno’alu , and it is written there: “For we have been foolish [ no’alnu ]” Moreover, they sin, as it is stated “And for we have sinned.” And if you wish, say from here “The ministers of Zoan have sinned [ no’alu ]”
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Anyone who loves to study in a group - to him shall come produce. And this is what Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: What is the meaning of what is written: "The sword against the heretics, and they shall be dismayed"? The sword is upon the necks of the enemies of the Torah scholars, who sit and engage in Torah study together, and not only that, but they sweat - it is written here: "and they shall be dismayed," and it is written there: "whom we have dismayed." And not only that, but they sin, as it is said: "and we have sinned." And if you wish, say it is derived from here: "the princes of Zoan are become fools."

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: כׇּל הָאוֹהֵב לְלַמֵּד בֶּהָמוֹן – לוֹ תְּבוּאָה. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי: הַרְבֵּה תּוֹרָה לָמַדְתִּי מֵרַבּוֹתַי, וּמֵחֲבֵירַי יוֹתֵר מֵהֶם, וּמִתַּלְמִידַי יוֹתֵר מִכּוּלָּן.
human_translation: Ravina says Anyone who loves to teach in abundance, to him shall be increase, And that is which Rabbi says: Much Torah have I studied from my teachers, and more from my colleagues from them, and more from my students from all of them.
llm_translation: Ravina said: Anyone who loves to learn in a group - to him shall come abundance. And this is what Rabbi said: I have learned much Torah from my teachers, and more from my colleagues, and more from my students than all of them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״עֹמְדוֹת הָיוּ רַגְלֵינוּ בִּשְׁעָרַיִךְ יְרוּשָׁלִָם״? מִי גָּרַם לְרַגְלֵינוּ שֶׁיַּעַמְדוּ בַּמִּלְחָמָה – שַׁעֲרֵי יְרוּשָׁלַםִ, שֶׁהָיוּ עוֹסְקִים בַּתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: What which is written: “Our feet were standing in your gates, Jerusalem” What caused our feet to withstand in war? the gates of Jerusalem, where they were engaged in Torah
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: What is the meaning of the verse, "Our feet were standing within your gates, O Jerusalem"? Who caused our feet to stand firm in battle? The gates of Jerusalem, where they were engaged in Torah study.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״שִׁיר הַמַּעֲלוֹת לְדָוִד שָׂמַחְתִּי בְּאֹמְרִים לִי בֵּית ה׳ נֵלֵךְ״? אָמַר דָּוִד לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, שָׁמַעְתִּי בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: ״מָתַי יָמוּת זָקֵן זֶה, וְיָבֹא שְׁלֹמֹה בְּנוֹ וְיִבְנֶה בֵּית הַבְּחִירָה וְנַעֲלֶה לָרֶגֶל?״, וְשָׂמַחְתִּי. אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: ״כִּי טוֹב יוֹם בַּחֲצֵרֶיךָ מֵאָלֶף״ – טוֹב לִי יוֹם אֶחָד שֶׁאַתָּה עוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה לְפָנַי, מֵאֶלֶף עוֹלוֹת שֶׁעָתִיד שְׁלֹמֹה בִּנְךָ לְהַקְרִיב לְפָנַי עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: What which is written: “A song of the ascents to David: I rejoiced when they said to me, let us go to the house of God” David said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, I heard people who were saying When will this old man die, and Solomon his son will come and build the Temple and we will ascend for the pilgrimage Festival? And I rejoiced. The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to him: “For better is one day in your courtyard than one thousand” I prefer one day which you engage in Torah before Me than one thousand burnt-offerings that your son Solomon is destined to sacrifice before Me upon the altar
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: What is the meaning of what is written: "A song of ascents. Of David. I rejoiced when they said to me, 'Let us go to the house of the Lord'"? David said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the world, I heard people saying, "When will this old man die, so that his son Solomon will come and build the chosen House and we will ascend for the festival?" And I rejoiced. The Holy One, blessed be He, said to him: "For one day in your courtyards is better than a thousand" – one day that you engage in Torah study before Me is better for Me than a thousand burnt offerings that your son Solomon will offer before Me on the altar.

hebrew_text: וּמְכֻוּוֹנוֹת לָהֶם דְּרָכִים וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: And roads were aligned for them It is taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says:
llm_translation: "And their intentions are directed towards them, etc." It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says:

hebrew_text: ״מִקְלָט״ הָיָה כָּתוּב עַל פָּרָשַׁת דְּרָכִים, כְּדֵי שֶׁיַּכִּיר הָרוֹצֵחַ וְיִפְנֶה לְשָׁם. אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: מַאי קְרָא? ״תָּכִין לְךָ הַדֶּרֶךְ״ – עֲשֵׂה [לְךָ] הֲכָנָה לַדֶּרֶךְ.
human_translation: Refuge was written on crossroads so that the murderer would identify and turn to there. Rav Kahana said: What is the verse “Prepare for you the road” Perform for you preparation of the road.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Miklat" was written regarding the portion of "Derechim," so that the murderer would recognize and turn there. Rav Kahana said: What is the verse? "Prepare for yourself the way" - make preparation for the way.

hebrew_text: רַב חָמָא בַּר חֲנִינָא פָּתַח לַהּ פִּתְחָא לְהַאי פָּרַשְׁתָּא מֵהָכָא: ״טוֹב וְיָשָׁר ה׳ עַל כֵּן יוֹרֶה חַטָּאִים בַּדָּרֶךְ״ – אִם לַחַטָּאִים יוֹרֶה, קַל וָחוֹמֶר לַצַּדִּיקִים.
human_translation: Rav Ḥama bar Ḥanina introduced this portion with an introduction from here: “Good and upright is God; therefore He directs sinners along the way” If He directs sinners a fortiori the righteous
llm_translation: Rav Hama son of Hanina began with her the opening of this portion from here: "Good and upright is the Lord; therefore He instructs sinners in the way." - If He instructs sinners, all the more so the righteous.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ פָּתַח לַהּ פִּתְחָא לְהַאי פָּרַשְׁתָּא מֵהָכָא: ״וַאֲשֶׁר לֹא צָדָה וְהָאֱלֹהִים אִנָּה לְיָדוֹ וְגוֹ׳״, ״כַּאֲשֶׁר יֹאמַר מְשַׁל הַקַּדְמֹנִי מֵרְשָׁעִים יֵצֵא רֶשַׁע וְגוֹ׳״,
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish introduced this portion with an introduction from here: “And one who did not lie in wait, but God caused it to come to his hand, “As the ancient parable says: From the wicked comes forth wickedness”
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish opened with her the opening of this portion from here: "And if a man has not lain in wait, but God let it come to hand, then I will appoint you a place to which he may flee." "As it is said, 'From the wicked goes forth wickedness.'"

hebrew_text: בַּמָּה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר – בִּשְׁנֵי בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁהָרְגוּ אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ, אֶחָד הָרַג בְּשׁוֹגֵג וְאֶחָד הָרַג בְּמֵזִיד, לָזֶה אֵין עֵדִים וְלָזֶה אֵין עֵדִים. הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַזְמִינָן לְפוּנְדָּק אֶחָד, זֶה שֶׁהָרַג בְּמֵזִיד יוֹשֵׁב תַּחַת הַסּוּלָּם, וְזֶה שֶׁהָרַג בְּשׁוֹגֵג יוֹרֵד בַּסּוּלָּם, וְנֹפֵל עָלָיו וְהֹרְגוֹ, זֶה שֶׁהָרַג בְּמֵזִיד – נֶהֱרָג, וְזֶה שֶׁהָרַג בְּשׁוֹגֵג – גּוֹלֶה.
human_translation: With regard to what is the verse speaking? with regard to two people who killed a person, one killed unintentionally the other killed intentionally. For this there are no witnesses and for that there are no witnesses The Holy One, Blessed be He, summons them to one inn. This who killed intentionally sits beneath a ladder, and that who killed unintentionally descends the ladder, and falls upon him and kills him. that who killed intentionally is killed, and that who killed unintentionally is exiled,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: In what case does the Scripture speak? In the case of two individuals who killed a person, one killed inadvertently and one killed intentionally, for this one there are no witnesses and for this one there are no witnesses. The Holy One, blessed be He, arranges for them to meet at a certain place, the one who killed intentionally sits under the ladder, and the one who killed inadvertently descends the ladder, and falls upon him and kills him. The one who killed intentionally is put to death, and the one who killed inadvertently goes into exile. English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מִן הַתּוֹרָה וּמִן הַנְּבִיאִים וּמִן הַכְּתוּבִים – בַּדֶּרֶךְ שֶׁאָדָם רוֹצֶה לֵילֵךְ בָּהּ – מוֹלִיכִין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna says Rav Huna says, and some say Rav Huna says Rabbi Elazar says: From the Torah, from the Prophets, and from the Writings along the path a person wishes to proceed, one leads him.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said, Rav Huna said, and some say he said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: From the Torah, the Prophets, and the Writings - in the way a person wants to go, they lead him.

hebrew_text: מִן הַתּוֹרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא תֵלֵךְ עִמָּהֶם״, וּכְתִיב: ״קוּם לֵךְ אִתָּם״. מִן הַנְּבִיאִים – דִּכְתִיב: ״אֲנִי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ מְלַמֶּדְךָ לְהוֹעִיל מַדְרִיכְךָ בְּדֶרֶךְ (זוּ) תֵּלֵךְ״. מִן הַכְּתוּבִים – דִּכְתִיב: ״אִם לַלֵּצִים הוּא יָלִיץ וְלַעֲנָוִים יִתֶּן חֵן״.
human_translation: from the Torah, as it is written “You shall not go with them” it is written: “Arise, go with them” from the Prophets, as it is written: “I am the Lord your God, Who teaches you for your profit, Who leads you on the path that you go” from the Writings, as it is written: “If one seeks the cynics, He will cause him to join the cynics, but to the humble He will give grace”
llm_translation: From the Torah, as it is written: "Do not walk with them," and it is written: "Arise, go with them." From the Prophets – as it is written: "I am the Lord your God, who teaches you to benefit, who leads you in the way you should go." From the Writings – as it is written: "He mocks the mockers but gives grace to the humble."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: רוֹצֵחַ שֶׁגָּלָה לְעִיר מִקְלָט וּמְצָאוֹ גּוֹאֵל הַדָּם וַהֲרָגוֹ – פָּטוּר. קָסָבַר: ״וְלוֹ אֵין מִשְׁפַּט מָוֶת״ – בְּגוֹאֵל הַדָּם הוּא דִּכְתִיב.
human_translation: Rav Huna says: murderer who was exiled to a city of refuge, and the blood redeemer found him and killed him, exempt. Rav Huna holds and for him there is no sentence of death, is written with regard to the blood redeemer,
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: A murderer who fled to a city of refuge and the blood redeemer found him and killed him - he is exempt. He holds: "But if there is no death penalty" - it is the blood redeemer that is written.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״וְלוֹ אֵין מִשְׁפַּט מָוֶת״ – בָּרוֹצֵחַ הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בָּרוֹצֵחַ, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בְּגוֹאֵל הַדָּם? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְהוּא לֹא שֹׂנֵא לוֹ מִתְּמוֹל שִׁלְשׁוֹם״ – הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר בָּרוֹצֵחַ הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: raises an objection “And for him there is no sentence of death”; the verse is speaking with regard to the murderer, Do you say with regard to the murderer, or only with regard to the blood redeemer? When it states “And he did not hate him from before” you must say the verse is speaking with regard to the murderer.
llm_translation: Challenger: "And if there is no death penalty" - the verse is speaking about a murderer. You say it is referring to the murderer, or is it only in relation to the blood redeemer? When it says, "And he did not hate him yesterday or the day before" - you must say the verse is speaking about the murderer.

hebrew_text: הוּא דְּאָמַר כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְלוֹ אֵין מִשְׁפַּט מָוֶת״ – בְּגוֹאֵל הַדָּם הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בְּגוֹאֵל הַדָּם הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בָּרוֹצֵחַ? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״כִּי לֹא שׂוֹנֵא הוּא לוֹ מִתְּמוֹל שִׁלְשׁוֹם״ – הֲרֵי רוֹצֵחַ אָמוּר, הָא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים: ״וְלוֹ אֵין מִשְׁפַּט מָוֶת״? בְּגוֹאֵל הַדָּם הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: states in accordance with that tanna , as it is taught “And for him there is no sentence of death”; the verse is speaking with regard to the blood redeemer. Do you say with regard to the blood redeemer, or only with regard to murderer? When it states: “As he did not hate him from before,” murderer stated, How do I realize “And for him there is no sentence of death”? with regard to the blood redeemer the verse is speaking.
llm_translation: He who said, as this Tanna taught: "And if there is no death penalty" - the redeemer of blood that is written speaks. Do you say the redeemer of blood that is written speaks, or is it only in the case of a murderer? When he says, "For he did not hate him from yesterday or the day before" - behold, a murderer is spoken of. How do I fulfill: "And if there is no death penalty"? The redeemer of blood that is written speaks.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: מוֹסְרִין לוֹ שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, שֶׁמָּא יַהַרְגֶנּוּ בַּדֶּרֶךְ, וִידַבְּרוּ אֵלָיו. מַאי לָאו דְּמַתְרוּ בֵּיהּ, דְּאִי קָטֵיל בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא?
human_translation: We learned And they would provide two Torah scholars, perhaps will kill him in transit, and they will talk to What, is it not that forewarn him that if he kills he liable to be executed?
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: They appoint for him two Torah scholars, lest he be killed on the way, and they speak to him. What is the reason they do not permit him to go alone, for if he kills, he is a murderer?

hebrew_text: לָא, כִּדְתַנְיָא: וִידַבְּרוּ אֵלָיו – דְּבָרִים הָרְאוּיִים לוֹ. אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: אַל תִּנְהַג בּוֹ מִנְהַג שׁוֹפְכֵי דָמִים, בִּשְׁגָגָה בָּא מַעֲשֶׂה לְיָדוֹ. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: הוּא מְדַבֵּר עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְזֶה דְּבַר הָרֹצֵחַ״. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: הַרְבֵּה שְׁלִיחוּת עוֹשָׂה.
human_translation: No, as it is taught And they will speak to him matters appropriate to him. They say to Do not accord him treatment murderers, unintentionally he came to be involved in the incident. Rabbi Meir says: speaks [ medabber ] on his own behalf as it is stated: “And this is the matter [ devar ] of the murderer, said to Many are performed agency.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: No, as it was taught: "And they shall speak to him" - words suitable for him. They say to him: Do not behave towards him like the shedders of blood, for an accident has come into his hands. Rabbi Meir says: He is speaking on his own behalf, as it is stated: "And this is the word of the slayer." They said to him: He performs many missions.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: בִּשְׁגָגָה בָּא מַעֲשֶׂה לְיָדוֹ. פְּשִׁיטָא! דְּאִי בְּמֵזִיד, בַּר גָּלוּת הוּא? אִין.
human_translation: The Master says unintentionally he came to be involved in the incident. obvious? As, if it were intentionally is he liable to be exiled? Yes,
llm_translation: Master said: "An action came into his hand unintentionally." Obviously! For if it were intentional, is he not a son of exile? No.

hebrew_text: וְהָא תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בַּתְּחִלָּה, אֶחָד שׁוֹגֵג וְאֶחָד מֵזִיד מַקְדִּימִין לְעָרֵי מִקְלָט, וּבֵית דִּין שׁוֹלְחִין וּמְבִיאִין אוֹתָם מִשָּׁם.
human_translation: And it is taught Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Initially, either unintentionally or intentionally hurry to the cities of refuge, and the court send and bring him from there
llm_translation: And there is a teaching: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Initially, whether one acted inadvertently or intentionally, they bring the fugitives to the cities of refuge, and the court sends and brings them from there.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁנִּתְחַיֵּיב מִיתָה – הֲרָגוּהוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְשָׁלְחוּ זִקְנֵי עִירוֹ וְלָקְחוּ אֹתוֹ מִשָּׁם וְנָתְנוּ אֹתוֹ בְּיַד גֹּאֵל הַדָּם וָמֵת״. מִי שֶׁלֹּא נִתְחַיֵּיב – פְּטָרוּהוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהִצִּילוּ הָעֵדָה אֶת הָרֹצֵחַ מִיַּד גֹּאֵל הַדָּם״. מִי שֶׁנִּתְחַיֵּיב גָּלוּת – מַחְזִירִין אוֹתוֹ לִמְקוֹמוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהֵשִׁיבוּ אֹתוֹ הָעֵדָה אֶל עִיר מִקְלָטוֹ אֲשֶׁר נָס שָׁמָּה״.
human_translation: one who was liable death would execute him, as it is stated: “And the elders of his city shall send and take him from there and deliver him into the hands of the blood redeemer and he shall die” one who was not liable death they freed him, as it is stated: “And the congregation shall rescue the murderer from the hands of the blood redeemer” one who was liable to be exiled, restore him to his place as it is stated: and the congregation shall restore him to his city of refuge, that he fled there”
llm_translation: One who is liable to death - they shall kill him, as it is stated: "And the elders of his city shall send and take him from there, and deliver him into the hand of the avenger of blood, and he shall die." One who is not liable - they shall exempt him, as it is stated: "And the congregation shall deliver the manslayer out of the hand of the avenger of blood." One who is liable to exile - they shall return him to his place, as it is stated: "And the congregation shall restore him to the city of his refuge, where he had fled."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: מֵעַצְמָן הֵן גּוֹלִין. כִּסְבוּרִין הֵן אֶחָד שׁוֹגֵג וְאֶחָד מֵזִיד – קוֹלְטוֹת, וְהֵן אֵינָן יוֹדְעִין שֶׁבַּשּׁוֹגֵג קוֹלְטוֹת, בְּמֵזִיד אֵינָן קוֹלְטוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi says: would exile on their own, they thought admitted both unintentional and intentional and they do not know that unintentionally are admitted intentionally are not admitted.
llm_translation: Rabbi says: From themselves they roll. They hold: one unintentional and one intentional - they receive, and they do not know that in unintentional they receive, in intentional they do not receive.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: עִיר שֶׁרוּבָּהּ רוֹצְחִים – אֵינָהּ קוֹלֶטֶת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְדִבֶּר בְּאׇזְנֵי זִקְנֵי הָעִיר הַהִיא אֶת דְּבָרָיו״ – וְלֹא שֶׁהוּשְׁווּ דִּבְרֵיהֶן לִדְבָרָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: is not admitted to a city whose majority murderers, as it is stated “And he shall speak his matters in the ears of the elders of that city” but not when their matters are equal to his matters,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: A city whose majority are murderers - it does not accept them, as it is stated: "And he shall speak in the ears of the elders of that city his words" - and not that their words should be equated to His words.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: עִיר שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ זְקֵנִים אֵינָהּ קוֹלֶטֶת, דְּבָעֵינַן ״זִקְנֵי הָעִיר״ וְלֵיכָּא. אִיתְּמַר: עִיר שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ זְקֵנִים, רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי – חַד אוֹמֵר: קוֹלֶטֶת, וְחַד אוֹמֵר: אֵינָהּ קוֹלֶטֶת. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵינָהּ קוֹלֶטֶת – בָּעֵינַן ״זִקְנֵי הָעִיר״, וְלֵיכָּא. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר קוֹלֶטֶת – מִצְוָה בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: is not admitted to a city in which there are no elders, as we require the elders of the city” and there are none. It was stated: A city in which there are no elders Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi. One says: is admitted and one says: is not admitted According to the one who says is not admitted to a city in which there are no elders, we require the elders of the city and there are none. According to the one who says is admitted merely a mitzva
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: A city that does not have elders does not accept new residents, for we require "the elders of the city" and there are none. It was stated: A city that does not have elders, Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi - one says: it accepts new residents, and one says: it does not accept new residents. According to the one who says it does not accept new residents - we require "the elders of the city," and there are none. According to the one who says it accepts new residents - it is a general mitzvah.

hebrew_text: וְעִיר שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ זְקֵנִים – רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי, חַד אָמַר: נַעֲשֶׂה בָּהּ בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה, וְחַד אָמַר: אֵין נַעֲשֶׂה בָּהּ בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין נַעֲשֶׂה בָּהּ בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה – בָּעֵינַן ״זִקְנֵי עִירוֹ״, וְלֵיכָּא. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר נַעֲשֶׂה בָּהּ בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה – מִצְוָה בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: And a city in which there are no elders Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi. One says: can become a wayward and rebellious son in it. And one says: cannot become a wayward and rebellious son in it. According to the one who says cannot become wayward and rebellious son in it, we require the elders of his city and there are none. According to the one who says can become a wayward and rebellious son in it, merely a mitzva
llm_translation: City that no elders - Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi, one said: will be in it a wayward and rebellious son, and one said: will not be in it a wayward and rebellious son. According to the one who said will not be in it a wayward and rebellious son - we require "the elders of his city," and it is not so. According to the one who said will be in it a wayward and rebellious son - it is a general commandment.

hebrew_text: וְעִיר שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ זְקֵנִים, רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי – חַד אָמַר: מְבִיאָה עֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה, וְחַד אָמַר: אֵינָהּ מְבִיאָה עֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵינָהּ מְבִיאָה עֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה – בָּעֵינַן ״זִקְנֵי הָעִיר הַהִיא״, וְלֵיכָּא. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מְבִיאָה עֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה – מִצְוָה בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: And a city in which there are no elders Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi. One says: bring a heifer whose neck is broken. And one says: do not bring a heifer whose neck is broken. According to the one who says do not bring a heifer whose neck is broken, we require the elders of that city and there are no According to the one who says bring a heifer whose neck is broken, merely a mitzva
llm_translation: And a city that does not have elders, Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi - one said: they bring a calf with a broken neck, and one said: they do not bring a calf with a broken neck. According to the one who said they do not bring a calf with a broken neck - we require "the elders of that city," and there are none. According to the one who said they bring a calf with a broken neck - it is a general commandment.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר חֲנִינָא: מִפְּנֵי מָה נֶאֶמְרָה פָּרָשַׁת רוֹצְחִים
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina says: For what was the portion murderers stated
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Ḥama son of Ḥanina: For what reason was the portion of murderers mentioned?

hebrew_text: בְּלָשׁוֹן עַזָּה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְדַבֵּר ה׳ אֶל יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לֵאמֹר דַּבֵּר אֶל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לֵאמֹר תְּנוּ לָכֶם אֶת עָרֵי הַמִּקְלָט אֲשֶׁר דִּבַּרְתִּי אֲלֵיכֶם וְגוֹ׳״? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן שֶׁל הַתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: with harsh language, as it is written: “And the Lord spoke [ vayedabber ] to Joshua saying: Speak [ dabber ] to the children of Israel, saying: Assign you the cities of refuge of which I spoke [ dibbarti ] to you due to that are of the Torah,
llm_translation: In the language of strength, as it is written: "And the Lord spoke to Joshua, saying, speak to the children of Israel, saying, 'Give yourselves the cities of refuge, of which I spoke to you, etc.'"? Because they are from the Torah.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּכׇל דִּיבּוּר לָשׁוֹן קָשָׁה? אִין, כְּדִכְתִיב: ״דִּבֶּר הָאִישׁ אֲדֹנֵי הָאָרֶץ אִתָּנוּ קָשׁוֹת״. וְהָתַנְיָא: ״נִדְבְּרוּ״, אֵין ״נִדְבְּרוּ״ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן נַחַת, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר ״יַדְבֵּר עַמִּים תַּחְתֵּינוּ״! ״דִּבֶּר״ לְחוּד, ״יַדְבֵּר״ לְחוּד.
human_translation: Is that to say that all speaking [ dibbur ] harsh language? Yes, as it is written “The man, the lord of the land, spoke [ dibber ] harshly to us” But isn’t it taught they spoke [ nidberu ] “they spoke” is nothing other than a term of gentleness, and likewise, states: “He subdues [ yadber ] peoples under us” dibber is discrete yadber is discrete.
llm_translation: In the matter of every utterance, is it difficult language? No, as it is written: "The man who is master of the land spoke harshly to us." And it was taught: "They spoke," "They spoke" is only a language of gentleness, as it also says: "He will speak to the nations beneath us!" "Spoke" separately, "will speak" separately.

hebrew_text: (סִימָנֵי רַבָּנַן מְהֵמְנֵי וְסָפְרֵי).
human_translation: a mnemonic Rabbis; mehemni , and scrolls
llm_translation: Signs of the Rabbis are reliable and the books.

hebrew_text: פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבָּנַן, חַד אוֹמֵר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁשִּׁיהָם. וְחַד אוֹמֵר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן שֶׁל תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis disagree with regard to this One says because delayed and one says because are of the Torah,
llm_translation: They disputed it, Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis. One says: because their teeth. And one says: because they are of the Torah.

hebrew_text: ״וַיִּכְתֹּב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אֶת הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה בְּסֵפֶר תּוֹרַת אֱלֹהִים״, פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה – חַד אוֹמֵר: שְׁמֹנָה פְּסוּקִים, וְחַד אוֹמֵר: עָרֵי מִקְלָט.
human_translation: “And Joshua wrote these matters in the scroll of the Torah of God” Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Neḥemya disagree with regard to this One says: eight verses And one says: cities of refuge
llm_translation: "And Joshua wrote these words in the book of the Torah of God." Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Nechemiah dispute it - one says: eight verses, and one says: cities of refuge.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׁמֹנָה פְּסוּקִים, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּסֵפֶר תּוֹרַת אֱלֹהִים״. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר עָרֵי מִקְלָט, מַאי ״בְּסֵפֶר תּוֹרַת אֱלֹהִים״? הָכִי קָאָמַר: ״וַיִּכְתּוֹב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בְּסִפְרוֹ אֶת הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה הַכְּתוּבִים בְּסֵפֶר תּוֹרַת אֱלֹהִים״.
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says that eight verses that is that it is written: in the scroll of the Torah of God,” But according to the one who says cities of refuge what “in the scroll of the Torah of God”? This is saying: And Joshua wrote in his book these matters that are written in the scroll of the Torah of God.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: In truth, according to the one who says eight verses, that is as it is written: "In the book of the Torah of God." But according to the one who says cities of refuge, what is "In the book of the Torah of God"? This is what he is saying: "And Joshua wrote these words in his book of the Torah of God."

hebrew_text: סֵפֶר שֶׁתְּפָרוֹ בְּפִשְׁתָּן, פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר – חַד אוֹמֵר: כָּשֵׁר, וְחַד אוֹמֵר: פָּסוּל.
human_translation: scroll where one sewed its with linen Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Meir disagree with regard to this One says: fit and one says: unfit
llm_translation: Book that-sew in-linen, dispute in-it Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Meir - one says: valid, and one says: invalid.

hebrew_text: לְמַאן דְּאָמַר פָּסוּל, דִּכְתִיב: ״לְמַעַן תִּהְיֶה תּוֹרַת ה׳ בְּפִיךָ״, וְאִיתַּקַּשׁ כׇּל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ לִתְפִילִּין: מָה תְּפִילִּין הֲלָכָה לְמֹשֶׁה מִסִּינַי לְתוֹפְרָן בְּגִידִין – אַף כֹּל לְתׇפְרָן בְּגִידִין. וְאִידַּךְ: כִּי אִיתַּקַּשׁ – לַמּוּתָּר בְּפִיךְ, לְהִלְכוֹתָיו לָא אִיתַּקַּשׁ.
human_translation: According to the one who says unfit as it is written in order that the Torah of God shall be in your mouth” And the entire Torah is juxtaposed to phylacteries: Just as phylacteries, a halakha to Moses from Sinai to sew them with sinews, so too, all to sew them with sinews. And the other When is juxtaposed with regard to that is permitted to your mouth, to its halakhot , it is not juxtaposed
llm_translation: To whom said disqualified, as it is written: "So that the Torah of the Lord may be in your mouth," and all the Torah is connected to tefillin: Just as tefillin, which is a halacha given to Moses from Sinai, is sewn with sinews - so too, everything is sewn with sinews. And the other opinion: when it is connected - for the permissible in your mouth, for his laws it is not connected.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: חֲזֵינַן לְהוּ לִתְפִילִּין דְּבֵי חֲבִיבִי דִּתְפִירִי בְּכִיתָּנָא, וְלֵית הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav said: I saw that the phylacteries of the house of my uncle, were sewn with linen. But the halakha is not in accordance with his
llm_translation: Rav said: We see with regard to the Tefillin of the household of the beloved ones, that they sew them with linen, and the halakha is not in accordance with their practice.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֶחָד מָשׁוּחַ בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה, וְאֶחָד הַמְרוּבֶּה בִּבְגָדִים, וְאֶחָד שֶׁעָבַר מִמְּשִׁיחוּתוֹ – מַחֲזִירִין אֶת הָרוֹצֵחַ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף מְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה מַחֲזִיר אֶת הָרוֹצֵחַ.
human_translation: one anointed with the anointing oil, and one multiple garments, and one who departed from his anointment facilitate return of the murderer Rabbi Yehuda says: Even anointed for war facilitates return of the murderer.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who is anointed with anointing oil, and one who is dressed in garments, and one who has passed from his anointing – they return the murderer. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even one anointed for war returns the murderer.

hebrew_text: לְפִיכָךְ אִימּוֹתֵיהֶן שֶׁל כֹּהֲנִים מְסַפְּקוֹת לָהֶן מִחְיָה וּכְסוּת, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִתְפַּלְּלוּ עַל בְּנֵיהֶם שֶׁיָּמוּתוּ.
human_translation: Therefore, the mothers of Priests provide sustenance and garments so that they would not pray that their sons would die.
llm_translation: Therefore, their mothers, the daughters of priests, provide them with sustenance and clothing, so that their sons will not pray for their death.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְיָשַׁב בָּהּ עַד מוֹת הַכֹּהֵן הַגָּדֹל״, וּכְתִיב: ״כִּי בְעִיר מִקְלָטוֹ יֵשֵׁב עַד מוֹת הַכֹּהֵן הַגָּדֹל״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְאַחֲרֵי מוֹת הַכֹּהֵן הַגָּדֹל״.
human_translation: From where are these matters, Rav Kahana said as the verse states: “And he shall dwell there until the death of the High Priest and it is written: “For in his city of refuge he shall dwell until the death of the High Priest” and it is written: “And after the death of the High Priest
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What are these words teaching us? Rav Kahana said: As the verse states, "And he shall dwell in it until the death of the high priest," and it is also written, "For in his city of refuge shall he dwell until the death of the high priest," and it is written, "And after the death of the high priest."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? כְּתִיב קְרָא אַחֲרִינָא: ״לָשׁוּב לָשֶׁבֶת בָּאָרֶץ עַד מוֹת הַכֹּהֵן״. (וְגוֹ׳) וְאִידַּךְ: מִדְּלָא כְּתִיב: ״הַגָּדוֹל״ – חַד מֵהָנָךְ הוּא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda another verse is written: to return and dwell in the land until the death of the priest” And the other From that High is not written is one of those
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda? It is written in another verse: "to return to dwell in the land until the death of the Kohen." And the other opinion: since it is not written "the elder" - it is one of the others.

hebrew_text: לְפִיכָךְ אִימּוֹתֵיהֶן שֶׁל כֹּהֲנִים כּוּ׳. טַעְמָא דְּלָא מְצַלּוּ, הָא מְצַלּוּ – מָיְיתִי? וְהָכְתִיב: ״כַּצִּפּוֹר לָנוּד כַּדְּרוֹר לָעוּף כֵּן קִלְלַת חִנָּם לֹא תָבֹא״! אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא סָבָא: מִפִּירְקֵיהּ דְּרָבָא שְׁמִיעַ לִי, שֶׁהָיָה לָהֶן לְבַקֵּשׁ רַחֲמִים עַל דּוֹרָן וְלֹא בִּקְּשׁוּ.
human_translation: Therefore, the mothers of Priests The reason is that they do not pray; but if they prayed die? But isn’t it written: “As the wandering sparrow, as the flying swallow, so a curse that is baseless shall come home” A certain elder said to him: I heard in the lecture by Rava as they should have pleaded for mercy for their generation, and they did not plead.
llm_translation: Therefore, the mothers of the priests, etc. The reason they did not pray, if they had prayed - would it have helped? But it is written: "Like a fluttering sparrow, like a darting swallow, so an undeserved curse does not come to rest." That elder said to him: From the interpretations of Rava I heard, that they should have sought mercy for their generation, but they did not seek.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי: כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּתְפַּלְּלוּ עַל בְּנֵיהֶם שֶׁלֹּא יָמוּתוּ. טַעְמָא דִּמְצַלּוּ, הָא לָא מְצַלּוּ – מָיְיתִי? מַאי הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֶעְבַּד? הָכָא אָמְרִינַן: טוֹבִיָּה חֲטָא וְזִיגּוּד מִנַּגַּיד.
human_translation: And some teach so that would pray that their sons will not die. The reason is that they pray, but if they did not pray die? What could have done Here, we say Toviyya sinned and Zigud is flogged.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And there are those who teach: in order that they should pray for their children that they should not die. The reason for the one who prayed and they did not die, if they did not pray - would they have died? What was there for him to do? Here we say: Toviya sinned and Ziggud was appointed.

hebrew_text: הָתָם אָמְרִי: שְׁכֶם נָסֵיב וּמִבְגַּאי גָּזַיר.
human_translation: There, they say Shechem married and Mavgai circumcised
llm_translation: There they said: "Shechem married and from the proud decreed."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא סָבָא: מִפִּירְקֵיהּ דְּרָבָא שְׁמִיעַ לִי, שֶׁהָיָה לָהֶן לְבַקֵּשׁ רַחֲמִים עַל דּוֹרָן וְלֹא בִּקְּשׁוּ. כִּי הָא דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאַכְלֵיהּ אַרְיָא בְּרָחוֹק תְּלָתָא פַּרְסֵי מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, וְלָא אִישְׁתַּעִי אֵלִיָּהוּ בַּהֲדֵיהּ תְּלָתָא יוֹמֵי.
human_translation: A certain elder said to him: I heard in the lecture by Rava as they should have pleaded for mercy for their generation and they did not plead. like this where a certain man was eaten by a lion at a distance of three parasangs from Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, and Elijah did not speak with him three days
llm_translation: He said to him, that elder: "From the explanations of Rava, let me hear, that they should have sought mercy for their generation, but they did not seek. For this man who ate a lion three parasangs away from the house of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, and Elijah did not appear to him for three days."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: קִלְלַת חָכָם – אֲפִילּוּ בְּחִנָּם הִיא בָּאָה. מְנָלַן? מֵאֲחִיתוֹפֶל, שֶׁבְּשָׁעָה שֶׁכָּרָה דָּוִד שִׁיתִין, קְפָא תְּהוֹמָא, בְּעָא לְמִישְׁטְפָא לְעָלְמָא. אֲמַר: מַהוּ לִכְתּוֹב שֵׁם אַחַסְפָּא וּמִישְׁדֵּא בִּתְהוֹמָא דְּלֵיקוּ אַדּוּכְתֵּיהּ? לֵיכָּא דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ מִידֵּי. אֲמַר: כׇּל הַיּוֹדֵעַ דָּבָר זֶה וְאֵינוֹ אוֹמְרוֹ – יֵחָנֵק בִּגְרוֹנוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: the curse of a Sage, even baseless, it comes From where do we from Ahithophel. When David dug the drainpipes the depths rose sought to inundate the world. said: What is to write name on an earthenware shard and throw into the depths, that stand in its place? There was no one who said anything to him. said: Anyone who knows this matter and does not say it shall be strangled.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: A curse of a wise man - even if it comes for no reason, from where do we know? From Ahitophel, that at the time when David cursed him, he wrapped himself in his cloak, went and drowned in the depths, seeking to be swallowed up by the world. He said: What is the use of writing the name of Achaspa and throwing it into the depths of the sea where its fish will eat it? There is no one to say it. He said: Anyone who knows this matter and does not say it - he will choke in his throat.

hebrew_text: נָשָׂא אֲחִיתוֹפֶל קַל וָחוֹמֶר בְּעַצְמוֹ, אָמַר: וּמָה לַעֲשׂוֹת שָׁלוֹם בֵּין אִישׁ לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, אָמְרָה הַתּוֹרָה: שְׁמִי שֶׁנִּכְתַּב בִּקְדוּשָּׁה יִמָּחֶה עַל הַמַּיִם, לְכׇל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁרֵי. כְּתַב שֵׁם אַחַסְפָּא, שְׁדָא אַתְּהוֹמָא, נְחַת וְקָם אַדּוּכְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Ahithophel raised an a fortiori on his own said: And if to make peace between a man and his wife the Torah says: My name that was written in sanctity shall be erased on the water, to establish peace for the whole world in its entirety, is it not all the more so said to It is permitted. wrote name on an earthenware shard cast it into the depths, subsided and stood in its place.
llm_translation: He lifted Ahithophel light and heavy on himself, he said: "And what to do peace between a man and his wife," the Torah said: "My name that is written in holiness will be erased in the water, to the entire world all of it not so? He said to him: permissible. He wrote the name Achaspa, the demon came, bowed and stood his ground.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי כְּתִיב: ״וַאֲחִיתֹפֶל רָאָה כִּי לֹא נֶעֶשְׂתָה עֲצָתוֹ וַיַּחֲבֹשׁ אֶת הַחֲמוֹר וַיָּקׇם וַיֵּלֶךְ אֶל בֵּיתוֹ (וְ)אֶל עִירוֹ וַיְצַו אֶל בֵּיתוֹ וַיֵּחָנַק וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And even so it is written “And Ahithophel saw that his counsel was not taken, and he saddled his donkey and he arose and went to his house, to his town, and he commanded his household and strangled himself”
llm_translation: "And even so it is written: 'And Ahithophel saw that his counsel was not followed, and he saddled his donkey, and arose and went to his house and to his city, and he gave orders to his household, and he hanged himself, etc.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: קִלְלַת חָכָם – אֲפִילּוּ עַל תְּנַאי הִיא בָּאָה. מְנָלַן? מֵעֵלִי, דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ [עֵלִי] לִשְׁמוּאֵל: ״כֹּה יַעֲשֶׂה לְּךָ אֱלֹהִים וְכֹה יוֹסִיף אִם תְּכַחֵד מִמֶּנִּי דָּבָר״. וְאַף עַל גַּב דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּגֶּד לוֹ שְׁמוּאֵל אֶת כׇּל הַדְּבָרִים וְלֹא כִחֵד מִמֶּנּוּ״, [וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי] כְּתִיב: ״וְלֹא הָלְכוּ בָנָיו בִּדְרָכָיו וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: the curse of a Sage, even conditionally, it comes From where do we from Eli as Eli said to Samuel, “Therefore may God do to you, and more also, if you hide any matter from me And even though it is written “And Samuel told him all the matters, and did not hide from him” it is written “And his sons did not follow in his ways”
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: The curse of a wise person—even if it comes conditionally. From where do we derive this? From Eli, for he said to Samuel: "So may God do to you and so may He add, if you hide from me a matter." And even though it is written: "And Samuel told him all the words and did not hide from him," and even so it is written: "But his sons did not walk in his ways, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: נִידּוּי עַל תְּנַאי – צָרִיךְ הֲפָרָה. מְנָלַן? מִיְּהוּדָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״אִם לֹא הֲבִיאֹתִיו אֵלֶיךָ וְגוֹ׳״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״יְחִי רְאוּבֵן וְאַל יָמֹת, וְגוֹ׳ וְזֹאת לִיהוּדָה״?
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Ostracism conditionally requires nullification, From where do we from Judah, as it is written “If I do not bring him to you… And Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: What which is written: “Let Reuben live and not die” “And this for Judah”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: If a condition was stipulated - a cow is required. From where do we derive this? From Yehudah, as it is written: "If I do not bring him to you, etc." And Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: What is the meaning of what is written: "Let Reuven live and not die, etc., and this for Yehudah"?

hebrew_text: כׇּל אוֹתָן אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר, עַצְמוֹתָיו שֶׁל יְהוּדָה הָיוּ מְגוּלְגָּלִין בָּאָרוֹן, עַד שֶׁעָמַד מֹשֶׁה וּבִקֵּשׁ עָלָיו רַחֲמִים. אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, מִי גָּרַם לִרְאוּבֵן שֶׁיּוֹדֶה – יְהוּדָה, ״וְזֹאת לִיהוּדָה... שְׁמַע ה׳ קוֹל יְהוּדָה״.
human_translation: Throughout those forty years that Israel were in the wilderness, Judah’s bones were rattling in the coffin, until Moses stood and entreated mercy upon him. said before Him: Master of the Universe, who caused Reuben to confess Judah. “And this is for Judah…hear God, the voice of Judah”
llm_translation: All those forty years that Israel was in the wilderness, the bones of Judah were rolling in the Ark, until Moses stood and sought mercy for him. He said before Him: Master of the Universe, who caused Reuben to acknowledge - Judah, "And this for Judah... Hear, O Lord, the voice of Judah."

hebrew_text: עָאל אִיבְרֵיהּ לְשָׁפָא, לָא הֲוָה קָא מְעַיְּילִי לֵיהּ לִמְתִיבְתָּא דְּרָקִיעַ, ״וְאֶל עַמּוֹ תְּבִיאֶנּוּ״. לָא הֲוָה קָא יָדַע לְמִישְׁקַל וּמִיטְרַח בִּשְׁמַעְתָּא בַּהֲדֵי רַבָּנַן, ״יָדָיו רַב לוֹ״. לָא הֲוָה יָדַע לְפָרוֹקֵי קוּשְׁיָא, ״וְעֵזֶר מִצָּרָיו תִּהְיֶה״.
human_translation: his limbs entered place [ leshafa ] would not him enter the heavenly academy. “And bring him to his people” did not know to engage in the give-and-take of halakha with the Sages “His hands shall contend for him” did not know to resolve difficulty “And You shall be a help against his adversaries”
llm_translation: He ascended his heel to the threshold, he was not causing to bring to him to the bed of the firmament, "And to his people you shall bring him." He did not know to weigh and to investigate in the matter in the presence of the sages, "His hands are full of reward." He did not know to solve difficulties, "And help will be from his adversaries."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: בְּמִיתַת כּוּלָּן הוּא חוֹזֵר, אוֹ דִלְמָא בְּמִיתַת אֶחָד מֵהֶן?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before with the death of all of returns, or perhaps with the death of one of them
llm_translation: He asked them: In the death of all of them, he returns, or perhaps in the death of one of them?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: נִגְמַר דִּינוֹ בְּלֹא כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל – אֵינוֹ יוֹצֵא מִשָּׁם לְעוֹלָם. וְאִם אִיתָא, לִיהְדַּר בֵּיהּ בִּדְהָנָךְ! בִּדְלֵיכָּא.
human_translation: Come hear verdict was decided when no High Priest, he never leaves And if it is so let him return with of these where there were no
llm_translation: "Come and hear: His judgment is concluded without the High Priest - he does not leave from there forever. And if it is so, let him be honored with it in your presence! With your permission."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִשֶּׁנִּגְמַר דִּינוֹ מֵת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל – הֲרֵי זֶה אֵינוֹ גּוֹלֶה. אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִגְמַר דִּינוֹ מֵת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל וּמִינּוּ אַחֵר תַּחְתָּיו וּלְאַחַר מִכֵּן נִגְמַר דִּינוֹ – חוֹזֵר בְּמִיתָתוֹ שֶׁל שֵׁנִי. נִגְמַר דִּינוֹ בְּלֹא כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, וְהַהוֹרֵג כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, וְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁהָרַג – אֵינוֹ יוֹצֵא מִשָּׁם לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: after verdict was decided the High Priest died, is not exiled, If before his verdict was decided the High Priest died and they appointed another in his place, and thereafter his verdict was decided, he returns with the death of the second the verdict of was decided when no High Priest, and one who killed a High Priest and a High Priest who killed never leaves
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: once the judgment of a High Priest who is to die has been completed - he is not exiled. If before the judgment of a High Priest who is to die is completed, he dies, and another High Priest is appointed in his place, and afterwards his judgment is completed - the death penalty of the second one is nullified. If his judgment is completed without a High Priest, and one kills a High Priest, and a High Priest who killed - he does not leave there forever.

hebrew_text: וְאֵינוֹ יוֹצֵא לֹא לְעֵדוּת מִצְוָה, וְלֹא לְעֵדוּת מָמוֹן, וְלֹא לְעֵדוּת נְפָשׁוֹת. וַאֲפִילּוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל צְרִיכִים לוֹ, וַאֲפִילּוּ שַׂר צָבָא יִשְׂרָאֵל כְּיוֹאָב בֶּן צְרוּיָה אֵינוֹ יוֹצֵא מִשָּׁם לְעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר נָס שָׁמָּה״ – שָׁם תְּהֵא דִּירָתוֹ, שָׁם תְּהֵא מִיתָתוֹ, שָׁם תְּהֵא קְבוּרָתוֹ.
