human_translation: And not leave either for testimony a mitzva, or for testimony monetary matters, or for testimony capital And even the Jewish people require and even the general of the army of Israel like Joab ben Zeruiah, he never leaves as it is stated: that he fled there” There shall be his dwelling, there shall be his death, there shall be his burial.
llm_translation: He does not go out for testimony of commandment, and not for testimony of money, and not for testimony of lives. And even if Israel needs him, and even if a chief of the army of Israel like Joab son of Zeruiah, he does not go out from there forever, as it is stated: "Whither he had fled" - there shall be his dwelling, there shall be his death, there shall be his burial.

hebrew_text: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהָעִיר קוֹלֶטֶת – כָּךְ תְּחוּמָהּ קוֹלֵט. רוֹצֵחַ שֶׁיֵּצֵא חוּץ לַתְּחוּם וּמְצָאוֹ גּוֹאֵל הַדָּם, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: מִצְוָה בְּיַד גּוֹאֵל הַדָּם, וּרְשׁוּת בְּיַד כׇּל אָדָם. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: רְשׁוּת בְּיַד גּוֹאֵל הַדָּם, וְכׇל אָדָם חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: Just as is admitted the city so is he admitted its outskirts, located boundary. where a murderer emerged beyond the boundary and the blood redeemer found him Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: a mitzva for the blood redeemer and optional for every person Rabbi Akiva says: optional for the blood redeemer, and every person is liable for him.
llm_translation: As the city receives, so too its boundary receives. A murderer who goes out beyond the boundary and the blood redeemer finds him, Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: The commandment is in the hand of the blood redeemer, and permission is in the hand of every person. Rabbi Akiva says: Permission is in the hand of the blood redeemer, and all people are obligated concerning it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: קַל וָחוֹמֶר, וּמָה מִי שֶׁגָּלָה כְּבָר – יָצָא עַכְשָׁיו, מִי שֶׁלֹּא גָּלָה – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא יִגְלֶה? וְדִלְמָא: הַאי דִּגְלָה אִיכַּפַּר לֵיהּ, הַאי דְּלָא גְּלָה לָא! מִידֵּי גָּלוּת קָא מְכַפְּרָא? מִיתַת כֹּהֵן הוּא דִּמְכַפְּרָא!
human_translation: What is the reason Abaye says: an a fortiori If one who was already exiled now emerges one who was not exiled, is it not right that he should not be exiled? And perhaps this who was exiled, was atoned that who was not exiled, no, Is exile atones It is the death of the High Priest that atones
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, what is the reason? Abaye said: A fortiori argument. And just as one who has already revealed his sin – he has already fulfilled his obligation to confess, one who has not revealed his sin – is it not the law that he should reveal it? But perhaps: this one who revealed, his atonement is effective, this one who did not reveal – it is not! Is atonement achieved through the revelation itself? It is the death of the High Priest that effects atonement!"

hebrew_text: אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִגְמַר דִּינוֹ וְכוּ׳. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְיָשַׁב בָּהּ עַד מוֹת הַכֹּהֵן הַגָּדֹל אֲשֶׁר מָשַׁח אֹתוֹ בְּשֶׁמֶן הַקֹּדֶשׁ״, וְכִי הוּא מוֹשְׁחוֹ? אֶלָּא: זֶה שֶׁנִּמְשַׁח בְּיָמָיו.
human_translation: If before his verdict was decided From where are these matters Rav Kahana said as the verse states: “And he shall dwell there until the death of the High Priest, whom he anointed with the sacred oil” Now is anoints Rather, that who was anointed during his days,
llm_translation: "If until not finished his judgment, etc." - From where are these words? Rav Kahana said: As the verse says: "And he shall dwell therein until the death of the Kohen Gadol who was anointed with the holy oil." But was he anointed? Rather, this refers to one who was anointed in his days.

hebrew_text: מַאי הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֶעְבַּד? הָיָה לוֹ לְבַקֵּשׁ רַחֲמִים שֶׁיִּגְמוֹר דִּינוֹ לִזְכוּת, וְלֹא בִּיקֵּשׁ.
human_translation: what could he have done He should have pleaded for mercy that verdict of would be decided favorably, and he did not plead.
llm_translation: What was there for him to do? He should have sought mercy that his judgment be concluded in merit, but he did not seek.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: נָקְטִינַן: נִגְמַר דִּינוֹ וָמֵת – מוֹלִיכִין אֶת עַצְמוֹתָיו לְשָׁם, דִּכְתִיב: ״לָשׁוּב לָשֶׁבֶת בָּאָרֶץ עַד מוֹת הַכֹּהֵן״, וְאֵיזֶהוּ יְשִׁיבָה שֶׁהִיא בָּאָרֶץ – הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זוֹ קְבוּרָה. תָּנָא: מֵת קוֹדֶם שֶׁמֵּת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, מוֹלִיכִין עַצְמוֹתָיו עַל קִבְרֵי אֲבוֹתָיו, דִּכְתִיב: ״יָשׁוּב הָרֹצֵחַ אֶל אֶרֶץ אֲחֻזָּתוֹ״, אֵיזֶהוּ יְשִׁיבָה שֶׁהִיא בְּאֶרֶץ אֲחוּזָּתוֹ הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זוֹ קְבוּרָה.
human_translation: Abaye said: We have a tradition whose verdict was decided and he died one transports his bones there, as it is written: “To return and dwell in the land until the death of the priest” And what is dwelling that is in the land? You must say it is burial. taught: died before the High Priest died, one transports his bones to the graves of his ancestors as it is written: “The murderer shall return to his ancestral land” What dwelling that is in his ancestral land? You must say it is burial.
llm_translation: Abaye said: We have learned: "His judgment is complete and he dies" - they bring his bones there, as it is written: "He shall dwell in the city until the death of the Kohen Gadol." And what is the dwelling that is in the city? One must say that it is burial. It was taught: If a person dies before the Kohen Gadol dies, they bring his bones to the graves of his ancestors, as it is written: "The manslayer shall return to his own land." And what is the dwelling that is in his own land? One must say that it is burial.

hebrew_text: נִגְמַר דִּינוֹ, וְנַעֲשָׂה כֹּהֵן בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה אוֹ בֶּן חֲלוּצָה, פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא. חַד אוֹמֵר: מֵתָה כְּהוּנָּה. וְחַד אוֹמֵר: בָּטְלָה כְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: verdict was decided, and Priest was deemed the son of a divorced woman or the son of a ḥalutza , Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa disagree with regard to this One says: The priesthood died, And one says: The priesthood is voided,
llm_translation: The judgment was concluded, and if a Kohen who is the son of a divorcee or the son of a halutzah becomes a Kohen, Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha disagree about it. One says: The priesthood is nullified. And one says: The priesthood remains.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ קָא מִיפַּלְגִי. דִּתְנַן: הָיָה עוֹמֵד וּמַקְרִיב עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, וְנוֹדַע שֶׁהוּא בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה אוֹ בֶּן חֲלוּצָה, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל קׇרְבָּנוֹת שֶׁהִקְרִיב פְּסוּלִין, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ מַכְשִׁיר.
human_translation: Let us say disagree with regard to the dispute Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua, as we learned was standing and sacrificing upon the altar, and it became known that he was the son of a divorced woman or the son of a ḥalutza , Rabbi Eliezer says: All offerings that he sacrificed not valid, and Rabbi Yehoshua deems valid.
llm_translation: Let us say in the dispute of Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua they are disputing. For it was taught: If one was standing and offering a sacrifice upon the altar, and it became known that he is a son of a divorcee or a son of a halutzah, Rabbi Eliezer says: all his sacrifices that he offered are invalid, and Rabbi Yehoshua declares them valid.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר מֵתָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר בָּטְלָה כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר?
human_translation: the one who says died in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua. And the one who says voided in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer,
llm_translation: The one who says "she died" is like Rabbi Yehoshua, and the one who says "she became nullified" is like Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְלִיגִי, כִּי פְּלִיגִי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: מַאן דְּאָמַר מֵתָה – כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר בָּטְלָה – עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הָתָם דִּכְתִיב: ״בָּרֵךְ ה׳ חֵילוֹ וּפֹעַל יָדָיו תִּרְצֶה״ – אֲפִילּוּ חֲלָלִין שֶׁבּוֹ, אֲבָל הָכָא, אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ מוֹדֶה.
human_translation: According to of Rabbi Eliezer, everyone agrees When they disagree, according to of Rabbi Yehoshua: The one who says dead in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua. And the one who says voided Rabbi Yehoshua states only there, as it is written: “Bless, God, his property [ ḥeilo ], and accept the work of his hands” even those disqualified from Temple service due to flawed lineage [ ḥalalin ] But here, even Rabbi Yehoshua concedes
llm_translation: In the school of Rabbi Eliezer, everyone agrees, for they only disagree in the school of Rabbi Yehoshua: Whoever says she died - like Rabbi Yehoshua, and whoever says she became nullified - until here Rabbi Yehoshua did not say. There, where it is written, "Bless the Lord, His strength, and accept the work of His hands" - even with its imperfections, but here, even Rabbi Yehoshua concedes.

hebrew_text: נִגְמַר דִּינוֹ וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: שְׁתֵּי טָעִיּוֹת טָעָה יוֹאָב בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּנׇס יוֹאָב אֶל אֹהֶל ה׳ וַיַּחֲזֵק בְּקַרְנוֹת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״,
human_translation: the verdict of Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Joab made two errors at that moment, as it is written: “And Joab fled to the Tent of God and grasped the horns of the altar”
llm_translation: The judgment was completed, etc. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Joab made two mistakes at that moment, as it is written: "And Joab fled to the tent of the Lord and grasped the horns of the altar."

hebrew_text: טָעָה – שֶׁאֵינוֹ קוֹלֵט אֶלָּא גַּגּוֹ, וְהוּא תָּפַס בְּקַרְנוֹתָיו. טָעָה – שֶׁאֵינוֹ קוֹלֵט אֶלָּא מִזְבַּח בֵּית עוֹלָמִים, וְהוּא תָּפַס מִזְבֵּחַ שֶׁל שִׁילֹה. אַבָּיֵי אוֹמֵר: בְּהָא נָמֵי מִיטְעָא טְעָה: טָעָה – שֶׁאֵינוֹ קוֹלֵט אֶלָּא כֹּהֵן וַעֲבוֹדָה בְּיָדוֹ, וְהוּא זָר הָיָה.
human_translation: He erred that only the top of provides refuge, and he grasped its corners. he erred that only the altar of the eternal House, provides refuge, and he grasped the altar at Shiloh. Abaye said: with regard to this also erred, as provides refuge only a priest and his service is in his hand, and was a non-priest.
llm_translation: Mistake - that he only receives his roof, and it caught with its horns. Mistake - that he only receives the altar of the Temple of the World, and it caught the altar of Shiloh. Abbaye says: In this case also, a mistake is made: Mistake - that he only receives a priest and service in his hand, and he was a non-priest.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: שָׁלֹשׁ טָעִיּוֹת עָתִיד שָׂרוֹ שֶׁל רוֹמִי לִטְעוֹת, דִּכְתִיב: ״מִי זֶה בָּא מֵאֱדוֹם חֲמוּץ בְּגָדִים מִבׇּצְרָה״, טוֹעֶה – שֶׁאֵינָהּ קוֹלֶטֶת אֶלָּא בֶּצֶר, וְהוּא גּוֹלֶה לְבׇצְרָה. טוֹעֶה – שֶׁאֵינָהּ קוֹלֶטֶת אֶלָּא שׁוֹגֵג, וְהוּא מֵזִיד הָיָה. טוֹעֶה – שֶׁאֵינָהּ קוֹלֶטֶת אֶלָּא אָדָם, וְהוּא מַלְאָךְ הוּא.
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: The angel of Rome is destined to make three errors, as it is written: “Who is this who comes from Edom, with crimsoned garments from Bozrah?” err that only Bezer provides refuge and he exiled to Bozrah; err that it provides refuge only an unintentional and he was intentional err that it provides refuge only a person and he is an angel.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Three errors the ministering angel of Rome is destined to make, as it is written: "Who is this coming from Edom, with crimson-stained garments from Bozrah." Error - that she only receives in Bozrah, and he exiles to Bozrah. Error - that she only receives unintentionally, and he was deliberate. Error - that she only receives from a man, and he is an angel.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: עָרֵי מִקְלָט לֹא נִתְּנוּ לִקְבוּרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּמִגְרְשֵׁיהֶם יִהְיוּ לִבְהֶמְתָּם וְלִרְכֻשָׁם וּלְכֹל חַיָּתָם״ – לְחַיִּים נִתְּנוּ וְלֹא לִקְבוּרָה. מֵיתִיבִי, ״שָׁמָּה״ – שָׁם תְּהֵא דִּירָתוֹ, שָׁם תְּהֵא מִיתָתוֹ, שָׁם תְּהֵא קְבוּרָתוֹ! רוֹצֵחַ שָׁאנֵי, דְּגַלִּי בֵּיהּ רַחֲמָנָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: Cities of refuge were not given for burial as it is written “And their open land shall be for their cattle, and for their property, and for all their beasts [ ḥayyatam ]” For life [ leḥayyim ] they are given, but not for burial. raises an objection there” There shall be his dwelling, there shall be his death, there shall be his burial. A murderer is different, as the Merciful One revealed concerning him
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: Cities of refuge were not designated for burial, as it is written: "And their open land shall be for their cattle and for their property and for all their beasts" - they were designated for the living and not for burial. An objection was raised: "There" - there his dwelling shall be, there his death shall be, there his burial shall be! The murderer is different, for the Merciful One revealed it.

hebrew_text: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהָעִיר קוֹלֶטֶת וְכוּ׳. וּרְמִינְהוּ: ״וְיָשַׁב בָּהּ״ – בָּהּ וְלֹא בִּתְחוּמָהּ! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָא קַשְׁיָא, כָּאן – לִקְלוֹט, כָּאן – לָדוּר.
human_translation: Just as is admitted the city And raises a contradiction “And he shall dwell in it” “In it,” but not within its boundary. Abaye said: not difficult. Here, admitted There, to dwell,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Just as the city receives and so on. And they raised a dilemma: "And he shall dwell in it" - in it and not within its boundary! Abaye said: It is not difficult, here - to receive, here - to dwell.

hebrew_text: ״לָדוּר״? תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּאֵין עוֹשִׂין שָׂדֶה מִגְרָשׁ וְלֹא מִגְרָשׁ שָׂדֶה, לֹא מִגְרָשׁ עִיר וְלֹא עִיר מִגְרָשׁ. אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לִמְחִילּוֹת.
human_translation: dwell Let him derive that one may not render the field an open space, nor an open space a field, nor an open space city, nor city an open space. Rav Sheshet said: It is necessary only for tunnels.
llm_translation: "To dwell"? Come and learn that they do not make a field a courtyard, nor a courtyard a field, nor a city a courtyard, nor a courtyard a city. Rav Sheshet said: It was only necessary for loopholes.

hebrew_text: רוֹצֵחַ שֶׁיָּצָא חוּץ לַתְּחוּם וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְרָצַח גֹּאֵל הַדָּם אֶת הָרֹצֵחַ״ – מִצְוָה בְּיַד גּוֹאֵל הַדָּם, אֵין גּוֹאֵל הַדָּם – רְשׁוּת בְּיַד כׇּל אָדָם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: רְשׁוּת בְּיַד גּוֹאֵל הַדָּם, וְכׇל אָדָם חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: where murderer emerged beyond the boundary The Sages taught and the blood redeemer murders the murderer, a mitzva for the blood redeemer there is no blood redeemer it is optional for any person the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili. Rabbi Akiva says: optional for the blood redeemer and any person is liable for him.
llm_translation: MURDERER WHO WENT OUTSIDE THE BOUNDARY, ETC. THE SAGES TAUGHT: "AND THE AVENGER OF BLOOD SHALL KILL THE MURDERER" - IT IS A MITZVAH FOR THE AVENGER OF BLOOD, IF THERE IS NO AVENGER OF BLOOD, IT IS PERMISSIBLE FOR ANY PERSON, THESE ARE THE WORDS OF RABBI YOSEI HAGELILI. RABBI AKIVA SAYS: IT IS PERMISSIBLE FOR THE AVENGER OF BLOOD, AND ALL PEOPLE ARE OBLIGATED CONCERNING HIM.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי? מִי כְּתִיב: ״אִם רֹצֵחַ״? וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: מִי כְּתִיב: ״יִרְצַח״?
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili? Is it written: If murders And Rabbi Akiva Is it written: shall murder,
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei the Galilean? As it is written: "If a murderer"? And Rabbi Akiva: As it is written: "He shall be put to death"?

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה אָמַר רַב: רוֹצֵחַ שֶׁיֵּצֵא חוּץ לַתְּחוּם, וּמְצָאוֹ גּוֹאֵל הַדָּם וַהֲרָגוֹ – נֶהֱרָג עָלָיו. כְּמַאן? לָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, וְלָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא!
human_translation: Mar Zutra bar Toviyya says Rav says: a murderer who emerged beyond the boundary and the blood redeemer found him and killed him, executed for him. In accordance with whose neither in accordance with Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, nor in accordance with Rabbi Akiva,
llm_translation: Master Zutra Bar Tobiah said in the name of Rav: A murderer who goes out beyond the boundary, and the blood redeemer finds him and kills him - he is killed. According to whom? Not like Rabbi Yosei Hagelili, and not like Rabbi Akiva!

hebrew_text: הוּא דְּאָמַר כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: ״עַד עׇמְדוֹ לִפְנֵי הָעֵדָה לַמִּשְׁפָּט״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְרָצַח גֹּאֵל הַדָּם אֶת הָרֹצֵחַ״, יָכוֹל מִיָּד? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עַד עׇמְדוֹ לִפְנֵי הָעֵדָה לַמִּשְׁפָּט״.
human_translation: states in accordance with that tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Eliezer says until he stands before the congregation for judgment” Why the verse state since it is stated: and the blood redeemer murders the murderer” might immediately; the verse states: “Until he stands before the congregation for judgment,”
llm_translation: He who said, as this Tanna, as it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: "Until his standing before the congregation for judgment," what is the teaching to say? Because it is stated: "And the avenger of blood shall slay the murderer," could it be immediate? The teaching is to say: "Until his standing before the congregation for judgment."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, הַאי ״עַד עׇמְדוֹ לִפְנֵי הָעֵדָה לַמִּשְׁפָּט״ מַאי דָּרְשִׁי בֵּיהּ? הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן לְסַנְהֶדְרִין שֶׁרָאוּ אֶחָד שֶׁהָרַג אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ שֶׁאֵין מְמִיתִין אוֹתוֹ עַד שֶׁיַּעֲמוֹד בְּבֵית דִּין אַחֵר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עַד עׇמְדוֹ לִפְנֵי הָעֵדָה לַמִּשְׁפָּט״ – עַד שֶׁיַּעֲמוֹד בְּבֵית דִּין אַחֵר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Akiva, this “Until he stands before the congregation for judgment,” what do derive from it? That is necessary for that which is taught Rabbi Akiva says: From where a Sanhedrin that saw one kill a person that may not execute him until he stands in a different court? as the verse states: “Until he stands before the congregation for judgment,” Until he stands a different court.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Akiva, this "until he stands before the congregation for judgment," what do they expound in it? That one who saw someone kill a person who is not liable to the death penalty, they do not execute him until he stands before another court? The verse teaches: "until he stands before the congregation for judgment" – until he stands before another court.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אִם יָצֹא יֵצֵא הָרֹצֵחַ״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בְּמֵזִיד, בְּשׁוֹגֵג מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִם יָצֹא יֵצֵא״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: The Sages taught “And if the murderer emerges [ yatzo yetze ] I have only intentionally. From where unwittingly? the verse states: “If yatzo yetze ”; in any case
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "If the murderer goes out" - I only have a case of intentional murder, how do I know the law regarding unintentional murder? The verse teaches: "If the murderer goes out" - this applies in any case.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: וְהַהוֹרְגוֹ, בְּמֵזִיד – נֶהֱרָג, בְּשׁוֹגֵג – גּוֹלֶה! לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר: אָמְרִינַן דִּבְּרָה תּוֹרָה כִלְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם, הָא כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר: לָא אָמְרִינַן דִּבְּרָה תּוֹרָה כִלְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught And one who kills him intentionally is executed, unintentionally is exiled? not difficult, this in accordance with the one who says we say: The Torah spoke in the language of people, that is in accordance with the one who says we do not say: The Torah spoke in the language of people,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: And one who kills intentionally - is killed, unintentionally - is exiled! It is not difficult, as according to whom do we say: The Torah spoke in the language of people, as according to whom do we say: We do not say that the Torah spoke in the language of people.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִסְתַּבְּרָא כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר דִּבְּרָה תּוֹרָה כִּלְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם, שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא סוֹפוֹ חָמוּר מִתְּחִלָּתוֹ: מָה תְּחִלָּתוֹ, בְּמֵזִיד – נֶהֱרָג, בְּשׁוֹגֵג – גּוֹלֶה, אַף סוֹפוֹ, בְּמֵזִיד – נֶהֱרָג, בְּשׁוֹגֵג – גּוֹלֶה.
human_translation: Abaye said: It stands to reason in accordance with the one who says: The Torah spoke in the language of people, that ultimate will not be more severe than his initial Just as his initial intentionally he is executed, unintentionally he is exiled, so too, his ultimate intentionally he is killed unwittingly he is exile
llm_translation: Abaye said: It is logical according to the one who said that the Torah spoke in the language of people, that its end should not be more stringent than its beginning. Just as its beginning, if done intentionally – one is liable to be killed, if done unintentionally – one is exiled, so too its end, if done intentionally – one is liable to be killed, if done unintentionally – one is exiled.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי חֲדָא: אָב שֶׁהָרַג – בְּנוֹ נַעֲשָׂה לוֹ גּוֹאֵל הַדָּם. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: אֵין בְּנוֹ נַעֲשָׂה לוֹ גּוֹאֵל הַדָּם. לֵימָא הָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי וְהָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא?
human_translation: is taught one a father who killed his son becomes his blood redeemer And it is taught another His son does not become his blood redeemer. Let us say this Rabbi Yosei HaGelili. And that Rabbi Akiva,
llm_translation: It was taught in one Baraita: If a father was killed, his son becomes the blood redeemer for him. And it was taught in another Baraita: His son does not become the blood redeemer for him. Let us say: This one is Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, and this one is Rabbi Akiva?

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרַאּ? בֵּין לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִצְוָה בֵּין לְמַאן דְּאָמַר רְשׁוּת, מִי שְׁרֵי? וְהָאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא, וְכֵן תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: לַכֹּל אֵין הַבֵּן נַעֲשֶׂה שָׁלִיחַ לְאָבִיו לְהַכּוֹתוֹ וּלְקִלְלָתוֹ, חוּץ מִמֵּסִית, שֶׁהֲרֵי אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה ״לֹא תַחְמֹל וְלֹא תְכַסֶּה עָלָיו״!
human_translation: And you understand Both according to the one who says a mitzva and according to the one who says optional, is it permitted But doesn’t Rabba bar Rav Huna say, and likewise the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: With regard to all a son does not become an agent to flog his father or to curse him, apart from one who incites as the Torah states “You shall neither spare nor conceal him”
llm_translation: And is it possible? Between one who says it is a commandment and one who says it is optional, who is permitted? And Rabba bar Rav Huna said, and so did the Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael: In all cases, a son is not made an agent to his father to strike him or curse him, except for a rebellious son, for the Torah said, "You shall not have pity, and you shall not cover for him"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בִּבְנוֹ, וְהָא בְּבֶן בְּנוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, not difficult, this to his son, and that to the son of his son,
llm_translation: Rather, it is not difficult: this one with his son, and this one with his grandson.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אִילָן שֶׁהוּא עוֹמֵד בְּתוֹךְ הַתְּחוּם, וְנוֹפוֹ נוֹטֶה חוּץ לַתְּחוּם, אוֹ עוֹמֵד חוּץ לַתְּחוּם וְנוֹפוֹ נוֹטֶה בְּתוֹךְ הַתְּחוּם – הַכֹּל הוֹלֵךְ אַחַר הַנּוֹף.
human_translation: a tree that stands within the boundary whose boughs extend outside the boundary, or stands outside the boundary and its boughs extend inside the boundary, all follows the boughs.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A tree that is standing within the boundary, and its branches extend outside the boundary, or it is standing outside the boundary and its branches extend within the boundary - all follow the branches.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּרְמִינְהִי: אִילָן שֶׁהוּא עוֹמֵד בְּתוֹךְ הַפָּנִים וְנוֹטֶה לַחוּץ, אוֹ עוֹמֵד בַּחוּץ וְנוֹטֶה לִפְנִים, מִכְּנֶגֶד הַחוֹמָה וְלִפְנִים – כְּלִפְנִים, מִכְּנֶגֶד הַחוֹמָה וְלַחוּץ – כְּלַחוּץ!
human_translation: And raises a contradiction a tree that stands within and extend outside or stands outside and extend inside above the wall and inward within above the wall and outward outside
llm_translation: Gemara and it was asked: A tree that is standing inside and leaning outside, or standing outside and leaning inside, opposite the wall and inside - it is considered inside; opposite the wall and outside - it is considered outside!

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֵׂר אַעָרֵי מִקְלָט קָא רָמֵית? מַעֲשֵׂר בְּחוֹמָה תְּלָה רַחֲמָנָא, עָרֵי מִקְלָט בְּדִירָה תְּלָה רַחֲמָנָא – בְּנוֹפוֹ מִתְּדַר לֵיהּ, בְּעִיקָּרוֹ לָא מִתְּדַר לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Are you raising a contradiction tithe and cities of refuge? tithe, the Merciful One made dependent on the wall, cities of refuge, the Merciful One made dependent on dwelling. One can dwell in its boughs, one cannot dwell in its trunk.
llm_translation: Tithing cities of refuge you raised? Tithing in a wall, the Merciful One suspended, cities of refuge in a dwelling, the Merciful One suspended - in its elevation it is consecrated, in its essence it is not consecrated.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִי מַעֲשֵׂר אַמַּעֲשֵׂר, דְּתַנְיָא: בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם – הַלֵּךְ אַחַר הַנּוֹף, בְּעָרֵי מִקְלָט – הַלֵּךְ אַחַר הַנּוֹף. אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְהָא רַבָּנַן, דְּתַנְיָא,
human_translation: And raises a contradiction tithe and tithe, as it is taught In Jerusalem, follow the boughs with regard to cities of refuge, follow the boughs Rav Kahana said: not difficult, this Rabbi Yehuda, and that the Rabbis. As it is taught
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And one should tithe from the tithe, as it was taught: In Jerusalem - follow the hill, in the cities of refuge - follow the hill. Rav Kahana said: It is not difficult, this is the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda and this is the opinion of the Rabbis, as it was taught,"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בִּמְעָרָה – הַולֵּךְ אַחַר פִּתְחָהּ, בְּאִילָן – הַולֵּךְ אַחַר נוֹפוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: With regard to a cave, follow its entrance; With regard to a tree, follow its boughs.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: In a cave - one follows its entrance, in a tree - one follows its foliage.

hebrew_text: אֵימוֹר דְּשָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה גַּבֵּי מַעֲשֵׂר לְחוּמְרָא, עִיקָּרוֹ בַּחוּץ וְנוֹפוֹ בִּפְנִים, כִּי הֵיכִי דִּבְנוֹפוֹ לָא מָצֵי פָּרֵיק – בְּעִיקָּרוֹ נָמֵי לָא מָצֵי פָּרֵיק. עִיקָּרוֹ מִבִּפְנִים וְנוֹפוֹ מִבַּחוּץ, כִּי הֵיכִי דִּבְנוֹפוֹ לָא מָצֵי אָכֵיל בְּלֹא פְּדִיָּיה – בְּעִיקָּרוֹ נָמֵי לָא מָצֵי אָכֵיל בְּלֹא פְּדִיָּיה.
human_translation: Say that you heard Rabbi Yehuda with regard to tithe a stringency, trunk is outside and its boughs are inside just as among its boughs, one may not redeem so too at its trunk he may not redeem trunk is inside and its boughs outside, Just as among its boughs, one may not partake without redemption, so too at its trunk he may not partake without redemption,
llm_translation: Statement that you heard from Rabbi Yehuda regarding the stringency of tithing: Its essence is on the outside and its boundary is on the inside, so that if its boundary is not found, it cannot be separated - in its essence also it cannot be separated. Its essence is from the inside and its boundary is from the outside, so that if its boundary is not found, one cannot eat without redemption - in its essence also one cannot eat without redemption.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא גַּבֵּי עָרֵי מִקְלָט, בִּשְׁלָמָא עִיקָּרוֹ בַּחוּץ וְנוֹפוֹ בִּפְנִים, כִּי הֵיכִי דִּבְנוֹפוֹ לָא מָצֵי קָטֵיל לֵיהּ, בְּעִיקָּרוֹ נָמֵי לָא מָצֵי קָטֵיל לֵיהּ. אֶלָּא עִיקָּרוֹ בִּפְנִים וְנוֹפוֹ בַּחוּץ, כִּי הֵיכִי דִּבְנוֹפוֹ מָצֵי קָטֵיל לֵיהּ, בְּעִיקָּרוֹ נָמֵי מָצֵי קָטֵיל לֵיהּ?! הָא גַּוַּאי קָאֵי!
human_translation: But with regard to cities of refuge, Granted, its trunk outside and its boughs inside, just as among its boughs, may not kill so too at its trunk, he may not kill him. But its trunk inside and its boughs outside, just as among its boughs, may kill him, at its trunk, he may also kill him? Isn’t standing inside
llm_translation: Rather, regarding cities of refuge, it is understandable if its essence is outside and its boundary inside, for if its boundary is not found, one cannot kill him. But even if its essence is not found, one cannot kill him. Rather, its essence is inside and its boundary outside, for if its boundary is found, one can kill him. But even if its essence is found, one cannot kill him?! This is a difficulty!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: בְּעִיקָּרוֹ – דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּלָא מָצֵי קָטֵיל. קָאֵי בְּנוֹפוֹ, וְיָכוֹל לְהוֹרְגוֹ בְּחִצִּים וּבִצְרוֹרוֹת – דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּמָצֵי קָטֵיל לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rava said at its trunk, everyone agrees that may not kill is standing among the boughs and is able to kill him with arrows and pebbles, everyone, agrees that may kill him,
llm_translation: Rava said: In its essence - the general populace does not argue that one cannot find a way to kill him. He stands in his place, and is able to kill him with arrows and stones - the general populace does not argue that one cannot find a way to kill him.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי – בְּמֶהֱוֵי עִיקָּרוֹ דַּרְגָּא לְנוֹפוֹ. מָר סָבַר: הָוֵי עִיקָּרוֹ דַּרְגָּא לְנוֹפוֹ. וּמָר סָבַר: לָא הָוֵי עִיקָּרוֹ דַּרְגָּא לְנוֹפוֹ.
human_translation: When they disagree is with regard to its trunk can become a step for its boughs, Sage, holds: Its trunk can become a step for its boughs; And Sage, holds: Its trunk cannot become a step for its boughs.
llm_translation: When they disputed - in what is its main essence, the rank for its shaking. One Master holds: its main essence is the rank for its shaking. And the other Master holds: its main essence is not the rank for its shaking.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: מַאי ״אַחַר הַנּוֹף״ – אַף אַחַר הַנּוֹף.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: What Follow its boughs? follow the boughs as well
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: What is "achar ha'nof" - even achar ha'nof.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָרַג בְּאוֹתָהּ הָעִיר – גּוֹלֶה מִשְּׁכוּנָה לִשְׁכוּנָה, וּבֶן לֵוִי – גּוֹלֶה מֵעִיר לְעִיר.
human_translation: killed in the same city, is exiled from neighborhood to neighborhood And a Levite is exiled from city to city.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "One who killed in that city - he is exiled from neighborhood to neighborhood, and a Levite - he is exiled from city to city."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְשַׂמְתִּי לְךָ מָקוֹם וְגוֹ׳״, ״וְשַׂמְתִּי לְךָ״ – בְּחַיֶּיךָ. ״מָקוֹם מִמְּקוֹמְךָ אֲשֶׁר יָנוּס שָׁמָּה״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מַגְלִין בַּמִּדְבָּר. לְהֵיכָן מַגְלִין – לְמַחֲנֵה לְוִיָּה.
human_translation: the Sages taught and I will appoint for you a place “And I will appoint for you”; during your lifetime. “A place”; from your place, “Where he may flee”; teaches that Israel would exile in the wilderness To where they exile to the Levite camp,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "And I will give you a place, etc.," "And I will give you" – in your lifetime. "A place from your place to which one shall flee there" – this teaches that the Israelites were wandering in the wilderness. Where did they wander to? To the camp of Levi.

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ: בֶּן לֵוִי שֶׁהָרַג – גּוֹלֶה מִפֶּלֶךְ לְפֶלֶךְ, וְאִם גָּלָה לְפִלְכּוֹ – פִּלְכּוֹ קוֹלְטוֹ. אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: מַאי קְרָא? ״כִּי בְעִיר מִקְלָטוֹ יֵשֵׁב״ – עִיר שֶׁקְּלָטַתּוּ כְּבָר.
human_translation: From here said: A Levite who killed is exiled from district to district, And if he was exiled to his district, he is admitted to his district, Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, said: What is the verse “For in his city of refuge he shall dwell” a city which he was already admitted,
llm_translation: From here they said: A son of Levi who killed - he goes into exile from city to city, and if he went into exile to his refuge city - his refuge city accepts him. Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, said: What is the verse? "For in his city of refuge he shall dwell" - a city that already accepted him.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ, רוֹצֵחַ שֶׁגָּלָה לָעִיר מִקְלָטוֹ וְרָצוּ אַנְשֵׁי הָעִיר לְכַבְּדוֹ, יֹאמַר לָהֶם ״רוֹצֵחַ אֲנִי״, אָמְרוּ לוֹ: ״אַף עַל פִּי כֵן״ – יְקַבֵּל מֵהֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְזֶה דְּבַר הָרוֹצֵחַ״.
human_translation: Similarly, a murderer who was exiled to a city of refuge and the people of the city sought to honor him he shall say to them: I am a murderer. say to him: nevertheless, he may accept from them, as it is stated: “And this is the matter [ devar ] of the murderer”
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Similarly, if a murderer who has fled to a city of refuge and the residents of the city wish to honor him, he should say to them, "I am a murderer." If they respond, "Even so," he should accept it from them, as it is stated: "And this is the word of the murderer."

hebrew_text: מַעֲלִים הָיוּ שָׂכָר לַלְוִיִּם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: לֹא הָיוּ מַעֲלִים לָהֶן שָׂכָר. וְחוֹזֵר לִשְׂרָרָה שֶׁהָיָה בָּהּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא הָיָה חוֹזֵר לִשְׂרָרָה שֶׁהָיָה בָּהּ.
human_translation: would pay a fee to the Levites the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Meir says: They would not pay a fee to them, He returns to the office that he occupied the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: He does not return to the office that he occupied.
llm_translation: They used to give wages to the Levites, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Meir says: They did not give them wages. And he returns to the beginning state that was in it, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: He did not return to the beginning state that was in it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: מַחֲלוֹקֶת בְּשֵׁשׁ, דְּמָר סָבַר ״לָכֶם״ – לִקְלִיטָה. וּמָר סָבַר: ״לָכֶם״ – לְכׇל צׇרְכֵיכֶם. אֲבָל בְּאַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁתַּיִם – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל הָיוּ מַעֲלִין לָהֶם שָׂכָר.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: dispute in six as Sage, holds “for you” for providing refuge, And Sage, holds “for you” for all your needs; But with regard to the forty-two everyone agrees would pay rent to
llm_translation: Gemara said Rav Kahana: Dispute in six, for Mar holds "to you" - for acceptance. And Mar holds: "to you" - for all your needs. But in forty-two - the words of all were elevating for them reward.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: הָא וַדַּאי ״לָכֶם״ – לְכׇל צׇרְכֵיכֶם מַשְׁמַע. אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: מַחֲלוֹקֶת בְּאַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁתַּיִם, דְּמָר סָבַר: ״וַעֲלֵיהֶם תִּתְּנוּ״ – כִּי הָנָךְ לִקְלִיטָה. וּמָר סָבַר: ״וַעֲלֵיהֶם תִּתְּנוּ״ – כִּי הָנָךְ, מָה הָנָךְ לְכׇל צׇרְכֵיכֶם, אַף הָנֵי נָמֵי – לְכׇל צׇרְכֵיכֶם, אֲבָל בְּשֵׁשׁ – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל לֹא הָיוּ מַעֲלִים לָהֶן שָׂכָר.
human_translation: Rava said to him: But “for you” certainly indicates for all your needs; Rather, Rava said: dispute with regard to forty-two as Sage, holds and beside them you shall give like these with regard to admitted. And Sage, holds and beside them you shall give like these Just as those for all your needs, so too, these for all your needs. But with regard to six everyone agrees would not pay a fee.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: This and certainly "for you" - for all your needs it implies. Rather Rava said: A dispute in forty-two, for Mar holds: "And upon them you shall give" - for the sake of acceptance. And Mar holds: "And upon them you shall give" - for the sake of, just as the sake of all your needs, so too these others - for all your needs, but in six - everyone agrees they were not elevating reward for them.

hebrew_text: חוֹזֵר לִשְׂרָרָה שֶׁהָיָה בָּהּ כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְשָׁב אֶל מִשְׁפַּחְתּוֹ וְאֶל אֲחֻזַּת אֲבוֹתָיו יָשׁוּב״ – לְמִשְׁפַּחְתּוֹ הוּא שָׁב, וְאֵינוֹ שָׁב לְמַה שֶּׁהֶחְזִיקוּ אֲבוֹתָיו, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אַף הוּא שָׁב לְמַה שֶּׁהֶחְזִיקוּ אֲבוֹתָיו, ״אֶל אֲחֻזַּת אֲבוֹתָיו״ – כַּאֲבוֹתָיו.
human_translation: returns to the office that he occupied the Sages taught “And he returns to his family, and to the estate of his fathers he shall return” He returns to his family, but he does not return to that that his ancestors held; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Meir says: He even returns to that that his ancestors held. “to the estate of his fathers like his fathers.
llm_translation: Returning to the authority that was in it as before. The Rabbis taught: "And he shall return to his family and to the property of his fathers he shall return" - he shall return to his family, but he does not return to what his fathers held, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Meir says: He also returns to what his fathers held, "to the property of his fathers" - like his fathers.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בַּגּוֹלָה, כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״יָשׁוּב״ – לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הָרוֹצֵחַ.
human_translation: And likewise, with regard to an exile when states: he shall return,” to include the murderer.
llm_translation: And so in the exile, when it says "he shall return" - to include the unintentional murderer.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְכֵן בַּגּוֹלָה״? כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״יָשׁוּב הָרֹצֵחַ אֶל אֶרֶץ אֲחֻזָּתוֹ״ – לְאֶרֶץ אֲחוּזָּתוֹ הוּא שָׁב, וְאֵינוֹ שָׁב לְמַה שֶּׁהֶחְזִיקוּ אֲבוֹתָיו, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אַף הוּא שָׁב לְמַה שֶּׁהֶחְזִיקוּ אֲבוֹתָיו – גָּמַר שִׁיבָה שִׁיבָה מֵהָתָם.
human_translation: What And likewise, with regard to an exile? as it is taught “The murderer shall return to his ancestral land” he returns to his ancestral land, but he does not return to that that his ancestors held; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Meir says: He even returns to that that his ancestors held. derives from there, “return” “return”
llm_translation: What is "And so in exile"? As it was taught: "The murderer shall return to his possession" - to his possession he shall return, but he does not return to what his forefathers held, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Meir says: He even returns to what his forefathers held - he completes the return step by step from there.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ אֵלּוּ הֵן הַגּוֹלִין
llm_translation: We will return to you: These are the Golin.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵלּוּ הֵן הַלּוֹקִין : הַבָּא עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ, וְעַל אֲחוֹת אָבִיו, וְעַל אֲחוֹת אִמּוֹ, וְעַל אֲחוֹת אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְעַל אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו, וְעַל אֵשֶׁת אֲחִי אָבִיו, וְעַל הַנִּדָּה. אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, גְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, מַמְזֶרֶת וּנְתִינָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְנָתִין וּלְמַמְזֵר.
human_translation: These are who are flogged One who engages in intercourse with his sister, or with his father’s sister, or with his mother’s sister, or with his wife’s sister, or with his brother’s wife, or with the wife of his father’s brother, or with a menstruating woman. a widow a High Priest, a divorcée or a ḥalutza an ordinary priest, a mamzeret , or a Gibeonite woman a Jew a Jewish woman a Gibeonite or a mamzer ,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: These are the ones who receive lashes: one who has relations with his sister, with his paternal sister, with his maternal sister, with his wife's sister, with his brother's wife, with his paternal grandfather's wife, and with a menstruating woman. A widow of a High Priest, a divorced woman, and a redeemed woman of an ordinary priest, a mamzeret, and a female slave for an Israelite, a daughter of an Israelite for a slave and a mamzer.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָנָה וּגְרוּשָׁה – חַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם שְׁנֵי שֵׁמוֹת. גְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם אַחַת בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: a widow and a divorcée, is liable for her due to two prohibitions, a divorcée and a ḥalutza , is liable only due to one alone.
llm_translation: Widow and divorcee - liable upon her due to two names. Divorcee and halutza - only liable due to one alone.

hebrew_text: הַטָּמֵא שֶׁאָכַל אֶת הַקֹּדֶשׁ, וְהַבָּא אֶל הַמִּקְדָּשׁ טָמֵא, וְאוֹכֵל חֵלֶב, וָדָם וְנוֹתָר וּפִגּוּל וְטָמֵא.
human_translation: A ritually impure person who ate sacrificial and one who entered the Temple ritually impure. And one eats fat or blood; or notar , or piggul , or impure,
llm_translation: The impure one who ate the holy, and the one who comes to the sanctuary impure, and eats fat, and blood, and leftovers, and disqualified, and impure.

hebrew_text: וְהַשּׁוֹחֵט וּמַעֲלֶה בַּחוּץ, וְהָאוֹכֵל חָמֵץ בְּפֶסַח, וְהָאוֹכֵל וְהָעוֹשֶׂה מְלָאכָה בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, וְהַמְפַטֵּם אֶת הַשֶּׁמֶן, וְהַמְפַטֵּם אֶת הַקְּטוֹרֶת, וְהַסָּךְ בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה, וְהָאוֹכֵל נְבֵילוֹת וּטְרֵיפוֹת שְׁקָצִים וּרְמָשִׂים.
human_translation: And one who slaughters or sacrifices outside and one who eats leavened bread on Passover, and one who eats and one who performs labor on Yom Kippur, and one who blends the oil and one who blends the incense and one who applies the anointing oil, and one who eats unslaughtered carcasses, or tereifot , repugnant creatures, or creeping animals,
llm_translation: The one slaughtering and offering outside, and the one eating leaven on Passover, and the one eating and working on Yom Kippur, and the one mixing the oil, and the one mixing the incense, and the one anointing with anointing oil, and the one eating neveilot and treifot, abominations, and creeping things.

hebrew_text: אָכַל טֶבֶל וּמַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁלֹּא נִטְּלָה תְּרוּמָתוֹ, וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי וְהֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁלֹּא נִפְדּוּ.
human_translation: one ate untithed produce, or first-tithe whose teruma was not taken; or second-tithe or sacrificial that was not redeemed;
llm_translation: He ate tevel and the first tithe without separating its heave offering, and the second tithe and consecrated items without redeeming them.

hebrew_text: כַּמָּה יֹאכַל מִן הַטֶּבֶל וִיהֵא חַיָּיב? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כׇּל שֶׁהוּא. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כְּזַיִת. אָמַר לָהֶן רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: אִי אַתֶּם מוֹדִים לִי בְּאוֹכֵל נְמָלָה כׇּל שֶׁהוּא שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא כִּבְרִיָּיתָהּ. אָמַר לָהֶן: אַף חִטָּה אַחַת כִּבְרִיָּיתָהּ.
human_translation: How much does one eat from untithed produce and be liable Rabbi Shimon says: any amount And the Rabbis say: an olive-bulk, Rabbi Shimon said to them: Do you not concede to me with regard to one who eats an ant of any size that he is liable said to due to that it is of its creation, said to them: One wheat also of its creation,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: How much must one eat from tevel to be liable? Rabbi Shimon says: Any amount. And the sages say: Like an olive. Rabbi Shimon said to them: If you agree with me that one who eats a ant, any amount he is liable? They said to him: Because it is its natural state. He said to them: Also one wheat kernel is its natural state.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת קָא תָנֵי, חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין לָא קָתָנֵי. מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי – רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: אֶחָד חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת וְאֶחָד חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין
human_translation: teaches liable to excision from the World-to-Come [ karet ], does not teach liable to court death Whose the mishna? It Rabbi Akiva, as it is taught Both those liable to karet and those liable to court death
llm_translation: The text states: "Regarding those liable for karet, it teaches; those liable for death penalties by the court, it does not teach. From where do we derive this? - It is a teaching of Rabbi Akiva, as it was taught: One, those liable for karet, and one, those liable for death penalties by the court."

hebrew_text: [יֶשְׁנָן] בִּכְלַל מַלְקוֹת אַרְבָּעִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל.
human_translation: are in the category forty lashes the statement of Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: Yesnan in the category of lashes forty, the words of Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת (יֶשְׁנוֹ) [יֶשְׁנָן] בִּכְלַל מַלְקוֹת אַרְבָּעִים, שֶׁאִם עָשׂוּ תְּשׁוּבָה בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל מַעְלָה מוֹחֲלִין לָהֶן. חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין אֵינוֹ בִּכְלַל מַלְקוֹת אַרְבָּעִים, שֶׁאִם עָשׂוּ תְּשׁוּבָה אֵין בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל מַטָּה מוֹחֲלִין לָהֶן.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Those liable to karet are in the category forty lashes, because if they repented, the heavenly court absolves them Those liable to court death are not in the category forty lashes, as if they repented, the earthly court does not absolve them
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Those liable to karet are included in the forty lashes, for if they repent, the heavenly court forgives them. Those liable to death penalties by the earthly court are not included in the forty lashes, for if they repent, the earthly court does not forgive them.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִצְחָק אוֹמֵר: חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת בַּכְּלָל הָיוּ, וְלָמָּה יָצָאת כָּרֵת בַּאֲחוֹתוֹ – לְדוּנוֹ בְּכָרֵת וְלֹא בְּמַלְקוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says Those liable to karet were in generalization: And why karet with regard to one’s sister emerge to sentence one with karet , and not with lashes.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak says: Those liable to receive karet were included, and why did karet come out in his sister - to judge regarding karet and not regarding lashes.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל? דִּכְתִיב: ״אִם לֹא תִשְׁמֹר לַעֲשׂוֹת אֶת כׇּל דִּבְרֵי הַתּוֹרָה הַזֹּאת״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְהִפְלָא ה׳ אֶת מַכֹּתְךָ״. הַפְלָאָה זוֹ אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ מַה הִיא. כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְהִפִּילוֹ הַשֹּׁפֵט וְהִכָּהוּ לְפָנָיו״, הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר הַפְלָאָה זוֹ מַלְקוֹת הִיא, וּכְתִיב: ״אִם לֹא תִשְׁמֹר לַעֲשׂוֹת אֶת כׇּל וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Yishmael, as it is written: “If you will not observe to perform all the matters of this Torah” and it is written “And God will make your plagues wondrous [ vehifla ]” This hafla’a , I do not know what its is. When states “And the judge shall cause him to lie down [ vehippilo ] and to be beaten before him” you must say this hafla’a is lashes, and it is written “if you will not observe to perform all
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yishmael's opinion? As it is written: "If you do not observe to do all the words of this Torah," and it is written: "And Hashem will make your plagues remarkable." This wonder I do not know what it is. When it says: "And the judge shall cause him to lie down and be beaten before him," one should say this wonder is lashes, and it is written: "If you do not observe to do all, etc."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, חַיָּיבֵי עֲשֵׂה נָמֵי! ״אִם לֹא תִשְׁמֹר״ כְּתִיב, וְכִדְרַבִּי אָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעַי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעַי: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״הִשָּׁמֶר״ ״פֶּן״ וְ״אַל״ – אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: If so, those liable positive also “if you will not observe” is written, and in accordance with that Rabbi Avin Rabbi Elai says, as Rabbi Avin says Rabbi Elai says: Wherever it is stated Observe, lest, or do not, it is nothing other than a prohibition.
llm_translation: So it is, those liable for positive commandments as well! "If you do not observe" is written, and as Rabbi Avin said Rabbi Ilai said, as Rabbi Avin said Rabbi Ilai said: Any place where it says "be careful," "lest," and "do not" - it is only a prohibition.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה נָמֵי! ״לַעֲשׂוֹת״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: If so, also a prohibition that does not involve an action, to perform” is written,
llm_translation: So it is not that there is no action at all! "To do" is written.

hebrew_text: לָאו שֶׁנִּיתָּק לַעֲשֵׂה נָמֵי! דֻּומְיָא דְּלָאו דַּחֲסִימָה.
human_translation: also a prohibition that entails of a positive similar to the prohibition of muzzling
llm_translation: Not that it was severed for the purpose of doing something else! It is similar to something that is not a barrier.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָתֵית לְהָכִי, כּוּלְּהוּ נָמֵי דּוּמְיָא דְּלָאו דַּחֲסִימָה.
human_translation: Now that you have arrived at this all also similar to the prohibition of muzzling,
llm_translation: At the time that you come to this, all the Nami of Dumeya that are not of Hasima.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מַאי טַעְמָא? ״כְּדֵי רִשְׁעָתוֹ״ – מִשּׁוּם רִשְׁעָה אַחַת אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ, וְאִי אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁתֵּי רִשְׁעָיוֹת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva, what is the reason according to the measure of his wickedness” For one evildoing you can render him liable, but you cannot render him liable for two evildoings,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva, what is the reason? "For the sake of his wickedness" - because of one wickedness you hold him liable, but if you do not hold him liable because of two wickednesses.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: הָנֵי מִילֵּי מִיתָה וּמָמוֹן, אוֹ מַלְקוֹת וּמָמוֹן, אֲבָל מִיתָה וּמַלְקוֹת – מִיתָה אֲרִיכְתָּא הִיא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael this matter death and monetary restitution, or lashes and monetary restitution. But death and lashes are an extended death,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael said: Those punishments of death and money, or lashes and money, but death and lashes - death is more severe.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אִי הָכִי חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת נָמֵי! מַאי אָמְרַתְּ, שֶׁאִם עָשׂוּ תְּשׁוּבָה? הַשְׁתָּא מִיהַת לָא עָבְדִי!
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Akiva, if that is so, those liable to karet too What did you say that if they repented Now, in any event, they have not done
llm_translation: To Rabbi Akiva, if so, the liable ones for excisions also! What do you say, that if they did repent? Now, presently, we do not act!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: בְּפֵירוּשׁ רִיבְּתָה תּוֹרָה חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת לְמַלְקוּת, דִּגְמַר ״לְעֵינֵי״ מִ״לְּעֵינֶיךָ״. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר מֶמֶל: אִי הָכִי חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין נָמֵי, נִגְמַר ״מֵעֵינֵי״ מִ״לְּעֵינֶיךָ״!
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: The Torah explicitly included with regard to lashes those liable to karet , as is derived before the eyes of [ le’einei ] from: before your eyes [ le’einekha ]” Rabbi Abba bar Memel objects to this: If so, those liable to court death should also be learned from the eyes of [ me’einei ] from: “Before your eyes,”
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: In the explanation of the Torah, those liable for karet are subject to lashes, as it is derived "to your eyes" from "to your eyes." Rabbi Abba bar Memel objected to him: If so, those liable for capital punishment by the court are also subject to lashes, as it is derived "from your eyes" from "to your eyes"!

hebrew_text: דָּנִין ״לְעֵינֵי״ מִ״לְּעֵינֶיךָ״, וְאֵין דָּנִין ״מֵעֵינֵי״ מִ״לְּעֵינֶיךָ״.
human_translation: One derives le’einei from le’einekha , but one does not derive me’einei from le’einekha .
llm_translation: We judge "before" from "before you," and we do not judge "from before" from "before you."

hebrew_text: וּמַאי נָפְקָא מִינֵּיהּ? וְהָא תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״וְשָׁב הַכֹּהֵן״, ״וּבָא הַכֹּהֵן״, זוֹ הִיא שִׁיבָה וְזוֹ הִיא בִּיאָה!
human_translation: And what difference is there But didn’t the school of Rabbi Yishmael teach “And the priest shall return [ veshav ] “And the priest shall come [ uva ] This returning this coming
llm_translation: And what is derived from it? And this is what was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: "And the priest shall return," "and the priest shall come," this is both departure and arrival!

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד: לִגְמַר ״מֵעֵינֵי״ מִ״לְּעֵינֵי״, דְּהָא גָּמַר ״לְעֵינֵי״ מִ״לְּעֵינֶיךָ״!
human_translation: And furthermore, derive me’einei from le’einei as le’einei from le’einekha was derived.
llm_translation: And furthermore: to complete "from your eyes" from "to your eyes," for he completed "to your eyes" from "to your eyes of yours"!

hebrew_text: קַבְּלַהּ מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק: ״כְּדֵי רִשְׁעָתוֹ״ – מִשּׁוּם רִשְׁעָה אַחַת אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ, וְאִי אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁתֵּי רִשְׁעָיוֹת – בְּרִשְׁעָה הַמְּסוּרָה לְבֵית דִּין הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak received from “According to the measure of his wickedness” For one evildoing you can render him liable, but you cannot render him liable for two evildoings, the verse is speaking with regard to an evildoing that is given to the court,
llm_translation: Received from him Rabbi Shmuel son of Rav Yitzchak: "For his wickedness" - because of one wickedness you hold him liable, and if you do not hold him liable because of two wickednesses - in the wickedness that is entrusted to the court, the Scripture speaks.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ לִקְטָלָא – כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּאֵין לוֹקֶה וָמֵת. כִּי פְּלִיגִי – דְּאַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ לְמַלְקוּת, רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל סָבַר: לָאו שֶׁנִּיתַּן לְאַזְהָרַת מִיתַת בֵּית דִין – לוֹקִין עָלָיו. וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: לָאו שֶׁנִּיתַּן לְאַזְהָרַת מִיתַת בֵּית דִּין – אֵין לוֹקִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: Rava says forewarned him to death, everyone, agrees that he is not flogged and executed. When they disagree, where they forewarned him to lashes. Rabbi Yishmael maintains a prohibition that serves as a mandate court capital punishment, one is flogged for its and Rabbi Akiva maintains a prohibition that serves as a mandate court capital punishment, one is not flogged for its
llm_translation: Rava said: If there is a place for him to flee to - everyone agrees that he is not liable to receive the death penalty. When do they disagree? When there is no place for him to flee to, Rabbi Yishmael holds: if it was not given as a warning of the court's death penalty - they administer lashes upon him. And Rabbi Akiva holds: if it was not given as a warning of the court's death penalty - they do not administer lashes upon him.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אִי הָכִי חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת נָמֵי, לָאו שֶׁנִּיתַּן לְאַזְהָרַת כָּרֵת הוּא! אָמַר לֵיהּ רַב מָרְדֳּכַי לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הָכִי אָמַר אֲבִימִי מֵהַגְרוֹנְיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת לָא צְרִיכִי הַתְרָאָה, שֶׁהֲרֵי פֶּסַח וּמִילָה עָנַשׁ אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא הִזְהִיר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva, if so, those liable to karet as well, a prohibition that serves as a mandate karet Rav Mordekhai said to Rav Ashi: This Avimi from Hagronya said in the name of Rava: Those liable to karet do not require forewarning, as Paschal offering and circumcision punished even though it did not warn
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva, if so, those liable for excision also, is it not that it is not given for the warning of excision! Rav Mordechai said to Rav Ashi: So said Avimi from Hagrauni in the name of Rava: Those liable for excision do not require a warning, for Passover and circumcision He punished even though He did not warn.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא אַזְהָרָה לְקׇרְבָּן. דְּהָא פֶּסַח וּמִילָה דְּלֵית בְּהוּ אַזְהָרָה לָא מַיְיתֵי קׇרְבָּן!
human_translation: But perhaps prohibition to an offering as Paschal offering and circumcision, for which there is no prohibition, one does not bring an offering.
llm_translation: "And perhaps a warning for a sacrifice. For indeed, Pesach and circumcision, which do not have a warning associated with them, do not bring a sacrifice!"

hebrew_text: הָתָם לָאו הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיתַּקַּשׁ כׇּל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה: מָה עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה – שֵׁב וְאַל תַּעֲשֶׂה, אַף כֹּל – שֵׁב וְאַל תַּעֲשֶׂה, לְאַפּוֹקֵי הָנֵי דְּקוּם עֲשֵׂה.
human_translation: There, that is not the reason Rather, due to that all the entire Torah are juxtaposed to idol worship. Just as idol worship Sit and do not perform so too, any Sit and do not perform to exclude these which Arise perform
llm_translation: There, not this is the reason, rather because it is connected all the Torah entirely to idolatry: Just as idolatry - sit and do not do, so too everything - sit and do not do, except for those that have a positive commandment.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם
human_translation: Ravina says: Actually,
llm_translation: Ravina said: forever

hebrew_text: כִּדְאָמְרִינַן מֵעִיקָּרָא, שֶׁאִם עָשׂוּ תְּשׁוּבָה – בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל מַעְלָה מוֹחֲלִין לָהֶן. מַאי אָמְרַתְּ? הָא לָא עֲבוּד תְּשׁוּבָה? לָא פְּסִיקָא מִילְּתָא לְכָרֵת.
human_translation: as we stated initially, that if they repented the heavenly court absolves them What do you say that they did not repent? the matter is not clear-cut with regard to karet ,
llm_translation: As we say from the outset, that if they did repent - the Heavenly Court forgives them. What do you say? Isn't repentance effective? It does not cut off the matter for punishment.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִצְחָק אוֹמֵר: חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת בַּכְּלָל הָיוּ, וְלָמָּה יָצָאת כָּרֵת בַּאֲחוֹתוֹ – לְדוּנוֹ בְּכָרֵת וְלֹא בְּמַלְקוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says: Those liable karet were included in And why was karet , with his sister, excluded to sentence him with karet and not to with lashes.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak says: Those liable to receive karet were included, so why did karet come out specifically in his sister - to judge regarding karet and not regarding lashes.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, כָּרֵת בַּאֲחוֹתוֹ לְמָה לִי? לְחַלֵּק, וְכִדְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שֶׁאִם עֲשָׂאָן כּוּלָּם בְּהֶעְלֵם אֶחָד – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, why do I karet with his sister; to divide and is in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan, as Rabbi Yoḥanan says that if one performed all during one lapse of awareness, liable for each and every one,
llm_translation: The sages, why is one liable for cutting off his sister? To divide, as Rabbi Yochanan said: For if one were to do them all in one concealment - he is liable for each and every one.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק, לְחַלֵּק מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִוְּאֶל אִשָּׁה בְּנִדַּת טֻמְאָתָהּ, לְחַיֵּיב עַל כׇּל אִשָּׁה וְאִשָּׁה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak, from where he to divide He derives it from “And to a woman in the separation of her impurity that one is liable for each and every woman.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak, to divide Mena to him? He derived to him from El a woman in her menstruation impurity, to obligate upon every woman and woman.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן נָמֵי, תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מֵהָא! אִין הָכִי נָמֵי. וְאֶלָּא, כָּרֵת דַּאֲחוֹתוֹ לְמָה לִי? לְחַיְּיבוֹ עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ וְעַל אֲחוֹת אָבִיו וְעַל אֲחוֹת אִמּוֹ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis as well, let them derive from this Yes, is indeed so, but rather, Why do I karet with his sister; to render him liable with his sister, and with his father’s sister, and with his mother’s sister,
llm_translation: The sages said, "Let it come out from there!" It is not so. Rather, why do I need the punishment of his sister? To obligate him for his sister, and for the sister of his father, and for the sister of his mother.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא, הֲרֵי גּוּפִין מוּחְלָקִין, הֲרֵי שֵׁמוֹת מוּחְלָקִין! אֶלָּא, לְחַיְּיבוֹ עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ שֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אָבִיו שֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אִמּוֹ. וְהֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ – בְּרַשִּׁיעָא בַּר רַשִּׁיעָא.
human_translation: obvious? separate bodies, names separate Rather, to render him liable with his sister who is his father’s sister who is his mother’s sister. And how can you find these in a wicked person, son of a wicked person.
llm_translation: The matter is clear: if the bodies are distinct, the names are distinct! Rather, he is liable for his paternal sister who is the sister of his father who is the sister of his mother. And how do you know this? From Rashi'a son of Rashi'a.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק, הָא מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר, דְּתַנְיָא: אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: שָׁאַלְתִּי אֶת רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בָּאִיטְלִיז שֶׁל עֵימָאוּם, שֶׁהָלְכוּ לִיקַּח בְּהֵמָה לְמִשְׁתֵּה בְנוֹ שֶׁל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: הַבָּא עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ שֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אָבִיו שֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אִמּוֹ, מַהוּ? [אֵינוֹ] חַיָּיב עַל כּוּלָּן אֶלָּא אַחַת, אוֹ חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת?
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak, from where does he He derives it by means of an a fortiori as it is taught Rabbi Akiva says: I asked Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Yehoshua in the meat market [ itliz ] of Emmaus, where they went to purchase an animal for the feast of Rabban Gamliel’s son. one who engages in intercourse with his sister who is his father’s sister who is his mother’s sister, what is he liable only one for all of or he liable for each and every
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak, did he answer him? He derived it from a fortiori argument, as it was taught: Rabbi Akiva said: I asked Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Yehoshua in the attic of the house of the blemish, who went to buy an animal for the feast of the son of Rabban Gamliel: If one comes upon his sister who is the sister of his father who is the sister of his mother, what is the law? Is he liable for all of them only once, or is he liable for each and every one separately?

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: זוֹ לֹא שָׁמַעְנוּ, אֲבָל שָׁמַעְנוּ: הַבָּא עַל חָמֵשׁ נָשִׁים נִדּוֹת בְּהֶעְלֵם אֶחָד, שֶׁחַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת, וְנִרְאִין דְּבָרִים מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה נִדָּה שֶׁהִיא שֵׁם אֶחָד – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת, כָּאן שֶׁשְּׁלֹשָׁה שֵׁמוֹת – לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?
human_translation: said to him: We did not hear that But we heard One who engages in intercourse with five menstruating women during one lapse of awareness liable for each and every one and it appears matter by means of an a fortiori If a menstruating woman, which name of one liable for each and every one, here, where names three not all the more so
llm_translation: They said to him: We did not hear this, but we heard this: One who comes upon five women who are menstruating simultaneously, he is liable for each and every one, and the matters appear from a fortiori reasoning: And what is the menstruating woman who is one name - he is liable for each and every one, here where there are three names - is it not all the more so?

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ, קַל וָחוֹמֶר פְּרִיכָא הוּא: מָה לְנִדָּה, שֶׁכֵּן גּוּפִין מוּחְלָקִין.
human_translation: And the other it is a refuted a fortiori What about a menstruating woman? in that separate bodies,
llm_translation: And the other opinion, a fortiori argument is it: Just as for a menstruant woman, so too their bodies are divided.

hebrew_text: וּלְאִידַּךְ נָמֵי, הַאי וַדַּאי קַל וָחוֹמֶר פְּרִיכָא הוּא! אֶלָּא, נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מֵ״אֲחֹתוֹ״ דְּסֵיפָא.
human_translation: And to the other too, this is certainly a refuted a fortiori Rather, derives it from “his sister” in the latter clause
llm_translation: And according to your reasoning, this is certainly a logical and a fortiori argument! Rather, it is derived from "his sister" in the later part.

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ, ״אֲחוֹתוֹ״ דְּסֵיפָא לְמָה לִי? לְחַיְּיבוֹ עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ בַּת אָבִיו וּבַת אִמּוֹ, לוֹמַר שֶׁאֵין עוֹנְשִׁין מִן הַדִּין.
human_translation: And the other why do I “his sister” in the latter clause to render him liable for his sister the daughter of his father and the daughter of his mother, to say that one does not administer punishment based on inference.
llm_translation: And the other, "his sister" of the latter clause, why do I need it? To obligate him for his sister, the daughter of his father and the daughter of his mother, to say that they are not punished by the court.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא גָּמַר עוֹנֶשׁ מֵאַזְהָרָה. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, נָפְקָא לֵיהּ
human_translation: And the other If you wish, say he derives punishment from the prohibition; And if you wish, say he derives it
llm_translation: And the other? If you wish, say that the punishment is derived from the warning. And if you wish, say, it is derived from there.

hebrew_text: מֵ״אֲחוֹתוֹ״ דְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: from “his sister” at the beginning
llm_translation: From "his sister" of the beginning.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ: הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ, לְחַלֵּק כָּרֵת לַמְפַטֵּם וְלַסָּךְ.
human_translation: And the other that is necessary to divide for one who blends or for one who applies karet ,
llm_translation: And the other opinion: That one requires it, to divide a karet for the plaintiff and for the defendant.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? סָבַר כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה מוֹצֵא שְׁנֵי לָאוִין וְכָרֵת אֶחָד – חֲלוּקִין הֵן לְקׇרְבָּן.
human_translation: And the other, holds in accordance with Rabbi Elazar Rabbi Hoshaya says, as Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Hoshaya says Any place where you find two prohibitions and one karet they are distinct with regard to an offering;
llm_translation: And the other? He holds like Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Hoshaya, as Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Hoshaya: Any place that you find two negative commandments and one punishment – they are divided for a sacrifice.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: לָא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, וְנָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״וְּאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יִשְׁכַּב אֶת אִשָּׁה דָּוָה״.
human_translation: And if you wish, say he does not hold in accordance with Rabbi Elazar and he derives from “And a man who lies with a woman who is afflicted,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: He did not hold like Rabbi Elazar, and he derived it from "a man who lies with a menstruating woman."

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין הָאִשָּׁה טְמֵאָה עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא מַדְוֶהָ דֶּרֶךְ עֶרְוָתָהּ? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יִשְׁכַּב אֶת אִשָּׁה דָּוָה וְגִלָּה אֶת עֶרְוָתָהּ וְגוֹ׳״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁאֵין הָאִשָּׁה טְמֵאָה עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא מַדְוֶהָ דֶּרֶךְ עֶרְוָתָהּ.
human_translation: And the other That is necessary for him to in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan, as Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: From where that a woman is impure only if the blood of menstruation is discharged through her vagina? as it is stated: “And a man who lies with a woman who is afflicted, and uncovers her nakedness” teaches that a woman is impure only if the blood of menstruation is discharged through her vagina.
llm_translation: And the other one? That one requires it according to Rabbi Yochanan, as Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: From where do we derive that a woman is not impure until her menstrual flow exits in the manner of her nakedness? As it is stated: "And a man who lies with a menstruating woman and uncovers her nakedness, etc." - this teaches that a woman is not impure until her menstrual flow exits in the manner of her nakedness.

hebrew_text: ״וְטָמֵא שֶׁאָכַל אֶת הַקֹּדֶשׁ״. בִּשְׁלָמָא הַבָּא לַמִּקְדָּשׁ טָמֵא – כְּתִיב עוֹנֶשׁ וּכְתִיב אַזְהָרָה: עוֹנֶשׁ – דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶת מִשְׁכַּן ה׳ טִמֵּא וְנִכְרְתָה״. אַזְהָרָה – ״וְלֹא יְטַמְּאוּ אֶת מַחֲנֵיהֶם״. אֶלָּא טָמֵא שֶׁאָכַל אֶת הַקֹּדֶשׁ, בִּשְׁלָמָא ״עוֹנֶשׁ״ כְּתִיב – ״וְהַנֶּפֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר תֹּאכַל בָּשָׂר מִזֶּבַח הַשְּׁלָמִים אֲשֶׁר לַה׳ וְטֻמְאָתוֹ עָלָיו וְנִכְרְתָה״, אֶלָּא אַזְהָרָה מִנַּיִן?
human_translation: And a ritually impure person who ate sacrificial Granted, one who entered the Temple impure a punishment is written and a prohibition is written. a punishment, as it is written: “He has rendered impure the Tabernacle of the Lord, and shall be excised” a prohibition, “And they shall not render their camp impure” But a ritually impure person who ate sacrificial granted, a punishment is written: “And the soul that eats from the flesh of a peace-offering that pertains to the Lord and his impurity is upon him, and shall be excised” But from where is a prohibition
llm_translation: "And one who is impure who ate the holy." Granted, one who comes to the sanctuary impure - it is written punishment and it is written warning: Punishment - as it is written: "The one who defiles the Tabernacle of the Lord shall be cut off." Warning - "And they shall not defile their camps." But one who is impure who ate the holy, granted "punishment" is written - "And the soul who eats the flesh of the peace offering sacrifices to the Lord, while his impurity is upon him, that soul shall be cut off." But where is the warning from?

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אוֹמֵר: ״בְּכׇל קֹדֶשׁ לֹא תִגָּע״.
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: “No consecrated item shall she touch”
llm_translation: Reish Lakish says: "In all holiness, do not touch."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹמֵר, תָּנֵי בַּרְדְּלָא: אָתְיָא ״טוּמְאָתוֹ״ ״טוּמְאָתוֹ״, כְּתִיב הָכָא ״וְטֻמְאָתוֹ עָלָיו וְנִכְרְתָה״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם ״טָמֵא יִהְיֶה עוֹד טֻמְאָתוֹ בּוֹ״, מָה לְהַלָּן עוֹנֶשׁ וְאַזְהָרָה – אַף כָּאן עוֹנֶשׁ וְאַזְהָרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says Bardela teaches: is derived “his impurity” “his impurity” Here, it is written: “And his impurity is upon him, and shall be excised,” and there, it is written: “He shall be impure, his impurity is yet upon him” Just as there, a punishment and a prohibition, so too here, a punishment and a prohibition.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan says, it was taught in the Baraita: It comes "his impurity" "his impurity," it is written here "and his impurity is upon him, and he shall be cut off," and it is written there "he shall remain impure, his impurity is in him." Just as there, there is punishment and warning - so too here, there is punishment and warning.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא, רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לָא אָמַר כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן – גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה לָא גְּמִיר. אֶלָּא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ? אָמַר לָךְ: הַהוּא אַזְהָרָה לִתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: Granted, Reish Lakish did not say in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan, he did not receive verbal analogy But what is the reason that Rabbi Yoḥanan did not say in accordance with Reish Lakish, say to you: That a prohibition for teruma
llm_translation: In truth, Reish Lakish did not say like Rabbi Yochanan - a decree similar to a decree is not established. Rather, Rabbi Yochanan, why did he not say like Reish Lakish? He said to you: that warning is for terumah.

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, אַזְהָרָה לִתְרוּמָה מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מֵ״אִישׁ אִישׁ מִזֶּרַע אַהֲרֹן וְהוּא צָרוּעַ אוֹ זָב״, אֵי זֶהוּ דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא שָׁוֶה בְּזַרְעוֹ שֶׁל אַהֲרֹן – הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זוֹ תְּרוּמָה. וְאִידַּךְ? הַהוּא לַאֲכִילָה, וְהָא לִנְגִיעָה.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish, from where he a prohibition against teruma He derives it from “Any man from the descendants of Aaron who is leprous or a zav What, is an item whose is equal to all descendants of Aaron, You must say it is teruma . And the other This to partaking and that to touching
llm_translation: Reish Lakish, how does he derive the warning regarding Terumah? It is derived from "a man, a man, from the seed of Aaron, and he is a leper or a discharge." If it is something that is equal in its seed to that of Aaron - one would say this is Terumah. And the other? That one is for eating, and this one is for contact.

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, הַאי ״בְּכׇל קֹדֶשׁ לֹא תִגָּע״ לְהָכִי הוּא דַּאֲתָא? הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְטָמֵא שֶׁנָּגַע בַּקֹּדֶשׁ! דְּאִיתְּמַר: טָמֵא שֶׁנָּגַע בַּקֹּדֶשׁ, רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אוֹמֵר: לוֹקֶה, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אוֹמֵר: לוֹקֶה, ״בְּכׇל קֹדֶשׁ לֹא תִגָּע״. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹמֵר: אֵין לוֹקֶה, הָהוּא אַזְהָרָה לִתְרוּמָה הוּא דַּאֲתָא!
human_translation: And Reish Lakish, this “No consecrated item shall she touch” come to this He requires that to a ritually impure person who touched sacrificial As it was stated a ritually impure person who touched sacrificial Reish Lakish says: flogged. Rabbi Yoḥanan says: He is not flogged. Reish Lakish says: flogged, “No consecrated item shall she touch.” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: He is not flogged, is a prohibition for teruma that this comes.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish, this "Do not touch any holy thing" - is this the reason he came? That he requires it for one who is impure who touched the holy thing! For it has been established: One who is impure and touched the holy thing, Reish Lakish says: He is liable, Rabbi Yochanan says: He is not liable. Reish Lakish says: He is liable, "Do not touch any holy thing." Rabbi Yochanan says: He is not liable, that is a warning for terumah that he came for!

hebrew_text: טָמֵא שֶׁנָּגַע בַּקֹּדֶשׁ – מִדְּאַפְּקֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא בִּלְשׁוֹן נְגִיעָה, אַזְהָרָה לָאוֹכֵל – אִתַּקַּושׁ קֹדֶשׁ לְמִקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: a ritually impure person who touched sacrificial from that the Merciful One formulates with the term touching. prohibition for partakes sacrificial is juxtaposed to the Temple
llm_translation: A ritually impure person who touched the holy - because the Merciful One expressed it in the language of touching, a warning to the eater - the holy is connected to the sanctuary.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי, לְהָכִי הוּא דַּאֲתָא? הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְטָמֵא שֶׁאָכַל בְּשַׂר קֹדֶשׁ לִפְנֵי זְרִיקַת דָּמִים! דְּאִיתְּמַר: טָמֵא שֶׁאָכַל בְּשַׂר קֹדֶשׁ לִפְנֵי זְרִיקַת דָּמִים, רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אוֹמֵר: לוֹקֶה, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה.
human_translation: And still, does come for that requires that to a ritually impure person who ate sacrificial meat before the sprinkling of blood As it was stated, a ritually impure person who ate sacrificial meat before the sprinkling of blood. Reish Lakish says: flogged Rabbi Yoḥanan says: He is not flogged.
llm_translation: And is it so that he came for this purpose? That one seeks to render impure who ate holy flesh before the sprinkling of the blood! For it has been established: One who is impure and ate holy flesh before the sprinkling of the blood, Reish Lakish says: He is liable, Rabbi Yochanan says: He is not liable.

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אוֹמֵר: לוֹקֶה, ״בְּכׇל קֹדֶשׁ לֹא תִגָּע״, לָא שְׁנָא לִפְנֵי זְרִיקָה וְלָא שְׁנָא לְאַחַר זְרִיקָה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״טוּמְאָתוֹ״ ״טוּמְאָתוֹ״, וְכִי כְּתִיב ״טוּמְאָתוֹ״ – לְאַחַר זְרִיקָה הוּא דִּכְתִיב! הָהִיא מִ״בְּכׇל קֹדֶשׁ״ נָפְקָא.
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: flogged, “No consecrated item shall she touch,” is no different prior to sprinkling and is no different after sprinkling Rabbi Yoḥanan says: He is not flogged. Rabbi Yoḥanan to his reasoning, as the verse states “his impurity,” “his impurity,” And when “his impurity” is written, after the sprinkling that it is written. that is derived from “No [ bekhol ] consecrated item,”
llm_translation: Reish Lakish says: One is liable to receive lashes for "Do not touch any holy thing," Leviticus 5:2, whether before sprinkling the blood of a sacrifice or after sprinkling. Rabbi Yochanan says: One is not liable. Rabbi Yochanan explains according to his reasoning, for he said: The verse states "his uncleanness" twice Leviticus 5:3, and is it written "his uncleanness" - it is after sprinkling that it is written! That ruling is derived from "any holy thing."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: ״בְּכׇל קֹדֶשׁ לֹא תִגָּע״ – אַזְהָרָה לָאוֹכֵל. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר אַזְהָרָה לָאוֹכֵל, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא אַזְהָרָה לַנּוֹגֵעַ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: בְּכׇל קֹדֶשׁ לֹא תִגָּע וְאֶל הַמִּקְדָּשׁ וְגוֹ׳״ – מַקִּישׁ קֹדֶשׁ לַמִּקְדָּשׁ, מָה מִקְדָּשׁ דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ נְטִילַת נְשָׁמָה – אַף כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ נְטִילַת נְשָׁמָה. וְאִי בִּנְגִיעָה – מִי אִיכָּא נְטִילַת נְשָׁמָה? אֶלָּא בַּאֲכִילָה.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Reish Lakish. “No consecrated item shall she touch”; a prohibition for eats Do you say a prohibition for eats or it is only a prohibition for touches The verse states: “No consecrated item shall she touch, and to the Temple juxtaposes sacrificial to the Temple Just as the Temple a matter that involves the taking of a life, so too, every matter that involves the taking of a life. And if with regard to touching is there the taking of a life? Rather, with regard to eating.
llm_translation: It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Reish Lakish: "Do not touch any holy thing" - a warning to the eater. Do you say it is a warning to the eater, or is it rather a warning to the one who touches? The Talmud teaches: "Do not touch any holy thing, and to the sanctuary, etc." - it compares holiness to the sanctuary. Just as the sanctuary is a matter that involves the taking of a life - so too, anything that involves the taking of a life. And if it is through touching - where is there a taking of a life? Rather, it is through eating.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁקְּדָמוֹ עֲשֵׂה – לוֹקִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: any prohibition that a positive mitzva preceded it, one is flogged for its
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Any negative commandment that is preceded by a positive commandment - one is liable for it.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אָמַרְתָּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: לָא. אָמַר רַבָּה: הָאֱלֹהִים! אַמְרַהּ, וּכְתִיבָא וּתְנֵינָא: כְּתִיבָא – ״וִישַׁלְּחוּ מִן הַמַּחֲנֶה [וְגוֹ׳]״ ״וְלֹא יְטַמְּאוּ אֶת מַחֲנֵיהֶם״. תְּנֵינָא – הַבָּא לַמִּקְדָּשׁ טָמֵא.
human_translation: They said to Did you say said to them: No. Rabba said By God, he said it, and is written and we learn It is written: “And they shall send from the camp and they shall not render their camp impure” we learn One who entered the Temple impure.
llm_translation: They said to him: Did you say it? He said to them: No. Rabba said: Oh God! She said it, and it is written and we learned: It is written - "And they shall send out of the camp etc." "And they shall not defile their camps." We learned - one who comes to the Temple impure.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי טַעְמָא קָא הָדַר בֵּיהּ? מִשּׁוּם דְּקַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ אוֹנֶס. דְּתַנְיָא: אוֹנֵס שֶׁגֵּירַשׁ, אִם יִשְׂרָאֵל הוּא – מַחְזִיר וְאֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה. אִם כֹּהֵן הוּא – לוֹקֶה וְאֵינוֹ מַחְזִיר.
human_translation: Rather, what is the reason he retracted due to that rapes is difficult for him, as it is taught a rapist who divorced if he is a non-priest, he remarries and he is not flogged If he is a priest, flogged and he does not remarry
llm_translation: Rather, what is the reason that he retracts from it? Because it is difficult for him. For it was taught: If one was compelled to divorce his wife and he divorced her, if he is an Israelite, he must return her and he is not flogged. If he is a priest, he is flogged and does not return her.

hebrew_text: אִם יִשְׂרָאֵל הוּא – מַחְזִיר וְאֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה, אַמַּאי? לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁקְּדָמוֹ עֲשֵׂה הוּא, וְלִילְקֵי!
human_translation: If he is a non-priest, he remarries and he is not flogged. Why? It is a prohibition that a positive mitzva preceded it, But let him be flogged,
llm_translation: If he is a Jew - he returns and is not lashed. Why? Do not do, that which is preceded by a positive commandment, and be lashed!

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: לֹא יֵאָמֵר ״לוֹ תִּהְיֶה לְאִשָּׁה״, בְּאוֹנֵס, וְלִיגְמַר מִמּוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע: וּמָה מוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע שֶׁלֹּא עָשָׂה מַעֲשֶׂה – אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא ״וְלוֹ תִהְיֶה לְאִשָּׁה״, אוֹנֵס לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?
human_translation: Ulla says Let not state: “And she shall be his wife,” in a rapist, and let us derive from one who defames If a defamer, who did not perform an action the Merciful One states: “And she shall be his wife” a rapist, is it not all the more so
llm_translation: Ula said: It should not be said, "If she was not betrothed to a man," in the case of rape, and to conclude from this a bad name: And what is a bad name that he did not commit the act - the Merciful One said, "If she was not betrothed to a man," in the case of rape, how much more so in the case of rape?

hebrew_text: לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר? אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְפָנָיו תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְאַחֲרָיו, שֶׁאִם גֵּירַשׁ יַחֲזִיר.
human_translation: Why, is stated If it is not matter of before apply it matter of after that if he divorced he must remarry
llm_translation: "Why is it stated? If it is not a matter before him, give it as a matter after him, for if he divorces, he may return."

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי, אוֹנֵס מִמּוֹצִיא שֵׁם רָע לָא גָּמַר, דְּאִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְמוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע, שֶׁכֵּן לוֹקֶה וּמְשַׁלֵּם!
