human_translation: But still, one cannot derive a rapist from a defamer, as can be refuted: What about a defamer, in that he is flogged and pay
llm_translation: And yet, one who coerces (oness) in bringing forth a bad name, not yet finished, for there is room to refute: What about one who brings forth a bad name, that he is thus flogged and pays!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: לֹא יֵאָמֵר ״לוֹ תִהְיֶה לְאִשָּׁה״ בְּמוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע, וְלִיגְמַר מֵאוֹנֵס: וּמָה אוֹנֵס שֶׁאֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה וּמְשַׁלֵּם, אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא ״וְלוֹ תִהְיֶה לְאִשָּׁה״, מוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן? וְלָמָּה נֶאֱמַר? אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לַמּוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע – תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לָאוֹנֵס, אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְפָנָיו – תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְאַחֲרָיו.
human_translation: Rather, let not state: “And she shall be his wife,” in defamer, and let us derive from a rapist: And if a rapist, who is not flogged and pay the Merciful One states: “And she shall be his wife,” a defamer, is it not all the more so And why, is it stated if is not matter of defamer, apply it matter of rapist, and if is not matter of before apply it matter of after
llm_translation: Rather: not should be said "to him she will be for a woman" in bringing out a bad name, and to learn from one who is forced: and what is forced that he is not punished and pays, said the Merciful One "and to him she will be for a woman," bringing out a bad name not all the more so? And why is it stated? If it is not relevant to one who brings out a bad name - give it relevance to one who is forced, if it is not relevant to him - give it relevance to those after him.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע מֵאוֹנֵס נָמֵי לָא גָּמַר, דְּאִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְאוֹנֵס – שֶׁכֵּן עָשָׂה מַעֲשֶׂה!
human_translation: But one cannot derive a defamer from a rapist either, as can be refuted: What about a rapist? that he performed an action,
llm_translation: And one who utters a bad name under coercion, it is not considered complete, for there is room to refute: Just as in the case of coercion - for he did such an act!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: לֹא יֵאָמֵר ״לוֹ תִהְיֶה לְאִשָּׁה״ בְּמוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע, שֶׁהֲרֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ הִיא. לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר? אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לַמּוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע – תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לָאוֹנֵס, וְאִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְפָנָיו – תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְאַחֲרָיו.
human_translation: Rather, let not state: “And she shall be his wife,” in defamer as she is his wife. Why, is it stated if is not matter of defamer, apply it matter of rapist, and if is not matter of before apply it matter of after
llm_translation: Rather: not should be said "to him she will be for a woman" in bringing out a bad name, for she is his wife. Why is it stated? If it is not a matter for bringing out a bad name - give him a matter for compulsion, and if it is not a matter before him - give him a matter for after him.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא, וְאִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְפָנָיו דְּמוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע – תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְאַחֲרָיו דִּידֵיהּ, דְּלָא לָקֵי!
human_translation: And say And if is not matter of defamer before apply it matter of himself after that he is not flogged,
llm_translation: And why not, and if it is not a matter before him that he brings out a bad name - give him a matter behind him of ours, so that he does not receive!

hebrew_text: אִין הָכִי נָמֵי, וְאָתֵי אוֹנֵס וְגָמַר מִינֵּיהּ. בְּמַאי גָּמַר מִינֵּיהּ? אִי בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר אִי בְּ״מָה מָצִינוּ״ – אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ כִּדְפָרְכִינַן: מָה לְמוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע, שֶׁכֵּן לֹא עָשָׂה מַעֲשֶׂה!
human_translation: Yes, it is indeed so; And rapist comes and is derived from With what derived from If by means of an a fortiori if by means of What do we find, can be refuted, as we refuted What about a defamer? in that he did not perform an action.
llm_translation: Thus it is said, and he comes by force and completes from it. With what does he complete from it? If with a fortiori argument or with "what have we found" - there is room to refute as we say: Just as one who brings forth a bad name, so too he did not do an action!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כׇּל יָמָיו בַּעֲמוֹד וְהַחְזֵר. וְכֵן כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל יָמָיו בַּעֲמוֹד וְהַחְזֵר.
human_translation: Rather, Rava says: all his days, to arise and remarry And likewise, when Ravin came Rabbi Yoḥanan says: All his days to arise and remarry
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: all his days in study and review. And similarly, when Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: all his days in study and review.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְרָבָא: וְהָא לָא דָּמֵי לָאוֵיהּ לְלָאו דַּחֲסִימָה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתַב בֵּיהּ רַחֲמָנָא עֲשֵׂה יַתִּירָא מִגְרָע גָּרַע?
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Rava But isn’t its prohibition dissimilar to the prohibition of muzzling said to him: due to that the Merciful One wrote in its an additional positive mitzva, lessens,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Rava: But isn't this not comparable to the case of Chasimah! He said to him: Because the Merciful One wrote in it, "Do more than less"?

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, לָאו שֶׁנִּיתָּק לַעֲשֵׂה נָמֵי, לֵימָא: מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתַב בֵּיהּ רַחֲמָנָא עֲשֵׂה יַתִּירָא מִגְרָע גָּרַע? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָהוּא לְנַתּוֹקֵי לָאו הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: If so, a prohibition that entails of a positive mitzva as well, let us say: due to that the Merciful One wrote in its an additional positive mitzva, lessens, said to him: that comes to sever the prohibition
llm_translation: If so, not that it was detached for the purpose of doing, rather, let it say: because the Merciful One wrote in it to do more than to omit? He said to him: that one for the purpose of detachment is not the one that came.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בִּיטְּלוֹ וְלֹא בִּיטְּלוֹ,
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says he nullified or did not nullify
llm_translation: He left it for the one who said "he nullified it" and not for the one who said "he did not nullify it."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר קִיְּימוֹ וְלֹא קִיְּימוֹ, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: But according to the one who says he fulfilled or did not fulfill what can be said?
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says "it was established" and not "it was not established," what is there to say?

hebrew_text: מִידֵּי הוּא טַעְמָא אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן? הָאָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְתַנָּא, תְּנִי: בִּטְּלוֹ – חַיָּיב, וְלֹא בִּטְּלוֹ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: The only reason is to Rabbi Yoḥanan, Didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say to tanna Teach nullified liable if he did not nullify exempt
llm_translation: From him is the reason, but for Rabbi Yochanan? He said to him Rabbi Yochanan to the Tanna, teach: if he nullified it - liable, and if he did not nullify it - exempt.

hebrew_text: דְּתָנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל מִצְוַת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ קוּם עֲשֵׂה, קִיֵּים עֲשֵׂה שֶׁבָּהּ – פָּטוּר, בִּיטֵּל עֲשֵׂה שֶׁבָּהּ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: The tanna taught before Rabbi Yoḥanan: any prohibition that entails arise perform he fulfilled the positive that therein, exempt nullified the positive mitzva that therein, liable
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita before Rabbi Yochanan: Any negative commandment that has a positive commandment associated with it, if one fulfills the positive commandment within it - he is exempt; if he nullifies the positive commandment within it - he is liable.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי קָא אָמְרַתְּ? קִיֵּים – פָּטוּר, לֹא קִיֵּים – חַיָּיב, בִּיטֵּל – חַיָּיב, לֹא בִּיטֵּל – פָּטוּר! תְּנִי: בִּיטְּלוֹ וְלֹא בִּיטְּלוֹ. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אוֹמֵר: קִיְּימוֹ וְלֹא קִיְּימוֹ.
human_translation: said to What you are saying? he fulfilled exempt, he did not fulfill liable. he nullified liable, he did not nullify exempt, teach: nullified and he did not nullify And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: he fulfilled and he did not fulfill
llm_translation: He said to him: What are you saying? If he fulfilled - exempt, if he did not fulfill - liable, if he annulled - liable, if he did not annul - exempt! It was taught: Whether he annulled it or did not annul it. And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: If he fulfilled it or did not fulfill it.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? בְּהַתְרָאַת סָפֵק קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, מָר סָבַר: הַתְרָאַת סָפֵק שְׁמָהּ הַתְרָאָה,
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? They disagree with regard to uncertain forewarning, Sage, holds: Uncertain forewarning is characterized as forewarning;
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? They disagree regarding a case of doubt. The Master holds: A case of doubt is called a doubt.

hebrew_text: וּמָר סָבַר: הַתְרָאַת סָפֵק לֹא שְׁמָהּ הַתְרָאָה.
human_translation: And Sage, holds: Uncertain forewarning is not characterized as forewarning.
llm_translation: And Mar said: The warning of doubt is not considered a warning.

hebrew_text: וְאָזְדוּ לְטַעְמַיְיהוּ, דְּאִיתְּמַר: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאוֹכַל כִּכָּר זֶה הַיּוֹם״, וְעָבַר הַיּוֹם וְלֹא אֲכָלָהּ, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה,
human_translation: And they follow their reasoning, as it was stated oath I will eat this loaf today, and the day passed and he did not eat it. Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish both say: He is not flogged Rabbi Yoḥanan says: He is not flogged,
llm_translation: And they went according to their reasons, for it was said: "A week in which one eats this loaf today," and the day passed and he did not eat it, Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish both said: He is not liable. Rabbi Yochanan says: He is not liable.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵי לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה, וְכׇל לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה – אֵין לוֹקִין עָלָיו. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה, מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵי הַתְרָאַת סָפֵק, וְכׇל הַתְרָאַת סָפֵק – לֹא שְׁמָהּ הַתְרָאָה.
human_translation: because it is a prohibition that does not involve an action. and any prohibition that does not involve an action, one is not flogged for its Reish Lakish says: He is not flogged, because is an uncertain forewarning. and any uncertain forewarning is not characterized as forewarning.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Because it is a negative commandment that does not involve an action, and any negative commandment that does not involve an action - one does not receive lashes for it. Reish Lakish says: He is not lashed, because it is a warning of doubt, and any warning of doubt - its warning is not considered a warning.

hebrew_text: וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְלֹא תוֹתִירוּ מִמֶּנּוּ עַד בֹּקֶר, וְהַנֹּתָר מִמֶּנּוּ עַד בֹּקֶר וְגוֹ׳״, בָּא הַכָּתוּב לִיתֵּן עֲשֵׂה אַחַר לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, לוֹמַר שֶׁאֵין לוֹקִין עָלָיו, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דָּיֵיק הָכִי: טַעְמָא דְּבָא הַכָּתוּב, הָא לֹא בָּא הַכָּתוּב – לוֹקֶה, אַלְמָא: הַתְרָאַת סָפֵק שְׁמָהּ הַתְרָאָה.
human_translation: And both in accordance with of Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught “And you shall let nothing of it remain until the morning, and that which remains of it until the morning The verse comes to position positive mitzva after prohibition to say that one is not flogged for its the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yoḥanan inferred this The reason that the verse comes but the verse not come flogged. Apparently, uncertain forewarning is characterized as forewarning,
llm_translation: And their dispute is in the case of Rabbi Yehuda. As it was taught: "And you shall not leave any of it until morning, and what remains of it until morning, etc." The verse comes to establish a positive commandment after a negative one, to say that one is not liable for it, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yochanan explained it thus: The reason the verse came is that if the verse did not come, one would be liable. This implies: a warning for a doubtful warning is a warning.

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ דָּיֵיק הָכִי: טַעְמָא דְּבָא הַכָּתוּב, הָא לֹא בָּא הַכָּתוּב – לוֹקֶה, אַלְמָא: לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה לוֹקִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish inferred this: The reason that the verse comes but the verse not come flogged. Apparently, one is flogged for a prohibition that does not involve an action,
llm_translation: And Reish Lakish precisely stated thus: The reason for which the Scripture came, if the Scripture did not come - he is liable. This implies: If there is no action, they do not administer punishment upon him.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ נָמֵי, הָא וַדַּאי הַתְרָאַת סָפֵק הוּא!
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish too, this is certainly uncertain forewarning;
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said, "Indeed, this is certainly a warning of doubt!"

hebrew_text: סָבַר לַהּ כְּאִידַּךְ תַּנָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. דְּתַנְיָא: הִכָּה זֶה וְחָזַר וְהִכָּה זֶה, קִילֵּל זֶה וְחָזַר וְקִילֵּל זֶה, הִכָּה שְׁנֵיהֶם בְּבַת אַחַת אוֹ קִילֵּל שְׁנֵיהֶם בְּבַת אַחַת – חַיָּיב. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּבַת אַחַת – חַיָּיב, בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: He holds in accordance with the other tanna of Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught struck this and then struck that cursed this and then cursed that one, he struck both of them simultaneously or cursed both of them simultaneously, liable Rabbi Yehuda says: simultaneously liable, one after the other, exempt.
llm_translation: He thought like the other Tanna of Rabbi Yehuda. As it was taught: If one struck this one and then struck that one, cursed this one and then cursed that one, whether he struck both of them at once or cursed both of them at once - he is liable. Rabbi Yehuda says: If he did it at once, he is liable; if he did it one after the other, he is exempt.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן נָמֵי, הָא וַדַּאי לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה הוּא!
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan too, this is certainly a prohibition that does not involve an action.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan named, this and certainly not that which does not have action it is!

hebrew_text: סָבַר לַהּ כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי: כׇּל לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה, לָאו שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה – לוֹקִין עָלָיו, לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה – אֵין לוֹקִין עָלָיו, חוּץ מִן הַנִּשְׁבָּע, וּמֵימִר, וְהַמְקַלֵּל אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ בַּשֵּׁם.
human_translation: holds in accordance with that which Rav Idi bar Avin says Rav Amram says Rabbi Yitzḥak says Rabbi Yoḥanan says Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili: any prohibition in the Torah, a prohibition that involves an action, one is flogged for its a prohibition that does not involve an action, one is not flogged for its except for one who takes oath, one who substitutes and one who curses another invoking the name
llm_translation: He thought to her, as this that Rav Idi bar Avin said in the name of Rav Amram said in the name of Rabbi Yitzchak said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Yosei Hagelili: Any negative commandment in the Torah that involves an action - one is liable for violating it; any negative commandment that does not involve an action - one is not liable for violating it, except for one who takes an oath, and for one who curses his fellow using the name.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה!
human_translation: of Rabbi Yehuda to of Rabbi Yehuda difficult.
llm_translation: The difficulty of Rabbi Yehuda is according to Rabbi Yehuda!

hebrew_text: אִי לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ – תְּרֵי תַּנָּאֵי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אִי לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן – לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דִידֵיהּ, הָא דְרַבֵּיהּ.
human_translation: If to Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, two tanna’im , in accordance with of Rabbi Yehuda. If to Rabbi Yoḥanan, not difficult, this his that of his teacher,
llm_translation: To Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish - two teachings in the school of Rabbi Yehuda. To Rabbi Yochanan - it is not difficult: this one is his, that one is his teacher's.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: הַנּוֹטֵל אֵם עַל הַבָּנִים, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לוֹקֶה, וְאֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּחַ. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מְשַׁלֵּחַ וְאֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה. זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל מִצְוַת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ קוּם עֲשֵׂה – אֵין חַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין לָנוּ אֶלָּא זֹאת וְעוֹד אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: We learned there one who takes mother with fledglings, Rabbi Yehuda says: flogged and does not send and the Rabbis say: He sends and is not flogged, this is the principle: any prohibition that entails arise perform one is not liable for its Rabbi Yoḥanan says: We have only this and another
llm_translation: We learned there: One who takes a mother bird with her young, Rabbi Yehuda says: he is liable and does not fulfill the sending away of the mother bird. And the Sages say: he fulfills the sending away and is not liable. This is the principle: any negative commandment that has a positive commandment associated with it - one is not liable for it. Rabbi Yochanan said: we have only this and another case.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הֵיכָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְכִי תַּשְׁכַּח. נְפַק דָּק וְאַשְׁכַּח, דְּתַנְיָא: אוֹנֵס שֶׁגֵּירַשׁ, אִם יִשְׂרָאֵל הוּא – מַחְזִיר וְאֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה, וְאִם כֹּהֵן הוּא – לוֹקֶה וְאֵינוֹ מַחְזִיר.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said to Which said to him: when you discover it went out, examined and discovered as it is taught a rapist who divorced if he is a non-priest, he remarries and he is not flogged And if he is a priest, flogged and he does not remarry
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Elazar: Where? He said to him: Go and forget. He went out, searched, and found, as it was taught: If one was forced to divorce, if he is an Israelite - he returns to his wife and is not punished, but if he is a Kohen - he is punished and does not return.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּתָנֵי קִיְּימוֹ וְלֹא קִיְּימוֹ.
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who teaches he fulfilled or did not fulfill
llm_translation: He left it for the one who taught "he established" and not "he established."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּתָנֵי בִּיטְּלוֹ וְלֹא בִּיטְּלוֹ, בִּשְׁלָמָא גַּבֵּי שִׁילּוּחַ הַקֵּן מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ, אֶלָּא אוֹנֵס בִּיטְּלוֹ וְלֹא בִּיטְּלוֹ הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
human_translation: But according to the one who teaches he nullified or did not nullify granted, with regard to sending the nest, you find But a rapist, he nullified or he did not nullify it, how can you find
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who teaches that he nullified it and did not nullify it, in the case of sending away the mother bird, she forgets about it. Rather, if one was forced, whether he nullified it or did not nullify it, how does she forget about it?

hebrew_text: אִי דְּקַטְלַהּ – קָם לֵיהּ בִּדְרַבָּה מִינֵּיהּ! אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי מָחוֹזְנָאָה: כְּגוֹן שֶׁקִּיבֵּל לָהּ קִידּוּשִׁין מֵאַחֵר. אָמַר רַב: אִי שַׁוֵּויתֵיהּ שָׁלִיחַ – אִיהִי קָא מְבַטְּלָא לֵיהּ, אִי לָא שַׁוֵּויתֵיהּ שָׁלִיחַ – כֹּל כְּמִינֵּיהּ? וְלָא כְּלוּם הִיא!
human_translation: If he killed her, He receives the greater Rav Shimi of Meḥoza said: where he received, on her betrothal from another, Rav said: if designated him as an agent she who nullifies for him, If she did not designate him as an agent, is it in his is nothing,
llm_translation: If he killed her - he is exempt from paying her ketubah! Rav Shimi Machozna'ah said: For example, if he accepted betrothal for her from someone else. Rav said: If his agent was equal - he is annulling it for him, if his agent was not equal - everything according to its kind? But it is nothing!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא כְּגוֹן שֶׁהִדִּירָהּ בָּרַבִּים. הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר נֶדֶר שֶׁהוּדַּר בָּרַבִּים אֵין לוֹ הֲפָרָה, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר יֵשׁ לוֹ הֲפָרָה, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? (דְּמַדִּירַהּ לַהּ) [כְּגוֹן שֶׁהִדִּירָהּ] עַל דַּעַת רַבִּים. דְּאָמַר אַמֵּימָר: הִלְכְתָא, נֶדֶר שֶׁהוּדַּר בָּרַבִּים – יֵשׁ לוֹ הֲפָרָה, עַל דַּעַת רַבִּים – אֵין לוֹ הֲפָרָה.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Shimi of Neharde’a said: where he vowed in public her, This works out well according to the one who says a vow that was taken in public has no nullification; But according to the one who says has nullification, what can be said? where he vows on the consent of the public her, as Ameimar says the halakha A vow that was taken in public has nullification; on the consent of the public has no nullification.
llm_translation: Rather, said Rav Shimi from Nehardea, for example, if she dwelt in public. It is preferable according to the one who says a vow made in public has no annulment, but according to the one who says there is annulment, what can be said? (Because she dwelt) for example, if she dwelt with the consent of the public. As Amemar said: The halacha is, a vow made in public - has annulment; with the consent of the public - has no annulment.

hebrew_text: וְתוּ לֵיכָּא? וְהָא אִיכָּא (סִימָן גָּזֵל מַשְׁכֹּן וּפֵאָה), גָּזֵל, דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר ״לֹא תִגְזֹל״, ״וְהֵשִׁיב אֶת הַגְּזֵלָה״. מַשְׁכּוֹן, דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר ״לֹא תָבֹא אֶל בֵּיתוֹ לַעֲבֹט עֲבֹטוֹ״, ״הָשֵׁב תָּשִׁיב לוֹ הָעֲבוֹט כְּבֹא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ״.
human_translation: And no more But aren’t there others? a mnemonic Robbery, collateral, and pe’a . robbery, where the Merciful One states: “You shall not rob” “And he shall return the stolen item” collateral, where the Merciful One states: “You shall not come into his house to fetch his pledge” “You shall return to him the pledge when the sun sets”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And is there a need for this? But there is a case (regarding the laws of theft, collateral, and gleanings). Theft, for the Merciful One said, "You shall not steal," "And you shall return the stolen item." Collateral, for the Merciful One said, "You shall not enter his house to take his pledge," "You shall surely return the pledge to him as the sun sets."

hebrew_text: וּמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בְּקִיְּימוֹ וְלֹא קִיְּימוֹ, וּבִיטְּלוֹ וְלֹא בִּיטְּלוֹ! הָתָם כֵּיוָן דְּחַיָּיב בְּתַשְׁלוּמִין – אֵין לוֹקֶה וּמְשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: And you find in he fulfilled or did not fulfill and he nullified or he did not nullify it. There, since he is liable to payment One is not flogged and pay
llm_translation: And she found it in his possession and not in his possession, and he denied it and did not deny it! There, since he is liable for payment - he is not lashed and he pays.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא: הָא אִיכָּא מַשְׁכּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל גֵּר, וּמֵת הַגֵּר!
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira objects to this: But isn’t there the collateral of a convert and the convert died
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira objects to her: There is a place for a convert's dwelling, and the convert dies!

hebrew_text: הָתָם, גַּבְרָא בַּר תַּשְׁלוּמִין הוּא, וְשִׁיעְבּוּדָא דְּגֵר הוּא דְּקָא פָקַע.
human_translation: There, the man is liable to payment, and it is that the lien of the convert has lapsed,
llm_translation: There, a man, son of Tashlumin, he is, and the servitude of a convert he is, that he violated.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִיכָּא פֵּאָה, דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר ״לֹא תְכַלֶּה פְּאַת וְגוֹ׳״ ״לֶעָנִי וְלַגֵּר תַּעֲזֹב אֹתָם וְגוֹ׳״,
human_translation: But isn’t there pe’a , as the Merciful One states: “You shall not wholly reap the corner of “To the poor and the convert you shall leave them”
llm_translation: And there is a case of Pe'ah, for the Merciful One said, "You shall not finish the corner, etc." "To the poor and to the stranger you shall leave them, etc."

hebrew_text: דְּמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בְּקִיְּימוֹ וְלֹא קִיְּימוֹ, בִּיטְּלוֹ וְלֹא בִּיטְּלוֹ! דִּתְנַן: מִצְוַת פֵּאָה לְהַפְרִישׁ מִן הַקָּמָה. לֹא הִפְרִישׁ מִן הַקָּמָה – מַפְרִישׁ מִן הָעוֹמָרִין. לֹא הִפְרִישׁ מִן הָעוֹמָרִין – מַפְרִישׁ מִן הַכְּרִי, עַד שֶׁלֹּא מֵירַח. מֵירְחוֹ – מְעַשֵּׂר וְנוֹתֵן לוֹ!
human_translation: you find in he fulfilled or did not fulfill and he nullified or he did not nullify it, as we learned mitzva of pe’a to separate from the standing grain he did not separate from the standing grain, he separates from the sheaves not separate from the sheaves, he separates from the pile before he smooths smoothed he tithes and gives to
llm_translation: She found it in its proper place and not in its proper place, she nullified it and did not nullify it! As we learned: The commandment of Pe'ah is to set aside from the standing crop. If one did not set aside from the standing crop, they set aside from the sheaves. If one did not set aside from the sheaves, they set aside from the granary, until the time of winnowing. Once it is winnowed, one tithes and gives it to him!

hebrew_text: כִּדְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, דְּאָמַר: אַף מַפְרִישׁ מִן הָעִיסָּה. וּלְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל נָמֵי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ, דַּאֲכַל עִיסָּה!
human_translation: in accordance with of Rabbi Yishmael, who says: separates even from the dough. And to Rabbi Yishmael, you also find where one ate dough.
llm_translation: As Rabbi Yishmael said: Also separates from the dough. And even Rabbi Yishmael also remembers her, that she ate dough!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, ״זֹאת וְעוֹד אַחֶרֶת״ – אַהָא, אֲבָל אוֹנֵס – לָא. דְּהֵיכָא אָמְרִינַן עַל דַּעַת רַבִּים אֵין לוֹ הֲפָרָה – לִדְבַר הָרְשׁוּת, אֲבָל לִדְבַר מִצְוָה – יֵשׁ לוֹ הֲפָרָה.
human_translation: Rather, This, and Another, to this But a rapist, no, Where do we say on the consent of the public has no nullification? for a matter optional, but for a matter a mitzva, has nullification.
llm_translation: Rather, "this and another" - ah, but in the case of rape - no. For where do we say that he does not have a cow according to the opinion of the majority - in matters of permission, but in matters of commandment - he does have a cow.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּהָהוּא מַקְרֵי דַרְדְּקֵי דַּהֲוָה פָּשַׁע בְּיָנוֹקֵי, אַדְּרֵיהּ רַב אַחָא, וְאַהְדְּרֵיהּ רָבִינָא, דְּלָא אִשְׁתְּכַח דְּדָיֵיק כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: As that where a certain teacher of children who was negligent in children, Rav Aḥa vowed he And Ravina restored him because no was found who was as accurate as he.
llm_translation: This is the case of Dardkei who was negligent with regards to nursing infants, Rav Acha admonished him, and Ravina repeated it, as it was not found that he was precise in his actions.

hebrew_text: וְהָאוֹכֵל נְבֵילוֹת וּטְרֵיפוֹת שְׁקָצִים וּרְמָשִׂים וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הַאי מַאן דַּאֲכַל בִּינִיתָא דְּבֵי כְרָבָא – מַלְקִינַן לֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם ״שֶׁרֶץ הַשֹּׁרֵץ עַל הָאָרֶץ״. הָהוּא דַּאֲכַל בִּינִיתָא דְּבֵי כְרָבָא וְנַגְּדֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: And one who eats unslaughtered carcasses, or tereifot , repugnant creatures, or creeping animals, Rav Yehuda says: One who eats a fish- in a plow [ binnita devei kerava ], we flog him due to “Creeping animals that creep on the ground… a certain who ate a fish- in a plow, and Rav Yehuda flogged him.
llm_translation: The one who eats neveilot, treifot, abominations, and creeping things, etc. Rav Yehudah said: One who eats the innards of the house of the butcher - we flog him because of "the swarming things that swarm upon the earth." That one who ate the innards of the house of the butcher, and Rav Yehudah confronted him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אָכַל פּוּטִיתָא – לוֹקֶה אַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: Abaye says: a putita , is flogged four
llm_translation: Abbaye said: "One who eats a pottage is liable for lashes - four."

hebrew_text: נְמָלָה – לוֹקֶה חָמֵשׁ, מִשּׁוּם ״שֶׁרֶץ הַשֹּׁרֵץ עַל הָאָרֶץ״.
human_translation: an ant, he is flogged five for “Creeping animals that creep on the ground…
llm_translation: Ant: "Nemalah - lokeh chamesh, mi'shum 'sheretz hashoretz al ha'aretz'."

hebrew_text: צִרְעָה – לוֹקֶה שֵׁשׁ, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁרֶץ הָעוֹף.
human_translation: a wasp, he is flogged six due to winged creeping creatures:
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Tzir'ah - lokeh sheish, mi'shum she'retz ha'of. English translation: Tzir'ah - receives lashes six, because of the creeping thing of the bird.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחַאי: הַמְשַׁהֶה אֶת נְקָבָיו עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא תְשַׁקְּצוּ״. אָמַר רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי: הַאי מַאן דְּשָׁתֵי בְּקַרְנָא דְּאוּמָּנָא קָא עָבַר מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא תְשַׁקְּצוּ״.
human_translation: Rav Aḥai says: One who delays his orifices violates of: “You shall not make detestable” Rav Beivai bar Abaye says: One who drinks from the horn of a bloodletter violates of: “You shall not make detestable.”
llm_translation: Rav Ahai said: One who delays relieving oneself transgresses the prohibition of "You shall not make yourselves detestable." Rav Bivi bar Abbaye said: Whoever covers himself with the horn of a craftsman's vessel transgresses the prohibition of "You shall not make yourselves detestable."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא בַּר רַב הוּנָא: רִיסֵּק תִּשְׁעָה נְמָלִים וְהֵבִיא אֶחָד חַי וְהִשְׁלִימָן לִכְזַיִת – לוֹקֶה שֵׁשׁ, חָמֵשׁ – מִשּׁוּם בְּרִיָּה, וְאֶחָד – מִשּׁוּם כְּזַיִת נְבֵילָה. רָבָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֲפִילּוּ שְׁנַיִם וְהוּא. רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ אַחַד וְהוּא. וְלָא פְּלִיגִי, הָא – בְּרַבְרְבֵי, וְהָא – בְּזוּטְרֵי.
human_translation: Rava bar Rav Huna says: crushed nine ants and brought one alive and completed to an olive-bulk flogged six Five for an entity and one for an olive-bulk of an unslaughtered carcass Rava Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Even he ate two and Rav Yosef says: Even he ate one and And they do not disagree; this to large And that to small
llm_translation: Rava son of Rav Huna said: If one crushed nine ants and brought one live ant and completed them to the size of an olive, he is liable for six lashes, five lashes - due to creating a living being, and one - due to the size of an olive being a carcass. Rava said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Even if there are two and it the live ant is included. Rav Yosef said: Even if there is one and it is included. And they do not disagree, this case is with large ants, and this case is with small ants.

hebrew_text: ״אָכַל טֶבֶל וּמַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן״ כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַב: אָכַל טֶבֶל שֶׁל מַעְשַׂר עָנִי – לוֹקֶה.
human_translation: ate untithed produce or first-tithe Rav says: ate untithed produce poor man’s tithe flogged.
llm_translation: "Eat tithe and first tithe" (Leviticus 27:30). Rav said: One who eats the tithe of the poor - is liable.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן – כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: יָכוֹל לֹא יְהֵא חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל הַטֶּבֶל שֶׁלֹּא הוּרַם מִמֶּנּוּ כׇּל עִיקָּר; הוּרַם מִמֶּנּוּ תְּרוּמָה גְּדוֹלָה וְלֹא הוּרַם מִמֶּנּוּ מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן, מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן וְלֹא מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי, וַאֲפִילּוּ מַעְשַׂר עָנִי, מִנַּיִן?
human_translation: In accordance with whose in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Yosei says: might that one is liable for only untithed produce from which no were taken at all; teruma gedola was taken from but first tithe was not taken from it, first tithe but not second tithe, or even poor man’s tithe from where
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As to whom - for this Mishnah, as it was taught, Rabbi Yosei said: Can it be that one is liable only for the tevel from which he did not separate any essential part? If he separated from it a large terumah and did not separate from it the first tithe, the first tithe and not the second tithe, and even the poor tithe, from where? English translation:

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תוּכַל לֶאֱכֹל בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ וְגוֹ׳״ וּלְהַלָּן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְאָכְלוּ בִשְׁעָרֶיךָ וְשָׂבֵעוּ״, מָה לְהַלָּן מַעְשַׂר עָנִי, אַף כָּאן מַעְשַׂר עָנִי, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״לֹא תוּכַל״.
human_translation: the verse states: “You may not eat within your gates and there it states: and they shall eat within your gates and be satisfied” Just as there, poor man’s tithe, here too, poor man’s tithe, and the Merciful One states You may not
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "You shall not be able to eat within your gates, etc." And elsewhere it says: "And they shall eat within your gates and be satisfied." Just as there it is referring to the tithe for the poor, so too here it is referring to the tithe for the poor. And the Merciful One says: "You shall not be able."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: כְּתַנָּאֵי, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֵין צָרִיךְ לִקְרוֹת אֶת הַשֵּׁם עַל מַעְשַׂר עָנִי שֶׁל דְּמַאי, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים:
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: subject to tanna’im . Rabbi Eliezer says: One need not calling the name upon poor man’s tithe of doubtfully tithed produce [ demai ]. And the Rabbis say:
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Like the Tannaim, Rabbi Eliezer says: One does not need to recite the name over the tithe of poor-quality produce, and the Sages say:

hebrew_text: קוֹרֵא אֶת הַשֵּׁם, וְאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְהַפְרִישׁ.
human_translation: calling the name but he is not required to separate
llm_translation: He reads the Name, and does not need to separate.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר: וַדַּאי – טוֹבְלוֹ. וּמָר סָבַר: וַדַּאי – אֵינוֹ טוֹבְלוֹ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אִי הָכִי, אַדְּמִיפַּלְגִי בִּסְפֵיקוֹ, לִיפַּלְגוּ בְּוַדַּאי!
human_translation: What, is it not they disagree with regard to this: That Sage, holds certainly is rendered untithed produce, and Sage, holds certainly is not rendered untithed produce, Abaye said to If so, rather than disagreeing with regard to uncertainty let them disagree with regard to certainty
llm_translation: What is the reason they are arguing about this? For Mar holds: Definitely - immerse it. And Mar holds: Definitely - do not immerse it? Abaye said to him: If so, if they argue in a case of doubt, let them argue in a case of certainty!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא וַדַּאי – טוֹבְלוֹ. וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, מָר סָבַר: לֹא נֶחְשְׁדוּ עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ עַל מַעְשַׂר עָנִי שֶׁל דְּמַאי. כֵּיוָן דְּמָמוֹנָא הוּא – אַפְרוֹשֵׁי מַפְרֵישׁ. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: כֵּיוָן דִּטְרִיחָא לֵיהּ מִילְּתָא – לָא מַפְרֵישׁ.
human_translation: Rather, that everyone agrees certainly is rendered untithed produce. And here, with regard to this they disagree: Sage, holds: Amei ha’aretz are not suspected of poor man’s tithe of demai . Since it is money, he separates And the Rabbis hold: Since the matter exertion for him, he does not separate
llm_translation: Rather, in all cases and certainly - he should immerse. And here in this case they are in disagreement, the Master thinks: The common people of the land were not suspected regarding the tithe of poor-quality produce. Since it involves money - they will separate tithes. But the Sages think: Since it is a burden for him - he will not separate.

hebrew_text: כַּמָּה יֹאכַל מִן הַטֶּבֶל וְכוּ׳: אָמַר רַב בִּיבִי אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּחִטָּה, אֲבָל בְּקֶמַח – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל כְּזַיִת. וְרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: כְּמַחְלוֹקֶת בָּזוֹ כָּךְ מַחְלוֹקֶת בָּזוֹ.
human_translation: How much does one eat from untithed produce Rav Beivai says Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: dispute with regard to wheat But with regard to flour, everyone agrees an olive-bulk. And Rabbi Yirmeya Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: as a dispute with regard to this so too, a dispute with regard to that
llm_translation: Talmudic text: How much may one eat from tevel, etc.? Rav Bibi said, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Disagreement regarding wheat, but regarding flour - everyone agrees like an olive. And Rabbi Yirmiyah said Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Just as there is disagreement in this, so too there is disagreement in that.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן, אָמַר לָהֶם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: אִי אַתֶּם מוֹדִים לִי בְּאוֹכֵל נְמָלָה כׇּל שֶׁהוּא שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא כִּבְרִיָּיתָהּ. אָמַר לָהֶן: אַף חִטָּה אַחַת כִּבְרִיָּיתָהּ. חִטָּה – אִין, קֶמַח – לָא!
human_translation: we learned Rabbi Shimon said to them: Do you not concede to me with regard to one who eats an ant of any size that he is liable said to due to that of its creation. said to them: One wheat is of its creation. wheat, yes, flour, no,
llm_translation: We learned: Rabbi Shimon said to them: Do you agree with me that one who eats a locust is liable for each and every one? They said to him: Because it is a creature of its kind. He said to them: Even one wheat kernel is a creature of its kind. Wheat - yes, flour - no!

hebrew_text: לְדִבְרֵיהֶם קָאָמַר לְהוּ: לְדִידִי – אֲפִילּוּ קֶמַח נָמֵי, אֶלָּא לְדִידְכוּ – אוֹדוֹ לִי מִיהַת דְּחִטָּה אַחַת כִּבְרִיָּיתָהּ. וְרַבָּנַן: בְּרִיַּית נְשָׁמָה – חֲשִׁובָה, חִטָּה – לָא חֲשִׁובָה. תַּנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כׇּל שֶׁהוּא לְמַכּוֹת, לֹא אָמְרוּ כְּזַיִת אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן קׇרְבָּן.
human_translation: with statement of spoke to them, to my even flour also But according to your concede to me at least that one wheat, of its creation. And the Rabbis an entity a soul, is significant, wheat is not significant. It is taught in accordance with of Rabbi Yirmeya, Rabbi Shimon says: any amount to lashes; said an olive-bulk only with regard to offering
llm_translation: Regarding their words, he said to them: According to me - even if the flour is fine, but according to you - give me one kernel of wheat. And the sages say: The creation of a soul is significant, but the wheat is not significant. It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yirmeya: Rabbi Shimon says: When it comes to afflictions, they did not say "like an olive" but for the matter of sacrifice.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאוֹכֵל בִּכּוּרִים עַד שֶׁלֹּא קָרָא עֲלֵיהֶם, קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים חוּץ לַקְּלָעִים, קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי חוּץ לַחוֹמָה. הַשּׁוֹבֵר אֶת הָעֶצֶם בַּפֶּסַח הַטָּהוֹר – הֲרֵי זֶה לוֹקֶה אַרְבָּעִים. אֲבָל הַמּוֹתִיר בַּטָּהוֹר וְהַשּׁוֹבֵר בַּטָּמֵא – אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה אַרְבָּעִים.
human_translation: who eats first fruits before recited over offerings of the most sacred order outside the curtains offerings of lesser sanctity or second-tithe outside the wall one who breaks the bone of a ritually pure Paschal offering; he is flogged forty But one who leaves of the ritually pure and one who breaks of a ritually impure not flogged forty
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who eats first fruits before reciting over them the declaration of sanctification, holy of holies items outside the Temple walls, lighter sanctified items, and second tithe outside the wall. One who breaks a bone of the Paschal lamb in a state of purity - he is liable to receive forty lashes. However, one who permits the Paschal lamb in a state of purity, and one who breaks a bone in a state of impurity - he is not liable to receive forty lashes.

hebrew_text: הַנּוֹטֵל אֵם עַל הַבָּנִים, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לוֹקֶה וְאֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּחַ. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מְשַׁלֵּחַ וְאֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה. זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל מִצְוַת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ קוּם עֲשֵׂה – אֵין חַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: one who takes the mother with fledglings, Rabbi Yehuda says: He is flogged and does not send and the Rabbis say: He sends and is not flogged, this is the principle: any prohibition that entails arise perform he is not liable for its
llm_translation: One who takes a mother bird with her young, Rabbi Yehuda says: he is liable and does not fulfill the sending away of the mother bird. And the Sages say: he fulfills the sending away and is not liable. This is the principle: for any negative commandment that has a positive commandment associated with it - one is not liable for it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סְתִימְתָּאָה, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בִּכּוּרִים – הַנָּחָה מְעַכֶּבֶת בָּהֶן, קְרִיאָה אֵין מְעַכֶּבֶת בָּהֶן.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This is the statement of Rabbi Akiva, unattributed. But the Rabbis say: first fruits, placement invalidates them, recitation does not invalidate them,
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: These are the words of Rabbi Akiva, a closed matter, but the Sages say: Firstborn animals - resting impedes them, reading does not impede them.

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סְתִימְתָּאָה! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And let say: This the unattributed statement of Rabbi Shimon, This teaches us that Rabbi Akiva holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: And say, is this the words of Rabbi Shimon S'timta'ah! This is what it implies to us that Rabbi Akiva holds like Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: מַאי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? דְּתַנְיָא: ״וּתְרוּמַת יָדֶךָ״ – אֵלּוּ בִּכּוּרִים.
human_translation: What Rabbi Shimon? as it is taught “nor the donation of [ terumat ] your hand,” these are first fruits.
llm_translation: What is the opinion of Rabbi Shimon? For it was taught: "The offering of your hand" - these are the first fruits.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מָה בָּא זֶה לְלַמְּדֵנוּ? אִם לְאוֹכְלָן חוּץ לַחוֹמָה – קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִמַּעֲשֵׂר הַקַּל: וּמָה מַעֲשֵׂר הַקַּל, אוֹכְלָן חוּץ לַחוֹמָה לוֹקֶה – בִּכּוּרִים לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן? הָא לֹא בָּא הַכָּתוּב אֶלָּא לָאוֹכֵל מִבִּכּוּרִים עַד שֶׁלֹּא קָרָא עֲלֵיהֶם, שֶׁהוּא לוֹקֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: What does come to teach us? If to eat outside the wall an a fortiori from the lenient tithe If the lenient tithe eats them outside the wall is flogged, first fruits, all the more so not the verse comes to teach only with regard to who partakes of first fruits before recited over them, that he is flogged.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: What does this come to teach us? If one eats them outside the wall - a fortiori from the lighter tithe: And what is the lighter tithe, if one eats them outside the wall he is liable - all the more so for first fruits? The verse only came to teach that one is not liable for eating from first fruits until he has recited over them, for which he is liable.

hebrew_text: ״וְנִדְבֹתֶיךָ״ – זוֹ תּוֹדָה וּשְׁלָמִים. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מָה בָּא זֶה לְלַמְּדֵנוּ? אִם לְאוֹכְלָן חוּץ לַחוֹמָה – קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִמַּעֲשֵׂר, הָא לֹא בָּא הַכָּתוּב אֶלָּא לָאוֹכֵל בְּתוֹדָה וּבִשְׁלָמִים לִפְנֵי זְרִיקָה, שֶׁהוּא לוֹקֶה.
human_translation: “Nor your gift offerings”; this is a thanks-offering and a peace-offering Rabbi Shimon says: What does come to teach us? If to eat outside the wall an a fortiori from tithe the verse comes to teach only with regard to one who partakes of a thanks-offering or of a peace-offering before sprinkling that he is flogged.
llm_translation: "and your freewill offerings" - this is thanksgiving and peace offerings. Rabbi Shimon said: What does this come to teach us? If regarding their consumption outside the wall - a fortiori from tithes, for the verse only came to teach us regarding consuming thanksgiving and peace offerings before the sprinkling, that one is liable.

hebrew_text: ״וּבְכֹרֹת״ – זֶה הַבְּכוֹר. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מָה בָּא זֶה לְלַמְּדֵנוּ? אִם לְאוֹכְלָן חוּץ לַחוֹמָה – קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִמַּעֲשֵׂר, אִם לִפְנֵי זְרִיקָה – קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִתּוֹדָה וּשְׁלָמִים! הָא לֹא בָּא הַכָּתוּב אֶלָּא לָאוֹכֵל מִן הַבְּכוֹר אֲפִילּוּ לְאַחַר זְרִיקָה, שֶׁהוּא לוֹקֶה.
human_translation: “Or the firstborn”; this is the firstborn. Rabbi Shimon says: What does come to teach us? If to eat outside the wall an a fortiori from tithe If before sprinkling an a fortiori from a thanks-offering and a peace-offering, the verse comes to teach only with regard to who partakes of a firstborn even after sprinkling that he is flogged.
llm_translation: "Uv'chorot" - this is the firstborn. Rabbi Shimon said: What does this come to teach us? If for eating outside the wall - a fortiori from Maaser, if before sprinkling - a fortiori from Todah and Shelamim! The verse only came to permit eating from the firstborn even after sprinkling, as he is exempt.

hebrew_text: ״בְּקָרְךָ וְצֹאנֶךָ״ – זוֹ חַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מָה בָּא זֶה לְלַמְּדֵנוּ?
human_translation: “Of your herd or of your flock”; this is a sin-offering and a guilt-offering, Rabbi Shimon says: What does come to teach us?
llm_translation: "In your cattle and in your flock" - this is referring to sin-offering and guilt-offering. Rabbi Shimon said: What does this come to teach us?

hebrew_text: אִם לְאוֹכְלָן חוּץ לַחוֹמָה – קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִמַּעֲשֵׂר, אִם לִפְנֵי זְרִיקָה – קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִתּוֹדָה וּשְׁלָמִים, אִם לְאַחַר זְרִיקָה – קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִבְּכוֹר! הָא לֹא בָּא הַכָּתוּב אֶלָּא לָאוֹכֵל מֵחַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם אֲפִילּוּ לְאַחַר זְרִיקָה חוּץ לַקְּלָעִים, שֶׁהוּא לוֹקֶה.
human_translation: If to eat outside the wall, an a fortiori from tithe If before sprinkling an a fortiori from a thanks-offering and a peace-offering, If after sprinkling an a fortiori from a firstborn the verse comes only with regard to one who partakes of a sin-offering or a guilt-offering even after sprinkling outside the curtains that he is flogged.
llm_translation: If for consumption outside the wall - a fortiori from Ma'aser, if before sprinkling - a fortiori from Todah and Shelamim, if after sprinkling - a fortiori from Bechor! The verse only comes for consumption of Chatat and Asham even after sprinkling outside the curtains, as he is liable.

hebrew_text: ״נְדָרֶיךָ״ – זוֹ עוֹלָה. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מָה בָּא זֶה לְלַמְּדֵנוּ?
human_translation: “Your vows”; this is the burnt-offering, Rabbi Shimon says: What does come to teach us?
llm_translation: "Your vows" - this is an olah offering. Rabbi Shimon said: What does this come to teach us?

hebrew_text: אִם לְאוֹכְלָן חוּץ לַחוֹמָה – קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִמַּעֲשֵׂר, אִם לִפְנֵי זְרִיקָה – קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִתּוֹדָה וּשְׁלָמִים, אִם לְאַחַר זְרִיקָה – קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִבְּכוֹר, אִם חוּץ לַקְּלָעִים – קַל וָחוֹמֶר מֵחַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם! הָא לֹא בָּא הַכָּתוּב
human_translation: If to eat outside the wall an a fortiori from tithe If before sprinkling an a fortiori from a thanks-offering and a peace-offering, If after sprinkling an a fortiori from a firstborn If outside the curtains an a fortiori from a sin-offering and a guilt-offering. the verse comes
llm_translation: If for consumption outside the wall - light and heavy from Maaser, if before sprinkling - light and heavy from Todah and Shelamim, if after sprinkling - light and heavy from Bechor, if outside the curtains - light and heavy from Chatat and Asham! The verse did not come.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאוֹכֵל מִן הָעוֹלָה לְאַחַר זְרִיקָה, אֲפִילּוּ בִּפְנִים, שֶׁהוּא לוֹקֶה.
human_translation: only with regard to one who partakes of a burnt-offering after sprinkling, even inside that he is flogged.
llm_translation: Rather, one who eats from the burnt offering after its blood has been sprinkled, even inside the Temple, is liable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: דְּיָלְידָא אִימֵּיהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן – תֵּילִיד, וְאִי לָא – לָא תֵּילִיד. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּאִית לְהוּ פִּירְכָא.
human_translation: Rava says whose mother is bearing like Rabbi Shimon, she should bear and if not, she does not bear And even though there is a refutation for
llm_translation: Rava said: If the child resembles his mother's family, like Rabbi Shimon - she will give birth, and if not - she will not give birth. Even though there is a way to reconcile this.

hebrew_text: מַאי חוּמְרָא דְּבִכּוּרִים מִמַּעֲשֵׂר – שֶׁכֵּן אֲסוּרִים לְזָרִים. אַדְּרַבָּה, מַעֲשֵׂר חָמוּר, שֶׁכֵּן אָסוּר לְאוֹנֵן.
human_translation: What stringency of first fruits vis-à-vis tithe that are forbidden to non-priests, on the contrary, tithe stringent that forbidden to an acute mourner,
llm_translation: What is the stringency of firstborn animals over tithes - that they are also forbidden to non-priests. On the contrary, tithes are stringent, as they are also forbidden to a mourner.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי חוּמְרָא דְּתוֹדָה וּשְׁלָמִים מִמַּעֲשֵׂר – שֶׁכֵּן טְעוּנִין מַתַּן דָּמִים וְאֵימוּרִין לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ. אַדְּרַבָּה, מַעֲשֵׂר חָמוּר, שֶׁכֵּן טְעוּנִין כֶּסֶף צוּרָה.
human_translation: And what stringency of a thanks-offering and a peace-offering vis-à-vis tithe that require the placement of blood and sacrificial portions upon the altar. on the contrary, tithe stringent that requires money minted
llm_translation: And what is the stringency of thanksgiving-offering and peace-offerings from tithe - because they require the giving of blood and sacrificial portions on the altar. On the contrary, tithe is more stringent, because they require coined money.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי חוּמְרָא דִּבְכוֹר מִתּוֹדָה וּשְׁלָמִים – שֶׁכֵּן קְדוּשָּׁתוֹ מֵרֶחֶם. אַדְּרַבָּה: תּוֹדָה וּשְׁלָמִים חֲמוּרִים, שֶׁכֵּן טְעוּנִים סְמִיכָה, וּנְסָכִים, וּתְנוּפַת חָזֶה וָשׁוֹק.
human_translation: And what stringency of a firstborn vis-à-vis a thanks-offering and a peace-offering? that sanctity of from the womb, on the contrary, a thanks-offering and a peace-offering are more stringent, that they require placing hands and libations, and the waving of the breast and the thigh,
llm_translation: And what is the stringency of a firstborn over thanksgiving and peace offerings - because his sanctity is from the womb. Adrabah: Thanksgiving and peace offerings are stringent, as they require leaning, libations, waving of the chest and the thigh.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי חוּמְרָא דְּחַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם מִבְּכוֹר – שֶׁכֵּן קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים. אַדְּרַבָּה, בְּכוֹר חָמוּר, שֶׁכֵּן קְדוּשָּׁתוֹ מֵרֶחֶם.
human_translation: And what stringency of a sin-offering and a guilt-offering vis-à-vis a firstborn that offerings of the most sacred order. on the contrary, a firstborn is more strin-gent, that its sanctity from the womb,
llm_translation: And what is the stringency of a sin offering and guilt offering over a firstborn? Because they are holy of holies. On the contrary, a firstborn is more stringent, for its holiness is from the womb.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי חוּמְרָא דְּעוֹלָה מֵחַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם – שֶׁכֵּן כָּלִיל. אַדְּרַבָּה, חַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם חֲמִירִי, שֶׁכֵּן מְכַפְּרִי.
human_translation: And what stringency of the burnt-offering vis-à-vis a sin-offering and a guilt-offering? that entirety on the contrary, the sin-offering and the guilt-offering are stringent, that they atone
llm_translation: And what is the stringency of an Olah sacrifice over a Chatat and Asham - that it is entirely so. Quite the contrary, Chatat and Asham are stringent, that they atone.

hebrew_text: וְכוּלְּהוּ חֲמִירִי מֵעוֹלָה, דְּאִית בְּהוּ שְׁתֵּי אֲכִילוֹת!
human_translation: And all stringent than the burnt-offering because there are two consumptions with regard to
llm_translation: And all the stringent laws of the burnt offering, for they have two eatings!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי דְּיָלְידָא אִימֵּיהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? דִּלְמַאי דִּסְבִירָא לֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ, מְסָרֵס לֵיהּ לִקְרָא וְדָרֵישׁ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, what whose mother is bearing like Rabbi Shimon, that to what he himself holds, he transposes the verse and interprets it.
llm_translation: Rather, what is the reason that his mother called him Rabbi Shimon? Perhaps because she thought to herself, "I will dedicate him to the Torah and teach him."

hebrew_text: וְכִי מַזְהִירִין מִן הַדִּין? הָא אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר עוֹנְשִׁין מִן הַדִּין, אֵין מַזְהִירִין מִן הַדִּין! אִיסּוּרָא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: And does one a prohibition from inference? But even according to the one who says one administers punishment on inference, one does not a prohibition from inference. a mere prohibition.
llm_translation: And are we cautious about the law? Behold, even according to the one who says punishments are from the law, we are not cautious about the law! It is a mere prohibition.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: זָר שֶׁאָכַל מִן הָעוֹלָה לִפְנֵי זְרִיקָה חוּץ לַחוֹמָה, לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לוֹקֶה חָמֵשׁ! חֲמִשָּׁה אִיסּוּרִין הָווּ.
human_translation: But doesn’t Rava say: a non-priest who ate of a burnt-offering before sprinkling outside the walls, according to Rabbi Shimon is flogged five they are five prohibitions.
llm_translation: And Rava said: A non-priest who ate from the burnt offering before the sprinkling outside the wall, according to Rabbi Shimon, receives lashes five! There were five prohibitions.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן: אֵלּוּ הֵן הַלּוֹקִין!
human_translation: But didn’t we learn And these are who are flogged
llm_translation: And we have learned: These are the ones who receive lashes!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא קְרָא יַתִּירָא הוּא, מִכְּדֵי כְּתִיב ״וְהֵבֵאתָ שָׁם וְאָכַלְתָּ לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ בַּמָּקוֹם וְגוֹ׳״, לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״לֹא תוּכַל לְאוֹכְלָם״, מִיהְדָּר מְפָרֵשׁ בְּהוּ רַחֲמָנָא לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Rather, is a superfluous verse. After all, it is written: “And there you shall bring and there you shall eat before the Lord your God” Let the Merciful One write You may not eat them, Why do I the Merciful One again enumerate detail them?
llm_translation: Rather, it is an extra verse, as it is written, "And you shall bring there and eat before the Lord your God in the place, etc." (Deuteronomy 12:26). The Merciful One should have written, "You shall not be able to eat them." Why did the Merciful One explain it in this way to me?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְיַחוֹדֵי לְהוּ לָאוֵי לְכׇל חַד וְחַד.
human_translation: Rather, to designate prohibitions for each and every one
llm_translation: Rather, for the uniqueness of each and every one.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רָבָא: זָר שֶׁאָכַל מִן הָעוֹלָה לִפְנֵי זְרִיקָה חוּץ לַחוֹמָה – לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לוֹקֶה חָמֵשׁ. וְלִילְקֵי נָמֵי מִשּׁוּם: ״וְזָר לֹא יֹאכַל כִּי קֹדֶשׁ הֵם״! הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דִּלְכֹהֲנִים חֲזֵי, הָכָא דִּלְכֹהֲנִים נָמֵי לָא חֲזֵי.
human_translation: the itself, Rava says: a non-priest who ate of a burnt-offering before sprinkling outside the walls, according to Rabbi Shimon is flogged five And let him also be flogged “And a non-priest may not eat, as they are sacred” This matter where is fit by priests. Here, where is not fit by priests either,
llm_translation: The body, Rava said: A non-priest who ate from the burnt offering before the sprinkling outside the wall - according to Rabbi Shimon, he receives lashes. And it is taught similarly in the name of: "And a stranger shall not eat, for they are holy!" Those matters where it is seen for the priests, here where it is not seen for the priests.

hebrew_text: וְלִילְקֵי נָמֵי מִשּׁוּם ״וּבָשָׂר בַּשָּׂדֶה טְרֵפָה לֹא תֹאכֵלוּ״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁיָּצָא בָּשָׂר חוּץ לִמְחִיצָתוֹ – נֶאֱסָר! הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּבִפְנִים חֲזֵי, הָכָא דִּבְפָנִים נָמֵי לָא חֲזֵי.
human_translation: And let him also be flogged for “And any flesh torn of animals in the field you shall not eat” Once the flesh emerged outside its partition forbidden. This matter, where is fit inside Here, where is not fit inside either,
llm_translation: And regarding the words of Naḥum from the verse "And you shall not eat flesh torn in the field," once the flesh has exited beyond its boundary - it becomes prohibited! These matters apply where it is visible from the inside, but here, where it is not visible from the inside, it is not visible.

hebrew_text: וְלִילְקֵי נָמֵי כִּדְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: ״לֹא יֵאָכֵל כִּי קֹדֶשׁ הוּא״,
human_translation: And let him also be flogged in accordance with of Rabbi Eliezer. As Rabbi Eliezer says “It shall not be eaten because it is sacred”
llm_translation: And for the disciples of Nami like Rabbi Eliezer, for Rabbi Eliezer said: "It shall not be eaten, for it is holy."

hebrew_text: כֹּל שֶׁבַּקֹּדֶשׁ פָּסוּל – בָּא הַכָּתוּב לִיתֵּן לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה עַל אֲכִילָתוֹ! הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּקוֹדֶם פְּסוּלוֹ חֲזֵי, הָכָא דְּקוֹדֶם פְּסוּלוֹ נָמֵי לָא חֲזֵי.
human_translation: any that is sacrificial disqualified the verse comes to impose a prohibition upon its consumption. This matter where before its disqualification it was fit; here, where before its disqualification it was not fit either,
llm_translation: All that is disqualified in the Temple - the verse comes to say "Do not do it for his consumption!" These matters, where its disqualification is seen beforehand, here, where its disqualification is not seen beforehand either.

hebrew_text: וְלִילְקֵי נָמֵי כְּאִידַּךְ דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל שֶׁהוּא בְּ״כָלִיל תִּהְיֶה״ – לִיתֵּן לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה עַל אֲכִילָתוֹ! אִין הָכִי נָמֵי, וְרָבָא – מֵהַאי קְרָא קָאָמַר.
human_translation: And let him also be flogged in accordance with the other of Rabbi Eliezer, as it is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: any that is in “It shall be burned in its entirety” to impose a prohibition upon its consumption, Yes, it is indeed so and Rava is saying from this verse
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And the disciples of Neemiah are like the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer. As it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says, "Anything that is 'completely forbidden' – one should not perform a positive action for its consumption!" Is it not so? And Rava – from this verse he speaks. English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: (סִימָן כּוּזָא) כֹּהֵן שֶׁאָכַל מֵחַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם לִפְנֵי זְרִיקָה – לוֹקֶה. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְאָכְלוּ אֹתָם אֲשֶׁר כֻּפַּר בָּהֶם״, לְאַחַר כַּפָּרָה – אִין, לִפְנֵי כַּפָּרָה – לָא. לָאו הַבָּא מִכְּלַל עֲשֵׂה, – לָאו הוּא.
human_translation: Rav Giddel says Rav says a mnemonic Kaf , vav , zayin , alef . A priest who ate of a sin-offering or a guilt-offering before sprinkling is flogged. What is the reason as the verse states “And they shall eat them, that with which they were atoned” After atonement, yes, before atonement, no, a prohibition that stems from a positive mitzva is a prohibition,
llm_translation: Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav: (Siman Kuz'a) A Kohen who ate from a Chatat and Asham offering before the sprinkling – receives lashes. What is the reason? As the verse states: "And they shall eat those things wherewith atonement was made," after atonement – no, before atonement – yes. Is it not a positive commandment that comes as part of a general principle? – It is not.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבָא: ״וְכׇל בְּהֵמָה מַפְרֶסֶת פַּרְסָה וְשֹׁסַעַת שֶׁסַע שְׁתֵּי פְרָסוֹת מַעֲלַת גֵּרָה בַּבְּהֵמָה אֹתָהּ תֹּאכֵלוּ״, ״אֹתָהּ תֹּאכֵלוּ״ – וְאֵין בְּהֵמָה אַחֶרֶת תֹּאכֵלוּ. וְאִי כִּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ, ״אֶת זֶה לֹא תֹאכְלוּ״ לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Rava raises an objection “And every beast that splits the hoof and has the hoof cloven in two, and chews the cud among the animals, that, you may eat” “That, you may eat,” but not other animal you may eat. And if as you say, why do I “This you may not eat”
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: "And every animal that splits the hoof and chews the cud, you shall eat it" (Deuteronomy 14:6), "you shall eat it" - and you shall not eat any other animal. And if, as you say, "you shall not eat this" - why do I need it?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אִיתְּמַר הָכִי אִיתְּמַר, אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: זָר שֶׁאָכַל מֵחַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם לִפְנֵי זְרִיקָה – פָּטוּר, מַאי טַעְמָא – דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְאָכְלוּ אֹתָם אֲשֶׁר כֻּפַּר בָּהֶם״, כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּקָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״וְאָכְלוּ אוֹתָם אֲשֶׁר כֻּפַּר בָּהֶם״ – קָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״וְזָר לֹא יֹאכַל קֹדֶשׁ״, וְכֹל הֵיכָא דְּלָא קָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״וְאָכְלוּ אֹתָם אֲשֶׁר כֻּפַּר בָּהֶם״ – לָא קָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״וְזָר לֹא יֹאכַל״.
human_translation: Rather, if it was stated, this was stated: Rav Giddel says Rav says: A non-priest who ate of a sin-offering or a guilt-offering before sprinkling exempt What is the reason as the verse states: “And they shall eat them, that with which they were atoned… Anywhere that we read concerning it: “And they shall eat them, that with which they were atoned,” we read concerning it: “And a non-priest may not eat sacrificial food.” But anywhere that we do not read concerning it: “And they shall eat them, that with which they were atoned,” we do not read concerning it: “And a non-priest may not eat.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, if it was stated thus, it was stated thus. Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav: A non-priest who ate from a sin-offering and guilt-offering before the sprinkling – is exempt. What is the reason? As the verse states: "And they shall eat those things wherewith atonement was made," wherever we find the phrase "And they shall eat those things wherewith atonement was made" – we find the prohibition "And a stranger shall not eat holy things." And wherever we do not find the phrase "And they shall eat those things wherewith atonement was made" – we do not find the prohibition "And a stranger shall not eat."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָה: בִּכּוּרִים, הַנָּחָה מְעַכֶּבֶת בָּהֶן, קְרִיָּיה אֵין מְעַכֶּבֶת בָּהֶן.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Hoshaya says: first fruits, placement invalidates them, recitation does not invalidate them.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Hoshaya: Bikurim, resting delays them, reading does not delay them.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הָכִי? וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא: הִפְרִישׁ בִּכּוּרִים קוֹדֶם לֶחָג, וְעָבַר עֲלֵיהֶן הֶחָג – יֵרָקְבוּ. מַאי לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא מָצֵי לְמִיקְרֵי עֲלֵיהֶן? וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ קְרִיָּיה אֵין מְעַכֶּבֶת בָּהֶן, אַמַּאי יֵרָקְבוּ?
human_translation: And did Rabbi Elazar say that? But doesn’t Rabbi Elazar say Rabbi Hoshaya says: set aside first fruits before the festival and the Festival elapsed over them they shall decay, What, is it not due to that he can no recite over them, And if it enters your mind recitation does not invalidate them, why must they decay?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who said it, Rabbi Elazar the Khi? But didn't Rabbi Elazar say, Rabbi Hoshaya said: Separate the first fruits before the festival, and if the festival passes over them - they become invalid. What, is it not because they cannot be read upon? And if according to your opinion, the reading does not invalidate them, why do they become invalid?

hebrew_text: כִּדְרַבִּי זֵירָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: כׇּל הָרָאוּי לְבִילָּה – אֵין בִּילָּה מְעַכֶּבֶת בּוֹ, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לְבִילָּה – בִּילָּה מְעַכֶּבֶת בּוֹ.
human_translation: in accordance with of Rabbi Zeira, as Rabbi Zeira says any that suitable for mixing mixing does not invalidate And any that not suitable for mixing mixing invalidates
llm_translation: As Rabbi Zeira said: Rabbi Zeira said: Anyone fit for intercourse - intercourse does not impede him, and anyone unfit for intercourse - intercourse impedes him.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב מַתְנֵי לַהּ כִּדְרַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וְקַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אַדְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בִּכּוּרִים הַנָּחָה מְעַכֶּבֶת בָּהֶן קְרִיָּיה אֵין מְעַכֶּבֶת בָּהֶן? וְהָא בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי אַסִּי מֵרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בִּכּוּרִים מֵאֵימָתַי מוּתָּרִין לְכֹהֲנִים? וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָרְאוּיִן לִקְרִיָּיה – מִשֶּׁקָּרָא עֲלֵיהֶן, וְשֶׁאֵין רְאוּיִן לִקְרִיָּיה – מִשֶּׁרָאוּ פְּנֵי הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: Rabbi Aḥa bar Ya’akov teaches as that Rabbi Asi Rabbi Yoḥanan says, and of Rabbi Yoḥanan and of Rabbi Yoḥanan difficult for him. And did Rabbi Yoḥanan say first fruits, placement invalidates them recitation does not invalidate them? But didn’t Rabbi Asi raise a dilemma before Rabbi Yoḥanan: first fruits, from when is it permitted for priests And said to that are fit for recitation from when he recites over them, and that are not fit for recitation once they entered inside the Temple.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ahah bar Yaakov teaches it according to Rabbi Assi who said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan, and it is difficult for him according to Rabbi Yochanan to say again in the name of Rabbi Yochanan. And who did Rabbi Yochanan say that with firstborn animals, if they have a blemish, it does not disqualify them? And Rabbi Assi asked Rabbi Yochanan: From when are firstborn animals permitted for the priests? And he said to him: Those fit for blemish - from when the verse is read over them, and those not fit for blemish - from when they are shown to the entrance of the house.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא קְרִיָּיה אַקְּרִיָּיה, קַשְׁיָא הַנָּחָה אַהַנָּחָה!
human_translation: recitation and recitation difficult; placement and placement difficult.
llm_translation: The translation of the text is as follows: "Kashya kriya akriya, kashya hanacha ahanacha!"

hebrew_text: קְרִיָּיה אַקְּרִיָּה לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, הָא רַבָּנַן. הַנָּחָה אַהַנָּחָה נָמֵי לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְהָא רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: recitation and recitation not difficult, this Rabbi Shimon and that the Rabbis. placement and placement not difficult either, this Rabbi Yehuda, and that the Rabbis.
llm_translation: The city I will call it not difficult: this is Rabbi Shimon, this is the Rabbis. The resting I will call it not difficult: this is Rabbi Yehuda, and this is the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: מַאי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה? דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״וְהִנַּחְתּוֹ״ – זוֹ תְּנוּפָה. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר זוֹ תְּנוּפָה, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא הַנָּחָה מַמָּשׁ? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״וְהִנִּיחוֹ״ – הֲרֵי הַנָּחָה אָמוּר, הָא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״וְהִנַּחְתּוֹ״ – זוֹ תְּנוּפָה.
human_translation: What Rabbi Yehuda? as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says “And you shall place it this waving Do you say this waving, or it is only actual placement When it states and place it placement is stated; how do I realize “And you shall place it”? This waving.
llm_translation: What is Rabbi Yehuda? For it was taught, Rabbi Yehuda says: "And you shall set it down" - this is waving. Do you say this is waving, or is it only actual setting down? When it says "And he shall place it" - behold, actual placing is said, so how do I fulfill "And you shall set it down" - this is waving.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן תַּנָּא דִּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְלָקַח הַכֹּהֵן הַטֶּנֶא מִיָּדֶךָ״ – לִימֵּד עַל הַבִּכּוּרִים שֶׁטְּעוּנִין תְּנוּפָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב?
human_translation: And who is the tanna who disagrees with Rabbi Yehuda? It is Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, as it is taught “And the priest shall take the basket from your hand” taught about first fruits that they require waving, the statement of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov. What is the reason of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who is the Tanna who disputes with regard to the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda? It is Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, as it was taught: "And the priest shall take the basket from your hand" - this teaches about the first fruits that require waving, the words of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov. What is the reason for Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov's opinion?

hebrew_text: אָתְיָא ״יָד״ ״יָד״ מִשְּׁלָמִים: כְּתִיב הָכָא ״וְלָקַח הַכֹּהֵן הַטֶּנֶא מִיָּדֶךָ״, וּכְתִיב ״יָדָיו תְּבִיאֶינָה אֵת אִשֵּׁי ה׳״, מָה כָּאן כֹּהֵן – אַף לְהַלָּן כֹּהֵן, מָה לְהַלָּן בְּעָלִים – אַף כָּאן בְּעָלִים. הָא כֵּיצַד? מַנִּיחַ כֹּהֵן יָדָיו תַּחַת יְדֵי בְּעָלִים וּמֵנִיף.
human_translation: is derived “hand” from “hand” a peace-offering. It is written here, “And the priest shall take the basket from your hand” and it is written his hands shall bring it, the fire of God… Just as here, priest so too there, a priest Just as there, owner so too here, owner How so; priest places his hands beneath the hands of the owner and waves
llm_translation: The Gemara raises a contradiction: It is written here "and the priest shall take the basket from your hand," and it is written "his hands shall bring the offerings of the Lord." Just as here regarding the priest - so too there, regarding the priest. Just as there, with owners - so too here with owners. How so? The priest places his hands beneath the hands of the owners and waves.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא בַּר אַדָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: בִּכּוּרִים
human_translation: Rava bar Adda says Rabbi Yitzḥak says: first fruits,
llm_translation: Rava son of Adda said Rabbi Yitzchak said: Bikkurim.

hebrew_text: מֵאֵימָתַי (מ)חַיָּיבִין עֲלֵיהֶם – מִשֶּׁיִּרְאוּ פְּנֵי הַבַּיִת. כְּמַאן – כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: בִּכּוּרִים מִקְצָתָן בַּחוּץ וּמִקְצָתָן בִּפְנִים, שֶׁבַּחוּץ – הֲרֵי הֵן כְּחוּלִּין לְכׇל דִּבְרֵיהֶם, שֶׁבִּפְנִים – הֲרֵי הֵן כְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ לְכׇל דִּבְרֵיהֶם.
human_translation: from when is liable for their from when will enter inside the Temple. In accordance with whose in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: first fruits, some of which outside and some of which inside that are outside like non-sacred for all matters concerning them, that are inside like consecrated for all matters concerning them.
llm_translation: From when are they obligated concerning them? - From when they see the face of the house. According to whom? - Like this Tanna, as it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: Some of the first fruits are outside and some are inside, those that are outside are like common things in all their matters, those that are inside are like holy things in all their matters.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: בִּכּוּרִים, הַנָּחָה – מְעַכֶּבֶת בָּהֶן, קְרִיָּיה – אֵין מְעַכֶּבֶת בָּהֶן.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet says: first fruits, placement invalidates them; recitation does not invalidate them.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: Bikurim, Hanacha - me'akhevet bahen, kriya - ein me'akhevet bahen.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן – כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים מִשּׁוּם שְׁלֹשָׁה זְקֵנִים, רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: יָכוֹל יַעֲלֶה אָדָם מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, וְיֹאכְלֶנּוּ? וְדִין הוּא: בְּכוֹר טָעוּן הֲבָאַת מָקוֹם, וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי טָעוּן הֲבָאַת מָקוֹם, מָה בְּכוֹר אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בִּפְנֵי הַבַּיִת – אַף מַעֲשֵׂר אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בִּפְנֵי הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: In accordance with whose in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Yosei says three statements in the name of three elders, Rabbi Yishmael says: might a person would bring second-tithe up to Jerusalem in the present, and eat it. And it a logical inference A firstborn requires bringing to place, and -tithe requires bringing to place; just as firstborn only in the presence of the Temple, so too, -tithe only in the presence of the Temple.
llm_translation: As who - for this Mishnah, as it was taught: Rabbi Yosei says three things in the name of three elders, Rabbi Yishmael says: Can a person ascend with a second tithe in Jerusalem at this time, and eat it? And it is just: The firstborn requires bringing to a specific place, and the second tithe requires bringing to a specific place, just as the firstborn is only in front of the house - so too the tithe is only in front of the house.

hebrew_text: מָה לִבְכוֹר שֶׁכֵּן טָעוּן מַתַּן דָּמִים וְאֵימוּרִין לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ! בִּכּוּרִים יוֹכִיחוּ. מָה לְבִכּוּרִים, שֶׁכֵּן טְעוּנִים הַנָּחָה!
human_translation: What about a firstborn? that it requires placement of blood and sacrificial portions upon the altar; First fruits will prove What about first fruits? in that they require placement
llm_translation: Firstborn animals require both blood offerings and verbal declarations at the altar! The firstborns will prove. Just as firstborns, so too they require resting!

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְאָכַלְתָּ [שָּׁם] לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ וְגוֹ׳״ – מַקִּישׁ מַעֲשֵׂר לִבְכוֹר, מָה בְּכוֹר אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לִפְנֵי הַבַּיִת – אַף מַעֲשֵׂר אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לִפְנֵי הַבַּיִת. וְאִם אִיתָא, לִיפְרוֹךְ: מָה לְבִכּוּרִים – שֶׁכֵּן טְעוּנִין קְרִיָּיה וְהַנָּחָה!
human_translation: the verse states: “And you shall eat before the Lord your God… juxtaposes tithe to firstborn. Just as firstborn only in the presence of the Temple, so too, -tithe only in the presence of the Temple. And if it is so let refute What about first fruits? in that they require recitation and placement
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And you shall eat there before the Lord your God, etc." - it compares tithing to firstborn. Just as firstborn is only before the house, so too tithing is only before the house. And if you wish, you can explain: Just as firstborns - because they require reading and resting!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: נְהִי דְּעִיכּוּבָא לֵיכָּא, מִצְוָה מִי לֵיכָּא? וְלֵימָא מִצְוָה וְלִיפְרוֹךְ! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא בִּכּוּרֵי הַגֵּר, דְּבָעֵי לְמֵימַר אֲשֶׁר נִשְׁבַּע [ה׳] לַאֲבֹתֵינוּ״, וְלָא מָצֵי אָמַר – לָא פְּסִיקָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Although does not invalidate is there no mitzva? And let say a mitzva and refute Rather, Rav Ashi said that there is the first fruits of a convert, who needs to recite: that the Lord swore unto our fathers” and he cannot say is not clear-cut for
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: "Even though the writing is present, is there a commandment present? And should we say there is a commandment and it should be fulfilled! Rather, Rav Ashei said: Since there are converts among us, who need to say 'which the Lord swore to our fathers,' and it cannot be said - it does not cease for him."

hebrew_text: וְלִיהְדַּר דִּינָא וְתֵיתֵי בַּ״מָּה הַצַּד״! מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְהַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן, שֶׁכֵּן יֵשׁ בָּהֶן צַד מִזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: And let the derivation revert and derive through the common factor due to that can be refuted: What about the common factor of in that they have an aspect altar,
llm_translation: And to honor the judgment and place it in "what is the side"! Because there is to differentiate: what is the equal side in them, for in them there is a side of the altar.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קָסָבַר? אִי קָסָבַר קְדוּשָּׁה רִאשׁוֹנָה קִדְּשָׁה לִשְׁעָתָהּ וְקִדְּשָׁה לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא – בְּכוֹר נָמֵי, אִי קָסָבַר קְדוּשָּׁה רִאשׁוֹנָה קִדְּשָׁה לִשְׁעָתָהּ וְלֹא קִדְּשָׁה לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא – אֲפִילּוּ בְּכוֹר נָמֵי תִּבְּעֵי!
human_translation: And what does hold If maintains the initial consecration sanctified for its time and sanctified forever, also a firstborn If he maintains the initial consecration sanctified for its time but did not sanctify forever, raise a dilemma even a firstborn,
llm_translation: And what does he hold? If he holds that the first sanctification is sanctified for its time and sanctified for the future - the firstborn is fitting. If he holds that the first sanctification is sanctified for its time but not sanctified for the future - even the firstborn requires!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: לְעוֹלָם קָסָבַר קִדְּשָׁה לִשְׁעָתָהּ וְלֹא קִדְּשָׁה לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא, וְהָכָא בִּבְכוֹר שֶׁנִּזְרַק דָּמוֹ קוֹדֶם חוּרְבַּן הַבַּיִת, וְחָרַב הַבַּיִת וַעֲדַיִין בְּשָׂרוֹ קַיָּים. וּמַקְּשִׁינַן בְּשָׂרוֹ לְדָמוֹ, מָה דָּמוֹ בַּמִּזְבֵּחַ – אַף בְּשָׂרוֹ בַּמִּזְבֵּחַ. וּמַקִּישׁ מַעֲשֵׂר לִבְכוֹר.
human_translation: Ravina said: Actually, maintains sanctified for its time but did not sanctify forever; and here, with regard to a firstborn whose blood was sprinkled before the destruction of the Temple, and the Temple was destroyed, and its flesh is still intact. And we compare its flesh to its blood; just as its blood at altar so too its flesh at the altar And he compares tithe to a firstborn
llm_translation: Ravina said: Always he holds that it was sanctified for its time and not sanctified for the future to come, and here in the case of a firstborn whose blood was sprinkled before the destruction of the Temple, and the Temple was destroyed, yet its flesh remains. And we compare its flesh to its blood, just as its blood is on the altar - so too its flesh is on the altar. And we compare tithes to firstborns.

hebrew_text: וְכִי דָּבָר הַלָּמֵד בְּהֶקֵּשׁ חוֹזֵר וּמְלַמֵּד בְּהֶקֵּשׁ? מַעְשַׂר דָּגָן חוּלִּין הוּא.
human_translation: And does a matter derived via juxtaposition then teach via juxtaposition? tithe of grain is non-sacred
llm_translation: "And is it a matter that one learns through difficulty, he goes back and teaches through difficulty? Tithing grain is a secular matter."

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בָּתַר לָמֵד אָזְלִינַן, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בָּתַר מְלַמֵּד אָזְלִינַן, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says: we follow is derived But according to the one who says: We follow teaches, what is there to say?
llm_translation: We leave it for the one who says "afterwards we learn" - we go, but for the one who says "afterwards teaches" - we go, what is there to say?

hebrew_text: דָּם וּבָשָׂר חֲדָא מִילְּתָא הִיא.
human_translation: blood and flesh are one matter.
llm_translation: Blood and flesh - one matter it is.

hebrew_text: קׇדְשֵׁי קֳדָשִׁים וְכוּ׳. תְּנֵינָא חֲדָא זִימְנָא: מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי וְהֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁלֹּא נִפְדּוּ! אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: סֵיפָא בְּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי טָהוֹר וְגַבְרָא טָהוֹר, דְּקָא אָכֵיל חוּץ לַחוֹמָה. רֵישָׁא בְּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי טָמֵא וְגַבְרָא טָמֵא, וְקָא אָכֵיל לֵיהּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: offerings of the most sacred order we learn one time second-tithe or sacrificial that was not redeemed Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: the latter clause, in ritually pure second-tithe and a ritually pure person who eats outside the wall The first clause, in ritually impure second-tithe and a ritually impure person who eats within Jerusalem.
llm_translation: The holy of holies, etc. We learned in one place: Second tithe and consecrated property that have not been redeemed! Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said: The latter part refers to pure second tithe and a pure person, who eats outside the wall. The former part refers to impure second tithe and an impure person, who eats it in Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָלַן דְּמִחַיַּיב עֲלֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם טוּמְאָה? דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא בִּעַרְתִּי מִמֶּנּוּ בְּטָמֵא״ – בֵּין שֶׁאֲנִי טָמֵא וְהוּא טָהוֹר, בֵּין שֶׁאֲנִי טָהוֹר וְהוּא טָמֵא. וְהֵיכָן מוּזְהָר עַל אֲכִילָה אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ.
human_translation: And from where do we that one is liable due to impurity? as it is taught Rabbi Shimon says “I have not put any of it away when impure” Whether I am impure and is ritually pure, whether I am ritually pure and is impure. And I do not know where one is warned, with regard to eating.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we derive that one is liable for it due to impurity? For it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says, "I did not burn it while impure" - whether I am impure and it is pure, or I am pure and it is impure. And where is one warned about eating it, I do not know.

hebrew_text: טוּמְאַת הַגּוּף – בְּהֶדְיָא כְּתִיב: ״נֶפֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר תִּגַּע בּוֹ וְטָמְאָה עַד הָעָרֶב וְלֹא יֹאכַל מִן הַקֳּדָשִׁים וְגוֹ׳״ אֶלָּא: טוּמְאַת עַצְמוֹ מִנַּיִן?
human_translation: impurity of the body explicitly written: “A soul that touches it shall be impure until the evening and shall not eat of the consecrated food” But the impurity of itself, from where
llm_translation: Impurity of the body - in the Hadaya it is written: "Any person who touches him and becomes impure until evening shall not eat of the holy things, etc." Rather: How do we know the impurity of the body itself?

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא תוּכַל לֶאֱכֹל בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ״. וּלְהַלָּן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ תֹּאכְלֶנּוּ הַטָּמֵא וְהַטָּהוֹר״,
human_translation: as it is written “You may not eat within your gates and later, states: “Within your gates you may eat it, the impure and the pure
llm_translation: It is written: "You shall not be able to eat within your gates." And elsewhere it says: "Within your gates you shall eat it, the impure and the pure."

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: אֲפִילּוּ טָמֵא וְטָהוֹר אוֹכְלִין בִּקְעָרָה אַחַת וְאֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין, וְקָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: הַאיְךְ טָמֵא דִּשְׁרַי לָךְ גַּבֵּי טָהוֹר הָתָם – הָכָא לָא תֵּיכוֹל.
