human_translation: And it is taught of the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Even a ritually pure and a ritually impure person may eat in one dish and not be concerned, And the Merciful One says: that impure that is permitted for you with a ritually pure there, here, you may not eat
llm_translation: And it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Even if one who is impure and one who is pure eat from one bowl, they are not concerned. And the Merciful One says: How is it permitted for you, impure one, in the case of the pure one there – here you cannot.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָא לַן דְּבַר פְּדִיָּיה הוּא?
human_translation: And from where do we that is subject to redemption?
llm_translation: And count for us, is it a matter of redemption?

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מִנַּיִן לְמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי שֶׁנִּטְמָא שֶׁפּוֹדִין אוֹתוֹ אֲפִילּוּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּי לֹא תוּכַל שְׂאֵתוֹ.״ – וְאֵין ״שְׂאֵת״ אֶלָּא אֲכִילָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וַיִּשָּׂא מַשְׂאֹת מֵאֵת פָּנָיו״.
human_translation: as Rabbi Elazar says: From where with regard to second-tithe that became impure that may redeem it even in Jerusalem? the verse states: “Because you are unable to carry it [ se’eto ], And se’et nothing other than eating, as it is stated: “And portions [ masot ] were taken to them from before him”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Elazar said: From where do we derive the law of the second tithe that became impure, that we redeem it even in Jerusalem? The verse teaches: "For you may not carry it." And "carry" refers only to consumption, as it is stated: "And he carried burdens from before his face." English translation: Rabbi Elazar said: From where do we derive the law of the second tithe that became impure, that we redeem it even in Jerusalem? The verse teaches: "For you may not carry it." And "carry" refers only to consumption, as it is stated: "And he carried burdens from before his face."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב בִּיבִי אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: מִנַּיִן לְמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי טָהוֹר שֶׁפּוֹדִין אוֹתוֹ אֲפִילּוּ בִּפְסִיעָה אַחַת חוּץ לַחוֹמָה? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי לֹא תוּכַל שְׂאֵתוֹ״. הַאי מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר!
human_translation: Rav Beivai says Rav Asi says: From where ritually pure second-tithe that may redeem it even one stride outside the wall as it is stated: “Because you are unable to carry it [ se’eto ],” That is necessary to of Rabbi Elazar
llm_translation: Rav Bevai said in the name of Rav Assi: From where do we derive that a second tithe that is pure, we redeem it even with one step outside the wall? As it is stated: "For you may not carry it." This question was asked according to Rabbi Elazar!

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, לֵימָא קְרָא ״לֹא תוּכַל לְאוֹכְלוֹ״, מַאי ״שְׂאֵתוֹ״? וְאֵימָא כּוּלּוֹ לְהָכִי הוּא דַּאֲתָא! אִם כֵּן, לֵימָא קְרָא ״לֹא תוּכַל לִיטְּלוֹ״, מַאי ״שְׂאֵתוֹ״? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: If so, let the verse state You are unable to eat it. What “ se’eto ”? And say comes entirely for this If so, let the verse state: You are unable to take it. Why “ se’eto ”? Conclude two from it:
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, let us say the verse "you shall not be able to eat it," what is "lift it up"? And let us say the entire thing is for this purpose that it came! If so, let us say the verse "you shall not be able to carry it," what is "lift it up"? Conclude from it two things.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַב חֲנִינָא וְרַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא, וְקָא מִבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: אַפִּיתְחָא דִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, מַהוּ? פְּשִׁיטָא, הוּא בַּחוּץ וּמַשָּׂאוֹ בִּפְנִים – קְלָטוּהוּ מְחִיצוֹת, הוּא בִּפְנִים וּמַשָּׂאוֹ בַּחוּץ, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Ḥanina and Rav Hoshaya sat, and a dilemma was raised before them: the entrance of Jerusalem, what is obvious one is outside and his burden is inside admitted the walls one is inside and his burden is outside what is
llm_translation: Sitting were Rav Chanina and Rav Hoshaya, and they were asking: The opening of Jerusalem, what? Obvious, it is outside and its carrying inside - its partitions absorbed it. It is inside and its carrying outside, what?

hebrew_text: תְּנָא לְהוּ הָהוּא סָבָא בִּדְבֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: ״כִּי יִרְחַק מִמְּךָ הַמָּקוֹם״ – מִמִּילּוּאֲךָ.
human_translation: A certain elder taught them of the school of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai. “As the place is too far from you [ mimmekha ]” From your fullness [ mimmilluakha ],
llm_translation: The Sage in the school of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai taught: "When the place is far from you" - from your words.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב פָּפָּא: נָקֵיט לֵיהּ בְּקַנְיָא, מַאי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa raises dilemma: one is holding on a reed, what shall stand
llm_translation: The question of Rav Papa: He took it with a reed, what? Let it stand.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי מֵאֵימָתַי חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו – מִשֶּׁרָאָה פְּנֵי הַחוֹמָה. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ תֹאכְלֶנּוּ (שָׁנָה בְשָׁנָה)״, וּכְתִיב ״(כִּי) לֹא תוּכַל לֶאֱכֹל בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ״, כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּקָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ תֹאכְלֶנּוּ״ – קָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״לֹא תוּכַל לֶאֱכוֹל בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ״. וְכֹל הֵיכָא דְּלָא קָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ תֹאכְלֶנּוּ״ – לָא קָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״לֹא תוּכַל לֶאֱכוֹל בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: second-tithe from when is one liable for it from when entered within the wall What is the reason as the verse states “Before the Lord your God you shall eat it” and it is written “You may not eat within your gates” Anywhere that we read concerning it: “Before the Lord your God you shall eat it,” we read concerning it “You may not eat within your gates,” and anywhere that we do not read concerning it: “Before the Lord your God you shall eat it,” we do not read concerning it “You may not eat within your gates.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: From when are we obligated to tithe the second tithe? From when one sees the face of the wall. What is the reason? As the verse states, "You shall eat it before the Lord your God in the place which He shall choose to place His name there" (Deuteronomy 14:23), and it is also written, "(For) you may not eat within your gates" (Deuteronomy 12:17). Wherever we find the phrase "before the Lord your God you shall eat it," we also find the phrase "you may not eat within your gates." And wherever we do not find the phrase "before the Lord your God you shall eat it," we do not find the phrase "you may not eat within your gates."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כֹּהֵן שֶׁעָלְתָה בְּיָדוֹ תְּאֵנָה שֶׁל טֶבֶל, אָמַר: תְּאֵנָה זוֹ, תְּרוּמָתָהּ בְּעוּקְצָהּ, מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן בִּצְפוֹנָהּ, וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי לִדְרוֹמָהּ. וְהִיא שְׁנַת מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי וְהוּא בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, אוֹ מַעְשַׂר עָנִי וְהוּא בִּגְבוּלִין, אֲכָלָהּ –
human_translation: The Gemara raises an objection Rabbi Yosei says: a priest that a fig of untithed produce came into his possession, he says: This fig, its teruma at its stem, first tithe at its north and second tithe at its south and it is a year second tithe and he is in Jerusalem, Or poor man’s tithe, and he is in the outlying areas, he ate
llm_translation: The Tanna raises an objection: Rabbi Yosei says: If a priest had in his possession a fig that is tevel, he declares: "This fig, its terumah is in its stem, the first tithe is in its north, and the second tithe is in its south. And it is the year of the second tithe, and it is in Jerusalem, or it is the poor tithe, and it is in the border regions, one may eat it –

hebrew_text: לוֹקֶה אַחַת.
human_translation: he is flogged one
llm_translation: One strike.

hebrew_text: וְזָר שֶׁאֲכָלָהּ – לוֹקֶה שְׁתַּיִם. שֶׁאִילּוּ בַּתְּחִלָּה אֲכָלָהּ – אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה אֶלָּא אַחַת.
human_translation: And a non-priest who eats is flogged two As if ate initially, he is flogged only one
llm_translation: "And a non-priest who ate it - receives two lashes. If he initially ate it - he only receives one."

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּאִיתֵיהּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, הָא בִּגְבוּלִין – לוֹקֶה שָׁלֹשׁ, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָאו רוֹאֶה פְּנֵי חוֹמָה! דְּעַיְּילַי[הּ] וְאַפְּקַי[הּ].
human_translation: the reason is that he is in Jerusalem, But in the outlying areas, he is flogged three that even if has not entered within the wall where they took into and took it out
llm_translation: Reason for which it is in Jerusalem, this in the borders - lashes three, even though he did not see the face of the wall! For he brought it in and took it out.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן דְּעַיְּילִינְהוּ בְּטִיבְלַיְיהוּ, וְקָסָבַר: מַתָּנוֹת שֶׁלֹּא הוּרְמוּ – כְּמִי שֶׁהוּרְמוּ דָּמְיָין.
human_translation: If so, what of stating what are we dealing with here? where one took they untithed produce, and holds gifts that were not separated like that were separated.
llm_translation: So what is there to say? Here, what are we dealing with? For example, when they bring them in with their rings, and he holds: gifts that were not lifted - are considered as if they were lifted.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַתָּנוֹת שֶׁלֹּא הוּרְמוּ כְּמִי שֶׁהוּרְמוּ דָּמֵי? וְהָתַנְיָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל עַל פֵּירוֹת שֶׁלֹּא נִגְמְרָה מְלַאכְתָּן וְעָבְרוּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם – שֶׁיִּפָּדֶה מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי שֶׁלָּהֶן וְיֵאָכֵל בְּכׇל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei hold gifts that were not separated like that were separated? But isn’t it taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Yosei: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree with regard to produce whose labor was not completed and passed through Jerusalem, that its second-tithe may be redeemed and may be eaten anywhere.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Yosei holds that gifts that were not separated are not considered as if they were separated? And it was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Yosei: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree regarding fruits that their work was not completed and they passed through Jerusalem - that one should redeem their second tithe and eat it anywhere.

hebrew_text: וְעַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ – עַל פֵּירוֹת שֶׁנִּגְמְרָה מְלַאכְתָּן וְעָבְרוּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: יַחְזִיר מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי שֶׁלָּהֶם וְיֵאָכֵל בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: יִפָּדֶה וְיֵאָכֵל בְּכׇל מָקוֹם. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ מַתָּנוֹת שֶׁלֹּא הוּרְמוּ כְּמִי שֶׁהוּרְמוּ דָּמְיָין – הָא קְלָטוּהוּ מְחִיצוֹת!
human_translation: With regard to what did they disagree? with regard to produce whose labor was completed and it passed through Jerusalem as Beit Shammai say: he must bring its second-tithe back and it shall be eaten in Jerusalem; and Beit Hillel say: may be redeemed and eaten anywhere. And if it enters your mind gifts that were not separated like that were separated, wasn’t admitted the walls
llm_translation: And on what did they argue? - On fruits that their work was completed and they passed through Jerusalem, for Beit Shammai say: Return their second tithe and eat it in Jerusalem, and Beit Hillel say: Redeem it and eat it anywhere. And if you think that gifts that were not separated as if they were separated are considered as if they were separated - behold, they have taken him in the partitions!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: מְחִיצָה לֶאֱכוֹל דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, מְחִיצָה לִקְלוֹט – דְּרַבָּנַן. וְכִי גְזוּר רַבָּנַן – כִּי אִיתֵיהּ בְּעֵינֵיהּ, בְּטִבְלֵיהּ לָא גְּזוּר רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rabba said: wall with regard to eating by Torah law; wall with regard to the admitting by rabbinic law. And when the Sages issued the decree when is in its unadulterated form in its untithed produce, the Sages did not issue a decree.
llm_translation: Rabah said: A partition for eating is of biblical origin, a partition for absorbing is of rabbinic origin. And when do the Rabbis decree? When it is in his eyes, but if it is for his immersion, the Rabbis do not decree.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן דְּנָקֵיט לֵיהּ בְּקַנְיָא. וְתִפְשׁוֹט בַּעְיָא דְּרַב פָּפָּא.
human_translation: Ravina said: where one is holding on a reed And resolve the dilemma of Rav Pappa
llm_translation: Ravina said: For example, when he entered with a reed. And he removed the cloak of Rav Papa.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַקּוֹרֵחַ קׇרְחָה בְּרֹאשׁוֹ וְהַמַּקִּיף פְּאַת רֹאשׁוֹ, וְהַמַּשְׁחִית פְּאַת זְקָנוֹ, וְהַשּׂוֹרֵט שְׂרִיטָה אַחַת עַל הַמֵּת – חַיָּיב. שָׂרַט שְׂרִיטָה אַחַת עַל חֲמִשָּׁה מֵתִים, אוֹ חָמֵשׁ שְׂרִיטוֹת עַל מֵת אֶחָד – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: One who creates a bald spot upon his head, and one who rounds the edge of his head and one who mars the edge of his beard, and one who cuts one incision over the dead, liable he cut one incision over five dead or five incisions over one dead liable for each and every one.
llm_translation: It was taught: One who shaves the crown of his head and leaves the corners, or one who destroys the corners of his beard, or one who makes a single scratch on a corpse - is liable. If he scratches five corpses once each, or scratches one corpse five times - he is liable for each and every one.

hebrew_text: עַל הָרֹאשׁ – שְׁתַּיִם, אַחַת מִכָּאן וְאַחַת מִכָּאן, עַל הַזָּקָן – שְׁתַּיִם מִכָּאן וּשְׁתַּיִם מִכָּאן, וְאַחַת מִלְּמַטָּה. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אִם נִיטְּלוּ כּוּלָּן כְּאַחַת – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת.
human_translation: For head, two one from here, and one from there, For beard two from here, and two from there, and one from below, Rabbi Eliezer says: If removed all in one he is liable only one
llm_translation: On the head - two, one from here and one from here, on the beard - two from here and two from here, and one from below. Rabbi Eliezer says: If they were all removed at once - he is only liable for one.

hebrew_text: וְאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיִּטְּלֶנּוּ בְּתַעַר. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ לִקְּטוֹ בְּמַלְקֵט אוֹ בִּרְהִיטָנִי – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: And one is liable only if he removes with a razor. Rabbi Eliezer says: Even if he removed with tweezers [ malket ] or with a plane [ rehitni ], liable
llm_translation: "And he is not liable until he removes it with a razor. Rabbi Eliezer says: Even if he gathered it with a sickle or with a rake - he is liable."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״לֹא יִקְרְחוּ״, יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ קָרַח אַרְבַּע וְחָמֵשׁ קְרִיחוֹת לֹא יְהֵא חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״קׇרְחָה״ – לְחַיֵּיב עַל כׇּל קׇרְחָה וְקׇרְחָה. ״בְּרֹאשָׁם״ מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״לֹא תִתְגֹּדְדוּ וְלֹא תָשִׂימוּ קׇרְחָה בֵּין עֵינֵיכֶם לָמֵת״, יָכוֹל לֹא יְהֵא חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל בֵּין הָעֵינַיִם בִּלְבַד, מִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת כָּל הָרֹאשׁ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בְּרֹאשָׁם״ – לְרַבּוֹת כׇּל הָרֹאשׁ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “They shall not create might even he created four or five bald spots he will be liable to only one the verse states: “Bald spot,” to liable for each and every bald “Upon their heads”; what the verse states Since it is stated: “You shall neither lacerate yourselves, nor place a bald spot between your eyes for the dead” might that one would be liable only for between the eyes. From where that includes the entire head? The verse states: “Upon their heads,” to include the entire head.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "They shall not shave." Could it be that even if one shaves four or five times, he should only be liable for one? The verse states "shave" - to obligate for each and every shaving. What is the meaning of "on their heads"? Because it is stated, "You shall not make any gashes in your flesh for the dead, nor incise any marks on yourselves; I am the Lord." Could it be that one should only be liable for between the eyes alone? How do we know to include the entire head? The verse states "on their heads" - to include the entire head.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לִי אֶלָּא בַּכֹּהֲנִים, שֶׁרִיבָּה בָּהֶן הַכָּתוּב מִצְוֹת יְתֵירוֹת, יִשְׂרָאֵל מִנַּיִן?
human_translation: And I have only with regard to priests, whom the Torah established numerous additional mitzvot, From where a non-priest
llm_translation: "And I have only with the priests, for the Scripture multiplied in them additional commandments, Israel from where?"

hebrew_text: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״קׇרְחָה״ וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״קׇרְחָה״, מָה לְהַלָּן חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל קׇרְחָה וְקׇרְחָה, וְחַיָּיב עַל הָרֹאשׁ כְּבֵין הָעֵינַיִם – אַף כָּאן חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל קׇרְחָה וְקׇרְחָה, וְחַיָּיב עַל הָרֹאשׁ כְּבֵין הָעֵינַיִם. וּמָה לְהַלָּן עַל מֵת – אַף כָּאן עַל מֵת.
human_translation: “Bald spot” is stated here and “bald spot” is stated there, just as there, liable for each and every bald spot and is liable for head as between the eyes, so too here, liable for each and every bald spot and is liable head as between the eyes. And just as there, over the dead; so too here, over the dead.
llm_translation: It is stated here "korcha" and it is stated there "korcha," just as there one is liable for every "korcha" and "korcha," and is liable for the head between the eyes - so too here one is liable for every "korcha" and "korcha," and is liable for the head between the eyes. And just as there one is liable for a dead person - so too here for a dead person.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי אַרְבַּע וְחָמֵשׁ קְרִיחוֹת הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה, וּבְחָמֵשׁ הַתְרָאוֹת – פְּשִׁיטָא!
human_translation: these four or five bald spots what are the circumstances? If we say one after the other and with five forewarnings, obvious
llm_translation: These four and five incense offerings, how much are they worth? If you say one after the other, and with five appearances - it is obvious!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בַּחֲדָא הַתְרָאָה, מִי מִחַיַּיב? וְהָתְנַן: נָזִיר שֶׁהָיָה שׁוֹתֶה יַיִן כׇּל הַיּוֹם – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: ״אַל תִּשְׁתֶּה״, ״אַל תִּשְׁתֶּה״, וְהוּא שׁוֹתֶה – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּסָךְ חֲמֵשׁ אֶצְבְּעוֹתָיו נָשָׁא וְאוֹתְבִינְהוּ בְּבַת אַחַת, דְּהָוְיָא לֵיהּ, הַתְרָאָה לְכׇל חֲדָא וַחֲדָא.
human_translation: Rather, with one forewarning; is one liable But didn’t we learn A nazirite who was drinking wine all day is liable only one said to him: Do not drink, do not drink, and he drinks liable for each and every No, is necessary only who, smeared his five fingers depilatory [ nasha ] and placed simultaneously as it is a forewarning for each and every
llm_translation: Rather, in the case of one warning, who is liable? And we learned in a Mishnah: A Nazirite who drank wine all day - he is only liable for one warning. They said to him, "Do not drink," "Do not drink," and he drank - he is liable for each and every one! It is not necessary, for he took five of his fingers and placed them together in one hand, so it would be considered as one warning for each and every one.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה שִׁיעוּר קׇרְחָה? רַב הוּנָא אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי שֶׁיֵּרָאֶה מֵרֹאשׁוֹ. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: כִּגְרִיס. כְּתַנָּאֵי: כַּמָּה שִׁיעוּר קׇרְחָה – כִּגְרִיס, אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: כְּדֵי שֶׁיֵּרָאֶה מֵרֹאשׁוֹ.
human_translation: And how much is the measure of a bald spot Rav Huna says: sufficient that will be visible on his head. Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon: a Cilician bean [ kigeris ]. parallel to tanna’im : And how much is the measure of a bald spot? a Cilician bean. Aḥerim say: sufficient that will be visible on his head.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And how much is the measure of a bald spot? Rav Huna says: Enough that it can be seen from his head. Rabbi Yochanan says in the name of Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon: Like a dried fig. As it was taught: How much is the measure of a bald spot – like a dried fig. Others say: Enough that it can be seen from his head."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בַּר חֲבִיבָא: פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ תְּלָתָא תַּנָּאֵי, חַד אוֹמֵר: כִּגְרִיס, וְחַד אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי שֶׁיֵּרָאֶה מֵרֹאשׁוֹ, וְחַד אוֹמֵר: כִּשְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת. וְאִיכָּא דְּמַפֵּיק שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת וּמְעַיֵּיל בְּכַעֲדָשָׁה. וְסִימָנָךְ: בַּהֶרֶת – כִּגְרִיס, וּמִחְיָה – בְּכַעֲדָשָׁה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda bar Ḥaviva said three tanna’im disagree concerning One says: a Cilician bean; and one says: sufficient that will be visible on his head; and one says: of two hairs. And there is one who removed two hairs, and inserted of a lentil. And your mnemonic a snow-white leprous mark [ baheret ] a Cilician bean, and raw a lentil.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah bar Chaviva said: They dispute in it three teachings, one says: like a bean, and one says: enough that it can be seen from its top, and one says: like two hairs. And there is one who removes two hairs and inserts it in a lentil. And your mnemonic: with leprosy - like a bean, and with a wound - in a lentil.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: הַנּוֹטֵל מְלֹא פִּי הַזּוּג בַּשַּׁבָּת – חַיָּיב. וְכַמָּה מְלֹא פִּי הַזּוּג? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: שְׁתַּיִם. וְהָתַנְיָא: לַקׇּרְחָה שְׁתַּיִם! אֵימָא: וְכֵן לַקׇּרְחָה שְׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: taught: One who removes a scissorsful [ melo pi hazug ] on Shabbat is liable. And how much is a scissorsful? Rav Yehuda says: Two But isn’t it taught For a bald spot two say: And likewise with regard to a bald spot two
llm_translation: Mishna: One who carries out the full mouth of a pair on Shabbat - is liable. And how much is the full mouth of a pair? Rav Yehudah said: Two. And it was taught: For the bald one, two! Say: And so for the bald one, two.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַנּוֹטֵל מְלֹא פִּי הַזּוּג בַּשַּׁבָּת חַיָּיב, וְכַמָּה מְלֹא פִּי הַזּוּג – שְׁתַּיִם. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אַחַת. וּמוֹדִים חֲכָמִים לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בִּמְלַקֵּט לְבָנוֹת מִתּוֹךְ שְׁחוֹרוֹת, אֲפִילּוּ אַחַת – שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב. וְדָבָר זֶה אֲפִילּוּ בְּחוֹל אָסוּר, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא יִלְבַּשׁ גֶּבֶר שִׂמְלַת אִשָּׁה״.
human_translation: That is also taught One who removes a scissorsful on Shabbat is liable. And how much is a scissorsful? two Rabbi Eliezer says: One And the Rabbis concede to Rabbi Eliezer in one who removes white from black even one that he is liable. And that matter is prohibited even during the week, due to that it is stated: “Neither shall a man don a woman’s garment”
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita in the name of the school of Hillel: One who carries out the full mouth of a pair of items on Shabbat is liable for a sin, and how much is the full mouth of a pair? Two. Rabbi Eliezer says: One. And the Sages agree with Rabbi Eliezer in the case of picking up items from among white items amidst black items, even one item - he is liable. And this matter is forbidden even on a weekday, as it is stated: "A man shall not wear a woman's garment."

hebrew_text: וְהַמַּקִּיף פְּאַת רֹאשׁוֹ וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״פְּאַת רֹאשׁוֹ״ – סוֹף רֹאשׁוֹ, וְאֵיזֶהוּ סוֹף רֹאשׁוֹ – זֶה הַמַּשְׁוֶה צְדָעָיו לַאֲחוֹרֵי אׇזְנוֹ וּלְפַדַּחְתּוֹ.
human_translation: And one who rounds the edge of his head The Sages taught: The edge of his head the extremity of his head. And what is the extremity of his head? This is one who levels his temples to behind his ear and to his forehead.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And the one who trims the corner of his head, etc." The Rabbis taught: "'The corner of his head' – the end of his head, and what is the end of his head? – this is one who aligns his sideburns to the back of his ear and to his forehead."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא: אֶחָד הַמַּקִּיף וְאֶחָד הַנִּיקָּף – לוֹקֶה. אָמַר לֵיהּ: מַאן דְּאָכֵיל תַּמְרֵי בְּאַרְבֵּילָא לָקֵי? דְּאָמַר לָךְ: מַנִּי – רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּאָמַר: לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה לוֹקִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: The tanna taught before Rav Ḥisda: Both one who rounds and one whom are rounded flogged. said to him: Is one who eats dates in a sieve [ arbeila ] flogged? who says to you: Who is it is Rabbi Yehuda, who says: a prohibition that does not involve an action, one is flogged for its
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rav Ḥisda: One who encircles and one who is encircled - is liable. He said to him: Who eats dates in Arbel, is he liable? I say to you: Who is it? It is Rabbi Yehuda, who said: If it does not involve an action, one is not liable for it.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אוֹמֵר: בְּמַקִּיף לְעַצְמוֹ, וְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל. רַב אָשֵׁי אוֹמֵר: בִּמְסַיֵּיעַ. וְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל.
human_translation: Rava says: to one who rounds for himself, and everyone agrees Rav Ashi says: where assists and everyone agrees
llm_translation: Rava says: "With a person who surrounds himself, and with the words of everyone." Rav Ashi says: "With a person who assists. And with the words of everyone."

hebrew_text: וְהַמַּשְׁחִית פְּאַת זְקָנוֹ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: פְּאַת זְקָנוֹ – סוֹף זְקָנוֹ, וְאֵיזֶהוּ סוֹף זְקָנוֹ – שִׁבּוֹלֶת זְקָנוֹ.
human_translation: And one who mars the edge of his beard The Sages taught: The edge of his beard the extremity of his beard. And what is the extremity of his beard? the stalk of his beard,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "And the one who destroys the corner of his beard. The Rabbis taught: 'The corner of his beard' - the end of his beard, and what is the end of his beard? The whiskers of his beard."

hebrew_text: וְהַמְשָׂרֵט שְׂרִיטָה אַחַת וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְשֶׂרֶט״ – יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ שָׂרַט עַל בֵּיתוֹ שֶׁנָּפַל וְעַל סְפִינָתוֹ שֶׁטָּבְעָה בַּיָּם? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לְנֶפֶשׁ״ – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל הַמֵּת בִּלְבַד. וּמִנַּיִן לַמְשָׂרֵט חָמֵשׁ שְׂרִיטוֹת עַל מֵת אֶחָד שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְשֶׂרֶט״ – לְחַיֵּיב עַל כׇּל שְׂרִיטָה וּשְׂרִיטָה.
human_translation: And one who cuts one incision over the dead The Sages taught “And an incision,” might even cut over his house that collapsed, or over his ship that sunk at sea. the verse states: “For the soul,” he is liable only for the dead alone. And from where that one who cuts five incisions over one dead is liable for each and every The verse states: “And an incision” to render liable for each and every incision.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And the one who makes one scratch, etc." The Rabbis taught: "'And a scratch' - could it be that even if he scratched his house that collapsed and his ship that sank in the sea? The Torah teaches: 'For a soul' - he is only liable for the dead alone. And from where do we derive that for making five scratches on one dead person he is liable for each and every one? The Torah teaches: 'And a scratch' - to obligate for each and every scratch."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן לַמְשָׂרֵט שְׂרִיטָה אַחַת עַל חֲמִשָּׁה מֵתִים, שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לְנֶפֶשׁ״ – לְחַיֵּיב עַל כׇּל נֶפֶשׁ וָנֶפֶשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: From where concerning one who cuts one incision over five dead that he is liable for each and every The verse states: “For the soul,” to render liable for each and every dead
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: From where do we derive that one who makes a single scratch on five corpses is liable for each and every one? The verse teaches "for a soul" - to obligate for each and every soul.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אַפֵּיקְתֵּיהּ לְבֵיתוֹ שֶׁנָּפַל וְלִסְפִינָתוֹ שֶׁטָּבְעָה בַּיָּם!
human_translation: But didn’t you derive over his house that collapsed, or over his ship that sunk at sea?
llm_translation: And this, his estate to his house that fell, and to his ship that sank in the sea!

hebrew_text: קָסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: שְׂרִיטָה וּגְדִידָה אַחַת הִיא, וּכְתִיב הָתָם ״לְמֵת״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei holds an incision and a laceration are one and it is written there, for the dead”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei holds: Scratching and cutting are one, and it is written there "for the dead."

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַמְשָׂרֵט בִּכְלִי – חַיָּיב. מֵיתִיבִי: שְׂרִיטָה וּגְדִידָה אַחַת הִיא, אֶלָּא שֶׁשְּׂרִיטָה בַּיָּד וּגְדִידָה בִּכְלִי! הוּא דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: Shmuel says: One who cuts [ mesaret ] with a utensil liable. raises an objection An incision [ serita ] and a laceration are one but an incision is by hand, a laceration is with a utensil. stated in accordance with Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: Shmuel said: One who scratches with a utensil - is liable. It was asked: A scratch and a furrow are the same thing, except that a scratch is with the hand and a furrow is with a utensil! This is what Rabbi Yosei said.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עַל מֵת, בֵּין בַּיָּד בֵּין בִּכְלִי – חַיָּיב, עַל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, בַּיָּד – חַיָּיב, בִּכְלִי – פָּטוּר. וְהָא אִיפְּכָא כְּתִיב: ״וַיִּתְגֹּדְדוּ כְּמִשְׁפָּטָם בַּחֲרָבוֹת וּבָרְמָחִים״! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: בַּיָּד – פָּטוּר, בִּכְלִי – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: A tanna taught before Rabbi Yoḥanan: over a dead whether by hand or with a utensil, liable. for idolatry, by hand, liable, with a utensil, exempt. But isn’t the reverse written “And they lacerated themselves in accordance with their custom, with swords and lances” Rather, say: by hand, exempt; with a utensil, liable.
llm_translation: The Mishna was taught before Rabbi Yochanan: Regarding a dead body, whether by hand or by vessel - one is liable. Regarding idol worship, by hand - one is liable, by vessel - exempt. But isn't it the opposite as it is written: "And they were torn as their judgment with swords and spears"! Rather say: by hand - exempt, by vessel - liable.

hebrew_text: וְחַיָּיב עַל הָרֹאשׁ. מַחְוֵי רַב שֵׁשֶׁת בֵּין פִּירְקֵי רֵישָׁא. וְעַל הַזָּקָן, שְׁתַּיִם מִכָּאן וּשְׁתַּיִם מִכָּאן וְאַחַת מִלְּמַטָּה. מַחְוֵי רַב שֵׁשֶׁת בֵּין פִּירְקֵי דִּיקְנָא.
human_translation: And for head, liable Rav Sheshet gesture between the parts of the head, For beard two from here, and two from there, and one from below, Rav Sheshet gesture between the parts of the beard.
llm_translation: "And liable on the head. Like Rav Sheshet between the sections of the beginning. And on the elder, two from here and two from here and one from below. Like Rav Sheshet between the sections of the courtyard."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אִם נְטָלָן וְכוּ׳. קָסָבַר: חַד לָאו הוּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: If he removed He maintains is a single prohibition,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: "If he took them, etc." He holds: "It is one negative."

hebrew_text: וְאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיִּטְּלֶנּוּ בְּתַעַר. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וּפְאַת זְקָנָם לֹא יְגַלֵּחוּ״, יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ גַּלָּחוֹ בְּמִסְפָּרַיִם יְהֵא חַיָּיב? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תַשְׁחִית״. אִי ״לֹא תַשְׁחִית״, יָכוֹל אִם לִקְּטוֹ בְּמַלְקֵט וּרְהִיטָנִי יְהֵא חַיָּיב? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא יְגַלֵּחוּ״.
human_translation: And one is liable only if he removes with a razor. The Sages taught “And the edge of their beard they may not shave” might even if he shaved with scissors, he would be liable; the verse states: “You may not mar If “You may not mar,” might if he removed with tweezers or with a plane would be liable the verse states: “They may not shave,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And he is not liable until he shaves it with a razor. The Rabbis taught: "And they shall not shave the corners of their beards," can one say that even if he shaves with scissors he should be liable? The Torah teaches: "You shall not destroy." If "You shall not destroy," can one say that if he plucks it out with tweezers or rubs it off he should be liable? The Torah teaches: "They shall not shave."

hebrew_text: הָא כֵּיצַד – גִּילּוּחַ שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ הַשְׁחָתָה, הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה תַּעַר.
human_translation: How so? shaving that involves marring. You must say this a razor.
llm_translation: This is how - a blade that has corrosion in it, one should say "this is a knife."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ לִקְּטוֹ בְּמַלְקֵט וּרְהִיטָנִי יְהֵא חַיָּיב. מָה נַפְשָׁךְ: אִי גְּמִיר גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה – לִיבְעֵי תַּעַר, אִי לָא גְּמִיר גְּזֵרָה שָׁוָה – מִסְפָּרַיִם נָמֵי [לָא]!
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Even he removed with tweezers or with a plane, he would be liable Whichever way you If he derives a verbal analogy let require a razor If he does not derive a verbal analogy, also not scissors,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Even if he gathered in a reaper's basket and threshed, he is liable. What is your reasoning? If he completed a similar decree - let him bring a knife, and if he did not complete a similar decree - he should also bring sickles!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם גְּמִיר גְּזֵרָה שָׁוָה, וְקָסָבַר: הָנֵי נָמֵי גִּילּוּחַ עָבְדִי.
human_translation: Actually, he derives a verbal analogy, and he holds these too, accomplish shaving.
llm_translation: Always learn a decree that is equal, and he holds: those people did a great deed.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַכּוֹתֵב כְּתוֹבֶת קַעֲקַע. כָּתַב וְלֹא קִעֲקַע, קִעֲקַע וְלֹא כָּתַב – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב, עַד שֶׁיִּכְתּוֹב וִיקַעְקַע (בְּיָדוֹ) [בִּדְיוֹ] וּבִכְחוֹל וּבְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא רוֹשֵׁם. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיִּכְתּוֹב שֵׁם אֶת הַשֵּׁם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּכְתֹבֶת קַעֲקַע לֹא תִתְּנוּ בָּכֶם אֲנִי ה׳״.
human_translation: One who imprints a tattoo, one imprinted but did not carve one carved but did not imprint he is not liable; until he imprints and carves with ink, or with kohl [ keḥol ], or with any substance that marks. Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: He is liable only if he writes the name there, as it is stated: “And a tattoo inscription you shall not place upon you, I am the Lord”
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who writes a form of inscription without engraving. If he wrote but did not engrave, or engraved but did not write - he is not liable until he both writes and engraves (with his hand) with ink and with a stylus and with any substance that leaves a mark. Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: One is not liable until he writes the name of the Name, as it is stated: "And a form of inscription you shall not give upon yourselves; I am the Lord."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: עַד דְּיִכְתּוֹב ״אֲנִי ה׳״ מַמָּשׁ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא. כִּדְתָנֵי בַּר קַפָּרָא: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיִּכְתּוֹב שֵׁם עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּכְתוֹבֶת קַעֲקַע לֹא תִתְּנוּ בָּכֶם אֲנִי ה׳״ – אֲנִי ה׳, וְלֹא אַחֵר.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: if he actually inscribes “I am the Lord” said to him: No, as bar Kappara teaches: One is liable only if he inscribes a name of idol worship, as it is stated: “And a tattoo inscription you shall not place upon you, I am the Lord,” I am the Lord, and no else.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said to him, Rav Acha, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: Until it is written "I am the Lord" literally? He said to him: No. As Bar Kappara taught: One is not liable until the name of idolatry is written, as it is stated: "And a tattoo you shall not place upon yourselves, I am the Lord" - I am the Lord, and not another.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מַלְכִּיָּא אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: אָסוּר לוֹ לְאָדָם שֶׁיִּתֵּן אֵפֶר מִקְלֶה עַל גַּבֵּי מַכָּתוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנִּרְאֵית כִּכְתוֹבֶת קַעֲקַע. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: שַׁפּוּד, שְׁפָחוֹת וְגוּמוֹת – רַב מַלְכִּיּוֹ, בְּלוֹרִית, אֵפֶר מִקְלֶה וּגְבִינָה – רַב מַלְכִּיָּא
human_translation: Rav Malkiyya says Rav Adda bar Ahava says: It is prohibited for a person to place burnt ashes on his wound because it looks like a tattoo. Rav Naḥman, son of Rav Ika, says: skewer, maidservants, and follicles Rav Malkiyyu. forelock, burnt ashes, and cheese Rav Malkiyya.
llm_translation: Rav Malkiya said, Rav Adda bar Ahava said: It is forbidden for a person to place ash from a stick on his wound, because it appears like a tattoo. Rav Nachman, son of Rav Ikka, said: For a burn, for maidservants and camels - Rav Malkiya; for a wound, for cheese and milk - Rav Malkiya.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: מַתְנִיתִין וּמַתְנִיתָא – רַב מַלְכִּיָּא, שְׁמַעְתָּתָא – רַב מַלְכִּיּוֹ. וְסִימָנָיךְ: מַתְנִיתָא מַלְכְּתָא. מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ שְׁפָחוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: a mishna or a baraita Rav Malkiyya. halakhot Rav Malkiyyu. And your mnemonic, The Mishna is queen [ malketa ], What is between between them maidservants,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Matnitin and Matnita - Rav Malkiya, Shema'tata - Rav Malkiyo. And your mnemonic: Matnita Malketa. What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them in maidservants.

hebrew_text: רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי קָפֵיד אֲפִילּוּ אַרִיבְדָּא דְּכוּסִילְתָּא. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ שָׁם מַכָּה – מַכָּתוֹ מוֹכִיחַ עָלָיו.
human_translation: Rav Beivai bar Abaye was fastidious even on the wound of bloodletting [ arivda dekhusilta ], Rav Ashi says: Any place where there is a wound, his wound proves about itself
llm_translation: Rav Bibi bar Abbayei was meticulous even with a needle of a compass. Rav Ashei said: In any place where there is a wound, his wound testifies against him.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נָזִיר שֶׁהָיָה שׁוֹתֶה יַיִן כׇּל הַיּוֹם – אֵין חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת. אָמְרוּ לוֹ ״אַל תִּשְׁתֶּה״, ״אַל תִּשְׁתֶּה״, וְהוּא שׁוֹתֶה – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת. הָיָה מִטַּמֵּא לְמֵתִים כׇּל הַיּוֹם – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת, אָמְרוּ לוֹ ״אַל תִּטַּמֵּא״, ״אַל תִּטַּמֵּא״, וְהוּא מִטַּמֵּא – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת. הָיָה מְגַלֵּחַ כׇּל הַיּוֹם – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת, אָמְרוּ לוֹ ״אַל תְּגַלֵּחַ״, ״אַל תְּגַלֵּחַ״, וְהוּא מְגַלֵּחַ – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: A nazirite who was drinking wine all day is liable only one said to him: Do not drink, do not drink, and he drinks liable for each and every was rendering himself impure to corpses all day, he is liable only one they said to him: Do not render yourself impure, do not render yourself impure, and he renders himself impure liable for each and every was shaving all day, he is liable only one they said to him: Do not shave, do not shave, and he shaves, liable for each and every
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: A Nazirite who drank wine all day - he is only liable for one sin offering. They said to him, "Do not drink," "Do not drink," and he drank - he is liable for each and every one. If he became impure through contact with the dead all day - he is only liable for one sin offering. They said to him, "Do not become impure," "Do not become impure," and he became impure - he is liable for each and every one. If he shaved all day - he is only liable for one sin offering. They said to him, "Do not shave," "Do not shave," and he shaved - he is liable for each and every one.

hebrew_text: הָיָה לָבוּשׁ בְּכִלְאַיִם כׇּל הַיּוֹם – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת, אָמְרוּ לוֹ: ״אַל תִּלְבַּשׁ״, ״אַל תִּלְבַּשׁ״, וְהוּא פּוֹשֵׁט וְלוֹבֵשׁ – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: was wearing diverse kinds all day, he is liable only one they said to him: Do not wear do not wear and he removes and dons liable for each and every
llm_translation: He was wearing two garments all day - he is liable only once, they said to him: "Do not wear," "Do not wear," and he stretches and wears - he is liable for each and every one.

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ חוֹרֵשׁ תֶּלֶם אֶחָד וְחַיָּיב עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם שְׁמוֹנָה לָאוִין: הַחוֹרֵשׁ בְּשׁוֹר וַחֲמוֹר, וְהֵן מוּקְדָּשִׁין, וְכִלְאַיִם בַּכֶּרֶם, וּבַשְּׁבִיעִית, וְיוֹם טוֹב, וְכֹהֵן וְנָזִיר בְּבֵית הַטּוּמְאָה.
human_translation: There is plows a single furrow and is liable for eight prohibitions. plowing with an ox and a donkey, and they are consecrated, and diverse kinds in a vineyard; and during the Sabbatical and a Festival, and a priest and a nazirite in a place of impurity
llm_translation: There is one who plows one furrow and is liable for eight prohibitions: plowing with an ox and a donkey, and they are consecrated, and diverse kinds in a vineyard, and during the Sabbatical year, and on a festival, and a priest and a Nazirite in a house of impurity.

hebrew_text: חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן חֲכִינַאי אוֹמֵר: אַף הַלּוֹבֵשׁ כִּלְאַיִם. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵינוֹ הַשֵּׁם. אָמַר לָהֶם: אַף הַנָּזִיר לֹא הוּא הַשֵּׁם.
human_translation: Ḥananya ben Ḥakhinai says: was wearing diverse kinds also said to him: not the category said to them: a nazirite is also not the category,
llm_translation: Hananiah son of Hakinai says: Even one who wears his garments like a blind person. They said to him: This is not the way. He said to them: Even a Nazirite is not the way.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב בִּיבִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: ״פּוֹשֵׁט וְלוֹבֵשׁ״ – לוֹבֵשׁ מַמָּשׁ, אוֹ אֲפִילּוּ מַכְנִיס וּמוֹצִיא בֵּית יָד אוּנְקְלֵי שֶׁלּוֹ? מַחְוֵי רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: עַיּוֹלֵי וְאַפּוֹקֵי. רַב אָשֵׁי אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ לֹא שָׁהָה אֶלָּא כְּדֵי לִפְשׁוֹט וְלִלְבּוֹשׁ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Rav Beivai says Rabbi Yosei says he removes and dons actually dons or even he inserts and removes the sleeve of his garment [ unkali ]; Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, gestured: inserting and removing Rav Ashi says: even if he only waited equivalent to remove and to don liable
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Beivi said in the name of Rabbi Yosei: "Spreading out and wearing" - does this mean literally wearing, or even if one brings in and takes out his house utensils or shoes? Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, interpreted: He brings in and takes out. Rav Ashi says: Even if he only paused in order to spread out and wear - he is liable.

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ חוֹרֵשׁ תֶּלֶם וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: בַּחֲבוּרָה נִמְנוּ וְגָמְרוּ: הַחוֹפֶה בְּכִלְאַיִם – לוֹקֶה. אָמַר לָהֶן רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לָאו מִשְׁנָתֵנוּ הִיא זוֹ? יֵשׁ חוֹרֵשׁ תֶּלֶם אֶחָד וְחַיָּיב עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם שְׁמוֹנָה לָאוִין: הַחוֹרֵשׁ בְּשׁוֹר וּבַחֲמוֹר וְהֵן מוּקְדָּשִׁין, וְכִלְאַיִם בַּכֶּרֶם – הַאי חוֹרֵשׁ דְּמִחַיַּיב מִשּׁוּם כִּלְאַיִם הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? לָאו דְּמִיכַּסֵּי בַּהֲדֵיהּ דְּאָזֵיל?
human_translation: There is plows furrow Rabbi Yannai says in a group, were counted and they concluded: One who covers diverse kinds is flogged Rabbi Yoḥanan said to them: Isn’t this our mishna: There is plows a single furrow and is liable for plowing with an ox and a donkey, and they are consecrated, and diverse kinds in a vineyard. this plows who is liable due to diverse kinds, how can you find these not where one covers in the course of as he proceeds,
llm_translation: There is one who plows with a yoke of wool, etc. Rabbi Yannai said: They were counted in a group and concluded: One who plows with two different kinds of animals - is liable. Rabbi Yochanan said to them: Is this not from our Mishnah? There is one who plows with one yoke and is liable for eight prohibitions: Plowing with an ox and a donkey, and they are both sanctified, and with two kinds of seeds in a vineyard - how can you find a plower who is liable for mixing? Is it not because it is covered by the principle that one prohibition follows another?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי לָאו דְּדַלַּאי לָךְ חַסְפָּא, מִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ מַרְגָּנִיתָא תּוּתַהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אִי לָאו דְּקַילְּסָךְ גַּבְרָא רַבָּה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי – רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, דְּאָמַר: הַמְקַיֵּים כִּלְאַיִם – לוֹקֶה.
human_translation: said to him: if I had not lifted the earthenware for you, would you have found the gem beneath it? Reish Lakish said to Rabbi Yoḥanan: If not that a great man, praised your I would say Whose the mishna? It is Rabbi Akiva, who says: One who maintains is flogged.
llm_translation: He said to him: If it is not that you have a purse, would you forget a needle of purple wool? Reish Lakish said to Rabbi Yochanan: If not for the fact that a great man supports you, I would say: The Mishnah is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who said: One who establishes boundaries is liable to receive lashes.

hebrew_text: מַאי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? דְּתַנְיָא: הַמְנַכֵּשׁ וְהַמְחַפֶּה בְּכִלְאַיִם – לוֹקֶה. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אַף הַמְקַיֵּים.
human_translation: What Rabbi Akiva? as it is taught One who weeds and one who covers diverse kinds is flogged, Rabbi Akiva says: Even one who maintains
llm_translation: What is the ruling of Rabbi Akiva? As it was taught: One who traps and covers with nets - is liable. Rabbi Akiva says: Even one who sustains.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? דְּתַנְיָא: ״שָׂדְךָ לֹא תִזְרַע כִּלְאָיִם״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא זוֹרֵעַ, מְקַיֵּים מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּהֶמְתְּךָ לֹא תַרְבִּיעַ כִּלְאַיִם שָׂדְךָ לֹא תִזְרַע כִּלְאָיִם״.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Akiva? As it is taught “Your field you shall not sow with diverse kinds” I have only sowing From where maintaining the verse states: “Your animals you shall not breed with different species [ kilayim ]; your field you shall not sow with diverse kinds [ kilayim ]”
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Akiva's opinion? For it was taught: "You shall not sow your field with mixed seed" - I have only the one who sows, how do I fulfill the requirement? The Talmud teaches: "You shall not mate your beast with a different kind, you shall not sow your field with mixed seed."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ עוּלָּא לְרַב נַחְמָן: וְלִילְקֵי נָמֵי מִשּׁוּם זוֹרֵעַ בְּיוֹם טוֹב! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תְּנָא וְשַׁיַּיר.
human_translation: Ulla said to Rav Naḥman: And let him be flogged also for sowing on a Festival. said to him: taught and omitted
llm_translation: He said to him Ulai to Rav Nachman: And to lick from the name of Zorea on a festival day! He said to him: It was taught and remains.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תַּנָּא קָתָנֵי שְׁמוֹנָה, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ תְּנָא וְשַׁיַּיר?! אָמַר רָבָא: יֵשׁ חִילּוּק מְלָאכוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, וְאֵין חִילּוּק מְלָאכוֹת בְּיוֹם טוֹב. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עָדָא תְּהֵא.
human_translation: said to him: The tanna taught eight and you say he taught and omitted Rava says: there is a division of labors on Shabbat, but there is no division of labors on a Festival. said to him: That [ ada ] is so.
llm_translation: He said to him: A Tanna taught eight, and you say teach and leave?! Rava said: There is a distinction of tasks on Shabbat, but there is no distinction of tasks on Yom Tov. He said to him: Until when will it be.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְאֵין חִילּוּק מְלָאכוֹת בְּיוֹם טוֹב? וְהָתְנַן: הַמְבַשֵּׁל גִּיד בְּחָלָב בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וַאֲכָלוֹ – לוֹקֶה חָמֵשׁ. לוֹקֶה מִשּׁוּם אוֹכֵל גִּיד, וְלוֹקֶה מִשּׁוּם מְבַשֵּׁל בְּיוֹם טוֹב שֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ, וְלוֹקֶה מִשּׁוּם מְבַשֵּׁל גִּיד בְּחָלָב, וְלוֹקֶה מִשּׁוּם אוֹכֵל בָּשָׂר בְּחָלָב, וְלוֹקֶה
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to And is there no division of labors on a Festival? But didn’t we learn One who cooks nerve in milk on a Festival and eats it is flogged five He is flogged for eating nerve and he is flogged for cooking on a Festival not for purpose and he is flogged for cooking nerve, in milk; and he is flogged for eating meat in milk; and he is flogged
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: And is there no distinction in the types of labor on a festival? But isn't it taught: One who cooks a sinew in milk on a festival, and eats it - he is liable to receive five sets of lashes. He is liable for eating sinew, and he is liable for cooking on a festival not for the purpose of the festival, and he is liable for cooking sinew in milk, and he is liable for eating meat with milk, and he is liable.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם הַבְעָרָה. וְאִם אִיתָא, מִשּׁוּם הַבְעָרָה לָא מִחַיַּיב, דְּהָא אִיחַיַּיב לֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם בִּשּׁוּלוֹ! אַפֵּיק הַבְעָרָה וְעַיֵּיל גִּיד הַנָּשֶׁה שֶׁל נְבֵילָה.
human_translation: for kindling And if it is so, he is not liable for kindling as he is liable for cooking Remove kindling and insert sciatic nerve of an unslaughtered animal carcass.
llm_translation: From the prohibition of burning. And if it is derived, from the prohibition of burning he is not liable, for he is liable to him from the prohibition of its cooking! Remove the prohibition of burning and bring the sinew of the thigh of a carcass.

hebrew_text: וְהָתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: לוֹקֶה שְׁתַּיִם עַל אֲכִילָתוֹ וְשָׁלֹשׁ עַל בִּשּׁוּלוֹ. וְאִי אִיתָא, שָׁלֹשׁ עַל אֲכִילָתוֹ הוּא חַיָּיב! אֶלָּא: אַפֵּיק הַבְעָרָה וְעַיֵּיל עֲצֵי אֲשֵׁירָה, וְאַזְהָרְתֵּיהּ מֵהָכָא: ״וְלֹא יִדְבַּק בְּיָדְךָ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya teach One is flogged two for his eating and three for his cooking? And if it is so, he is liable three for his eating; Rather, Remove kindling and insert wood of a tree [ ashera ], whose prohibition is from here: “And shall cleave to your hand”
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And it was taught by Rabbi Chiya: One is liable for two lashes for its consumption and three for its cooking. And if you say that one is liable for three for its consumption, he would be liable! Rather, he kindles a fire and brings wood of an idolatrous tree, and his warning is from here: "And it shall not cleave to your hand, etc."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְלִילְקֵי נָמֵי מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא תָבִיא תוֹעֵבָה אֶל בֵּיתֶךָ״! אֶלָּא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁבִּישְּׁלוֹ בַּעֲצֵי הֶקְדֵּשׁ, וְאַזְהַרְתֵּיהּ מֵהָכָא: ״וַאֲשֵׁרֵיהֶם תִּשְׂרְפוּן בָּאֵשׁ... לֹא תַעֲשׂוּן כֵּן לַה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם״.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: let him also be flogged for “You shall not bring an abomination into your house” Rather, What are we dealing with here? where one cooked with wood consecrated whose warning, from here: “And their asherim you shall burn in fire…you shall not do so to the Lord your God”
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: "And let us learn from the verse 'You shall not bring an abomination into your house'! Rather, what are we dealing with here - for example, when one cooks with wood from the Temple, and I warn you from here: 'And their trees you shall burn in the fire... You shall not do so to the Lord your God.'"

hebrew_text: סִימָן. שנבא״י שנ״ז
human_translation: a mnemonic: Shin , nun , beit , alef , yod ; shin , nun , zayin ;
llm_translation: Sign. That which Rabbi Yehudah HaNasi said: "Shenaz."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא: וְלִיחְשׁוֹב נָמֵי הַזּוֹרֵעַ בְּנַחַל אֵיתָן, וְאַזְהָרְתֵּיהּ מֵהָכָא: ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא יֵעָבֵד בּוֹ וְלֹא יִזָּרֵעַ״!
human_translation: Rav Hoshaya objects to this: And let also enumerate sowing in a forceful stream, and its prohibition is from here: which will be neither plowed nor sown”
llm_translation: The Gemara challenges him: And let Namai the sower consider, in the valley of Etan, and its warning is from here: "Which he shall not serve nor sow!"

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב חֲנַנְיָא: וְלִיחְשׁוֹב נָמֵי הַמּוֹחֵק אֶת הַשֵּׁם בַּהֲלִיכָתוֹ, וְאַזְהָרְתֵּיהּ מֵהָכָא: ״וְאִבַּדְתֶּם אֶת שְׁמָם וְגוֹ׳ (וְ)לֹא תַעֲשׂוּן כֵּן לַה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם״!
human_translation: Rav Ḥananya objects to this: And let also enumerate one who erases the name in his walking and its prohibition is from here: “And you shall destroy their names…you shall not do so to the Lord your God”
llm_translation: Rav Chananya objects to her: And let Namai consider one who erases the Name as he walks, and I caution her from here: "And you shall destroy their name, etc." (Deuteronomy 12:3) "And you shall not do so to the Lord your God!"

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: וְלִיחְשׁוֹב נָמֵי הַקּוֹצֵץ אֶת בַּהַרְתּוֹ, וְאַזְהָרְתֵּיהּ מֵהָכָא: ״הִשָּׁמֶר בְּנֶגַע הַצָּרַעַת״!
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu objects to this: And let also enumerate one who severs his snow-white leprous mark and its prohibition is from here: “Take heed of the plague of leprosy”
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Rabbi Abbahu objects to her: "And let the one who shaves his leprosy be considered impure, and I warn her from here: 'Beware of the plague of leprosy!'"

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְלִיחְשׁוֹב נָמֵי הַמֵּזִיחַ הַחוֹשֶׁן מֵעַל הָאֵפוֹד, וְהַמֵּסִיר בַּדֵּי אָרוֹן, וְאַזְהָרְתֵּיהּ מֵהָכָא: ״(וְ)לֹא יָסֻרוּ״, ״וְלֹא יִזַּח הַחֹשֶׁן״!
human_translation: Abaye objects to this: And let also enumerate one who loosens the breastplate from upon the ephod or one who removes the staves of the Ark And its prohibition is from here: they shall not be removed “And the breastplate shall not be loosened
llm_translation: Abbaye objects to this: And let him consider, the one who removes the breastplate from above the ephod, and the one who removes the staves from the Ark, and its warning is from here: "They shall not be removed," "and the breastplate shall not be removed!"

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: וְלִיחְשׁוֹב נָמֵי הַחוֹרֵשׁ בַּעֲצֵי אֲשֵׁירָה, וְאַזְהָרְתֵּיהּ מֵהָכָא: ״וְלֹא יִדְבַּק בְּיָדְךָ מְאוּמָה וְגוֹ״!
human_translation: Rav Ashi objects to this: And let also enumerate one who plows with wood of an ashera , and its prohibition is from here: “And there shall cleave nothing to your hand”
llm_translation: Challenges him Rav Ashe: And to think, the craftsman who carves the wood of the Asherah, and its warning is from here: "And nothing shall stick to your hand, etc."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבִינָא: וְלִיחְשׁוֹב נָמֵי הַקּוֹצֵץ אִילָנוֹת טוֹבוֹת, וְאַזְהָרְתֵּיהּ מֵהָכָא: ״כִּי מִמֶּנּוּ תֹאכֵל וְאֹתוֹ לֹא תִכְרֹת״!
human_translation: Ravina objects to this: And let also enumerate one who chops down beautiful trees and its prohibition is from here: “For you may eat of it, and you shall not chop it down”
llm_translation: Ravina objects to her: And let the pleasant trees be considered, and its warning from here: "For from it you may eat, but you shall not cut it down!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זְעֵירָא לְרַבִּי מָנִי: וְלִיחְשׁוֹב נָמֵי כְּגוֹן דְּאָמַר ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא אֶחְרוֹשׁ בְּיוֹם טוֹב״! הָתָם לָא קָא חָלָה שְׁבוּעָה, מוּשְׁבָּע וְעוֹמֵד מֵהַר סִינַי הוּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּגוֹן דְּאָמַר ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא אֶחְרוֹשׁ בֵּין בַּחוֹל בֵּין בְּיוֹם טוֹב״, דְּמִגּוֹ דְּחָלָה עֲלֵיהּ שְׁבוּעָה בְּחוֹל – חָלָה עֲלֵיהּ נָמֵי בְּיוֹם טוֹב! מִידֵּי דְּאִיתֵיהּ בִּשְׁאֵילָה לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Mani: And let also enumerate where one says: oath I will not plow on the Festival, There, the oath does not take effect, he is already under oath from Mount Sinai said to him: where one says: oath I will not plow whether during the week or on a Festival, as since oath takes effect in his during the week, it takes effect in his on a Festival as well. is not teaching a matter that is in a request
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Mani: And to think, for example, that one might say, "I will take an oath not to plow on a festival day!" There, he did not take an oath, as he was already bound and standing at Mount Sinai. He said to him: For example, that one might say, "I will take an oath not to plow, whether on a weekday or on a festival day," for if he became ill and took an oath not to plow on a weekday - he would also be bound not to plow on a festival day! Since it is dependent on his inquiry, it is not taught.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וַהֲרֵי הֶקְדֵּשׁ! בִּבְכוֹר. וַהֲרֵי נָזִיר! בִּנְזִיר שִׁמְשׁוֹן.
human_translation: And not But isn’t there consecrated to a firstborn But isn’t there a nazirite, to a nazirite Samson,
llm_translation: And not? But behold, hekdesh! In bechor. And behold, nazir! In nazir Shimshon.

hebrew_text: נְזִיר שִׁמְשׁוֹן בַּר אִיטַּמּוֹיֵי לְמֵתִים הוּא? אֶלָּא, הַאי תַּנָּא אִיסּוּר כּוֹלֵל לֵית לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Is a nazirite Samson subject contracting impurity by corpses? Rather, this tanna is not of inclusive prohibition
llm_translation: "Nazir Shimshon bar Ittammoyei to the dead he is? Rather, this Tanna prohibition includes does not have."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא: הַמַּרְבִּיעַ שׁוֹר פְּסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁים – לוֹקֶה שְׁנַיִם. אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: הַמַּנְהִיג בְּשׁוֹר פְּסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁים – לוֹקֶה, שֶׁהֲרֵי גּוּף אֶחָד הוּא, וַעֲשָׂאוֹ הַכָּתוּב כִּשְׁנֵי גּוּפִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Hoshaya says: One who breeds a disqualified consecrated ox is flogged two Rabbi Yitzḥak says: One who drives a disqualified consecrated ox is flogged, as it is one body, and the verse accorded it two bodies.
llm_translation: Rabbi Hoshaya said: One who causes a fourth blemish in consecrated oxen - receives two sets of lashes. Rabbi Yitzchak said: One who leads a consecrated ox with a fourth blemish - receives lashes, for it is considered one body, yet the verse states it as two bodies.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כַּמָּה מַלְקִין אוֹתוֹ – אַרְבָּעִים חָסֵר אַחַת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״בְּמִסְפַּר אַרְבָּעִים״ – מִנְיָן שֶׁהוּא סָמוּךְ לְאַרְבָּעִים. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַרְבָּעִים שְׁלֵימוֹת הוּא לוֹקֶה, וְהֵיכָן הוּא לוֹקֶה אֶת הַיְּתֵירָה – בֵּין כְּתֵפָיו.
human_translation: how many does one flog forty less one, as it is stated: by number. Forty A sum adjacent to forty. Rabbi Yehuda says: He is flogged a full forty And where is he flogged the extra between his shoulders.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: How many lashes does one receive? Forty less one, as it is stated, "With the number forty" - to teach that it is adjacent to forty. Rabbi Yehudah says: He receives forty complete lashes, and where does he receive the additional one? Between his shoulders.

hebrew_text: אֵין אוֹמְדִין אוֹתוֹ, אֶלָּא בְּמַכּוֹת רְאוּיוֹת לְהִשְׁתַּלֵּשׁ. אֲמָדוּהוּ לְקַבֵּל אַרְבָּעִים, וְלוֹקֶה מִקְצָת,
human_translation: One assesses only with lashes fit to be divided into three assessed him to receive forty and he is flogged some
llm_translation: One does not establish him, except with fitting blows to be flogged. They estimated him to receive forty, and he receives some.

hebrew_text: וְאָמְדוּ שֶׁאֵין יָכוֹל לְקַבֵּל אַרְבָּעִים – פָּטוּר. אֲמָדוּהוּ לְקַבֵּל שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה, וּמִשֶּׁלָּקָה אָמְדוּ שֶׁיָּכוֹל הוּא לְקַבֵּל אַרְבָּעִים – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: and they assessed that he cannot receive forty exempt assessed him to receive eighteen and once he was flogged they assessed that he is able to receive forty, exempt
llm_translation: And they estimated that if he cannot receive forty - he is exempt. They estimated him to be able to receive eighteen, and when they re-estimated, they estimated that he can receive forty - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא? אִי כְּתִיב ״אַרְבָּעִים בְּמִסְפָּר״ הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אַרְבָּעִים בְּמִנְיָינָא, הַשְׁתָּא דִּכְתִיב ״בְּמִסְפַּר אַרְבָּעִים״ – מִנְיָן שֶׁהוּא סוֹכֵם אֶת הָאַרְבָּעִים. אָמַר רָבָא: כַּמָּה טַפְשָׁאֵי שְׁאָר אִינָשֵׁי, דְּקָיְימִי מִקַּמֵּי סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה, וְלָא קָיְימִי מִקַּמֵּי גַּבְרָא רַבָּה, דְּאִילּוּ בְּסֵפֶר תּוֹרָה כְּתִיב ״אַרְבָּעִים״, וַאֲתוֹ רַבָּנַן בְּצַרוּ חֲדָא.
human_translation: What is the reason If it had been written: Forty by number, I would say forty as sum; now that it is written: “By number, forty,” a sum that approaches forty. Rava said: How foolish the rest of the people who stand before a Torah scroll and they do not stand before a great man, as in a Torah scroll, forty is written and the Sages came subtracted one,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the reason? If it were written "forty in number," I would say: forty in counting. Now that it is written "in number forty" - how do we know that it includes the forty? Rava said: How foolish are the other people who stand before a Torah scroll and do not stand before a great man, for even in the Torah scroll it is written "forty," and the Rabbis come and interpret it differently.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַרְבָּעִים שְׁלֵימוֹת וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה – דִּכְתִיב ״מָה הַמַּכּוֹת הָאֵלֶּה בֵּין יָדֶיךָ וְאָמַר אֲשֶׁר הֻכֵּתִי בֵּית מְאַהֲבָי״. וְרַבָּנַן? הַהוּא בְּתִינוֹקוֹת שֶׁל בֵּית רַבָּן הוּא דִּכְתִיב.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: a full forty Rabbi Yitzḥak says: What is the reason of Rabbi Yehuda? as it is written: “And one shall say to him: What are these wounds between your arms? Then he shall answer: Those with which I was wounded in the house of my friends” And the Rabbis, this is written with regard to schoolchildren
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: "Forty lashes, etc." Rabbi Yitzchak said: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda's opinion? Because it is written, "What are these wounds between your arms?" and he said, "Those with which I was wounded in the house of my friends." And the Rabbis? That is with regard to the children of the house of Rabban, as it is written.

hebrew_text: אֵין אוֹמְדִין אֶלָּא בְּמַכּוֹת הָרְאוּיוֹת וְכוּ׳. לָקָה – אִין, לֹא לָקָה – לָא.
human_translation: One assesses only with lashes fit he was flogged yes, he was not flogged, no,
llm_translation: One does not establish guilt except with fitting blows, etc. Struck - yes, not struck - no.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: אֲמָדוּהוּ לְקַבֵּל אַרְבָּעִים, וְחָזְרוּ וְאָמְדוּ שֶׁאֵין יָכוֹל לְקַבֵּל אַרְבָּעִים – פָּטוּר. אֲמָדוּהוּ לְקַבֵּל שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה, וְחָזְרוּ וַאֲמָדוּהוּ שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְקַבֵּל אַרְבָּעִים – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: And raises a contradiction assessed him to receive forty and they then assessed that he cannot receive forty exempt. assessed him to receive eighteen and they then assessed that he is able to receive forty, exempt.
llm_translation: And they asked him: If they measured him to receive forty, and then they went back and measured that he cannot receive forty - he is exempt. If they measured him to receive eighteen, and then they went back and measured that he can receive forty - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא – דַּאֲמָדוּהוּ לְיוֹמֵי, הָא – דַּאֲמָדוּהוּ לִמְחַר וּלְיוֹמָא אוּחְרָא.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: not difficult, this where assessed his for day, That where assess his for next day or for a different day.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: It is not difficult, this - that they established it for today, this - that they established it for tomorrow and the following day.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עָבַר עֲבֵירָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ שְׁנֵי לָאוִין, אֲמָדוּהוּ אוֹמֶד אֶחָד – לוֹקֶה וּפָטוּר, וְאִם לָאו – לוֹקֶה וּמִתְרַפֵּא, וְחוֹזֵר וְלוֹקֶה.
human_translation: one performed a transgression that involves two prohibitions, they assessed him a single assessment he is flogged and exempt And if not, he is flogged and heal, and then is flogged
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one transgresses a sin that involves two prohibitions, and he was warned regarding one of them - he is liable and exempt. But if he was not warned - he is liable and can be healed, and then he is warned and is liable.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵין אוֹמְדִין אוֹמֶד אֶחָד לִשְׁנֵי לָאוִין!
human_translation: But isn’t it taught One does not perform one assessment for two prohibitions?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, and it was taught: One does not establish an establishment for two prohibitions!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא – דַּאֲמָדוּהוּ לְאַרְבָּעִים וַחֲדָא. הָא – דַּאֲמָדוּהוּ לְאַרְבָּעִים וְתַרְתֵּי.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: not difficult; this where assessed him to forty-one That where assessed him to forty-two
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: It is not difficult, this one - that they estimated him at forty-one. This one - that they estimated him at forty-two.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֵּיצַד מַלְקִין אוֹתוֹ? כּוֹפֶה שְׁתֵּי יָדָיו עַל הָעַמּוּד הֵילָךְ וְהֵילָךְ, וְחַזַּן הַכְּנֶסֶת אוֹחֵז בִּבְגָדָיו, אִם נִקְרְעוּ – נִקְרְעוּ, וְאִם נִפְרְמוּ – נִפְרְמוּ, עַד שֶׁהוּא מְגַלֶּה אֶת לִבּוֹ. וְהָאֶבֶן נְתוּנָה מֵאַחֲרָיו. חַזַּן הַכְּנֶסֶת עוֹמֵד עָלָיו וּרְצוּעָה בְּיָדוֹ, שֶׁל עֵגֶל, כְּפוּלָה אֶחָד לִשְׁנַיִם וּשְׁנַיִם לְאַרְבָּעָה, וּשְׁתֵּי רְצוּעוֹת שֶׁל חֲמוֹר עוֹלוֹת וְיוֹרְדוֹת בָּהּ. יָדָהּ טֶפַח וּרְחָבָה טֶפַח, וְרֹאשָׁהּ מַגַּעַת עַל פִּי כְרֵיסוֹ.
human_translation: How do they flog him? He ties two hands on this and that of a post, and the attendant of the congregation takes hold of his garments If they were ripped they were ripped, and if they were unraveled, they were unraveled, until he bares his chest. And the stone is situated behind The attendant of the congregation stands on it with a strap in his hand. of calf doubled, one into two, and two into four, and two straps of donkey go up and down its handle one handbreadth, width one handbreadth, and its end reaches the top of his abdomen,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: How is one to administer lashes? He binds his two hands to the pillar, this way and that way, and the synagogue attendant holds his garments. If they tear - they tear, and if they become untied - they become untied, until his heart is revealed. And the stone is placed behind him. The synagogue attendant stands over him, holding a calf's whip, folded once for two and twice for four, and two straps of a donkey, one going up and one going down. Its width is a handbreadth, its length is a handbreadth, and its tip touches his anus.

hebrew_text: וּמַכֶּה אוֹתוֹ שְׁלִישׁ מִלְּפָנָיו וּשְׁתֵּי יָדוֹת מִלְּאַחֲרָיו. וְאֵינוֹ מַכֶּה אוֹתוֹ לֹא עוֹמֵד וְלֹא יוֹשֵׁב, אֶלָּא מוּטֶּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וְהִפִּילוֹ הַשֹּׁפֵט״,
human_translation: And flogs him one-third from the front of him, and two portions from behind him, And he does not flog him standing, nor sitting; rather, hunched, as it is stated: “And the judge shall cause him to lie down,
llm_translation: And one who strikes him a third time from in front of him, and two hands times from behind him. And he who strikes him, not standing and not sitting, but lying down, as it is said, "And the judge shall cause him to fall."

hebrew_text: וְהַמַּכֶּה מַכֶּה בְּיָדוֹ אַחַת בְּכׇל כֹּחוֹ, וְהַקּוֹרֵא קוֹרֵא: ״אִם לֹא תִשְׁמֹר לַעֲשׂוֹת וְגוֹ׳״, ״וְהִפְלָא ה׳ אֶת מַכֹּתְךָ וְאֵת מַכּוֹת וְגוֹ׳״ וְחוֹזֵר לִתְחִלַּת הַמִּקְרָא: ״וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם אֶת דִּבְרֵי הַבְּרִית הַזֹּאת וְגוֹ׳״ וְחוֹתֵם: ״וְהוּא רַחוּם יְכַפֵּר עָוֹן״, וְגוֹ׳, וְחוֹזֵר לִתְחִלַּת הַמִּקְרָא.
human_translation: And the flogging flogs [ makeh ] him with one hand with all his strength, and the crier recites “If you do not observe to perform And the Lord will make your plagues [ makkotekha ] outstanding, and the plagues And he returns to the beginning of the verse. “And you shall observe the matters of this covenant, and concludes “And He is merciful and shall atone for transgression, and destroys not; and returns to the beginning of the verse
llm_translation: The one who strikes, strikes with one hand with all his strength, and the one who reads, reads: "If you will not be careful to do etc.," "And Hashem will make wondrous your blows and the blows etc.," and returns to the beginning of the verse: "And you shall observe the words of this covenant etc.," and concludes: "And He is merciful, He will atone for iniquity," etc., and returns to the beginning of the verse.

hebrew_text: וְאִם מֵת תַּחַת יָדוֹ – פָּטוּר. הוֹסִיף לוֹ עוֹד רְצוּעָה אַחַת וּמֵת – הֲרֵי זֶה גּוֹלֶה עַל יָדוֹ. נִתְקַלְקֵל, בֵּין בְּרֵיעִי בֵּין בְּמַיִם – פָּטוּר, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הָאִישׁ – בְּרֵיעִי, וְהָאִשָּׁה – בְּמַיִם.
human_translation: If dies at hand exempt, added for him an additional a strap and he died, is exiled on his account, If sullies himself, whether with excrement or with urine, exempt Rabbi Yehuda says The man with excrement, and the woman with urine.
llm_translation: "If the animal dies under his care - he is exempt. If he added another strap and it dies - this one is considered as if it died under his care. If it became blemished, whether among his friends or in water - he is exempt. Rabbi Yehuda says: The male animal - among his friends, and the female animal - in water."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא – מִשּׁוּם ״נִקְלָה״.
human_translation: What is the reason due to debased
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason? - Because of "niklah."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה: מִנַּיִן לִרְצוּעָה שֶׁהִיא שֶׁל עֵגֶל – דִּכְתִיב ״אַרְבָּעִים יַכֶּנּוּ״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ ״לֹא תַחְסֹם שׁוֹר בְּדִישׁוֹ״.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet says in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya: From where with regard to the strap that it is of a calf? as it is written: “Forty he shall flog him,” and juxtaposed to it “You shall not muzzle an ox in its threshing”
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah: From where do we derive the prohibition of a cow that is designated for stoning? As it is written, "Forty lashes may be given," and juxtaposed to it is, "You shall not muzzle an ox while it is threshing."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה: מִנַּיִן לִיבָמָה שֶׁנָּפְלָה לִפְנֵי מוּכֵּה שְׁחִין, שֶׁאֵין חוֹסְמִין אוֹתָהּ – דִּכְתִיב ״לֹא תַחְסֹם שׁוֹר בְּדִישׁוֹ״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ ״כִּי יֵשְׁבוּ אַחִים יַחְדָּו וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet says in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya: From where with regard to a yevama who happened before afflicted with boils, that one does not compel her as it is written: “You shall not muzzle an ox in its threshing,” and juxtaposed to it “When brothers dwell together”
llm_translation: And Rav Sheshet said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah: From where do we derive the law of a yevamah who fell before a person afflicted with boils, that they do not perform chalitzah on her? - For it is written, "You shall not muzzle an ox while it is threshing," and juxtaposed to it is, "When brothers dwell together..."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה: כׇּל הַמְבַזֶּה אֶת הַמּוֹעֲדִים כְּאִילּוּ עוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, דִּכְתִיב ״אֱלֹהֵי מַסֵּכָה לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה לָּךְ״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ ״אֶת חַג הַמַּצּוֹת תִּשְׁמֹר״.
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet says in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya: anyone who treats the Festivals with contempt, it is as though worshipping idols, as it is written: “Molten gods you shall not make for yourself” and juxtaposed to it “The festival of Passover you shall observe”
llm_translation: And Rav Sheshet said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah: Anyone who disgraces the appointed times is as if he worships foreign worship, as it is written, "You shall not make for yourself a molten god," and it is juxtaposed with, "You shall observe the Feast of Unleavened Bread."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה: כׇּל הַמְסַפֵּר לָשׁוֹן הָרָע, וְכֵן הַמְקַבֵּל לָשׁוֹן הָרָע, וְכׇל הַמֵּעִיד עֵדוּת שֶׁקֶר – רָאוּי לְהַשְׁלִיכוֹ לִכְלָבִים, דִּכְתִיב ״לַכֶּלֶב תַּשְׁלִכוּן אֹתוֹ״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ ״לֹא תִשָּׂא שֵׁמַע שָׁוְא וְגוֹ׳״, קְרִי בֵּיהּ נָמֵי ״לֹא תַשִּׂיא״.
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet says in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya: anyone who speaks malicious speech, and any-one who accepts malicious speech and anyone who testifies a false testimony, it is fit to throw him to the dogs, as it is written: “To the dog you shall cast it” and juxtaposed to it “You shall not accept [ lo tissa ] a false report; also reads into You shall not relate [ lo tassi ]
llm_translation: And Rav Sheshet said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah: Anyone who repeats slander, and similarly one who accepts slander, and anyone who testifies falsely - it is fitting to cast him to the dogs, as it is written, "You shall cast it to the dog," and it is juxtaposed with, "You shall not carry a false report," and read in it also, "You shall not bear."

hebrew_text: וּשְׁתֵּי רְצוּעוֹת וְכוּ׳. תָּנָא: שֶׁל חֲמוֹר. כִּדְדָרֵישׁ הָהוּא גָּלִילָאָה עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא: ״יָדַע שׁוֹר קֹנֵהוּ וַחֲמוֹר אֵבוּס בְּעָלָיו יִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא יָדַע וְגוֹ׳״, אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: יָבֹא מִי שֶׁמַּכִּיר אֵבוּס בְּעָלָיו, וְיִפָּרַע מִמִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַכִּיר אֵבוּס בְּעָלָיו.
human_translation: And two straps taught: And of donkey As a certain Galilean interpreted before Rav Ḥisda: “The ox knows its owner, and the donkey its master’s trough; but Israel does not know, The Holy One, Blessed be He, says: Let the one who recognizes its master’s trough, come and exact retribution, from one who does not recognize his Master’s trough
llm_translation: "And two straps, etc." It was taught: of a donkey. As that Galilean expounded to Rav Hisda: "He knows his ox, and the donkey the manger of its owner, an Israelite does not know, etc." The Holy One, blessed be He, said: Let the one who recognizes the manger of its owner come, and let him exact payment from one who does not recognize the manger of its owner.

hebrew_text: יָדָהּ טֶפַח וְכוּ׳. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ כֹּל חַד וְחַד לְפוּם גַּבֵּיהּ עָבְדִינַן לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אִם כֵּן נַפֵּישׁ לְהוּ רְצוּעוֹת טוּבָא! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: אַבְקָתָא אִית לַיהּ, כִּי בָּעֵי מְיקַטַּר בַּיהּ, כִּי בָּעֵי מְרַפֵּה בַּהּ.
human_translation: its handle one handbreadth, Abaye said: Conclude from it for each and every one, we craft according to their back. Rava said to him: If so, there will be numerous straps for them. Rather, Rava said: It has loops; when wants, he ties when wants, he loosens
llm_translation: Her hand a handbreadth, etc. Abaye said: Learn from it, for each and every one according to its stature we make for it. Rava said to him: If so, it should have many good joints! Rather, Rava said: It has a socket, for when it needs to contract, it contracts, and when it needs to expand, it expands.

hebrew_text: מַלְקִין אוֹתוֹ וְכוּ׳. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״וְהִפִּילוֹ הַשֹּׁפֵט וְהִכָּהוּ לְפָנָיו כְּדֵי רִשְׁעָתוֹ בְּמִסְפָּר״ – רִשְׁעָה אַחַת מִלְּפָנָיו, שְׁתֵּי רִשְׁעָיוֹת מֵאַחֲרָיו.
human_translation: One flogs him From where are these matters Rav Kahana said: as the verse states: “And the judge shall cause him to lie down, and strike him before him in accordance with his wickedness, by number” one wickedness from the front of him, two wickedness from behind him.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "They flog him, etc." Where do we derive these words from? Rav Kahana said: As the verse states, "And the judge shall cause him to lie down and be beaten before him according to his wickedness by number" - one wickedness before him, two wickednesses behind him.

hebrew_text: אֵין מַלְקִין אוֹתוֹ וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִנַּיִן לִרְצוּעָה שֶׁהִיא מוּכְפֶּלֶת – שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וְהִפִּילוֹ״. וְהָא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְגוּפֵיהּ! אִם כֵּן לִכְתּוֹב קְרָא ״יַטֵּיהוּ״, מַאי ״הִפִּילוֹ״? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: And he does not flog him Rav Ḥisda says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: From where to the strap that it is doubled? as it is stated: And he shall cause him to lie down [ vehippilo ], But doesn’t he require for itself, If so, let the verse write: Shall bend him. What “Shall cause him to lie down”? Conclude two from it:
llm_translation: The text reads: "One does not administer lashes, etc." Rav Hisda said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: From where do we derive that the doubling of the punishment is effective? Because it is stated, "and cause him to fall." But this should be necessary for itself! If so, the verse should have written, "cause him to fall," why "and cause him to fall"? Learn from it two things.

hebrew_text: הַמַּכֶּה מַכֶּה בְּיָדוֹ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מַעֲמִידִין חַזָּנִין אֶלָּא חֲסֵירֵי כֹחַ וִיתֵירֵי מַדָּע. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ חֲסֵירֵי מַדָּע וִיתֵירֵי כֹּחַ.
human_translation: And the flogging flogs with hand The Sages taught: appoints only attendants lacking in strength and exceedingly knowledgeable Rabbi Yehuda says: even lacking in knowledge and exceedingly strong.
llm_translation: The one who strikes, strikes with his hand. The Rabbis taught: Only those lacking strength and exceeding in knowledge are appointed as cantors. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even those lacking in knowledge and exceeding in strength.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דִּכְתִיב ״לֹא יוֹסִיף... פֶּן יוֹסִיף״, אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא חֲסֵירֵי מַדָּע – הַיְינוּ דִּצְרִיךְ לְאַזְהוֹרֵי. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ יְתֵירֵי מַדָּע – מִי צְרִיךְ לְאַזְהוֹרֵי? וְרַבָּנַן: אֵין מְזָרְזִין אֶלָּא לַמְזוֹרָז.
human_translation: Rava said: It is reasonable in accordance with of Rabbi Yehuda, as it is written: he shall not exceed, lest he continue Granted, if you say lacking in knowledge that is it is necessary to warn But if you say exceedingly knowledgeable does need to warn And the Rabbis, one implores only one who is implored.
llm_translation: Rava said: The reasoning of Rabbi Yehuda's colleagues is logical, as it is written, "He shall not add... lest he add." If you say it refers to those lacking knowledge - that means one must be cautious. But if you say it refers to those with excess knowledge - who needs to be cautious? And the Rabbis say: We only hasten for the one who is already hastening.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: כְּשֶׁהוּא מַגְבִּיהַּ – מַגְבִּיהַּ בִּשְׁתֵּי יָדָיו, וּכְשֶׁהוּא מַכֶּה – מַכֶּה בְּיָדוֹ אַחַת, כִּי הֵיכִי (דְּלֵיתֵא) [דְּתֵיתֵי] מִדִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: taught: When raises he raises with both hands, and when he flogs he flogs with one hand, so that will come from him
llm_translation: Mishna: When he lifts - he lifts with both his hands, and when he strikes - he strikes with one hand, for otherwise it is not from his own.

hebrew_text: וְהַקּוֹרֵא קוֹרֵא וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַגָּדוֹל שֶׁבַּדַּיָּינִין קוֹרֵא, הַשֵּׁנִי מוֹנֶה, וְהַשְּׁלִישִׁי אוֹמֵר: ״הִכָּהוּ״! בִּזְמַן שֶׁמַּכָּה מְרוּבָּה – מַאֲרִיךְ, בִּזְמַן שֶׁמַּכָּה מוּעֶטֶת – מְקַצֵּר. וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן: חוֹזֵר לִתְחִלַּת הַמִּקְרָא! מִצְוָה לְצַמְצֵם, וְאִי[ם] לֹא צִמְצֵם – חוֹזֵר לִתְחִלַּת הַמִּקְרָא.
human_translation: And the crier recites The Sages taught: The most prominent of the judges recites the second counts and the third says Strike him. When the lashes are numerous, extends when the lashes are few, curtails But didn’t we learn he returns to the beginning of the verse, mitzva is to precisely and if he did not precisely he returns to the beginning of the verse.
llm_translation: The one who reads, reads, and so forth. The Rabbis taught: The greatest among the judges reads, the second counts, and the third says, "Strike him!" When he strikes heavily - he prolongs, when he strikes lightly - he shortens. And we learned: One should go back to the beginning of the verse! It is a commandment to shorten, and if one did not shorten - he should go back to the beginning of the verse.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״מַכָּה רַבָּה״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא מַכָּה רַבָּה, מַכָּה מוּעֶטֶת מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא יוֹסִיף״. אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״מַכָּה רַבָּה״? לִימֵּד עַל הָרִאשׁוֹנוֹת שֶׁהֵן מַכָּה רַבָּה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: a great flogging” I have only a great flogging; from where a minimal flogging the verse states: “He shall not exceed,” why the verse state: “A great flogging”? teaches that the initial as a great flogging,
llm_translation: The sages taught: "A great blow," I have only a great blow, how do we know a minor blow? The Torah teaches: "He shall not add." If so, why does the Torah say "a great blow"? To teach about the initial ones, which are a great blow.

hebrew_text: נִתְקַלְקֵל וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֶחָד הָאִישׁ וְאֶחָד הָאִשָּׁה בְּרֵיעִי וְלֹא בְּמַיִם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הָאִישׁ בְּרֵיעִי, וְהָאִשָּׁה בְּמַיִם. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֶחָד הָאִישׁ וְאֶחָד הָאִשָּׁה – בֵּין בְּרֵיעִי בֵּין בְּמַיִם.
human_translation: sullies himself, The Sages taught both a man and a woman, with excrement, but not with urine; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: The man with excrement, and the woman with urine. And the Rabbis say: Both a man and a woman whether with excrement or with urine.
