llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "נִתְקַלְקֵל וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֶחָד הָאִישׁ וְאֶחָד הָאִשָּׁה בְּרֵיעִי וְלֹא בְּמַיִם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הָאִישׁ בְּרֵיעִי, וְהָאִשָּׁה בְּמַיִם. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֶחָד הָאִישׁ וְאֶחָד הָאִשָּׁה – בֵּין בְּרֵעִי בֵּין בְּמַיִם." Translation: "Dispute and so forth. The Rabbis taught: One case with the man and one case with the woman, in a private domain and not in water, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: The man in a private domain, and the woman in water. And the Sages say: One case with the man and one case with the woman – whether in a private domain or in water."

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד הָאִישׁ וְאֶחָד הָאִשָּׁה – בְּרֵיעִי! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: שְׁנֵיהֶם שָׁוִין בְּרֵיעִי.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda says: Both a man and a woman with excrement, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: both are equal with regard to excrement.
llm_translation: The text states: "And it was taught, Rabbi Yehuda says: One man and one woman - they are considered friends! Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Both of them are considered friends."

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כְּפָתוּהוּ, וְרָץ מִבֵּית דִּין – פָּטוּר. מֵיתִיבִי: קָלָה, בֵּין בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה בֵּין בַּשְּׁנִיָּה – פּוֹטְרִין אוֹתוֹ. נִפְסְקָה רְצוּעָה בַּשְּׁנִיָּה – פּוֹטְרִין אוֹתוֹ, בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה – אֵין פּוֹטְרִין אוֹתוֹ. אַמַּאי? לֶהֱוֵי כְּרָץ! הָתָם רָץ, הָכָא לָא רָץ.
human_translation: Shmuel says: they bound him and he fled from court, exempt. The Gemara raises an objection was debased whether during first or during second exempts him. strap was severed during second they exempt him, during first they do not exempt him. Why Let be like one who fled There, he fled here, he did not flee,
llm_translation: Shmuel said: If he was pushed and ran out of the court - he is exempt. It was asked: Whether he stumbled, whether in the first instance or in the second instance - they exempt him. If the strap broke in the second instance - they exempt him, in the first instance - they do not exempt him. Why? It should be like a running! There he ran, here he did not run.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֲמָדוּהוּ לִכְשֶׁיִּלְקֶה קָלֶה – פּוֹטְרִין אוֹתוֹ. לִכְשֶׁיֵּצֵא מִבֵּית דִּין קָלֶה – מַלְקִין אוֹתוֹ. וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא, אֲפִילּוּ קָלָה בַּתְּחִלָּה – מַלְקִין אוֹתוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהִכָּהוּ וְגוֹ׳ וְנִקְלָה״ וְלֹא שֶׁלָּקָה כְּבָר בְּבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: The Sages taught: they assessed him that when he is flogged he debased they exempt him, that when he will leave the court he debased they flog him. Moreover, even if he was debased initially, they flog him, as it is stated: “And strike him…and shall be debased” and not one who was already debased in court
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If he was warned and he committed a light transgression - they exempt him. If he leaves the court after being warned - they flog him. And not only that, but even if he committed a light transgression initially - they flog him, as it is stated: "And he shall strike him, etc., and he shall be flogged," not that he was already flogged in court.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת שֶׁלָּקוּ – נִפְטְרוּ יְדֵי כְּרִיתָתָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנִקְלָה אָחִיךָ לְעֵינֶיךָ״ – כְּשֶׁלָּקָה הֲרֵי הוּא כְּאָחִיךָ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָה בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: All those liable karet who were flogged are exempted from their karet , as it is stated: “And your brother shall be debased before your eyes” Once he is flogged he is as your brother, the statement of Rabbi Ḥananya ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: all those liable to karet who were flogged - their karet obligation is discharged, as it is stated: "And your brother shall be degraded in your eyes" - when he is flogged, he is like your brother. These are the words of Rabbi Hananiah ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָה בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: מָה אִם הָעוֹבֵר עֲבֵירָה אַחַת נוֹטֵל נַפְשׁוֹ עָלֶיהָ, הָעוֹשֶׂה מִצְוָה אַחַת עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה שֶׁתִּנָּתֵן לוֹ נַפְשׁוֹ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מִמְּקוֹמוֹ הוּא לָמֵד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנִכְרְתוּ הַנְּפָשׁוֹת הָעֹשֹׂת וְגוֹ׳״
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥananya ben Gamliel says: And if one who performs one transgression his soul is taken for it, one who performs a single mitzva, all the more so that his soul will be given to him, Rabbi Shimon says: It is derived from its place as it is stated “And the souls that perform shall be excised” and it states
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Hananiah ben Gamliel: What if one transgresses one sin, he takes his soul upon it, one who performs one mitzvah, how much and how much his soul is given to him. Rabbi Shimon says: He learned from his place, as it says: "And the souls that do shall be cut off, etc."

hebrew_text: ״אֲשֶׁר יַעֲשֶׂה אֹתָם הָאָדָם וָחַי בָּהֶם״. הָא הַיּוֹשֵׁב וְלָא עָבַר עֲבֵירָה נוֹתְנִין לוֹ שָׂכָר כָּעוֹשֶׂה מִצְוָה.
human_translation: “That a person shall perform and live by them” that one who sits and did not perform a transgression, gives him a reward like performs a mitzva.
llm_translation: "Which a man shall do and live by them." Here, one who sits and does not transgress a sin, reward is given to him as one who performs a commandment.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּר רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר ״רַק חֲזַק לְבִלְתִּי אֲכֹל (אֶת) הַדָּם כִּי הַדָּם הוּא הַנָּפֶשׁ וְגוֹ׳״ וּמָה אִם הַדָּם, שֶׁנַּפְשׁוֹ שֶׁל הָאָדָם קָצָה מִמֶּנּוּ – הַפּוֹרֵשׁ מִמֶּנּוּ מְקַבֵּל שָׂכָר, גָּזֵל וַעֲרָיוֹת, שֶׁנַּפְשׁוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם מִתְאַוָּה לָהֶן וּמְחַמַּדְתָּן – הַפּוֹרֵשׁ מֵהֶן עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה שֶׁיִּזְכֶּה לוֹ וּלְדוֹרוֹתָיו וּלְדוֹרוֹת דּוֹרוֹתָיו עַד סוֹף כׇּל הַדּוֹרוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon bar Rabbi says states: “Only be steadfast to not eat the blood, as the blood is the soul” And if the blood, which a person’s soul loathes, one who abstains from its receives a reward robbery and forbidden relatives, which a person’s soul desires and covets, one who abstains from their all the more so that he and his descendants and the descendants of his descendants until the end of all generations will merit
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi, says: Behold, he says, "Only be strong not to eat the blood, for the blood is the soul, etc." And if the blood, whose soul of a person ends from him - one who separates from it receives reward, theft, and forbidden relationships, for the soul of a person desires them and covets them - one who separates from them even a little, how much more so will he merit for himself and for his generations and for the generations of his generations until the end of all generations.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן עֲקַשְׁיָא אוֹמֵר: רָצָה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְזַכּוֹת אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל, לְפִיכָךְ הִרְבָּה לָהֶם תּוֹרָה וּמִצְוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״ה׳ חָפֵץ לְמַעַן צִדְקוֹ יַגְדִּיל תּוֹרָה וְיַאְדִּיר״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akashya says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, sought to confer merit upon the Jewish people; therefore, He increased for them Torah and mitzvot, as it is stated: “It pleased the Lord for the sake of His righteousness to make the Torah great and glorious”
llm_translation: Rabbi Hananiah ben Akashya says: The Holy One, blessed be He, desired to merit Israel; therefore, He increased for them Torah and commandments, as it is stated, "Hashem desired, for the sake of His righteousness, to make the Torah great and glorious" (Isaiah 42:21).

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: חֲלוּקִין עָלָיו חֲבֵרָיו עַל רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָה בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: אָמְרִי בֵּי רַב, תְּנֵינַן: אֵין בֵּין שַׁבָּת לְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים אֶלָּא שֶׁזֶּה זְדוֹנוֹ בִּידֵי אָדָם וְזֶה זְדוֹנוֹ בְּהִכָּרֵת. וְאִם אִיתָא, אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בִּידֵי אָדָם הוּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi Ḥananya ben Gamliel’s colleagues are in disagreement with him Rav Adda bar Ahava said they say the school of Rav we learned The difference between Shabbat and Yom Kippur is only that this its intentional by human hands, and that its intentional with karet . And if is so, this and that by human hands.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rabbi Yochanan: His colleagues divided concerning Rabbi Chananya ben Gamliel. Said Rav Adda bar Ahava: Said the students of Rav, we learned: There is no difference between Shabbat and Yom Kippur except that this one involves intentional actions by man and this one involves excision. And if it comes, both are in the hands of man.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אוֹמֵר: הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי יִצְחָק הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מַלְקוֹת בְּחַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת לֵיכָּא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יִצְחָק אוֹמֵר: חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת בַּכְּלָל הָיוּ, וְלָמָּה יָצָאת כָּרֵת בַּאֲחוֹתוֹ – לְדוּנוֹ בְּכָרֵת וְלֹא בְּמַלְקוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: whose is this It is Rabbi Yitzḥak, who says: There are no lashes in those liable karet . As it is taught Rabbi Yitzḥak says: those liable karet were included in And why was karet one’s sister excluded to sentence to with karet and not with lashes.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak says: This is the teaching of Rabbi Yitzchak, who said: There are lashes for those liable for karet. As it was taught: Rabbi Yitzchak says: Those liable for karet were included in general, so why did karet come out specifically in its sister - to judge regarding karet and not lashes.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, זֶה – עִיקַּר זְדוֹנוֹ בִּידֵי אָדָם, וְזֶה – עִיקַּר זְדוֹנוֹ בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even you say the Rabbis, this primary its intentional by human hands, and that primary its intentional at the hand of Heaven.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even if you say they are scholars, this one - the main part of his punishment is in the hands of man, and this one - the main part of his punishment is in the hands of Heaven.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מַאן סְלֵיק לְעֵילָּא וַאֲתָא וַאֲמַר?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים עָשׂוּ בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל מַטָּה וְהִסְכִּימוּ בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל מַעְלָה עַל יָדָם – מַאן סְלֵיק לְעֵילָּא וַאֲתָא וַאֲמַר? אֶלָּא: קְרָאֵי קָא דָרְשִׁינַן, הָכָא נָמֵי, קְרָאֵי קָא דָרְשִׁינַן.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava says Rav says: The halakha in accordance with Rabbi Ḥananya ben Gamliel, Rav Yosef said: Who ascended on high and came and said Abaye said to But that which Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: three matters earthly court implemented and the heavenly court agreed with them, Who ascended on high and came and said Rather, we interpret verses. Here too, we interpret verses.
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said in the name of Rav: The halakha is according to Rabbi Chananya ben Gamliel. Rav Yosef said: Who ascended on high and came and said this?! Abaye said to him: Rather, what Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: If the lower court did three things and the higher court agreed with them, who ascended on high and came and said this? Rather, we are expounding verses here, and there too, we are expounding verses.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים עָשׂוּ בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל מַטָּה וְהִסְכִּימוּ בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל מַעְלָה עַל יָדָם, [אֵלּוּ הֵן]: מִקְרָא מְגִילָּה, וּשְׁאֵילַת שָׁלוֹם [בַּשֵּׁם], וַהֲבָאַת מַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: the itself, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: three matters earthly court implemented and the heavenly court agreed with them, and these are they: Reading the Scroll and greeting with the name of God, and bringing tithe
llm_translation: The body, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Three things the lower court did, and the higher court agreed with them, these are: Reading the Megillah, inquiring after one's welfare in the name of God, and bringing tithes.

hebrew_text: מִקְרָא מְגִילָּה – דִּכְתִיב ״קִיְּמוּ וְקִבְּלוּ הַיְּהוּדִים״ – קִיְּימוּ לְמַעְלָה מַה שֶּׁקִּבְּלוּ לְמַטָּה.
human_translation: Reading the Scroll as it is written: “The Jews confirmed, and they took upon themselves” They confirmed above which they took upon themselves below
llm_translation: Tractate Megillah - as it is written "they established and took upon themselves" - they established above what they had accepted below.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁאֵילַת שָׁלוֹם – דִּכְתִיב ״וְהִנֵּה בֹעַז בָּא מִבֵּית לֶחֶם וַיֹּאמֶר לַקּוֹצְרִים ה׳ עִמָּכֶם״, וְאוֹמֵר ״ה׳ עִמְּךָ גִּבּוֹר הֶחָיִל״. מַאי ״וְאוֹמֵר״? וְכִי תֵּימָא בּוֹעַז הוּא דַּעֲבַד מִדַּעְתֵּיהּ, וּמִשְּׁמַיָּא לָא אַסְכִּימוּ עַל יְדֵיהּ – תָּא שְׁמַע: וְאוֹמֵר ״ה׳ עִמְּךָ גִּבּוֹר הֶחָיִל״.
human_translation: And greeting as it is written: “And presently Boaz came from Bethlehem and said to the harvesters: The Lord is with you, and they said to him: May the Lord bless you” And it states: The Lord is with you, mighty man of valor” What And it states? And if you would say: It is Boaz who did on his own, and from Heaven they did not agree with him; come hear and it says: “The Lord is with you, mighty man of valor.”
llm_translation: Inquiry of well-being - as it is written, "And behold, Boaz came from Bethlehem and said to the reapers, 'The Lord be with you.'" And it says, "The Lord be with you, mighty man of valor." What is "and he says"? And if you say that Boaz himself said it with his own knowledge, and not from Heaven, they did not agree with him - come and hear: "And he says, 'The Lord be with you, mighty man of valor.'"

hebrew_text: הֲבָאַת מַעֲשֵׂר – דִּכְתִיב ״הָבִיאוּ אֶת כׇּל הַמַּעֲשֵׂר אֶל בֵּית הָאוֹצָר וִיהִי טֶרֶף בְּבֵיתִי וּבְחָנוּנִי נָא בָּזֹאת אָמַר ה׳ צְבָאוֹת אִם לֹא אֶפְתַּח לָכֶם אֵת אֲרֻבּוֹת הַשָּׁמַיִם וַהֲרִיקֹתִי לָכֶם בְּרָכָה עַד בְּלִי דָי״. מַאי ״עַד בְּלִי דָּי״? אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר רַב: עַד שֶׁיִּבְלוּ שִׂפְתוֹתֵיכֶם מִלּוֹמַר ״דָּי״.
human_translation: bringing tithe as it is written: “Bring you the whole tithe into the storehouse, that there may be food in My house, and try Me now with this, says the Lord of hosts, if I will not open for you the windows of heaven and pour you out a blessing, that there shall be more than sufficiency [ ad beli dai ]” What “ ad beli dai ”? Rami bar Rav says: that your lips will be worn out [ yivlu ], from saying enough [ dai ].
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Bringing of the tithe - as it is written, "Bring all the tithes into the storehouse, so that there may be food in My house, and test Me now herewith, says the Lord of hosts, if I will not open for you the windows of heaven, and pour out for you a blessing until there is no more need." What is "until there is no more need"? Ramei bar Rav said: Until your lips become worn out from saying "enough." English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה מְקוֹמוֹת הוֹפִיעַ רוּחַ הַקּוֹדֶשׁ: בְּבֵית דִּינוֹ שֶׁל שֵׁם, וּבְבֵית דִּינוֹ שֶׁל שְׁמוּאֵל הָרָמָתִי, וּבְבֵית דִּינוֹ שֶׁל שְׁלֹמֹה. בְּבֵית דִּינוֹ שֶׁל שֵׁם – דִּכְתִיב ״וַיַּכֵּר יְהוּדָה וַיֹּאמֶר צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״. מְנָא יָדַע? דִּלְמָא כִּי הֵיכִי דַּאֲזַל אִיהוּ לְגַבַּהּ אֲזַל נָמֵי אִינָשׁ אַחֲרִינָא [לְגַבַּהּ]! יָצָאת בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: מִמֶּנִּי יָצְאוּ כְּבוּשִׁים.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: In three places the Divine Spirit appeared In the court of Shem, in the court of Samuel the Ramathite, and in the court of Solomon. in the court of Shem, as it is written “And Judah acknowledged them and said: She is more righteous than I [ mimmenni ]” How did know Perhaps, just as he went to her another person went to her as well, a Divine Voice emerged and said: from Me [ mimmenni ] secrets emerged.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: In three places the Holy Spirit appeared: in the court of Shem, in the court of Samuel the Ramathite, and in the court of Solomon. In the court of Shem - as it is written, "Judah acknowledged and said, 'She is more righteous than I.'" How did he know? Perhaps when he went up, another person went up before him! A Divine Voice emerged and said: "From me they have come out embarrassed."

hebrew_text: בְּבֵית דִּינוֹ שֶׁל שְׁמוּאֵל – דִּכְתִיב ״הִנְנִי עֲנוּ בִי נֶגֶד ה׳ וְנֶגֶד מְשִׁיחוֹ אֶת שׁוֹר מִי לָקַחְתִּי... וַיֹּאמְרוּ לֹא עֲשַׁקְתָּנוּ וְלֹא רַצּוֹתָנוּ... וַיֹּאמֶר עֵד ה׳ וְעֵד מְשִׁיחוֹ... כִּי לֹא מְצָאתֶם בְּיָדִי מְאוּמָה וַיֹּאמֶר עֵד״, ״וַיֹּאמֶר״? ״וַיֹּאמְרוּ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! יָצָאת בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: אֲנִי עֵד בְּדָבָר זֶה.
human_translation: in the court of Samuel, as it is written: “Here I am; testify against me before the Lord and before His anointed: Whose ox have I taken…And they said: You have neither defrauded us nor oppressed us…And he said to them: The Lord is witness against you, and His anointed is witness this day, that you have not found anything in my hand. And he said: He is witness” “And he said,” And they said, should have a Divine Voice emerged and said: I, am witness to this matter.
llm_translation: In the court of Shmuel - as it is written, "Behold, here I am; testify against me before the Lord and before His anointed: Whose ox have I taken... And they said, 'You have not wronged us, nor oppressed us...' And he said, 'The Lord is witness against you, and His anointed is witness...' For I have found nothing in my hand." Why does it say, "And he said"? It should have said, "And they said"! A heavenly voice came forth and said: "I am a witness regarding this matter."

hebrew_text: בְּבֵית דִּינוֹ שֶׁל שְׁלֹמֹה – דִּכְתִיב ״וַיַּעַן הַמֶּלֶךְ וַיֹּאמֶר תְּנוּ לָהּ אֶת הַיֶּלֶד הַחַי וְהָמֵת לֹא תְמִיתֻהוּ (כִּי) הִיא אִמּוֹ״. מְנָא יָדַע? דִּלְמָא אִיעָרוּמֵא מְיעָרְמָא! יָצָאת בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: ״הִיא אִמּוֹ״.
human_translation: in the court of Solomon, as it is written: “And the king answered and said: Give her the living child, and do not slay him; she is his mother” How did know Perhaps she was devious a Divine Voice emerged and said: She is his mother.
llm_translation: In the court of Solomon - as it is written, "And the king answered and said, 'Give her the living child, and by no means kill it; she is its mother.'" How did he know? Perhaps it was a deception! A heavenly voice emerged and said, "She is its mother."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא יְהוּדָה, כֵּיוָן דְּחַשֵּׁיב יַרְחֵי וְיוֹמֵי וְאִיתְרְמִי – דְּחָזֵינַן מַחְזְקִינַן, דְּלָא חָזֵינַן לָא מַחְזְקִינַן.
human_translation: Rava said: From where Perhaps Judah, once he calculated months and the days and it happened which we see, we establish presumptive status; which we do not see, we do not establish presumptive status.
llm_translation: Rava said: From where? Perhaps it is the opinion of Yehudah, since he calculates months and days and intercalates - we see that we strengthen the leap year, for if we do not see the new moon, we do not strengthen the leap year.

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל נָמֵי, כּוּלְּהוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל קָרֵי לְהוּ בִּלְשׁוֹן יְחִידִי, דִּכְתִיב ״יִשְׂרָאֵל נוֹשַׁע בַּה׳״.
human_translation: Samuel too, entire Jewish people is referred to in the singular, as it is written, “The Jewish people is saved by the Lord”
llm_translation: Samuel the Aramean, all of Israel calls him in the singular language, as it is written, "Israel is saved by the Lord."

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹמֹה נָמֵי – מִדְּהָא קָא (מְרַחַמְתָּא) [מְרַחֲמָא] וְהָא לָא קָא (מְרַחַמְתָּא) [מְרַחֲמָא]! אֶלָּא גְּמָרָא.
human_translation: Solomon too, due to that this is merciful and this is not merciful, Rather, a tradition
llm_translation: Shlomo named - from here it is (merachamta) merachama and this is not (merachamta) merachama! Rather, it is Gemara.

hebrew_text: דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי שִׂמְלַאי: שֵׁשׁ מֵאוֹת וּשְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה מִצְוֹת נֶאֶמְרוּ לוֹ לְמֹשֶׁה, שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת וְשִׁשִּׁים וְחָמֵשׁ לָאוִין כְּמִנְיַן יְמוֹת הַחַמָּה, וּמָאתַיִם וְאַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁמוֹנָה עֲשֵׂה כְּנֶגֶד אֵיבָרָיו שֶׁל אָדָם. אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: מַאי קְרָא – ״תּוֹרָה צִוָּה לָנוּ מֹשֶׁה מוֹרָשָׁה״, ״תּוֹרָה״ בְּגִימַטְרִיָּא
human_translation: Rabbi Simlai taught: 613 mitzvot stated to Moses 365 prohibitions corresponding to the number of days the solar year, and 248 positive corresponding to a person’s limbs. Rav Hamnuna said: What is the verse “Moses commanded to us the Torah, an inheritance Torah, in its numerical value [ gimatriyya ],
llm_translation: Rabbi Shemlai expounded: Six hundred and thirteen commandments were spoken to Moses, three hundred and sixty-five negative commandments corresponding to the number of days of the sun, and two hundred and forty-eight positive commandments corresponding to the limbs of a person. Rav Hamnuna said: What is the verse? "The Torah that Moses commanded us is the inheritance of the congregation of Jacob," "Torah" in gematria.

hebrew_text: שֵׁית מְאָה וְחַד סְרֵי הָוֵי, ״אָנֹכִי״ וְ״לֹא יִהְיֶה לְךָ״ – מִפִּי הַגְּבוּרָה שְׁמַעְנוּם.
human_translation: is 611, “I am “You shall have we heard from the mouth of the Almighty,
llm_translation: "Six hundred and eleven shall be," 'I' and 'you shall not have' - from the mouth of the Almighty we have heard them.

hebrew_text: (סימן דמשמק סק).
human_translation: a mnemonic Dalet , mem , shin , mem , kuf ; samekh , kuf ;
llm_translation: Tractate: Siman Demashmek Sak Translation:

hebrew_text: בָּא דָּוִד וְהֶעֱמִידָן עַל אַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה, דִּכְתִיב ״מִזְמוֹר לְדָוִד [ה׳] מִי יָגוּר בְּאׇהֳלֶךָ מִי יִשְׁכֹּן בְּהַר קׇדְשֶׁךָ. הוֹלֵךְ תָּמִים וּפוֹעֵל צֶדֶק וְדֹבֵר אֱמֶת בִּלְבָבוֹ, לֹא רָגַל עַל לְשֹׁנוֹ לֹא עָשָׂה לְרֵעֵהוּ רָעָה וְחֶרְפָּה לֹא נָשָׂא עַל קְרֹבוֹ. נִבְזֶה בְּעֵינָיו נִמְאָס וְאֶת יִרְאֵי ה׳ יְכַבֵּד נִשְׁבַּע לְהָרַע וְלֹא יָמִר. כַּסְפּוֹ לֹא נָתַן בְּנֶשֶׁךְ וְשֹׁחַד עַל נָקִי לֹא לָקָח עֹשֵׂה אֵלֶּה לֹא יִמּוֹט לְעוֹלָם״.
human_translation: David came and established upon eleven as it is written: “A Psalm of David. Lord, who shall sojourn in Your Tabernacle? Who shall dwell upon Your sacred mountain? He who walks wholeheartedly, and works righteousness, and speaks truth in his heart. Who has no slander upon his tongue, nor does evil to his neighbor, nor takes up reproach against his relative. In whose eyes a vile person is despised, and he honors those who fear the Lord; he takes an oath to his own detriment, and changes not. He neither gives his money with interest, nor takes a bribe against the innocent. He who performs these shall never be moved”
llm_translation: David came and established them on eleven, as it is written, "A Psalm of David. Hashem, who may dwell in Your tent, who may abide on Your holy mountain? One who walks with integrity and acts justly and speaks the truth in his heart, who does not slander with his tongue, does no evil to his fellow, nor takes up a reproach against his neighbor. In his eyes a vile person is despised, but he honors those who fear Hashem; he swears to his own hurt and does not retract. He does not lend his money at interest, nor take a bribe against the innocent. One who does these things shall never be shaken."

hebrew_text: ״הוֹלֵךְ תָּמִים״ – זֶה אַבְרָהָם, דִּכְתִיב ״הִתְהַלֵּךְ לְפָנַי וֶהְיֵה תָמִים״.
human_translation: “He who walks wholeheartedly”; this Abraham, as it is written “Walk before Me and be wholehearted”
llm_translation: "The one who walks blamelessly" - this is Abraham, as it is written, "Walk before Me and be blameless."

hebrew_text: ״פּוֹעֵל צֶדֶק״ – כְּגוֹן אַבָּא חִלְקִיָּהוּ.
human_translation: “Works righteousness”; such as Abba Ḥilkiyyahu,
llm_translation: "Worker of righteousness" - such as Abba Chilkiah.

hebrew_text: ״וְדוֹבֵר אֱמֶת בִּלְבָבוֹ״ – כְּגוֹן רַב סָפְרָא.
human_translation: “And speaks truth in his heart”; such as Rav Safra,
llm_translation: "And speaking truth in his heart" - like Rav Safra.

hebrew_text: ״לֹא רָגַל עַל לְשֹׁנוֹ״ – זֶה יַעֲקֹב אָבִינוּ, דִּכְתִיב ״אוּלַי יְמֻשֵּׁנִי אָבִי וְהָיִיתִי בְעֵינָיו כִּמְתַעְתֵּעַ״.
human_translation: “Who has no slander upon his tongue”; this our forefather Jacob, as it is written: “Perhaps my father will feel me, and I will be in his eyes like a fraud”
llm_translation: "Not stepped on his tongue" - this is our father Jacob, as it is written, "Perhaps my father will feel me, and I will be in his eyes as a deceiver."

hebrew_text: ״לֹא עָשָׂה לְרֵעֵהוּ רָעָה״ – שֶׁלֹּא יָרַד לְאוּמָּנוּת חֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: “Nor does evil to his neighbor”; who did not infringe upon another’s trade,
llm_translation: "Not did to his fellow evil" - that he should not descend to his fellow's level of craftiness.

hebrew_text: ״וְחֶרְפָּה לֹא נָשָׂא עַל קְרֹבוֹ״ – זֶה הַמְקָרֵב אֶת קְרוֹבָיו.
human_translation: “Nor takes up reproach against his relative”; this one who draws his relatives near,
llm_translation: "And disgrace he did not bear upon his relatives" - this refers to one who brings near his relatives.

hebrew_text: ״נִבְזֶה בְּעֵינָיו נִמְאָס״ – זֶה חִזְקִיָּהוּ הַמֶּלֶךְ, שֶׁגֵּירַר עַצְמוֹת אָבִיו בְּמִטָּה שֶׁל חֲבָלִים.
human_translation: “In whose eyes a vile person is despised”; this King Hezekiah, who dragged the bones of his father, in a bed of ropes,
llm_translation: "Despised in his eyes, rejected" - this is King Hezekiah, who dragged the bones of his father on a bed of ropes.

hebrew_text: ״וְאֶת יִרְאֵי ה׳ יְכַבֵּד״ – זֶה יְהוֹשָׁפָט מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה, שֶׁבְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהָיָה רוֹאֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם הָיָה עוֹמֵד מִכִּסְּאוֹ וּמְחַבְּקוֹ וּמְנַשְּׁקוֹ וְקוֹרֵא לוֹ ״אָבִי אָבִי, רַבִּי רַבִּי, מָרִי מָרִי״.
human_translation: “And he honors those who fear the Lord”; this Jehoshaphat, king of Judea, who when he would see a Torah scholar would arise from his throne and hug him and kiss him, and call him: My father, my father, my teacher, my teacher, my master, my master.
llm_translation: "And those who fear the Lord shall be honored" - this is Jehoshaphat, king of Judah, who, when he would see a Torah scholar, would rise from his throne, embrace and kiss him, and call him 'my father, my father, my teacher, my teacher.'

hebrew_text: ״נִשְׁבַּע לְהָרַע וְלֹא יָמִר״ – כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֱהֵא בְּתַעֲנִית עַד שֶׁאָבֹא לְבֵיתִי.
human_translation: “He takes an oath to his own detriment, and changes not”; in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan, as Rabbi Yoḥanan say I shall fast until I will come to my house.
llm_translation: "Swore to do evil and did not regret" - like Rabbi Yochanan, for Rabbi Yochanan said: "Be on a fast until I come to my house."

hebrew_text: ״כַּסְפּוֹ לֹא נָתַן בְּנֶשֶׁךְ״ – אֲפִילּוּ (בְּ)רִבִּית גּוֹי.
human_translation: “He neither gives his money with interest”; with interest even a gentile,
llm_translation: "His silver he did not give with interest" - even with Gentile interest.

hebrew_text: ״וְשֹׁחַד עַל נָקִי לֹא לָקָח״ – כְּגוֹן רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: “Nor takes a bribe against the innocent”; such as Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: "And a bribe upon the innocent he did not take" - such as Rabbi Yishmael son of Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: כְּתִיב ״עֲשֵׂה אֵלֶּה לֹא יִמּוֹט לְעוֹלָם״ – כְּשֶׁהָיָה רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מַגִּיעַ לְמִקְרָא הַזֶּה הָיָה בּוֹכֶה, אֲמַר: מַאן דְּעָבֵיד לְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ – הוּא דְּלָא יִמּוֹט, הָא חֲדָא מִינַּיְיהוּ – יִמּוֹט.
human_translation: it is written: “He who performs these shall never be moved.” When Rabban Gamliel would reach this verse he would cry, he said: one who performed all who shall never be moved; but one of them, he shall be moved.
llm_translation: It is written, "Do these, it shall not be moved forever" - when Rabban Gamliel would reach this verse, he would cry. He said: Whoever does these for all of them - he shall not be moved, but one of them - shall be moved.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מִי כְּתִיב ״עֹשֵׂה כׇּל אֵלֶּה״? ״עֹשֵׂה אֵלֶּה״ כְּתִיב, אֲפִילּוּ בַּחֲדָא מִינַּיְיהוּ. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, כְּתִיב קְרָא אַחֲרִינָא ״אַל תִּטַּמְּאוּ בְּכׇל אֵלֶּה״, הָתָם נָמֵי, הַנּוֹגֵעַ בְּכׇל אֵלֶּה – הוּא דְּמִטַּמֵּא, בַּחֲדָא מִינַּיְיהוּ – לָא? אֶלָּא לָאו בְּאַחַת מִכׇּל אֵלֶּה, הָכָא נָמֵי בְּאַחַת מִכׇּל אֵלּוּ.
human_translation: said to him: Is it written: He who performs all these? “he who performs these” is written, even in one of them. As if you do not say so, a different verse is written “Do not impurify yourselves with all these” there too one who comes into contact with all these who becomes impure, one who comes into contact with one of these, no, Rather, not With one of all these? Here too one of all these
llm_translation: They said to him: Who is it written "doing all these"? "Doing these" is written, even with one of them. For if you do not say so, it is written another verse "Do not defile yourselves with all these," there too, one who touches all these - he is the one who defiles, but with one of them - not? Rather, not with one of all these, here too with one of all these.

hebrew_text: בָּא יְשַׁעְיָהוּ וְהֶעֱמִידָן עַל שֵׁשׁ, דִּכְתִיב ״הֹלֵךְ צְדָקוֹת וְדֹבֵר מֵישָׁרִים מֹאֵס בְּבֶצַע מַעֲשַׁקּוֹת נֹעֵר כַּפָּיו מִתְּמֹךְ בַּשֹּׁחַד אֹטֵם אׇזְנוֹ מִשְּׁמֹעַ דָּמִים וְעֹצֵם עֵינָיו מֵרְאוֹת בְּרָע״.
human_translation: Isaiah came and established upon six, as it is written: “He who walks righteously, and speaks uprightly; he who despises the gain of oppressions, who shakes his hands from holding of bribes, who stops his ears from hearing blood, and shuts his eyes from looking upon evil”
llm_translation: Isaiah came and established them on six, as it is written, "He who walks righteously and speaks uprightly, who despises the gain of oppressions, who shakes his hands, lest they hold a bribe, who stops his ears from hearing of bloodshed and shuts his eyes from looking on evil."

hebrew_text: ״הֹלֵךְ צְדָקוֹת״ – זֶה אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ, דִּכְתִיב ״כִּי יְדַעְתִּיו לְמַעַן אֲשֶׁר יְצַוֶּה וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: “He who walks righteously”; this our forefather Abraham, as it is written “For I have known him, that he will command
llm_translation: "The one who goes in righteousness" - this is our father Abraham, as it is written, "For I have known him, to the end that he may command his children and his household after him."

hebrew_text: ״וְדֹבֵר מֵישָׁרִים״ – זֶה שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַקְנִיט פְּנֵי חֲבֵירוֹ בָּרַבִּים.
human_translation: “And speaks uprightly”; this one who does not shame another in public.
llm_translation: "And one who speaks 'from straightness' - this is one who does not provoke the face of his fellow in public."

hebrew_text: ״מֹאֵס בְּבֶצַע מַעֲשַׁקּוֹת״ – כְּגוֹן רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן אֱלִישָׁע.
human_translation: “He who despises the gain of oppressions”; such as Rabbi Yishmael ben Elisha,
llm_translation: "Despises in profits extortion" - such as Rabbi Yishmael ben Elisha.

hebrew_text: ״נֹעֵר כַּפָּיו מִתְּמֹךְ בַּשֹּׁחַד״ – כְּגוֹן רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: “Who shakes his hands from holding of bribes”; such as Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: "The youth supports himself with a bribe" - such as Rabbi Yishmael son of Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: ״אֹטֵם אׇזְנוֹ מִשְּׁמֹעַ דָּמִים״ – דְּלָא שָׁמַע בְּזִילוּתָא דְּצוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן וְשָׁתֵיק, כְּגוֹן רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: “Who stops his ears from hearing blood”; who not hear derision of a Torah scholar and remain silent, such as Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon,
llm_translation: "Plugging his ear from hearing blood" - for he did not hear through the theft of a bird from the sages and remained silent, like Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: ״וְעֹצֵם עֵינָיו מֵרְאוֹת בְּרָע״ – כְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: זֶה שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִסְתַּכֵּל בְּנָשִׁים בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעוֹמְדוֹת עַל הַכְּבִיסָה.
human_translation: “And shuts his eyes from looking upon evil” in accordance with Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, as Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says: This who does not look at women when they stand over the laundry
llm_translation: "And he shuts his eyes from seeing evil" - like Rabbi Chiya bar Abba, as Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said: This refers to one who does not look at women when they are standing by the laundry."

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״הוּא מְרוֹמִים יִשְׁכּוֹן״.
human_translation: And it is written “He shall dwell on high;
llm_translation: And it is written: "He dwells in the heights."

hebrew_text: בָּא מִיכָה וְהֶעֱמִידָן עַל שָׁלֹשׁ, דִּכְתִיב ״הִגִּיד לְךָ אָדָם מַה טּוֹב וּמָה ה׳ דּוֹרֵשׁ מִמְּךָ כִּי אִם עֲשׂוֹת מִשְׁפָּט וְאַהֲבַת חֶסֶד וְהַצְנֵעַ לֶכֶת עִם (ה׳) אֱלֹהֶיךָ״.
human_translation: Micah came and established upon three, as it is written: “It has been told to you, O man, what is good, and what the Lord does require of you; only to do justly, and to love mercy, and to walk humbly with your God”
llm_translation: Micah came and established for us on three, as it is written, "He has told you, O man, what is good, and what the Lord requires of you: Only to do justice, to love kindness, and to walk humbly with your God."

hebrew_text: ״עֲשׂוֹת מִשְׁפָּט״ – זֶה הַדִּין. ״אַהֲבַת חֶסֶד״ – זֶה גְּמִילוּת חֲסָדִים. ״וְהַצְנֵעַ לֶכֶת״ – זֶה הוֹצָאַת הַמֵּת וְהַכְנָסַת כַּלָּה. וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה דְּבָרִים שֶׁאֵין דַּרְכָּן לַעֲשׂוֹתָן בְּצִנְעָא, אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה ״וְהַצְנֵעַ לֶכֶת״, דְּבָרִים שֶׁדַּרְכָּם לַעֲשׂוֹתָם בְּצִנְעָא – עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה!
human_translation: “To do justly,” this justice; “to love mercy,” this acts of loving-kindness; “and to walk humbly with your God,” this taking the dead out and accompanying bride And are matters not a fortiori ? If, matters that tend to be conducted in public, the Torah states “walk humbly” matters that tend to be conducted in private, all the more so in private.
llm_translation: "Doing justice" - this is the law. "Loving-kindness" - this is acts of kindness. "And to walk humbly" - this is accompanying the dead and bringing in a bride. And are these not logical: Just as things that are not typically done in humility, the Torah said, "And to walk humbly," things that are typically done in humility - all the more so!

hebrew_text: חָזַר יְשַׁעְיָהוּ וְהֶעֱמִידָן עַל שְׁתַּיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ שִׁמְרוּ מִשְׁפָּט וַעֲשׂוּ צְדָקָה״. בָּא עָמוֹס וְהֶעֱמִידָן עַל אַחַת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ לְבֵית יִשְׂרָאֵל דִּרְשׁוּנִי וִחְיוּ״. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אֵימָא דִּרְשׁוּנִי בְּכׇל הַתּוֹרָה! אֶלָּא: בָּא חֲבַקּוּק וְהֶעֱמִידָן עַל אַחַת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וְצַדִּיק בֶּאֱמוּנָתוֹ יִחְיֶה״.
human_translation: Isaiah then established upon two, as it is stated: “So says the Lord: Observe justice and perform righteous-ness” Amos came and established upon one, as it is stated: “So says the Lord to the house of Israel: Seek Me and live” Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak objects to this: say Seek Me throughout the entire Torah, Rather, Habakkuk came and established upon one, as it is stated: “But the righteous person shall live by his faith”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Yeshayahu returned and established them on two, as it is stated, "So said Hashem: Keep justice and do righteousness." Amos came and established them on one, as it is stated, "So said Hashem to the house of Israel: Seek Me and live." Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak objected: Perhaps seek Me in the entire Torah! Rather, Chavakuk came and established them on one, as it is stated, "But the righteous shall live by his faith."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: אַרְבַּע גְּזֵירוֹת גָּזַר מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל, בָּאוּ אַרְבָּעָה נְבִיאִים וּבִיטְּלוּם. מֹשֶׁה אָמַר: ״וַיִּשְׁכֹּן יִשְׂרָאֵל בֶּטַח בָּדָד עֵין יַעֲקֹב״, בָּא עָמוֹס וּבִיטְּלָהּ, [שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר]: ״חֲדַל נָא מִי יָקוּם יַעֲקֹב וְגוֹ׳״ וּכְתִיב ״נִחַם ה׳ עַל זֹאת״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina says: Moses our teacher issued four decrees upon the Jewish people, four prophets came and revoked them. Moses said: “And Israel dwells in safety, the fountain [ ein ] of Jacob alone” Amos came and revoked it, as it is stated: cease, I beseech You; how shall Jacob stand, and it states: “The Lord regretted this;
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina said: Four decrees did our teacher Moses decree upon Israel, and four prophets came and annulled them. Moses said: "And Israel dwelt securely, alone, at the fountain of Jacob." Amos came and annulled it, as it is stated: "Let Jacob arise no more." And it is written: "The Lord repented concerning this."

hebrew_text: מֹשֶׁה אָמַר: ״וּבַגּוֹיִם הָהֵם לֹא תַרְגִּיעַ״, בָּא יִרְמְיָה וְאָמַר: ״הָלוֹךְ לְהַרְגִּיעוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל״.
human_translation: Moses said: “And among these nations you shall have no repose” Jeremiah came and said: “Even Israel, when I go to cause him to rest”
llm_translation: Moses said: "And among those nations you will find no peace." Jeremiah came and said: "Going to bring peace to Israel."

hebrew_text: מֹשֶׁה אָמַר: ״פֹּקֵד עֲוֹן אָבוֹת עַל בָּנִים״, בָּא יְחֶזְקֵאל וּבִיטְּלָהּ: ״הַנֶּפֶשׁ הַחֹטֵאת הִיא תָמוּת״.
human_translation: Moses said: “He visits the transgression of the fathers upon the sons” Ezekiel came and revoked it: “The soul that sins, it shall die”
llm_translation: Moses said: "Visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children." Ezekiel came and annulled it: "The soul that sins, it shall die."

hebrew_text: מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״וַאֲבַדְתֶּם בַּגּוֹיִם״, בָּא יְשַׁעְיָהוּ וְאָמַר: ״וְהָיָה בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא יִתָּקַע בְּשׁוֹפָר גָּדוֹל״.
human_translation: Moses said: “And you shall be lost among the nations” Isaiah came and said: “And it shall be on that day the great shofar shall be sounded,
llm_translation: Moses said, "And you will be lost among the nations." Isaiah came and said, "And it shall come to pass in that day that a great shofar shall be blown."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: מִסְתְּפֵינָא מֵהַאי קְרָא ״וַאֲבַדְתֶּם בַּגּוֹיִם״. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא: דִּלְמָא כַּאֲבֵידָה הַמִּתְבַּקֶּשֶׁת, דִּכְתִיב ״תָּעִיתִי כְּשֶׂה אֹבֵד בַּקֵּשׁ עַבְדֶּךָ״! אֶלָּא מִסֵּיפָא [דִּקְרָא], ״וְאָכְלָה אֶתְכֶם אֶרֶץ אֹיְבֵיכֶם״. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ מָר זוּטְרָא: דִּלְמָא כַּאֲכִילַת קִישּׁוּאִין וְדִילּוּעִין.
human_translation: Rav says: I am afraid of that verse: “And you shall be lost among the nations.” Rav Pappa objects to this: Perhaps like a lost item that is sought as it is written: “I have gone astray like a lost lamb; seek Your servant” Rather, from the latter of that verse, “And the land of your enemies shall consume you.” Mar Zutra objects to this: Perhaps like the consumption of cucumbers and gourds,
llm_translation: Rav said: I am troubled by this verse, "And you shall be lost among the nations." Rav Papa objected to him: Perhaps it is like a lost object that is being sought, as it is written, "I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek Your servant"! Rather, from the continuation of the verse, "And the land of your enemies shall consume you." Mar Zutra objected to him: Perhaps it is like the consumption of cakes and pastries.

hebrew_text: וּכְבָר הָיָה רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מְהַלְּכִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ, וְשָׁמְעוּ קוֹל הֲמוֹנָהּ שֶׁל רוֹמִי מִפְּלָטָהּ [בְּרָחוֹק] מֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים מִיל, וְהִתְחִילוּ בּוֹכִין, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מְשַׂחֵק. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִפְּנֵי מָה אַתָּה מְשַׂחֵק? אָמַר לָהֶם: וְאַתֶּם מִפְּנֵי מָה אַתֶּם בּוֹכִים? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: הַלָּלוּ גּוֹיִם שֶׁמִּשְׁתַּחֲוִים לַעֲצַבִּים וּמְקַטְּרִים לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה יוֹשְׁבִין בֶּטַח וְהַשְׁקֵט, וְאָנוּ, בֵּית הֲדוֹם רַגְלֵי אֱלֹהֵינוּ שָׂרוּף
human_translation: And it once was that Rabban Gamliel, Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, Rabbi Yehoshua, and Rabbi Akiva were walking along the road and they heard the sound of the multitudes of Rome from Puteoli at a distance of one hundred and twenty mil . And began weeping and Rabbi Akiva laughing. They said to him: For what are you laughing? said to them: And you, for what are you weeping? They said to him: These gentiles, who bow to false gods and burn incense to idols, dwell securely and tranquilly and us, the House of the footstool of our God, is burnt
llm_translation: And already were Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah and Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Akiva walking on the road, and they heard the noise of the Romans from their camp at a distance of one hundred and twenty mil, and they began to cry, and Rabbi Akiva was laughing. They said to him: Why are you laughing? He said to them: And why are you crying? They said to him: These idolaters who bow down to idols and offer sacrifices to foreign worship dwell securely and peacefully, and we, the House where the feet of our God were burnt.

hebrew_text: בָּאֵשׁ, וְלֹא נִבְכֶּה?! אָמַר לָהֶן: לְכָךְ אֲנִי מְצַחֵק, וּמָה לְעוֹבְרֵי רְצוֹנוֹ כָּךְ, לְעוֹשֵׂי רְצוֹנוֹ עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: by fire, and shall we not weep? said to them: That is why I am laughing. If for those who violate His will, so for those who perform His will, all the more so
llm_translation: In fire, and not consumed?! He said to them: That is why I am joking, and if for those who transgress His will it is so, for those who fulfill His will, how much more so.

hebrew_text: שׁוּב פַּעַם אַחַת הָיוּ עוֹלִין לִירוּשָׁלַיִם, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעוּ לְהַר הַצּוֹפִים קָרְעוּ בִּגְדֵיהֶם, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעוּ לְהַר הַבַּיִת רָאוּ שׁוּעָל שֶׁיָּצָא מִבֵּית קׇדְשֵׁי הַקֳּדָשִׁים, הִתְחִילוּ הֵן בּוֹכִין וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מְצַחֵק. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִפְּנֵי מָה אַתָּה מְצַחֵק? אָמַר לָהֶם: מִפְּנֵי מָה אַתֶּם בּוֹכִים? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מָקוֹם שֶׁכָּתוּב בּוֹ ״וְהַזָּר הַקָּרֵב יוּמָת״, וְעַכְשָׁיו שׁוּעָלִים הִלְּכוּ בּוֹ, וְלֹא נִבְכֶּה?!
human_translation: On another occasion they were ascending to Jerusalem When they arrived at Mount Scopus they rent their garments When they arrived at the Temple Mount, they saw a fox that emerged from the Holy of Holies. They began weeping, and Rabbi Akiva laughing. They said to him: For what are you laughing? said to them: For what are you weeping? They said to him: place which it is written: “And the non-priest who approaches shall die” and now foxes walk in it; and shall we not weep?
llm_translation: Once they were going up to Jerusalem, when they reached Mount Scopus, they tore their garments. When they reached Mount Beit Horon, they saw a fox emerging from the Holy of Holies. They began to weep, but Rabbi Akiva was laughing. They said to him: Why are you laughing? He said to them: Why are you weeping? They said to him: In a place where it is written "And the stranger who comes near shall die," and now foxes walk there, and we should not weep?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן: לְכָךְ אֲנִי מְצַחֵק, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאָעִידָה לִּי עֵדִים נֶאֱמָנִים אֵת אוּרִיָּה הַכֹּהֵן וְאֶת זְכַרְיָה בֶּן יְבֶרֶכְיָהוּ״ – וְכִי מָה עִנְיַן אוּרִיָּה אֵצֶל זְכַרְיָה? אוּרִיָּה בְּמִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן, וּזְכַרְיָה בְּמִקְדָּשׁ שֵׁנִי! אֶלָּא: תָּלָה הַכָּתוּב נְבוּאָתוֹ שֶׁל זְכַרְיָה בִּנְבוּאָתוֹ שֶׁל אוּרִיָּה.
human_translation: said to them: That is why I am laughing, as it is written, “And I will take to Me faithful witnesses to attest: Uriah the priest, and Zechariah the son of Jeberechiah” Now what is the connection between Uriah and Zechariah? Uriah during the First Temple and Zechariah during the Second Temple Rather, the verse established that the prophecy of Zechariah dependent on the prophecy of Uriah.
llm_translation: He said to them: "That is why I am joking, as it is written: 'And I will appoint to myself faithful witnesses, Uriah the priest and Zechariah son of Jeberechiah' - What is the connection between Uriah and Zechariah? Uriah was in the First Temple, and Zechariah was in the Second Temple! Rather, the verse linked the prophecy of Zechariah to the prophecy of Uriah."

hebrew_text: בְּאוּרִיָּה כְּתִיב ״לָכֵן בִּגְלַלְכֶם צִיּוֹן שָׂדֶה תֵחָרֵשׁ״, בִּזְכַרְיָה כְּתִיב ״עוֹד יֵשְׁבוּ זְקֵנִים וּזְקֵנוֹת בִּרְחֹבוֹת יְרוּשָׁלִָם״. עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִתְקַיְּימָה נְבוּאָתוֹ שֶׁל אוּרִיָּה הָיִיתִי מִתְיָירֵא שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְקַיֵּים נְבוּאָתוֹ שֶׁל זְכַרְיָה, עַכְשָׁיו שֶׁנִּתְקַיְּימָה נְבוּאָתוֹ שֶׁל אוּרִיָּה – בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁנְּבוּאָתוֹ שֶׁל זְכַרְיָה מִתְקַיֶּימֶת. בַּלָּשׁוֹן הַזֶּה אָמְרוּ לוֹ: עֲקִיבָא נִיחַמְתָּנוּ, עֲקִיבָא נִיחַמְתָּנוּ.
human_translation: In Uriah it is written: “Therefore, for your sake Zion shall be plowed as a field, In Zechariah it is written: “There shall yet be elderly men and elderly women sitting in the streets of Jerusalem” Until the prophecy of Uriah was fulfilled I was afraid that the prophecy of Zechariah would not be fulfilled, Now that the prophecy of Uriah was fulfilled, it evident that the prophecy of Zechariah valid. said to him, this formulation: Akiva, you have comforted us; Akiva, you have comforted us.
llm_translation: In the prophecy of Uriah it is written, "Therefore because of you, Zion shall be plowed as a field." In the prophecy of Zechariah it is written, "Yet old men and old women shall again sit in the streets of Jerusalem." Until the prophecy of Uriah was not fulfilled, I was afraid that the prophecy of Zechariah would not be fulfilled. Now that the prophecy of Uriah has been fulfilled, it is known that the prophecy of Zechariah is also fulfilled. In this language they said to him: "Akiva, you have comforted us, Akiva, you have comforted us."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ אֵלּוּ הֵן הַלּוֹקִין וּסְלִיקָא לַהּ מַסֶּכֶת מַכּוֹת
llm_translation: We will return to you. These are the ones who are lashed, and the conclusion is to her the tractate of Makkot.
